title: DO NOT STAY HERE. MY FIRST EVER HOTEL REVIEW.
text:
The worst hotel experience ever. I have never written a review for hotels before and the experience I had compelled me to write a review so people are aware. I never understood people complaining about the "service" aspect of hotels until I dealt with the staff working at this property. 

1. They falsely advertised the 2br suite. When we raised the issue, the manager did not believe our complaint was valid and had to send someone up with a tape measure. The employee confirmed the bed was not a queen, but rather a full sized bed. We could not get a hold of anyone about this issue until the day after making multiple phone calls.

2. IT IS IMPOSSIBLE TO REACH ANYONE FOR ANYTHING. We called the front desk to ask for utensils, earplugs, and a late check out. People rarely pick up the phone morning, daytime, and evening. We were told that "90% of guests are diamond and we can't help you" along with many interesting comments and behaviors that you wouldn't even see at their lowest level brand, Homewood Suites.

Just save your $ somewhere and stay anywhere but here. We ended up going to a different hotel (arguably a lower brand) and were so relieved that people treat you like guests with a proper hello and eye contact.

title: Fantastic Views and Service
text: This hotel is in a nice and quiet location but close to many attractions..  It is walkable to St Patrick’s Cathedral, Empire State Building, Rockefeller  Plaza, MoMA, Times Square, Grand central Station and Fifth Ave Shopping…The hotel upgraded us to a beautiful Corner Suite on 35 th floor with great views of the city and the river. Staff was fantastic, room was very clean and services were outstanding… I highly recommend this hotel.. I know I will be back and would stay here again. UN is right around the corner and just a short walk to a great Italian restaurant… we went twice..

title: Was once great but not anymore …
text:
The hotel unfortunately does not present as well as the advertising .. rooms are tired (however the housekeeping ensures that they are spotless) … no exec lounge and as a diamond member the locations you can spend your f and b credit are limited. The lifts rattle up and down and you just hope there is not an issue ..
Parts of the hotel are locked off or alarmed so you are advised not to enter … the onsite restaurant is a bit of a joke …

title: Spring break
text: The bed is hard but the pillows are soft. The room has a mildew smell. The bathroom was updated and nice.  I would not stay here again. I’m don’t like the $30 a day they take but tell you that you can use it for a credit in the restaurant there in the hotel or the cafe in the hotel.

title: Nice and Clean Hotel. Good central location.
text: My mom had never stayed in a NYC hotel.  She had been all around the world 🌎 visited every continent and in her very backyard she’s never been to a nice NYC hotel. We chose this hotel because of the amazing skyline. It was lovely. Clean and the staff were nice.

title: Don’t stay here.  Stay anywhere else.
text: I’m disabled and have multiple bulging discs and spine degeneration.  The beds are like slabs of concrete.  Management refused to bring extra blankets, anything to try to help.  I missed out on family time on the first vacation I’ve been able to take since 2019.  After two sleepless nights and being in severe pain, I would love to thank the management of this hotel for ruining my entire vacation.  Its most likely the last one my health will allow me to take.

title: Lacking good customer service.
text: Hotel was booked for a birthday celebration, hotel was advised prior to check-in regarding the celebration and if a surprise can be arrange. Additionally, this was again re-confirmed upon check-in. However, nothing was arrange - no amenity, no card nothing. Furthermore, we paid an upgrade for city view but again this was not given "not available" according to front desk but room rate not changed. All of the front desk team, are not interested in providing good customer service and border  just rude as are management.

title: Great
text: Great hotel, beautiful view and very helpful staff! Would 100% recommend and would defo come again. But only issue we had during our stay was that we had to pay an extra $100 a night deposit and which you only get $70 back of as they take $30 a night for you to spend within the hotel and if you do not spend it you still do not get that back. But other than that great hotel

title: デスティネーションフィーは不快
text: ベッドメイクされない日がある。デスティネーションフィーを取られるうえにレンタルバイクに使えるはずのクーポンが適用されなかった。

title: Fantastisch
text: The location is great, so is the service. Nice and clean rooms, soft pillows and the staff at the font desk is friendly.  The restaurant serves a good variety and there is a separate sitting area at the entrance for a coffee or a drink at the bar. In a small cafe area you can buy a snack/ sandwich or some cookies for with your cofffee or tea

title: Aging but comfortable hotel with annoying fees and overpriced restaurant
text: The hotel is aging but still in good condition and has an 80s vibe with dark hallways and mirrors. But the rooms are pleasant and comfortable and the bathroom has a great bidet. The $30 mandatory fee is definitely a money grab as so many guests leaving the hotel are forced to spend the fee at the hotel sundry shop on overpriced needless items. The Ambassador Grill is wildly overpriced and not worth the hassle. On a recent visit 2 bowls of yoghurt and berries and 2 coffees was almost $60.00. Plus it took almost an hour to get served. They didn’t even have croissants or pastries in the restaurant, in NYC! The front desk staff are really nice and helpful and here’s a shout out to Sylvia for helping me with my bill. Bottom line, if you want to be near the UN, this is the place to be, otherwise you might want to check out other places.

title: A true nightmare
text:
6 months pregnant, I was obliged to stand for almost 1 hour for the check-in as the lady refused to check the pre-payment  done by the travel agency. 
Even if my company paid in advance for the resort fee I had the surprise to get a double debt on my credit card after checkout!
The breakfast was included in the rate for 50 dollars per day, but we found out the buffet was no longer available and only  eggs for 30 dollars were complementary !
The rooms are old, stinky and very noisy!
All the hotel urgently claims for maintenance  and a change in staff!

title: Bait and switch
text: The website claims a viewof Chrysler and Empire state (see picture), but Hilton's customer service +18556050316 claims that the room faces te river. I've e-mailed nycup_hotel@hilton.com twice for confirmation and also asked on X (Twitter), but Hilton does not reply. Seems like a textbook bait and switch to me.

title: Fabulous hotel
text:
Great hotel in a great location. 
Slight problem with payment before we got there, they’d put double to amount of our room on hold but this was sorted when we arrived. 

View of the room was phenomenal, just what we were looking for. 

Will definitely be back on our next visit to NYC 🫶

title: DO NOT STAY HERE!
text: I stayed here from December 28 to January 2nd, they took $500 for deposit and I just received back $300. I never used the restaurant or something where they could charged me and take the money from my deposit. Ive called many times to ask them why they didnt send the full amout and they dont answer. Please make yourself a favor and stay away from this hotel

title: Brilliant stay at the Millennium Hilton
text:
Absolutely amazing staff and hotel. I actually booked the wrong Millennium hotel, but they were so accommodating. It was a birthday trip for my daughter and I had emailed several times asking for a room with a view of the river (thinking I was at the midtown hotel). 
Well we had a lovely room with a view of the East river. However, I found out other rooms had amazing views of the Empire State Building & the Chrysler Building. A sweetheart of a lady called Sylvia was kind enough to upgrade us to a corner room, which had the best view of both buildings AND the river. She also gave us vouchers to spend in the bar/ restaurant or coffee shop. 
Thank you Sylvia and the other lady on reception (whose name I unfortunately didn’t get) who also helped us. 
Another huge thanks to the wonderful man with grey hair on the concierge desk. He was so helpful and a real gentleman. You guessed it, I didn’t get his name either. 
Although we ended up having to do a lot of walking (40 miles!!), we had the trip of a lifetime and would highly recommend this hotel. The staff are fabulous and the hotel is comfortable and spotlessly clean.

title: Excellent stay!
text:
Stayed here overnight & we were greeted by the security dogs each day in the lobby. They were sweet & curious creatures & we were glad they were in the job protecting us. Everyone we interacted with from the Valet who handled the car, to the front desk, the bell captain & especially Shane the overnight guy was courteous, friendly & professional. He e had a view of the Empire State & Chrysler buildings. We had dinner at the Ambassador Grill downstairs. The portions were generous & the food was cooked as requested. We will be back on our next trip into NYC. Thank you all.
Jerry & Del

title: Wonderful stay with incredible views of the city!
text:
We had a great stay overall as a family group. Our rooms were spacious and clean. Breakfast was pretty good and the staff at the Ambassador Grill and the coffee shop were polite and friendly. 
Some of the front desk staff we encountered on our arrival day (I don’t want to give names) can work more on their hospitality skills and smiles. The first impression I had on the hotel was not a good one but on the second night , I met Brandon at the front desk and everything changed! It’s incredible how a person with a positive attitude and a smile can change your whole stay and make it memorable. Brandon was very professional and friendly and he went above and beyond in making our stay excellent! Thank you Brandon! You are truly a gem to this hotel and the best!! And you are the reason I give this place a 5 stars review. I would suggest the management team to give him a very well deserved promotion. Not too many people in this industry have such strong hospitality skills and professionalism as you do! 
I will definitely stay here again when traveling to NYC.

title: Outdated. Everything in need of repair and update. Guest services absolutely abysmal. Dirty. Stay anywhere else.
text: Checked in at 6pm and had dinner at Ambassador Grill - more like an outdated bar than restaurant with limited menu and awful service. Went up to tiny, smelly room and television did not work so called to ask for a new room. Was told I had checked in a noon - I had simply responded to a text asking if I wanted to check in through the app - which I chose to check in at 5pm so my app key would be ready. The awful woman at “guest services” on the phone seemed to insist I had been lying around the room for hours but if I went down to the front desk, I could ask for another room. It was insulting and rude but I went to lobby and thankfully the person at front desk was polite and gave me another room. I went to the new room which also contained a television that did not work. At this point, I simply gave up as I needed to get up the next morning at 6am. I was already stuck in this dump as I was only here for 2 nights and at this point could not cancel and go elsewhere without paying in full. Accordingly, I’m writing this review to warn others to stay clear of this pit that had its heyday in the 1970s and appears to have not been updated since. So many better options in the area. It was very convenient to where I needed to be but next time I will stay with a better brand hotel. Hyatts never disappoint. This hotel is an insult, even to Hiltons.

title: Great hotel, not so great staff
text:
The hotel itself has everything you could ask for, clean, large rooms and the view is unsurpassed.

The front desk staff are atrocious, extremely rude and not approachable at all, which is a shame because the hotel itself is so beautiful.
I was standing near the front desk waiting whilst 2 staff were talking to each other and after about 2 minutes I’ve of them said ‘ Can I help you with something? You keep looking at me so it makes me think you want something’ what I wanted should have been clear as I had just arrived with 2 suitcases and wanted to check in.
They certainly need more training

title: Good hotel, Great Location, not so great Front Desk staff
text: The hotel is very nice, the room was very nice, the view was very nice, the food was good, the staff was very nice with the exception of the front desk. The front desk person was so rude! I asked to speak with the manager and of course the manager was too busy to speak to me which was disappointing because I travel to the city very often and would have like to have made this hotel one of my regulars.

title: Clen and Great Location
text: Stayed  in this hotel  just before Christmas the location was great Check in was quick and easy Room was clean and spacious  bed comfortable View from hotel was amazing was in a quiet location which  was nice  Would definitely stay again.

title: wonderful customer experience
text: Linda is an absolute credit to the hotel, and was a joy to speak with when I need assistance. Thank you Linda for your impeccable customer service, from The english sounding scottish lady! She made my evening as well as helping and chatting with me.

title: Wonderful Hotel & Staff!
text: Really super friendly staff (Hi to Barry!) and big, clean room, overlooking the UN & East River.  Art deco inspired lobby with a little shop to get a coffee, sandwich. Very attentive & polite staff. My only hiccup; the beds were small (hard to fit 2 ppl). But such a great location, it's quiet but not too far away from anything. Price point is on the high end, but great for families (we met other families staying there & everyone seem to really enjoy it).

title: Rude reception staff.
text: This is a beautiful hotel in a great location, 20 minute walk to times square. The rooms are spacious, very clean, have a great view and the beds are very comfortable. We absolutely loved our stay here until we checked out. While waiting in the lobby to head to the airport I received a text message that our flight home to London had been cancelled and I was required to contact the airline. As I could not use my own mobile phone to make the call, I explained the situation to the hotel reception staff and asked to use their phone. I was advised to use the phone located next to the elevators and to press 0, explain the situation and ask to be put through to the airline (I had the airline phone number ready). The women on the phone shouted at me saying she didn't know what the airline was and that I could not use this phone. I explained my situation and why I was requesting to use the hotel phone. She told me no and informed me to return to reception. I returned to reception and was then told by reception staff that I could not use a phone and they couldn't help me. When I asked what I was meant to do they then told me to use that one again. I used that phone again next to the elevator and the woman shouted at me again shouting I couldn't use the phone. By this point I was in tears after being shouted at twice and received no help. I returned to reception and informed them the woman on the hotel phone said no. The receptionist then said I could use the concierge's phone, thankfully he was much kinder and offered me a drink of water as I was in tears. This event ruined this hotel and not once did any reception staff member care or help, absolutely shocking service.

title: Good Location for UN related Work
text: Probably the nearest hotel to UN office. Hotel is next to UNCIEF office and even in winter you can enter UNICEF without winter clothes.  Hotel lobby provide working space as well. Cafe staff is very friendly. Spacious and clean rooms.

title: Hidden resort fee!!!!!
text: This hotel had a ridiculous deal. It was $299 per night. Not bad. But it had a condition in fine print. There was a $200 per night as a resort fee. That made me outraged. The hotel should have said that it is $499 per night. I reported this case to New York State Attorney. Other guests should also report this practice as the condition is predatory.

title: Poor check in experience
text:
The front desk woman was rude when I checked in. She called the night manager who wasn’t wearing a name tag but claimed his name was John Gibson. He simply sneered when I told him about my rude experience and that NYC is full of other hotel options. As a current Gold and frequent Diamond member (doesn’t seem to be worth anything these days), I’ve observed that Hilton gets worse and worse every year. This experience might have been the low point. 

I’m not even touching on how horribly dated and old the room felt (first time I’ve stayed in a hotel without a single piece of art on the wall, which is fine but more in keeping with a motel than a hotel masquerading as a 4-star). The room was adequately cleaned every day, but still smelled like mold. 

I won’t stay at this hotel again even though I’m in NY often for work or leisure.

title: Watch for Inaccurate Charges
text:
Hotel & service were nice enough. Problem was later getting charged $271.07 for parking when we did not park a car.

After numerous phone calls & emails, final word from hotel was "Unfortunately, we are 
unable to reverse any charges."  Really?!
I'd definitely discourage anyone from risking a stay at this hotel.

title: Disappointing Hotel
text: Hotel is very "blah" for a big city hotel, not much of a lobby or amenities, and bar didn't open until 5pm on a Saturday! Front desk staff was rude and not helpful when our room wasn't ready yet at 1:30pm, only saying "guaranteed check in is 4pm" and not offering to call ot text us when the room was ready. Also weren't helpful for a later check out request only providing an extran1 hour for checkout of 12pm.

title: Lots of hotel choices in New York - I would not choose this one again
text:
The hotel is generally tired - USB charge points in the rooms is often a good indicator if an establishment has been updated (or not in this case). Showers very dated. 

Gym not very well equipped and when I visited (twice) there were no sanitary wipes available for cleaning equipment for pre or post use.  The space is also cramped.

Main issue - which ultimately resulted in the Duty Manager telling me that she would not let me stay there again - was about them wanting me to pay $500+ without explaining properly why I should pay.  Their initial explanation was that it was a city tax / food voucher.  I said that I did not need food vouchers as this is New York and there so many eating options.  Specifically when I booked for my family of 4, I declined breakfast packages. When I arrived they said that I need to buy a meal / destination package of $30 per person per night; $500+.

I stayed in California last week - no such charge. Hyatt Centric Mountain View; great team

I stayed in New York last month - no such charge. Park Terrace Hotel; great place.

I tried to sort it out at the front desk 5 times; 3 times I was told that the manager would contact me; they did not. On day 5 I went to the front desk for a 4th time and eventually spoke with the manager who once I had shared all of my booking details agreed that I would not be liable for this charge.  

On Day 6 I went to check out and was told that I would be liable for the charge and in the ensuing conversation I was told by the duty manager that I would not be welcome back.  

This could have been so much better if (1) they had explained things more clearly and if (2) the Manager had contacted me on Day 1 when I was told that they would

title: Poor customer service
text:
This is a really nice hotel in a good location in New York Cily but, the manager is totally inflexible.
We booked for three nights but my wife came down with a bad cold and cough so we opted to leave after one night.
The manager totally refused to give us a refund for the two unused nights that I would think they were able to sell again quite easily as the hotel was very busy.

title: Top Lage, mittelmässiger Service
text: Das Hotel liegt sehr zentral gelegen und bietet ein tolles Fitnessstudio mit einmaligen Ausblick. Die Zimmer sind schön, aber wurden nicht immer sehr sauber geputzt. Man wird gezwungen für 30 Dollar pro Tag ein Konsumationsgutschein zu kaufen, welcher nicht kummulierbar ist. Da ein Kaffee ca 9 Dollar kostet und das Frühstücks-Gebäck ebenso teuer ist, kommt man damit nicht sehr weit.

title: Nice motel with a poor restaurant.
text: Room was nice and staff was great. Would not recommend the restaurant in the motel at all. Below average food and poor service. Restaurant charged a 15% gratuity for the poor service. They did not have to work to get a tip.

title: Good size room
text:
The hotel location us not the best but ok for midtown . The size of the room is very good for NY . Service wise is mediocre . No recognition for HH elite status at all . The check in counter was empty when I had arrived the hotel at 19:30 . Waited for 10m before a front desk women showed up . Although the check in was rapid but there was no greeting nor any form of communication . She was just like a frigid robot to get your data , credit card and give you the room key . Never had I experienced this kind of service during check in at any hotel that I had been to worldwide. 
It really was a very bad experience . Other than the size of the room nothing else will make me return .
In all fairness the day shift front desk staffs , the concierge were all much nicer .

title: Fine stay
text:
Bed is comfortable and cafe is helpful to have on-site. 

Gym is on the smaller side. 

Check in process was easy and room was clean. 

Some rooms are significantly better than others - good value for size of room and it’s a relatively quiet neighborhood

title: Mixed feelings on this one.
text: Daily Mandatory Destination Charge will be added to the room rate and includes: Premium guest internet access: daily $30 food & beverage credit for use in all hotel outlets: Citibike day Sounds like a plan right? But you couldn't get near the cafe (Soda $4.50-5.50 due to long lines every morning and we had to loose our $30 credit if we did not wait. I get free internet with Hilton Honors and would not even try to ride a bike in NY. SCAM to get you to sit down to their $42 breakfast buffet perhaps?

title: Outdated and odor
text: Outdated. Room had a terrible mold/mildew smell at in the room's entry hallway, some of which lingered into suite. Carpeting was old, stained, musty smelling, and torn in suite. Only one USB outlet and that didn't work. Carpeting was also old in hallways, and hallways smelled musty. Not the same experience as I had back in 2019. Won't be back.

title: Terrible Client service, double billing not refunded one year later
text: Terrible client service, I went to this Hilton for a business trip last October and they used my personal credit card to check-in. Despite being told that the payment would be redirected to my corporate card later, it was not done yet (almost a year later). They billed BOTH my personal and corporate cards and have not responded to ANY emails sent.

title: Vecchio, decadente, personale scortese, carissimo, attenti alla Destination fee!
text:
Peccato non si possa dare zero. L’hotel è vecchio e fatiscente, con manutenzione trascurata, buchi e macchie ovunque e soprattutto una moquette sporca che puzza terribilmente. Le stanze sono quasi buie a causa delle finestre minuscole e l’unica luce presente non illumina. In bagno manca luce sullo specchio pertanto ci si trucca al buio.Letti sfondati, vasca da bagno con tenda da due lire, ascensori scassati lentissimi.  I frigobar sono spenti, vuoti e senza acqua in omaggio. Sconsiglio assolutamente di prendere la colazione a buffet: costa la bellezza di 60 dollari e i pochissimi prodotti presenti sono vecchi e di scarsa qualità. Si salva solo la frutta.
Ma passiamo alla nota peggiore: mi presento al check in dopo quasi un’ora di fila essendoci solo una unità di personale per un hotel così grande,  e la signora mi chiede 700 dollari di deposito più 35 dollari al giorno di destination fee. Rimango sorpresa da questa “tassa” e chiedo maggiori informazioni perché sul Boucher c’è scritto “tutto incluso”.
La signora seccata mi dice che se non pago non mi consegna la chiave. Chiedo allora di poter parlare con un manager. Arriva un signore molto scortese che mi dice che non ha tempo da perdere e che se non pago non mi fa entrare in camera. Preciso che ho pagato un soggiorno all- inclusive e che sarei grata de mi potesse mettere per iscritto la richiesta da poter girare all’agenzia. Si indispettisce comunque accetta e mi lascia la chiave.
Il giorno dopo contatto l’agenzia che mi conferma che il mio soggiorno comprende tutto ed è già stata pagata anche la destination fee. Naturalmente il manager non si è mai scusato. Fare attenzione!!!

title: Clean and Great Location!
text:
The location was great, we walked to a lot of things, or used Uber. I especially liked that UN Plaza is a quiet area, away from many tourist areas.

Check-in was easy, the staff was really friendly throughout our stay, including the people who worked in the coffee bar. (Really good coffee, too!)

Our room was spacious, and meticulously clean, in fact the entire hotel was very clean. The views were to die for!

Overall a great place to stay, and we’ll definitely be back!

title: Lovely hotel right next to UN building
text: Hotel warmly welcomed the people who came in for the Pokemon Go Fest - (staff were dressed as Pikachu and a trainer ball upon arrival!). Easy walk from Grand Central Terminal and over to Bryant Park. Lovely view from the room. There is a coffeemaker and small fridge but no microwave. Daily maid service!  There is a restaurant and bar on premises. Friendly bellman.😃

title: taxes nacceptable
text:
Attention !!!
This hotel will charge you a Mandatory tax corresponding to services or benefits that you do not necessarily want! (Internet connection 30Usd food and drink inside hotel rent Citybike...) you will have to pay even if you do not use these services.
This unacceptable practice makes me advise to avoid this establishment. I inform the reader that not all hotels practice it.
AVOID therefore

title: Super location, room and service!
text:
From the reception, to the valet to our room, everything was great as expected for a Hilton!
Rooms are big for NYC, clean and the view from our room was simply amazing!
Hats off to the staff, made my stay enjoyable!
Love that this hotel is in a quiet area yet so close to everything…5 mins walk to Grand Central! I would recommend and might come back on my next stop in NYC!

title: They had me at 5 stars...until I checked out
text:
Until checkout, I was quite willing to give this hotel a five - the room was excellent, the service friendly and the views (the hotel's position above an office building giving all of the rooms unobstructed views) were outstanding.  My deal on Hotwire was also superb value.  But - there's the matter of the $30 a day "destination fee" that was said to be available as food and beverage credit.

I dropped the hotel a star (and nearly two) when I found out only on checkout that only one $30 credit could be used per day.  What that meant was that my drinks at the hotel bar - selected to soak up the "credit" resulted in an additional $70 on my bill because I had already used $20 on overpriced coffee and juice from the "cafe"  that morning, while my $30 from my last day went up in smoke because I checked out before using it.  A net reversal of about $100, and no slack from the overworked one-person crew checking out a long queue of departing guests.

I didn't think the $30 per day charge was unreasonable - but not telling me that it reset daily regardless of use was ridiculous.  It put a stain on an otherwise flawless visit.

title: Fabulous location, but service ethos mixed at best
text: Mixed review for a mixed experience. I arrived past 8pm after an 18-hour flight from Singapore, to be told that my room wasn't yet ready! Some airport crew had commandeered the rooms, apparently. Anyway, the manager kindly offered me an upgrade, but I doubt if it really was one: the room I was given had indeed fabulous views, but it was the smallest on the entire floor as I could see from the emergency floor plan. (Ah, I'm an engineer ... I tend to notice such things. Hotel managers, beware of engineers.) The next day, I was trying to call the front desk to see if I might get a half hour extension to check out, and nobody was picking up. Not to mention the curt "Hold on" by the operator, before putting me on hold interminably. Who has time to answer the telephone and be courteous, right, with all these pesky customers requesting things. On the upside, the Ambassador Bar is quite nice. It's located at the basement so no views, but the bartender was really kind and generous with the cocktail portions. That and the views from my (smallest) room were the best part of the experience.

title: Class Action?  Do they purposely not apply food/beverage credits hoping you don't realize?
text: I have been staying at this hotel frequently lately for business trips.  As a Diamond Member, I thought this would be a great place to stay.  What I've found out is that they don't seem to apply the food and beverage credit consistently.  In fact, I'm wondering if they purposely don't apply it, waiting for people to ask or hopefully just forget.  It's a major hassle to get the credits after you've left as phone calls and e-mails don't get anywhere.  Fortunately, we have choices and I'll plan to stay elsewhere.

title: Excellent all around
text: Staff was excellent from the valet to the front desk to housekeeping. The destination fee of $30/day is a food credit that can be used in the UN Cafe or restaurant.  Room furnishings were well chosen, from the daybed settee to the elegant leather chair.  There was a problem with the light in the glass front room fridge, they brought a replacement refrigerator immediately.  Bathroom was modern, clean, room was exceptionally clean, linens were good quality.  Spectacular view of the Secretariat building and East River as evening settled. My new favorite hotel in NYC.  Affordable, classy, elegant.

title: Average stay, not good value for money
text: Our stay was generally just fine.  Travelled with family, so we were split in two rooms.  The beds were super comfortable and the rooms had great views.  However enough was lacking which made me think the hotel is not good value for money.  Staff were ill informed about most things.  No complimentary water in rooms and when we asked, no water was offered.  I had to ask for coffee creamer twice and still didn't receive any.  The hotel also has a strange policy of charging an extra $30 (not mentioned anywhere during the booking process) which can be spent in their cafe or restaurant, however everything is so overpriced in both, that the money doesn't go far.  Overall a very average experience.

title: Not for us
text: Stayed here because we wanted a 2-bedroom suite since we were 2 couples traveling together. Bad choice should have stayed elsewhere. Noisy air con and stained carpets. When you pay 800 USD a night and are refused to borrow wine glasses from the bar, that says it all!

title: Disappointing hotel ..
text:
I opted to stay at this hotel due to proximity to the UN where I had meetings. The hotel does not have a business center so at 9:00pm I couldn’t get something urgent printed for my meeting in the morning. The front desk staff I interacted with in trying to get my document printed (an Asian looking young lady) was most unhelpful and had an attitude to go along with it! I also observed her on another occasion interacting with another guest and it was the same behavior. 
My room had an issue with broken clips for the blackout curtains. Despite repeated notification, it was never fixed during my 8 night stay so there was considerable light coming into the room at nights. 
The window tracks and ledge were dusty and dirty. I had to ask housekeeping to clean it. The carpet had a few dirty spots but I was told that they can’t do anything about it.
One night the water backed up in the bathtub and brought up a lot of dirty particles. Not sure what caused this but I had to wash it down in order to shower. 
Apparently as a Hilton Honors member you get 2 bottles of water at this hotel. I was never told this upon check in. 
Overall, I was disappointed with this hotel having regard to the price of the room. 
The only good thing was the proximity to the UN, the view from my room and the lovely staff at the coffee shop downstairs.

title: Natasha is awesome!!
text:
I stay at this location every other week! And Natasha, never lets me down. 
She is always polite, pleasant, kind hearted, patient, and very respectful to all the guest. Exactly why I keep coming back because of her! Natasha you ROCK and please continue doing what you do. Best Frank Vick

title: Disappointing experience
text: Staff not really interested in working and helping guests. Mold in the bathroom. When luggage assistance was requested the bellman never showed up. Nice location but that’s about the only advantage of this property. Best to avoid.

title: Never paid more for less in my life
text: Do not stay here. It is NOT up to Hilton standards - shocked it has the name. Lobby and restaurant decor is like a strip club without the strippers. Overwhelming smell in lobby like a car wash air freshener. Very very old hotel. Staff try their best to deal with problems - God bless them. Will never stay again. This hotel attracts a strange clientele to be sure.

title: Not the best option for travelers
text:
I am not sure that writing a review of this hotel makes any difference whatsoever. The staff do not seem to care. However, I decided to write one anyway, if it will help people make a decision about whether to stay here. We had to stay here while my husband conducted some business. It would not have been my choice. I am a Hilton diamond member, but I didn’t reserve the room through the app so we didn’t receive any benefits. We had to book through my husband’s work. I don’t think it would’ve made any difference in the quality of our service, though.

It’s convenient to have the coffee shop downstairs, except that it never opens on time. The sign says that it opens at 6:30 but it’s at least 645 every morning before it’s open and there are people standing outside waiting. The coffee they serve is good. They do have some snacks and sandwiches. The woman who works in the morning is friendly, if not punctual.

The hallways are dark, most likely because they are painted dark gray. The lighting is dim. The front desk staff is surly and you are definitely an imposition when you check in or ask a question. I would expect much better from a hotel located literally across the street from the UN. But they may be friendlier to diplomats than they are to the general public. Our room faced the river. I have heard the highest floor, city view rooms are best. it was the worst hotel bathroom we’ve ever had. Terrible lighting, and I couldn’t even find the light switch on the mirror. The shower was complicated, and the bathtub was very slippery.

I wrote a separate review for the ambassador grill, which is not open for lunch. Not convenient for the hotel to not offer a place to get a nice lunch. Unfriendly staff, mediocre food, limited menu. This hotel does not offer many amenities. I didn’t use the gym, so I don’t know what that was like. 

The area around the hotel is also very limited for food choices. Several options are either permanently closed or they have limited hours. I would not recommend this part of town for those who want hotels in areas where there are food, options, convenience, stores, and other things you might need while traveling. We prefer to stay further uptown.

This hotel is in need of some renovation, as well as some training for their staff.

title: Mixed Feelings
text:
Regarding hospitality, the Hilton brand always has elegance, luxury, and exceptional service. However, my recent stay at a Hilton establishment has disappointed me. From the moment I walked through the doors, it was clear that this hotel was far from meeting the high standards I had come to expect. The first issue that struck me was the severe lack of organization. The check-in process was an absolute nightmare. With long, understaffed check-in counters, guests were left waiting in never-ending lines, their patience draining away as time ticked by. 

As we finally made our way to our assigned rooms, I couldn't help but notice the hotel's dire need for renovation, from the lobby to the dimly lit hallways. 

On a positive note, one aspect that truly stood out was the exceptional housekeeping service provided at our hotel. Our rooms' housekeepers' attention to detail and cleanliness exceeded our expectations, leaving us impressed. It is only fair to say that the housekeeping staff deserves commendation for their excellent work.

Another positive is in the bustling city, where coffee is on every corner, the little coffee shop in the hotel lobby had fantastic coffee. There is a single mother who stands out among the crowd. She is not just an ordinary barista; she is a master of her craft, creating the best coffee in town. As the sun peeks through the city skyline every morning, this single mother works her magic. Her dedication and passion for her job radiated as she greeted us with a warm smile and genuine enthusiasm. It is evident that she takes pride in her work, and that is reflected in every cup she serves.

Another negative, being a Diamond member at a hotel has its fair share of perks and privileges, usually from exclusive lounge access to upgraded room amenities, which this hotel did not have. These benefits make stays more memorable. However, what happens when these perks turn into bad experiences? Let me recount an incident that left a bitter taste in my mouth during my recent stay in a New York City hotel. As a Diamond member, my spouse and I were thrilled to learn that we would receive two complimentary bottles of water every day. It may seem like a small gesture, but after a long day exploring the bustling streets of NYC, this simple amenity brings comfort and convenience. The front desk clerk formed during check-in that we could collect our water bottles at the front desk every day, so we did for the first two days without any issues. On the third day, our experience took an unexpected turn. As we approached the front desk to pick up our water bottles, the front desk clerk said we should buy our own &^*&*(( water and don't ask for anymore. 

As I stated - mixed feelings.

title: Would stay again!
text:
Loved the location and the overall vibe  of this hotel. I had never spent time around the UN and it was very cool. Upon arrival, the staff at the bellman desk were funny and efficient. The front desk representative was also very nice and recommended a great roof top bar down the street. We stayed for two nights and the rest of the time the line at the front desk was ridiculous. There is no Concierge so if you have any questions, there is no one to ask unless you want to wait for a long time.  The coffee shop staff were the best! Cannot say enough good things about them, one man in particular whose name I didn't get. 
Our room was, I thought, I really good size for a NYC hotel. And amazing views! The cleanliness was a bit uneven, but I really liked our room. I would come back.

title: VISITOR BEWARE!
text:
DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL! 

It's terribly disorganized with long understaffed check in waits. In addition, the hotel is dirty and in desparate need of a renovation.

Another reason not to stay at this facility, if you're a pet lover, is their unecessary use of entrance "security dogs" that are past their prime yet forced to spend long hours in 90°+ weather lying on hard cement. It's heart breaking to witness.

All combined, this Hilton establishment is a HUGE disappointment.

title: Nice staff in outdated hotel
text:
Overall I would not return to this hotel.
It has a number of good points in that the staff were really decent and helpful and the use of the Hilton app is good. The people on reception, the porters and the coffee shop girls were all really nice and helpful. The views of the city are also very good especially at night. The 30 dollar charge is not an issue as you can use it in the coffee shop and bar.
However the hotel is jaded and old, the owners of this hotel need to update it. The rooms and elevators are shabby and outdated.
We found our room to be dirty. It is as if the owners are trying to deliver an experience without spending any money.
If the hotel was up to date it would be good. Unfortunately for me I wish I had booked somewhere which was newer and cleaner.

title: Bad experience as diamond member
text:
I am a diamond member, I never treated as it should be. They put me in the lower floor I a bad room and not in the renovated part of the hotel. They didn't offer me for  example the brekfast for free, as it is usual for diamond member.
All my experience as diamond member witl Hilton chain was excellent, except this hotel.

title: Room needs TLC
text: The hotel itself is nice and in a good location. Our room however was in Poor condition. It was not cleaned properly when we arrived. There was still other people’s hair in the bathroom shower, floor and toilet. We were in room 3426 and stayed June 6-8th. The bathroom door was warped and paint peeling off of it. The carpet has many holes and tears. This room definitely needed a makeover and some TLC. If the room was updated and cleaned properly we would have had a very enjoyable stay. It’s within walking distance to most places. We were only there for 2 quick nights so we didn’t bother to ask for a different room. We were busy exploring anyways. Only stayed in the room to sleep & shower.

title: Overrated and overpriced
text: Very surly staff on desk on arrival insisting on price of whole stay being put on credit card with numerous added extras and taxes before even started check-in. Rooms are looking tired and dated and not even a bottle of water provided in room when you are paying $350 a night. Breakfast at $60 for the buffet is particularly overpriced. Cleaning staff kept letting themselves in room early in morning without even knocking

title: April One Night Stay
text:
This is a very classic-style Hilton, skyscraper, NYC hotel. Overall, my stay was very good. The lobby is gorgeous with lots of black marble. But this leads to a shabby looking elevator area. I am not sure why Hilton doesn't invest more in this hotel when it has such a great location and the building is well designed. The rooms, though very clean, could also use updating by Hilton. There are no ice machines, room service, or mini bar items. Another odd choice by Hilton but maybe impacted by staffing issues. 

On the plus side,  the beds and duvets were super comfy and the views were spectacular!

There may be a long check in line so use the Hilton app if you can. The front desk people are friendly as well as the coffee station staff. There is a destination fee so make sure to use your credit,  the restaurant can make your food to go. The bellman were excellent and hailed me a cab, very appreciated!

title: Ottimo ma troppo caro
text:
Ottimo hotel a Manhattan proprio vicino alla sede delle Nazioni Unite.
Grande struttura molto ben attrezzata,
Discreto servizio e discreta accoglienza al check inn.
Camera al 31 piano molto ampia e confortevole oltre che pulita.
Colazione carissima assolutamente da evitare.
Molto caro.

title: Excellent stay at a modern NY Landmark
text:
Was kind of worried based on recent reviews but my stay was excellent from start to finish. Easy check in via the app let me skip a long checkin line. My room was an upgraded loft suite that was clean and fresh with a good view of the UN and the east river. The bell staff are very friendly and helpful and super attentive. The front desk people are easy to talk to and accommodating. Breakfast at the Ambassador Grill was good and my charges were reversed due to my Hilton Status. The gym is clean, modern and all the equipment works plus the views from the treadmill machines is amazing.

I really enjoyed my stay and will definitely be back. Ignore the negative comments, the hotel is excellent.

title: Not the friendliest Front Desk (if you need assistance)
text:
I am surprised that the Hotel does not have a business center but had a tiny printer to print. The printer is very sensitive to the instructions. I was having trouble with printing a business document at 6:30AM and requested assistance from the FD agent on duty at 6:45AM on 5/17. Wow - the attitude that I got was shocking this early. When asked to speak to a Mgr, there was none on duty. I overheard her interactions with other guests too and she was certainly not at her best part of the day.

The bellman Ainsley was great and was trying to assist me. The FD agent should probably work the night shift and go home before the customer return to the hotel or work in the back office as clearly guest service was not her strength. Ainsley should be given a 5 star in trying and willing to help the guest.

Hotel - Please implement an easy way to print business documents and clearly no Mgr on duty and leaving the interaction of the guest to just one front Desk agent, that is not one would expect from a Hotel like you when price per night is up there.

title: Not worth it !
text: It didn't start well: upon arrival, a lenghty check-in process with only one couple before me, only to be told at 12:30 that I had to wait until 3 - 4 p.m. because my room wasn't ready. At 3 p.m., my room still wasn't ready, and the tone of the receptionist was in no way apologetic like "we'll do our best to get your room ready" but rather "yup, that's the way it is". When I finally got into my room, the toilet bowl hadn't been cleaned (pretty disgusting) and the tube with the body wash was empty, probably  left by the previous occupant. I don't blame the cleaning staff, it all points to them being overworkedl. I also missed those small amenities you get in better hotels, like a pen and notepad, a shower cap, a shoe mitt and a bath robe. The amenities were  bare bones.. The room was spacious and had a lovely sofa next to a huge window with a beautiful view over Manhattan, but the walls were completely bare and the room looked rather austere, more like an office than a bedroom.  The bed was comfortable. On the plus side, I want to mention the concierge/valet staff, Ainsley and his colleagues: they were friendly, proactive and very helpful. They were the ones that made me feel welcome.

title: US trip 26 April to 8 May
text: I recently stayed at the Millennium Hilton Hotel New York and unfortunately, I was not satisfied with the level of service provided by the front office staff, specifically Ms. Ami, who I found to be unprofessional and impolite. Additionally, I was disappointed when I was unable to borrow an umbrella from the hotel, though I did appreciate the helpful and friendly demeanor of the bellmen. Regrettably, my experience at the hotel fell short of my expectations and I do not plan to return or recommend this establishment to friends or colleagues. I hope that this feedback will help improve the service and experience for future guests.

title: Great Hotel in Mew York
text:
This hotel was at a handy location to attractions but at the same time away from busy areas so very quiet at night. Central Station is a 5.min walk away. The rooms were spotless with maids coming in each day. We had city views on the 35th floor and can say this was one of the highlights of our stay, the views were spectacular.
Doormen were so friendly and couldn't help you more. Our check out agent was so friendly and chatty. The hotel has a small cafe which was fab for grabbing a quick bite to eat on the go. Water for the room would have been a nice additional extra provided to guest. I would recommend check in agents took time to assist guest in explaining extra charges for the room. There is a resort fee of $30 dollars per night that you should be able to use in the hotel cafe, however this was not explained to us on how to access this. When we asked the cafe staff about this they advised you charged it to your room and it was sorted at check out. This was not the case and we actually got charged for these goods extra. Security deposit is taken at check in and was refunded the next working day after check out.
Definitely would stay here again.

title: Sadly, it fell below our expectations
text: We were attending a week long meeting at the UN and booked several rooms. All of us had similar experiences each being disappointed at the quality of accommodation, service, ambience, amenities, and staff responsiveness.

title: Worst hotel experience I have ever had
text:
The staff is overall fully incompetent and not thought through. 
We booked the hotel with the company card for our high-level delegation. I had to come back to the front desk every single day to give the credit card back again physically (after having exchanged it previously over the phone and per email) to give back the name and reservation of our guests. Despite this, they still managed to ask one of our high-level guests for his credit card for booking his reservation, and I had to again go to the front desk to deal with their incompetence.  
After the stay, the amount of the reservation per room was wrong (billed at the tariff of the day and not at the tariff at the moment of reservation) and I had to formally call AND write to ask again for a reimbursement. I am still waiting for the reimbursement. 
I have spent overall more time at the front desk dealing with the staff than at the conference I was supposed to attend.

title: Service not so good
text: Love this hotel the stuff was great and the location was very walkable to many destinations in Manhattan. Was not happy with the executive lounge not being open, not being turned during the day, ice machines taken off the floor and general lack of amenities. I expect more when I stay at Hilton properties. Full service does not mean full service anymore. Tried to order room service and was told I had to come downstairs and get the food to go and they would not take my order on the phone.

title: Excellent Stay
text: Staff were very friendly and helpful.  Rooms were good size with good view of the city. Location was great within walking distance to everything.  Happy hour in hotel lounge was good quality.  Also lots of great restaurants close by.

title: Good location
text: Hotel is located directly across the UN and quiet area.  Hotel lobby is dated but rooms are clean. I arrived early and paid for an upgrade for a room that was ready at check in rather than wait as we left home pretty early that day. The view was amazing. Mattress needs to be changed as it dipped in the middle but I only stayed one night so was not bothered by it.

title: A great overnight stay
text:
We needed a nice hotel in a good location and the UN Plaza Hilton checked all our boxes. I’ve stayed there before so knew what to expect, and got a fair price for a corner room with East River view. The hotel is a short walk from Grand Central Station and located in a safe area. 
With the digital key, I didn’t even have to check in at the front desk or wait to get into my room once it was available. The room was clean, well-equipped, the bed comfortable and a nice view out the window. 
We have no complaint and would gladly stay there again.

title: Don’t stay here if you’re on a holiday
text:
We arrived around 14 obvious we couldn’t check in however, customer service is hard to find at the Front Desk. She mentioned that we can comeback later.. didn’t explained where we could leave our luggage or any standard information. At 16 we had to wait in queue again to check in which could be more efficient if they did a pre check in already while we were there before.. 

Right after we checked in we found a lot of hair from previous guest behind the bathroom door and around the toilet. Went downstairs again to mention this at the same Frond Desk Clerk and her reaction was everything which you could not imagine: I didn’t cleaned your room, with an apologie which was hard to make and not sincere at all. The Director of Rooms came along to apologize and tried to resolve the issues, had to wait for another hour to finally get settled after 15 hours traveling. We got a complimentary coffee which we didn’t took. 

The housekeeping never provided us with new glasses or cleaned the used glasses. Trash was still there on multiple days. Lights in the hallway of the room didn’t worked entire stay even when we mentioned this multiple times, rain shower didn’t worked entire stay even with pressing or pulling the button when switching the shower on. 

Level of service in general below standards, never a Hello or have a nice day by walking by, not even by the doorman. Had 1 drink at the bar, worst experience ever for 78 dollar. The bartender was discussing internal staffing issues with the waiter, it was so loud that we could overhear the entire conversation how he wasn’t scared to get fired since the hotel has no one else to run the bar. I do understand that the staff is running for everyone who is staying for the UN but I highly recommend to stay elsewhere if you’re a tourist, not very welcome at all. 

Maybe a recap of how service in hospitality works and add a body language course especially facial expressions. There are a few who rather stay at home than helping hotel guests with a resting … face.  

After 2 weeks of messaging the hotel due to all the complaints, not a single reply.

title: great experience for a family gathering
text: My family and I gathered in New York to remember my recently departed brother. Scott, the Director of Rooms, made sure we had a lovely time together. We had a two bedroom suite with views of the East River and New York's incredible skyline. I lived for three years in this city earlier this century and the memories of a "city so nice they named it twice" returned. Thanks to Rosie for being so kind every time I called the main number. Dorca made us feel welcomed from the moment we arrived. Habibur and Peter were wonderful souls, too, as was the housekeeper for the 33rd floor this past weekend. I didn't get her name. I absolutely loved that sweet guard dog on the first floor, too. Because we're near the UN, lots of security is on this block. I enjoyed walking by the consulate offices for African countries and Haiti. We have such an incredible world that needs us to love it and each other. The staff at this hotel helps us remember this.

title: Wonderful service, amazingly helpful staff
text:
We have stayed at this hotel many times.  Its a terrific location for the UN as well as easy access to Central Station and mid-town.  The staff are fantastic.  They have been so helpful and made our stay a delight, they could not have been more helpful.

We are a diamond member and had been upgraded.  We had booked a suite, they gave us a bigger one with the most awesome views.  We needed a few extra things in the room and they were so helpful and went out of their way and were super helpful.  Special call outs to Marlin, Ranji, Susan and John.   
The coffee shop serves excellent coffees and good range of food throughout the day.
Some aspects of the decor are a little tired and need a attention but that is outside the remit of the hotel staff (thats for the owner)  but our room was clean and comfortable and the staff throughout the hotel absolutely the best.  We were so pleased with our 7 day stay at the hotel we extended it for a few extra nights and already planning to stay here on our next visit to NYC.

title: Wonderful location
text:
Great location, wonderful staff and great views.
The room was perfect and we had a wonderful view. Everyone working here was very friendly and profesional. The building is not the newest but it’s well maintained. Everything is within a walk king distance.

title: Book a King City View, Get Something Else!
text:
Booked a solo birthday trip for my 40th back in January. Got divorced the last year and this is my first solo b-day in a long time, so I decided to hit up NYC for the week.

Flight got in pretty late and when I got to the room I found two full beds instead of a king. No worries, I figured I’d get some sleep and call in the morning to change rooms.

Called the front desk and was informed that they overbooked and tough cookies. Apparently the room labeled “king bed city view” doesn’t actually mean you get that room.

I was informed to call Expedia, which I did. Expedia called the front desk and was informed that the Hilton is out of king bed rooms that they gladly sold me, but not to worry! I was actually given an “upgrade” to a double bed room WITH a city view (the one I already paid for with a king bed).

Everything else is as expected, one star because I don’t like that when I called down the Hilton staff tried to make their problem my problem.

I booked a king room. I paid for a king room. I did this two months ago. Hilton choosing to overbook their rooms is not acceptable… it’s not like your customers can choose to not pay the agreed upon amount, now is it?

title: Not worth it on points or dollars
text:
I’m writing this from the perspective of a Hilton Diamond member. Got a room for NYE on points. But had another paid reservation for an additional 4 nights and the rate was reasonable. Glad I did because this place is barely 3 stars and not worth the price or points.

Being NYE I understood no upgrades were available. The room we got was ok but the carpet was beyond filthy!

I had asked about an upgrade for the following nights and in the span of a day and half, I must have talked to 6 different front desk agents and none cared. By the 7th person I spoke to I was able to score a suite. Well it was dated, old furniture and plumbing and the AC did not work well and it was noisy.

As an ex-New Yorker, I can understand some attitude but this is a training and management issue: these folks have not been properly trained in the art of customer service or just basically caring about customer needs.

Then trying to get a late check out was another fiasco! I had a teleconference in the afternoon before leaving and needed privacy. Also had to talk to several front desk people and none cared and they all had to go in the back and talk to someone. And I wasn’t even asking for a 4 pm late check out which I’m entitled to receive.

Poor customer service by all front desk staff that I dealt with during my stay.

The only exception was Wendy at the coffee shop! She was delightful!

Unless you get a very good deal this place is not worth it even though some views are nice and the location is ok.

title: Sehr zuvorkommend und aufmerksam
text:
Als wir endlich im Hotel angekommen sind gab es erst einen kleinen Schock, dass kein Zimmer für uns gebucht ist. Aber die sehr freundliche Managerin konnte dies bald klären und wir bekamen eins mit sehr tollem Ausblick.
Alle Angestellte im Hotel waren sehr freundlich und zuvorkommend.

title: Female receptionist vs males - completely different level.
text:
Stay there 22-27.  Have some problem wz my credit card and need some flexibility to use cash invole. Im so lucky to check in with a lovely and helpful lady. She help me solve the problem quite easy. And along the stay, one manager on duty during 25 morning also have been very helpful. Including the lady manager on duty of 26 evening also very understanding and caring. One Asian lady on duty of the eveing of 26th though seem to lack the vasic understanding of the bill. I point out to her what s wrong and she seem to not understand. Keep brushing off and in the end said I need to talk to whoever make the bill....once the lady manager come in, with a single glance she spot what s weird in the bill immidately, just like i try to tell the Asian lady who refuse to listen.

The male receptionsit though...was on different level. Not only they seem to lack knowledge to simple understand basic bill math, they also lack passion. Quite stone cold and unwillingful to help. If i were to checked in with them, no way they wd help me the same way i got help from woman side.

The duty manager at night, during 26th night also have been quite rude. He dont allow me to finish my story and try to brush me off everytime i speak. He keep saying he will fix the bill, blame me for making his work harder. And at one point he point his finger on my bill that show f&f rate and say he wont do this (help) especially with booking like this one. It s like he disrespecrful for people who use discounted rate as if they are not one of the clients. When i had  enough I just empasis a few point lf the bill that s wrong and ask him to fix. He wave his hand and say in shooing motion said 'bye now'  this s probably the most rudest person I encounter in this trip. And the bill he promise he will fix and ask me to come back in the morning? It didnt fix. Everything stay the same.

title: Good stay
text: The staff was very friendly and there was a nice little cafe downstairs to grab a snack if you needed it. Our room was fine. The bathroom was the best part. It was updated and pretty nice and clean. The carpets and walls in the bedroom were a little dirty in spots, but the bed, furniture and windows were clean. We enjoyed our stay and didn't have any issues.

title: Still dreaming of this view
text: The view from my room was so enchanting. To this day I cant help but blush whenever I see the Chrysler building. I didn't love that you could smell second hand smoke through the ventilation system, or that the cold air was always on, or that you could hear the neighbors in the wee hours... But I really did love my stay here. So cool sleeping across the street from The UN, & taking a light walk to work.

title: Fantastic location and view
text:
I read a lot of reviews before I came and was honestly regretting my choice of booking but I’m so glad I was wrong. Staff were friendly enough on check in. The hotel looks lovely (the odd stain on carpets but honestly it just sounds like people are being overly picky) the rooms were large, we had a stunning view of the water and cleaned daily (if you want). The location is right next to grand central and a short walk to Times Square. I would stay again. 

I would have given it 5/5 but there was a small issue with housekeeping not shutting our room door properly, luckily it was only for a short time and the issue was resolved by security but feel it did need to be mentioned.

title: URGE MEJORAR SERVICIO
text: Es un gran hotel en una zona muy buena si vas a Naciones Unidas pero el trato del personal es terrible . Cero amables . Me correspondía mi upgrade y me ofrecieron hasta al final un cuarto terrible y viejo y mejor me fui.

title: Location everything
text: We have stayed at this hotel many times over the years.  Location is everything, staff welcoming and helpful.  Agree that in some regards the hotel is a bit tired now but rooms remain large and toilets luxurious!

title: Mala atención
text: Servicio despersonalizado, no hay atención ni amabilidad como si el cliente no existiera. Ha bajado mucho la calidad. De tres dias de estadía, el segundo ni siquiera hicieron aseo en la alcoba. No volvería a este hotel.

title: Terrible staff! So Rude! They scammed me
text: The manager Scott is very rude to customers, he yelled and screamed at me on the phone he wouldn’t let me talk and blamed me for an issue that was from the front desk. ! This guy needs training he’s a loose cannon

title: Room not ready after 4pm
text: The reception didn’t welcome guests . Check in time 4pm but still not ready after 4:50pm , not allow check out extension after 11am check out . Not provide diamond member benefits to me during my staying experience.

title: Horrible experience staying here with family!
text:
There was brown water coming out of the tap, should there be anything else that’s needed for a one star? I have videos of the incident where for over a minute and half we could see sewer water coming out of the sink. The manager on duty did very little to help rectify the situation. After asking repeatedly, were given a case of water and was told more will be provided in the morning but no additional water was provided in the morning. I was told the General Manager named Thomas Caska would be reaching out to me, that never happened either! 

Lastly, as a gold member I am supposed have $30 of daily credit towards food, however, I was charged for those too!

title: Terrible experience!
text: Went into the hotel with great expectations, right around the Christmas holidays. The experience from the first point of contact was very unwelcoming. The Bellman on duty that night was rude and unfriendly. He acted like he was unhappy taking our bags and parking our car. So I decided to take the bags in myself. Then came the most cold and unfriendly check in experience I’ve ever had at any Hilton ( and I stay at a lot of Hiltons and I love the brand and the staff). No hello! No greetings! Especially as my wife is a Gold member, we expected a little bit more. The person who checked us in was a gentleman called Avery. He was the most disconnected hotelier I’ve ever seen and terribly unfriendly. Even though we had paid extra for an upgraded room type , he gave us a lower category room type and just wanted us to go away. Didn’t even point to the elevators. When we got to the room it was dirty and had soiled carpets and crumbs on the floor. The room essentially was very much a lower category room and not very clean to begin with. When we came down and told him the issue , he just handed over another key and didn’t bother to apologize or show any expression of concern whatsoever!!!! Unreal!!! Never in my 30 years of travel have I seen such terrible service and that too at a Hilton. This gentleman needs to be in a different profession as his decision to give us a lower category room than what we had paid for was essentially unethical and he terrible customer service skills. Not a good representation of Hilton! One silver lining was the morning crew. Much more friendly and actually helpful.

title: Plastic in Drink
text: Got a shot at the bar and when I took it there was a piece of plastic in it. I ended up swallowing it and there was more plastic left in the cup. The bartender did not seem to care at all and just gave me a glass of water and asked if I was going to be ok which was almost insulting. Do not recommend going to the bar here at all.

title: Brilliant from start to finish
text: Just spent 3 nights and the place is fantastic. The staff are all amazing and friendly the hotel it’s self is clean and well kept and the beds are very comfortable. I truly can’t understand the bad reviews but you can’t please everyone. If I return to nyc this is where I’m staying

title: Awful!!
text:
It was awful from start. 
1 st they could not find my booking for 2 hours. And did not even apologize once they finally were able to find. Incompetent. 
2 nd  My room
Had in the name “city view” and of course I paid more but guess what- they did not have it available. No refund no compensation big ZERO for this hole. Also very dirty and outdated.

title: needs a remodel
text: while this is a great location, only three short blocks to Grand Central, the shoddy rooms and poor elevators make it a poor choice.  stained carpets, moody staff, faucets coming out of the counters, thermostats that require a PhD to operate.

title: There are better hotels in New York.
text:
Our hotel room had plastic glasses and paper cups, no drawer space, a wardrobe with five coat hangers, the view from our window, which is supposed to one of the hotels strongpoints, was a view of next doors air conditioning  unit. The happy hour white wine offering was a pretty disgusting Chardonnay. The hotel lobby was dirty and needed a good clean. No office facilities, the lady on the checking desk was quite rude, stayed here three nights, we wont be coming back here.
On the plus side our hotel room was very clean.

title: Diamonds memeber mean nothing to the hotel.
text:
Gerneral manager whor read review on tripadvisor and keep answer the review that they will take suggestions and improve, ect...did nothing as such. I think all the complaints here has been ignored and no measures have been done to improve whatever the service all the customer dissatifies. All the promise of 'we will take your words and do something better' is just auto responses from general manager, using copy and paste words from his computer without actually doing anything abou it.

Im not a picky person. Barely complaint about anything. Stay at 12 properties hilton in New York and this one is the most less friendly one and having the most attitude one from receptionists. By reading all the reviews, everyone say good things about house keeping and door man and they all have problem about receptionists and these are true.

I was diamonds members, upon check in I did not ask for upgrade. I understand it's depends on availability. I simply ask her if she could check if there is any room that have bigger windows or bright/sunny room. Im happy to stay at room type i have book, never expect to get free freebies despite being diamonds. You now what she said back? She said 'no upgrade OR WHATSOEVER' in this hotel even if you are diamonds. I was taking aback at how rude she sound and the way she snap back at me. I was smiling at her the entrie time when I greet her. Then I gather myself and calmly said I wasnt ask for upgrade. Im asking if she can maybe assign room that sunny or have big window more than others. She snaped back at me again said 'you got what you've paid for'.

At this points I just shut up already. Never feel so much ashame like this in my life. What is the point being loyal customer of hilton and get this diamonds status if i was treat like a begggers.

title: vue superbe bon. emplacement
text:
la vue superbe et l’emplacement seront les seuls points positifs que nous retiendrons..
le personnel d’accueil est expéditif et désagréable 
aucun effort pour se faire comprendre..
la literie est confortable mais le reste ne correspond en rien à un 4 étoiles !!  pas de peignoir pas de chaussons pas de coton ni coton tiges.. une machine à café en fin de vie
un frigo vide , une moquette tachée.. et pour un prix exorbitant  (noël) petit dej et wifi non compris..
dommage !!

title: Average Hotel with poor service
text:
An average experience throughout. 

We arrived at around 10pm, no help was offered with our luggage. My wife is 6 months pregnant and after travelling for 18 hours - I would have really appreciated some help with our bags - none was forthcoming.

The property itself is nice, although our room was tired. One of the wardrobes had a hole where bulbs were meant to be (so no light at all) the other wouldn’t close properly so shed a constant light into the room. The desk and bedside tables in the room had all seen better days and the lamp on the desk was bent and broken. The computer connections to the side of the desk (USB to charge phones/tablets) was broken. We had paid extra to have an ‘illy coffee machine’ - which was just a terrible cafetière and not as described. 

The carpet is absolutely disgusting and we didn’t dare walk on it bare foot!

The ‘mini fridge’ is a domestic fridge which did not fit in the space adequately (obviously the cupboard was originally fitted with a hotel spec minibar). This meant that the door would catch on the inner of the cupboard every time you wanted to open it. Whilst the room was adequate, it simply is not good enough at this price point.

On a plus, the bathroom is excellent, the bed was comfy and the city view - spectacular!

Service;

Overall the service from this property was poor almost exclusively at every single touch point.

1 - I had emailed prior to arrival to ask a few questions - the reply was overly direct and set the tone for our upcoming stay.
2 - Check in was the only exception and the gentleman who checked us in was efficient and helpful but not overly friendly. We were not told about any relevant details (would we like to pay for breakfast for example)
3 - I had cause to wait in the lobby for a delivery - I asked the lady behind the desk if she had seen it arrive, she didn’t want to help. Whilst I waited, I witnessed 3 separate guests enquire about what time checkout was - the lady behind the desk was rude to every single one of them (if so many guests are asking the same question, this shows a lack of service at check in). She could not have made her displeasure at having to answer guests queries more obvious had she spat in their faces! She was dreadful and is definitely working in the wrong industry! (Management, if you are reading this it was 1830 on December 29th 2022).
4 - Several guests asked for late checkout and were rudely told ‘call back before 11am and speak to the manager’ - really quite unhelpful and unprofessional - not to mention unnecessarily rude!

Bar Service

1 - Service was slow and we were not made to feel very welcome. At one point one of the 2 barmen simply turned his back and walked away from me, even though I had been stood at the bar for 2-3 minutes and there were no other customers waiting to be served.
2 - The bar pricing is different to the advertised rates on the website (and the rates which we were emailed prior to arrival)
3 - The service was ‘ok’ and there was certainly no ‘service with a smile’ here!

Overall - the property is ‘OK’ and the location and views are great but the service was poor and this is what would stop me returning. Having spent my career working for two very large American companies who put the customer at the absolute heart of everything which they do - it was a great shame to see that the staff at this property were not doing this. Put simply, the service was ‘the straw that broke the camel’s back’

A special mention to the housekeeping staff however - after a long day of sightseeing - it was lovely to come back to a clean room and their thank you note for being tipped a relatively small amount really meant a lot!

title: Review of stay
text:
Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights last week arriving on Monday 19th December 2022. Upon check in I found the lady behind the check in desk to be extremely rude. She wasn't welcoming towards us and just appeared annoyed we were there bothering her. She asked me to put my card into the machine to pay the deposit which I did but I was using a credit card that very rarely gets used so I had to double check the pin number through my online banking app. To do this I asked her if I could have the WiFi code to which she said in an annoyed voice "its hilton" as if she expected me to already know it. I eventually got the pin number and made the payment. Yes I understand that it may have been annoying as I slowed the process down but nobody else was waiting. She was just doing everything in silence not communicating with us whatsoever. When she had finished she told us our room wasn't ready and that we could either wait or leave our bags with the concierge. We didn't realise that it was only 10 minutes until 4pm when check in was so we said we would leave the bags and go for a look around the area. The gentlemen who took our bags from us were extremely helpful and polite and made it appear that nothing was a problem for them. They actually exclaimed "your room isn't ready at this time" when we went over to them. We came back at 4pm and I asked to check in as it was the correct time. The entire time the lady was checking us in she didn't say one word to us until she handed us the cards and then said "breakfast is at the ambassador suit 7am-11am and to get to your room go to the left take elevator to 32nd floor", no enjoy your stay, nothing. 
The room itself was quite nice with a lovely view of the Empire State and Chrysler Buildings. 
There was plenty of coffee but only 2 tea bags and two portions of powdered milk in the room which I thought was ridiculous so I requested more tea bags the following morning from reception when we left the hotel for the day as I was going to purchase milk at a local shop. That night we arrived back to find we hadn't been given any tea bags so I had to ring down to housekeeping who then brought me 2 tea bags immediately. However each day we had the same issue as they never refilled the tea bags despite it being evident that was the only hot drink we were having. The room generally appeared clean however the carpet was a little bit stained in places and could do with a clean and the bedside light shades were incredibly dusty. The light by the room door was hanging out of the ceiling by about an inch and the bulb at the window light was blown. The bathroom was quite nice and pretty large, it had a large shower but I didn't know how to work the shower head that was fixed to the wall but that wasn't really a problem as we used the other shower head. I am used to hotels providing a guide where they mention how to use things in the room, room service menus, local attractions etc but this hotel didn't have that. We asked to use the reception safe to put some jewellery and cash but we're told there wasn't a reception safe only the safe in our room despite the notice on the back of room door stating we could leave valuables in the reception safe.
The first morning we went down for breakfast we were told that we would have to wait as there were no tables available, despite there being at least 10 tables which I counted which had nobody sitting at them. The lady was also incredibly rude to us and other guests and another couple actually asked to see the manager who came over and explained they were short staffed. One member of the couple complaining actually worked at another Hilton hotel and stated that it was completely unacceptable to speak to guests the way the lady had and that there were several tables empty so there was no reason why people's orders couldn't be taken while tables were being cleaned which I felt was a rather good suggestion. The manager then stated that due to staff shortages they wouldn't be able to clean tables and also take orders. When we did eventually sit down to eat 20mins later my partner found a long hair in between his napkin which at this point he wanted to walk out however I felt we had wasted so much time already that we may aswel just stay. My partner ordered sausages which were incredibly salty, overcooked and generally unpleasant. I ordered the Irish oats with banana which I enjoyed. There were also items on the menu which they said they didn't have and it wasn't a case they just didn't have them on that occasion as the waiter said "oh no we don't have those" meaning croissants and English muffins. Why have items on a menu if you don't have them or at least tell the customer you don't have them prior to them ordering. We could see one of the chefs eating and it wasn't him tasting the food he was actually having his breakfast behind the pass.
