The waiter brought us down the bill for breakfast despite breakfast being included in our room rate so we had to explain this to him and he had to go off to check this. Breakfast on the other mornings was an improvement from the first morning.
During our stay we found the concierge and housekeeping staff to be incredibly helpful and friendly. They would greet us each morning when they saw us asking how we were. 
Upon check out the lady (a different one to the one who checked us in) was very polite. She apologised for the wait despite us only waiting 5 mins and was polite to me during our exchange.
The hotel is in a good location near to Grand Central Station and you can walk to all local attractions such as St Patrick's cathedral, Rockefeller Centre and Empire State Building.

title: UN Plaza Hilton New York - Look Elsewhere!
text:
Told at checkin that this property does not ever offer any upgrades - even to Hilton Diamond members.

No glasses in room, so called for glasses and ice, but told that we’d have to go downstairs to bar to request.

In house service phones go unanswered.

Only one set of towels in room.

In short, paying almost $1500 for three days with few amenities - I’d look elsewhere!

title: Location is fabulous for sightseeing. Standard and quality of the hotel isn’t great sadly. Staff were friendly.
text: I stayed here to enjoy special time pre-Xmas with my granddaughter. Our best times were when we were out of the hotel. It was well below expectations! It had a couple of serious failings including a rat running around the breakfast room and food in the cafe not being labelled properly almost causing sickness. The rooms were tired and there was blood on my bedding which wasn’t mine.

title: Ok but that's all!
text:
Nice enough place to stay. The room was tidy but a little dated. The views over the city were fantastic although you had to crane your neck to get a good view of the river. The food is very pricey , much like the rest of New York, and the wine is expensive unless you go to happy hour(which is actually 2 hours). I mean 10 dollars for some Brussel Sprouts!!!!!!! 25 minute walk to the heart of the city so not too far and close to local diners, pubs, stores etc. We had noisy neighbours on our first night and you could hear everything they said , and sometimes the corridors are a bit noisy but I suppose that depends on who is staying there. 
I wouldn't go back but it wasn't the best.

title: Precio-calidad, no muy buena relación.
text:
Me alojé la noche del día 9 de diciembre recién pasado. Llegué muy temprano ese día cerca de las 08:30,  no tenían early check-in, menos la habitación lista, por lo que solicité un baño para asearme y poder salir antes de que estuviera lista la habitación a las 16:00 horas.
No tenían baño privado para ese tipo  de situaciones menos una ducha. Tuve que lavarme los dientes en un baño en el cual entraba gente constantemente, abrir mi maleta en dicho lugar todo muy incómodo.
Para el precio que cobran, ese es un servicio deficiente.
Habitación piso 31 con vista al Norte, agradable.

title: There’s better Hilton properties
text:
Pros: Corner rooms large by NYC standards, comfy beds, great location
Cons: Surly staff who make you feel like they don’t want you there.

I’ve never felt so unwelcome at a Hilton (gold honors member here). From reception to bar staff, employees were rude and just miserable—except for the doormen. This is particularly true of the older guy who works at the bar. Don’t even ask for an early check in or late check out EVEN IF YOU ARE GOLD AND ABOVE HILTON HONORS.

Though the location is great, pick another hotel where they actually make you feel like they’re glad you’re there.

title: Great hotel!
text: We had the most wonderful stay here, the staff were really helpful and our room had an incredible view (so much so we left the curtains open at night to be able to look out on it) and it was spotlessly clean. Highly recommend this accommodation for anyone looking to stay here.

title: Surprisly really nice hotel in NYC
text:
Stayed here for a couple of nights because jt was close to hospitals I was visiting and was very happy with the accommodations.

For New York City the rooms were very spacious - and also we were on the 29th floor (low floor for this hotel)  and the views were still amazing! 

A lot of reviewers mentioned it is dated and unclean , but the rooms didnt seem as dated as I expected. The house cleaning team definitely aren,t very thorough and it looked like the bathroom was not vacuumed before we checked in.

The toilet had heated seats and a bidet- unheard of in an American property. Heated seats was awesome cause it was cold few days!

While we were there the hotel was fully booked and there were about 3 sets of conferences happening so lobby was chaotic. We also tried to check in at 4:20pm but had to wait about 30 mins cause rooms were not ready despite their 4pm check in policy.

For check-out , even tho their app said you can pay $75 to check out at 2pm, we were denied since they were fully booked.

Also the connivence shop in the hotel is a joke!  The staff there  don’t seem to care about customer service since I had to wait for them to finish chatting with their coworkers before I could pay for my weak Ily coffee , so that can be improved for sure.

Would stay here again tho for comfort and convenience  of location

title: Nice Hotel but run like a holiday Inn
text:
Not sure who is in charge of this Hotel. I asked to speak to a Mgr at 7AM and there is no one available.

No room service, when I called the restaurant to order for me to pick up, the answer is "People have called in sick and I cannot do that". This is the B'fast server at American Grill. That kind of attitude is not reflected in the price they charge for the rooms. I would pay a little bit more and get to a better hotel than this.

title: Wonderful Stay
text: Great hotel, staff and location - couldn't have wished for a better final night in New York.  The room was spacious and clean and toiletries very much appreciated.  I wish I could have stayed longer as we liked this hotel very much.

title: Menos que razoável
text:
O Hotel possui quartos grandes e confortáveis, com uma vista belíssima do East River. Tem  uma cafeteira, um frigobar mínimo e não tem micro-ondas.  O banheiro também tinha um tamanho bom e um chuveiro potente. A limpeza foi ok, com troca de toalhas e reposição de amenities, porém percebemos que ao tomarmos banho, a água não fluía pelo ralo corretamente, acumulando água na banheira. Descobrimos que o ralo estava entupido com uma quantidade enorme de cabelo e mais outras coisas, simplesmente nojento, e acabamos por limpar por nós mesmos. Acredito que isso seja uma falha de manutenção grave !
Outro ponto que também não agradou foi a falta de atenção dos funcionários do Front Desk, pouco amáveis e extremamente secos, como se estivessem fazendo um favor de nos atender, ao contrário dos porteiros, que sempre eram simpáticos.
A localização do hotel também não é das melhores. Fica distante dos principais pontos turísticos de NY e a estação de metrô mais próxima fica a 4 quarteirões distância. Esse é um hotel que atende às pessoas que querem ir nas Noções Unidas, pois fica praticamente em frente, mas para o turista comum, achei a localização ruim.

title: Great views, easy to walk everywhere, friendly staff
text: I stayed for 4 nights over thanksgiving and I had a great stay. I was upgraded to the top floor with my Gold membership and given $18/day to use on food&drink (had breakfast bits from the little cafe daily as the restaurant was overpriced). The views were amazing, with equally impressive views from the gym. The TV in the room allows you to login to your Netflix account which was great too. Perfect location to walk everywhere if you are capable. About 7 min to Grand central station, 15-20 to 5th Av/Times Square and 30 mins to Central Park. Hardly had to use the subway due to this great location. Definitely coming back next Winter.

title: Do NOT stay here if attending UN for business!
text:
I would NOT stay there again. Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza is poorly run and lacking as to guest services.  This is especially tragic given that it flaunts itself as a UN hotel as in close to the UN and on UN Plaza. The UN conducts business with guests worldwide and the Millennium Hotel is not a business hotel. They provide ZERO business services.  I was especially dismayed to find out after leaving another hotel to check into the Millennium Hotel. I had to present at the UN and there was NO business services. No computer, no printer, no private space for meetings. NOTHING! The  operator asked me if I didn't have my laptop? Why would I ask about business services if I had my laptop? Even if I had my laptop, there was nowhere to print anything! The printer at the front desk was broken and not replaced for the majority of my stay.  What kind of UN hotel doesn't provide business services to guests? 

Then the kicker: The front desk manager, Crystal, told me that due to covid the hotel shut down the business center and could not reopen it due to regulations. She also misstated that this was the case for hotels up and down the East coast.  Does she think guests at a UN hotel are idiots? That we have not travelled before now during covid? That we didn't stay in hotels up and down the East coast. From Marco Island Florida to New York, New York, I have stayed in hotels up and down the East coast with business centers available to the hotel guests. I have also stayed at hotels internationally with business centers that were open to hotel guests. Someone inform her, and all of staff, that hotel guests are not idiots and that hotels on the East Coast have operable business centers for guests to use freely.  The additional insult is that the hotel takes ZERO precautions for covid/pandemic so why should a closed business center be the only precaution?!!!  Most of the staff do not wear mask (except for a few bellmen). There are no disinfecting wipes provided to guests - not in the lobby and not in the guestrooms. There is no hand sanitizer provided in the lobby nor guestrooms. There are no masks provided to guests in the lobby. I did not see anyone disinfecting high touch areas in the lobby (or elevators). NOTHING! 

The staff needs training. Hospitality is  a SERVICE industry!  But services here are below par.

title: Helt ok
text:
Greit hotell. Ved resepsjonen ga de ingen beskjeder, ingen smil å se heller, var kun betaling og en pekefinger mot heisen. Husk at det er tips og fees i prisen, vi betalte rundt 4000kr ekstra utenom det rommet kostet.
Rommet var stort, sengene litt harde. I dusjen la vi merke til små fluer og mugg i taket. Så ikke dette før siste dagen, så rakk ikke å spørre om nytt rom.
Beste med hotellet var dørmannen, alltid blid og hjelpsom. Håper han har god lønn. :-)
Bor nok ikke her igjen.

title: Very convenient location
text:
We stayed for 6 nights and the hotel was a great base for our sightseeing. We had fabulous view from our room. Easy walk to the Roosevelt Island tramway, Grand Central Terminal (where you can get the subway), Times Square etc.
The room was clean and well looked after, our only criticism would be the powdered creamer instead of milk for the coffee machine.
We used our Hilton Honors Gold food and beverage credit in the little coffee shop at reception. There was a good choice of cakes, pastries, yogurts, granola and some salads.
Had a super stay.

title: Do not worry about the bad reviews
text:
Booked this a good 8/9 months before my stay, and became concerned about the recent poor reviews.
However my concerns were unfounded.  Room was absolutely fine. Loads of space with both city and river views (room 3020)

All reception/concierge staff were very welcoming and helpful.  

Would have no hesitation in staying again if I go back to NY

title: A few days in NYC
text: stayed in this hotel for the second time from the 31st October to the 4th of November. It is without a shadow of doubt the best hotel I have stayed in NYC and I've stayed in quite a few. The room was immaculate, the staff was superb the view was out of this world. As I do every October I go to NYC and I hope they will welcome me back next year again and too all who have been making stupid comments about this hotel relax your not the Royal Family and shouldn't expect much else. This hotel is awesome

title: A week in NYC - excellent base!!
text:
Having travelled to NYC a few times before, we know NOT to stay anywhere near the Times Square area. We have done all the tourist stuff several times before, however our son and his girlfriend, who were with us, did most of the sights. 

PRO's
We found this hotel spot on for location. Grand Central 5/8 mins walk for the Metro, East 34th Street 10/12 mins walk for the ferry, Bryant Park/Times Square 5th Ave all with 15/20 mins walk, what's not to like?
Right from the get go the staff were excellent, no complaints, with reception/Maids/cleaning, security had to come and unlock our safe as we messed up the code, no dramas and was done with 10/15 of my call. The chap in the small coffee shop in the lobby was excellent too. But a big shout out to the concierge ( I so wish I'd got his name) he organised taking care of our cases on our last night, made sure we had a cab on time, loaded the cases in and dealt with us in such an engaging a friendly manner. 
The room we had was perfect, 3730, a fab view of the Hudson all the way down to Brooklyn. Very well fitted out, comfy bed, plenty of storage, we have stayed in some small rooms with even smaller bathrooms in NYC, this is deffo a class above. A very good standard.
Yes the carpet had a few stains etc on it, due to previous careless guests, (it had clearly been cleaned ) but did this effect my enjoyment of the room, it's facilities and the amazing views NO! TBH who comes to NYC to spend hours in their room??
We didn't eat breakfast in the hotel, nor eat in the restaurant, so I can't comment on either the standard or cost. We did have cocktails in the bar which we excellent and no more expensive than anywhere else. 

CONS
None that come to mind, would I like it to be cheaper, yes, however it was on par with others if not better and decent NYC value for money.

OVERALL would I stay here again, YES in a heartbeat.

Our last NYC visit was  Oct 2019, this was Oct 2022, we are planning a trip in 2025 , see you then Millennium Hilton!

title: Worst stay I’ve ever had in any Hilton Hotel. See below
text: I booked a night here to celebrate my anniversary on Halloween. Minus the dirty carpet everything was okay at first. In the morning the house keeper kept accidentally walking into our room while we were sleeping because the lock on the door wasn’t working. Even after I complained it happened multiple times. Once I checked out I received a 250 dollar charge on my card. when I called to question the charge they said they smelled weed in my room. I never smoked in the room or within the property. There are smoke detectors all over the room and would have went off I did. New York State law allows me to carry weed on my person and as an adult I would never smoke in a hotel room that clearly states that it isn’t allowed. I am beyond upset at the service I received. As I am a person of color I noticed a huge difference between how I was treated compared to other people who were there. I will never be staying at a Hilton hotel.

title: Great view, shabby hotel
text:
We had a pleasant experience at the hotel however there were some failings. 

Firstly the view is fantastic, and the staff are very friendly and polite. However the room itself was shabby and tired, and sleep quality was low. The walls are marked and the carpet is ripped and torn in many places. 

The sliding door to the bathroom area was damaged and did not close. Not ideal when staying with a partner. The ‘rain’ shower head did not work either, and the bathroom lights were temperamental. 

The lights inside the wardrobe were on permanently and the wardrobe door did not close fully, resulting in the room being too light to sleep in comfortably (if you need a dark room). There’s also a lot of noise within the hotel that doesn’t help sleep quality (loud air con, generators etc). 

The facilities were quite minimal, there is no kettle and no tea, only a coffee maker and powder creamer instead of milk. Housekeeping seemed to be fairly lazy for the last two days of our stay and did not top up the coffee bar or change the towels which was disappointing. 

Overall, we did enjoy our stay but we would not stay again as sleep quality was too low.

title: The best view ever
text: As I wolrd traveler's this hotel is my favourite,  best location and very friendly staff , the view from there spiceally if you take hight floor room will be best view , this hotel is very business hotel but for me as a tourist traveler always this is my best choice,  view is the best, location is the best and the staff are very friendly

title: Fabulous
text:
Our 8th time in the city. Wowsa well where do we start. Stayed for 7 nights as a party of 7 (15-77)  using three rooms. Check in perfect staff friendly and helpful. They take a holding charge on your credit card. Reception and public areas bright clean and modern. Room double double with a city view. Loads of space and large bathroom - room huge for NYC standards. Fridge, safe, hairdryer, iron all in room. Large TV with hundreds of channels. Situated off 2nd ave 43rd - quiet area but really accessible via grand central station 
We found a great diner for breakfast Johns diner on 3rd - breakfast amazing and at a decent price 
Did all the usual sites - make time for Brooklyn and Dumbo if you can and try the Edge at Hudson Yards and then walk the High-line. We got a 7 day metro pass which also covered a trip across to Roosevelt Island on the elevated tram. We took the Amtrak train from Penn station and travelled to Washington for the day - took approx 3 hrs 20. straight forward, trains on time and immaculate  
NYC noticeably dirtier in parts more than ever before - bin bags left on the streets and the smell of cannabis is everywhere (practically)  
We would definitely use this hotel again great value for money and easy access from JFK

title: October 2022 stay
text:
Lots of things happened which made me regret staying at the hotel 

1) The Lock on the door was not working, I asked the hotel reception but nothing was done about it.

2) I was not very happy with the upgrade room that I received as a Diamond Hilton Honors and when I pointed that out to reception, again fell on deaf ears 

3) The bathroom stank and I was particularly unhappy with the toilet as it stank and looked unclean.

4) The woman at reception was quite funny about Late checkout, was not given and the woman was quite rude, it was only when I complained to the manager(see below) that it was given although I’m entitled to a late checkout as being a Diamond Member. 

5) It was a nightmare asking for the  electric kettle, I was told to use the coffee maker to get hot water for the tea which was very appalling, the milk which was given was in powder form and was very bitter to taste, I asked them repeatedly for liquid milk, it was not provided!

6)  no slippers, no bathrobe was provided, infact no items which would indicate the slightest bit of luxury or enhance your stay was given. There were no cups/ plates/ cutlery which was given and paper cups were provided! 

7) The guests have to actually go down to reception to get water, normally at all the Hilton hotels that I’ve stayed, I’ve always been provided water whenever I ask reception, they were so rude about it and when I went to get water, there was no water at reception!!! 

8) everyone was speaking behind a screen, I don’t know why they still have the screens which were used during covid, it’s just so off putting. I went and asked a person at reception about my daily beverage allowance and he couldn’t explain to me what it was.

9) I complained about all the above points to the manager at the hotel and he had a very cocky, condescending attitude and didn’t resolve any issue apart from wanting to hand me water bottles!!!! He said he will ask housekeeping to go and have a look at the toilet and when I came back at the hotel, nothing was done about it neither I was offered a room
Change.

I was celebrating a birthday and overall it was a very rubbish experience, I will also be posting this review on Trip advisor so that other people can be saved from making the same mistake that I did by booking a stay at this hotel!!

title: Great Location - Great Hotel
text:
This hotel was a really a nice surprise.  Love the location. The lobby was bustling and beautiful. Our room, a corner room on the 35th floor, was spectacular. The view was breathtaking. The room was comfortable and clean. The bed was extremely comfortable, and the bathroom and shower were very good. The only problem was it took the hot water a little while to come up. 
The bar in the hotel was a wonderful end to the evening. The World Series was on the tv, and drinks and food were abundant. A very welcoming spot. 
This is definitely a hotel we will book in the future.

title: Go for the view! (If you can ignore the other failings..)
text:
We’ve recently stayed here in a two bedroom suite one the 34th floor and the view was UNBELIEVABLE. I’ve been to New York maybe 10 times and have never stayed in a room with views like this or the size of this room (especially for the money). Really brilliant value if that experience is valuable to you. HOWEVER the rooms are really quite shabby. The carpets in the suite were damaged, burned, frayed in areas. The sliding doors to the bathrooms etc are damaged and many don’t work properly. The fridges were not clean. There’s marks on the paintwork and ceilings. Generally everything looks very very tired. That said, the bathrooms were clean and had good, modern showers and the beds were good and comfortable. 

Overall, I would come back here to stay with children for the benefit of a two bedroom suite and the view. BUT the shabbiness of the room really really lets this hotel down. What a wasted opportunity for them to have a luxury hotel with the best views in Manhattan.

title: Hilton Millennium UN One - fantastic stay!
text:
We stayed at the UN One Hilton Millennium during our pre cruise New York stay from 5th to the 8th October 2022. I was allocated room 3230 on the 32nd floor and my parents had 3530 3 floors directly above me. They were both identical king corner suite rooms with lots of space and a stunning view of the city. We could clearly see the one world trade centre from our rooms. 

There was a comfortable king size bed with a writing desk and chair plus a comfortable armchair by the large windows. There was a luggage table, that was most useful and the bathroom was fabulous, fitted in stone tiles with a large walk in shower and cupboards/safe. The lighting and air conditioning was all controlled from a computer panel and was easy to use. There were plenty of lighting options including a useful nightlight in the door of the bathroom. 

The entrance to the hotel was all finished in black marble and was spotlessly clean with smart, friendly staff. We arrived late having come down on the maple leaf Amtrak service from Niagara Falls, but we were swiftly checked in by reception and soon up to our rooms. I found the rooms to be very pleasant, but the carpet did let it down a little. It was a bit grubby and worn in places but perfectly serviceable. One of the support struts under the bed was broken and rattled as you sat down, but did not impact use. I did find a half drunk bottle of the complimentary water under the bed from a previous guest, so it clearly hadn’t been deep cleaned. That said the sheets and mattress were all clean with no issues. 

We went to the highly recommended ‘johns’ cafe further down the road for our first morning breakfast, but ate at the hotel for the remaining 2 days as the hotel restaurant was very nice. Expensive, but that’s New York all over! Take more money than you expect for food as even 3 McDonald’s meals was over $70!! 

The hotel is perfectly located by the UN building and close to the river with fabulous views thanks to the rooms starting from Floor 29! You catch an express lift from reception using your room key card. 

I really enjoyed my stay at this hilton and would recommend it.

title: The views 😍
text: The lobby and reception area is pretty impressive on arrival. We were on the 35th floor and the city view was unbelievable! It was amazing watching the buildings change at different times of the day. The location is also pretty central as a great base for exploring. The rooms are a really good size but could do with a bit of a deep clean. The WiFi is pretty expensive and only free in the lobby. The coffee shop on site is also expensive at over $10 for a bottle of water and a coke! Overall a good hotel, with plenty to see near by but definitely upgrade to the city view 👌

title: Hotel is in need of some serious TLC
text: The most important factor for me is price and I got a great rate for my stay. As a Hilton diamond I appreciated being upgraded via the app to the top floor on the west wing.  However had I paid a higher rate I would have been very disappointed. The carpet in my room had a very large tear and there were several large visible stains on the floor. Honestly I was shocked. at the poor condition of the carpet.

title: Excellent hotel with fantastic rooms and views
text: This is the second time I am staying in the hotel and it is no disappointment. Relatively spacious rooms and fantastic views of UN HQ and 1st Av/Tudor City if you manage to catch the right room. I was able to check in at 12 noon which was fantastic, usual check in time is 4 pm. No extra fee was charged as is usual practice in most other hotels in NY. There’s no room service and rooms are slightly dated. Yet, very well appointed, clean and very comfortable. The guy are the check in counter is super friendly and cheers you up. The housekeeping is good by knock at your door 10 am on a Saturday. Rooms and corridors are thin-walled and it is easy to hear everything that is going on outside and next door. After I told the house keeping that that shall come back later, they happily sang along in the corridor and cleaned the next door rooms with some gospels and R&B radio in my ear. Not that it was a real bother, yet I would expect the house keeping to be slightly more respectful of the privacy of their hotel guests.

title: Disgusting
text: Worst hotel I’ve stayed in, ever!!  I don’t know how people overlook the ripped furniture, smelly bedding, cigarette burns in the carpet and furniture, and mildew in the shower and say this is a nice hotel!  Yes, the location is good for the UN but not much else.  They refused to switch my room, except maybe in the morning, after a housekeeper verifies the terrible condition.  And I have Hilton Hhonors Status!!  Can’t wait to get out of here and I  hope I don’t bring bed bugs home with me.

title: Lovely hotel with amazing views over the city
text: We had an amazing time! The room views are breathtaking, we saw the Chrysler building , Empire State Building and the one World Trade Center all from our window (room 3333) . Our room was modern and very clean, there were some stains on the carpet , which is normal when it’s all carpet, however this was not disturbing at all. The check staff was not that friendly to be honest, she just handed us the room-card not even a description where we can find our room or information about the hotel. However the rest of the staff was amazing and very friendly !

title: Beauty of City
text: The New York City prime heart of the United States, I found different cultures, nice food, and the beauty of feelings.   i found proud to visit the place UN plaza, where i found and feel humans value, importance

title: Geweldig verblijf met een fantastisch uitzicht!
text:
Wat een fantastisch hotel. Wij zijn hier een week te gast geweest en hadden waarschijnlijk de mooiste kamer. Een suite op de 40e etage met onze 2 kinderen. New York is een geweldige stad maar 's avonds terugkomen in onze suite was ook een feest! In de ochtend wakker worden ook! Wat een prachtig uitzicht. Onze citytrip was mede dankzij Millenium UN Plaza onvergetelijk.
Extra dank en complimenten voor George, de portier. Hij regelde een taxi naar het vliegveld voor ons en dankzij hem hadden we onze rugzak die we vergeten waren in de taxi heel snel terug, een lifesaver en zo'n aardige man!
vraag aan Hotel: we zijn 2 dingen vergeten en hebben gemaild, maar we krijgen verder geen antwoord meer. Hoe kan ik jullie bereiken per mail?

title: Not the best experience !
text: We booked a 2 bedroom suite based on a recommendation from colleagues who had attended the nearby United Nations. Our room was not ready at 4pm check in and a complimentary ( much smaller) alternative was given after waiting over an hour for information. After going out for the evening carrying our valuables & passports we were told our room would be ready at 9pm. 9pm came & went and despite hanging around reception it was 10pm before our room was ready. John the manager offered to deduct 1 nights room charge & give us $100 spends in the bar. The suite we eventually got into after 10pm had fabulous views but was dated and had the most stained carpet I’ve ever seen in any hotel. There was no room service, no ice bucket , no plates to eat a take away we had in the room on our last night despite there being a 6 seater round table & fridge in the suite. The elevator was dated and old resulting in us getting stuck on the 34th floor and having to call for assistance. The very best part of this hotel is the concierge staff who are wonderful. Our breakfast was very nice as was the restaurant staff . However we were advised on check out that a Diplomat had overstayed in our room on the first night causing the check in delay for us! So in reality someone more important than us had priority over us gaining access to our room so be aware of this when booking & choosing this hotel. Not a great experience for us but we were quickly compensated for our troubles . I would far rather have had a nice experience on my holiday than compensation though ! Not a great experience for my wife & I sadly on what was a very special retirement trip for me .

title: AVREI DATO ZERO MA NON SI PUO'......NON FATEVI INGANNARE DALLE FOTOGRAFIE
text:
Abbiamo soggiornato per 11 notti (21.08.2022\01.09.2022), prenotazione effettuata a novembre 2021 ad un prezzo vantaggioso, eravamo in 4.
Da fuori molto bello e bella la zona, camera al 30mo piano, entriamo e vediamo subito che è sporca e vecchia, chiediamo un cambio, la manager di turno (una donna afro-americana) ci dice che il giorno seguente avrebbe provveduto, quindi la mattina seguente scendiamo con tutti i bagagli con la promessa che al nostro rientro li avremmo trovati nella nuova camera ma nulla, arriviamo e la camera è sempre la stessa, riparliamo con il manager (un altro...ben poco gentile, non molto alto costituzione robusta carnagione chiara e rosso di capelli) dopo mille rimostranze ci cambia camera e ci manda la 35mo piano, camera peggiore della prima!! Lo chiamiamo gli facciamo vedere la sporcizia, la tenda stracciata, la lampada rotta...ci porta in una terza stanza nell'altra ala, peggio del peggio, senza frigo e con due letti singoli (noi in 4) no doccia ma vasca, mi sento presa in giro, ci propone di andarcene ovviamente pagando le 2 notti fatte, noi cerchiamo un'altra soluzione ma non troviamo nulla ovviamente! La mattina seguente alla reception parliamo con un terzo manager (l'unico che salvo per gentilezza...un ragazzo calvo dagli occhi scuri) si segna tutte le criticità e al nostro rientro in stanza la lampada rotta era stata sostituita e anche la sveglia con gli attacchi per le ricariche dei cellulari funzionante ed il frigo ripulito ma le tende rotte, i cereali incastrati tra pavimento e finestra oltre allo schifo delle macchie sparse a destra e manca ci hanno accompagnato per tutto il soggiorno. Ci hanno offerto una colazione che tra l'altro non consiglio di acquistare perché carissima e senza assortimento di cibo salato (per averlo ordini piatti a parte che si pagano cari e salati). Non lo consiglio assolutamente perché anche se si possono trovare ogni tanto offerte interessanti su Booking assolutamente le camere sono sporche e vecchie, come anche i corridoi e gli ascensori (della nostra ala), si può trovare assolutamente di meglio inoltre il personale in reception non è affatto cordiale e ti trattengono 100$ a notte di cauzione.
Salvo solo la vista dalla camera, per il resto zero assoluto.

title: Terrible hotel, no room service, old-age, It's not worth a tenth of the price!!!!
text: Terrible hotel, no room service, old-age carpets that looked so old and dirty trash!!, but when we arrived we saw that they are more fake than a 3 dollar bill! I booked a city view room with a king bed and they put me in another 4x cheaper room and a room trash and they didn't solve the problem! It's not worth paying even a tenth of the price they ask of you!!

title: Place looks nothing like the photos
text: Great Views. Place is filthy.  First thing you notice is that the carpets look like they have never been cleaned in both the hallways and rooms.  The shower heads are moldy.  The sofa in our room has stains that I don't even want to think what they are. Snagged a bedsheet to cover. Curtains are off the hooks and difficult to close.  It is a shame as this is the hotel by the UN and am sure that visitors from foreign countries book here because of its location.

title: Unbelievable views it pays to step away from Times Square for your  accommodation
text: Fifth time to New York first time staying away from Times Square, the hotels views were breath taking we booked a two bedroom suite and a separate queen room as a party of 5 for the price I’d have payed for a double queen in Times Square. The hotel was everything you could ask for.

title: Greedy Greedy Place
text: Stay awwy they serm to specialize in price gouging. I think they are so used to ripping off UN folks and foreigners that they may forget ever day americans. John Gibson manager i spoke with is most greedy manager i ever encountered and lstaed they “ often oversell rooms “  Hilton honors is worthless here. Save your money, also $100 for valet parking , stay away !

title: Vi rassicuro: vi offre quello che vedete in foto!
text: Siamo stati con mia moglie per 6 notti. Hotel che mantiene quel che promette. Eravamo in una camera al 31esimo piano. vedevamo il palazzo di vetro delle UN, il Chrysler e l'Empire State Building, più tutto il resto di Downtown Manhattan! uno spettacolo. Camera spaziosa, che con i bagagli è importante, bagno e letto comodissimi. abbiamo fatto colazione una volta sola, non consiglio, perchè lì vicino c'è un diner da perdere la testa e quindi, non siamo rimasti in hotel. posizione tranquilla e comoda: in 5 minuti a piedi siete alla fermata tra la 42th e la Lexington e andate praticamente ovunque. Prossima volta a NYC so dove prenotare.

title: Stay somewhere else
text: Not worth staying at. Crappy service... Uncomfortable bed. I'm sure there are better places to stay so avoid this Hilton hotel... Bad service. Unfriendly staff.. The hotel is just too busy in general.

title: Etwas runtergerockt
text: Mitten in Manhattan, ruhige Seitenstraße. Service eher desinteressiert. Zimmer gross und ruhig und relativ modern. Grosse Dusche. Leider alles etwas runtergerockt und leicht verdreckt. Unter dem Bett lag noch eine Wasserflache vom Vorgänger.

title: Dirty and dilapidated
text: Ok folks - we need to get real about this place - hope the photos will be added so you can see for yourselves.  This place does NOT reflect what should be a Hilton hotel.  Its dirty and dilapidated.  From wallpaper coming away to filthy carpets to mould in bathrooms to broken window are aspects you really wouldn't expect to find with this brand. The staff are great and, through cheek-biting conversation, are fully aware they're doing the best they can with what they've got to work with. The location is excellent with Grand Central Station just an 8 minute walk away and a 10 minute walk to the East River ferry terminal which is a fantastic way to get to Long Island and Brooklyn and also takes you straight down to Wall Street for an exceptional $3 per trip. Very important to note that when it comes to room sizing this is one area where American Hotels decide to go small.  We had a room apparently accommodating 4 adults so naturally we expect - from the photos - to see two double beds.  Double they were not - more like large singles or very conservative three quarter beds.  As the hotel was full - staff couldn't accommodate a larger room - not even able to provide a camp bed - most disappointing.

title: My necklace was stolen / lost during room service
text:
My stay was from June 5th to June 7th, 2022

The next day on June 6th at around 6 or 7pm, after returning from my meeting, I realized that my room was missing my Gucci necklace; the room was serviced while I was gone.

I immediately called the front desk and was transferred to the manager on duty, his name is Zack. I believe he is the Front Desk Manager.

Zack told me that he along with a security guard would go into the old room to make sure I didn’t leave the necklace there, and that the room was occupied but they had gotten permission from the current guest there.

I waited for about an hour and I was told by Zack that they couldn’t find the necklace there. 

I asked Zack if I should call the police about this incident and Zack advised me to fill out a report with security instead and that they’ll see what the hotel can do for me. He also mentioned the next day, when both rooms were vacated, that they’d flip it upside down to search for the missing necklace. He also advised me to talk to the security manager (Sulvino) the next day.

The next day on June 7th, at around 1pm, I found and spoke with Sulvino from security and informed him of my missing necklace. He assured me that he would look into the matter and get back to me by the end of the day via email and phone call.

I didn’t receive any sort of communication from Sulvino, I then returned to the hotel at around 5pm to speak with Sulvino to get a status update, he informed me that they couldn’t find the necklace.

Sulvino suggested that maybe I didn’t bring the necklace on this trip or have lost it before I got into the hotel. However I showed him photos I sent to friends of my visit to the hotel gym, wearing the necklace on the same night I checked in. After which I did not leave the hotel property that night. I encouraged Sulvino to have hotel security check footage of that night and trace my movement, and also witness me wearing the necklace with their own eyes.

After this conversation, Sulvino assured me that he would be contacting me by the end of the day with contact information to the main management and instructions.

Today is June 8th, and I still haven’t received any communication from Sulvino or anyone from the hotel.  I feel this is very unprofessional.

I trust my life and property with the hotel when I stay there. Almost 40 years of my life I have stayed in many hotels including Hilton, and I have never had an incident like this occur, where a valuable item disappears from my hotel room. Because my room was entered by someone unknown to me for cleaning service and etc.. I hold the hotel accountable for this missing piece of jewelry.

title: Great Hotel location
text:
We stayed here for a week whilst in New York .  From the moment we arrived to time we left all staff at the hotel were super helpful and friendly from reception bell boys cleaners bar staff . 

We had booked a two bedroom suite and the suite was massive a little dated but very clean huge table chaise lounges two fridges microwave two bathrooms both very modern . 

Three tvs all smart tvs WiFi worked well comfy beds and the views were amazing from the 36th floor of Un river back in Manhattan Location was good opposite UN 10 min walk to grand central . 

Overall great stay would recommend.

title: Puuuuuh.....
text:
Also nachdem wir das Hotel für einen recht günstigen Preis bekommen haben (550 Dollar für 4 Nächte in den Sommerferien) war das alles okay. Die Mitarbeiter waren von mundfaul bis freundlich  alle unterschiedlich. Das Hotel ist total alt. Die Teppiche in den Fluren sind fleckig und allgemein wirkt alles sehr abgeranzt, auch Sachen im Zimmer, wie zB der Kofferständer. Allerdings war dafür alles sauber. Für Goldmember gab es 18 Dollar credit pro Person, welchen man im Café unten in der Lobby einlösen konnte. Das war für uns zu dritt tatsächlich ausreichend. Für Bagels, Kaffee, Wasser etc. hats immer gereicht. Natürlich sind die Preise höher als draußen, aber warum das Guthaben verschwenden. Für 36 Dollar konnten wir uns morgens immer eindecken.

Die Lage ist ok, je nach dem, welche Sachen man erleben will. Nachdem ich gesehen habe, welche Preise hier aufgerufen werden, würde ich das Hotel für diese Preise allerdings nicht buchen. Ich bereue den Aufenthalt definitiv nicht. Aber ich habe mich auch aufgrund des Preises dafür entschieden und ging das Risiko aufgrund der Bewertungen ein. Es ist zum Schlafen allemal gut, aber ein highclass Hotel sollte man auf keinen Fall erwarten

title: Location Location Location
text: Had a corner room on 30th floor. Great views of the Empire State Building,  Chrysler Building,  and East River. Room seems very dated and not the cleanest. Very, very pleasant staff. Location is great. Not a bad price. Not sure if we will stay again.

title: Hilton Millennium One UN Plaza Hotel: Rarely has an hotel fallen so far
text:
The Hilton Millennium One UN Plaza was once the jewel of the United Nations area hotels. It is across the street from the UN at First Avenue and 44th Street in New York City. 

It used to be well-kept. It used to have a gym with a swimming pool, men's and women's locker rooms with a sauna, fresh flowers in the lobby, experienced and well-trained staff, the list could go on. Today almost all of this is gone 

Staff are poorly trained, impolite (downright rude), unhelpful, and just make you feel that they don't care about the hotel or it's guests. The hotels itself is unkept with dirty carpets, poor beds, peeling wall-paper, dirty windows, no pool, no saunas, the list could go on. Many facilities suffer from neglect of maintenance or mere cleaning. Gone is the charm and service that made this a top hotel. Instead it is a property that is stumbling towards being one of the worse hotels that your money can pay for in New York City. 

Some of this might be to Hilton taking over the hotel, but whatever the reason the Hilton Millennium One UN Plaza has become a disaster zone. A hotel that on e hosted Heads of States, is today (under Hilton management) unfit to serve as a prison for international criminals.

We checked in for a week's stay and checked out the next morning searching for a safer place to stay. 

My advice is that visitors should avoid this place like the plague.

title: Used to be nice…..
text:
Comfortable room in a great spot. 

Needs some TLC. The hallways were filthy. Room smelled musty. 

I used to stay here for years, but after a hiatus, I see that there is much work to be done. The staff is super friendly and helpful, but the hall carpets were appalling.

title: Very bad experience because of the receptionist bad way of communication
text:
Very bad reception service from the first minute in this hotel from the receptionist 
Tica , who dealt with us so badly despite us being diamond member, which made me to call the manager after 15 seconds only of communication. She was so rude upon any request, even when asking her for a complimentary water that is supposed to be given to us at check in, claiming that this prestigious hotel doesn’t have bottles of water. We are booking 3 rooms for 3-4 nights and we are diamond members, and even though we have a very bad way of treatment. I will never ever stay in this hotel again. 
There is another receptionist, who I did not take her name, who was even more rude to me and my daughter, claiming that she needs to be firm when we asked to activate our keys that stop working every one hour. 
Avoid this hotel because of the bad customer service from receptionists.

title: Recommended if your intention is just to see the fireworks
text:
It was our first time staying at this hotel. We stayed here from Jul 3 to Jul 6 with our primary intention to see the fireworks from our room facing the East River. There are some positives & negatives to this review, which I will outline towards the end.

Check-in staff were very friendly when we got there around the 8AM. The only issue was the room was not available when we got there and they knew the reason was because we are coming from the West Coast (San Francisco) & some from Los Angeles (as the primary reason as most took a redeye flight and just wanted to rest). Because of that, we left some of our bags with the bellman, who was friendly. To compensate for the room delay, we got to rest comfortably on their couch (there were also lounge chairs, which is pretty neat). To use the restrooms one would need a key card (or the bellman would give it if we did not get our room). 

The other thing is I indicated an early-check-in but understood it was not guaranteed. When I inquired about the room facing the East River, they said it was full, but they did say they had a very nice room for me (to our surprise and happiness, one part of it faced the East River, and the other part of it had a wonderful city view), which part of me wanted for a downtown hotel. 

We only got our room around 2PM and were on the 30th floor (the highest floor I have ever stayed at in any hotel in my life), room 3023. The room was very clean, but we had a couple of instances where the bathroom reeked of odor. When we reported this, the room service took care of it once, but  not a second time, which was a little disappointing. 

I liked that the shower had two shower heads; a fixed shower head & a moveable one. At some points, the tub was a little slippery, so not really a grab bar so had to hold on to another surface. 

The beds were very comfortable. I guess there's a reason why for 2 full beds they only want 2 people in the room (it was pretty comfortable for my parents, just a little bit smaller to their liking, but no complaints from them, they enjoyed the bed). I got a very good night's sleep on them, and still better than the bed & pillows I have at my home. 

I went to the fitness center one morning and one thing I liked was you could see the East River and skyline view from different parts. One thing is that they did close early for July 4th for safety reasons, likely to prevent crowding of hotel guests at the gym, still owing to the current COVID-19 situation. 

There's also a coffee shop (Illy) & a restaurant/bar (Ambassador Grill). The coffee was average at most during the times I bought it, and $3 more for a cappuccino was a better choice which I enjoyed during our hotel stay. hat One little gripe about that, which is outside our control was that every day they had different hours (Jul 3, they closed at 4:30PM, Jul 4 11PM, Jul 5 around 6PM). Keeping stability of the hours or keeping it open 24 hours would be helpful. For breakfast, only 1 of the days we ate there (Tuesday) and had the French Toast, waffles and scrambled eggs. It was delicious, but it was quite pricey ($85). I would suggest at least 1 day have breakfast at the hotel as there are certainly many cheaper options nearby, which we equally enjoyed breakfast outside as well. 

Coming to the main part - Fireworks. We had a friend also visit and hung out with us and even he got to enjoy the fireworks from the room. Given my parents are elderly and my dad (and ofc some of us) do not want to stand in the crowds, seeing it from the room was certainly very convenient & an experience I will never forget. Because of that I was able to fulfill my parents' wishes. It was unique like no other; seeing it deployed from the barges with the Macys logo was beautiful. For $250-$300/night, it's definitely worth the view and convenience to downtown and many of the main landmarks like Empire State Building, Times Square, and Grand Central. It's also next to the UN Building, which has guided tours. 

Positives:
- Great location if your intention is to see the fireworks from the East River
- Friendly staff (they recognized me every day and made sure I enjoyed my stay)
- Food (and of course the cappuccino)

Negatives:
- Some room service issues were not addressed all the time when we requested it (bathroom odor, laundry bags)
- Coffee wasn't so good at the Illy coffee shop but good at the Ambassador Grill
- Breakfast was a little more pricier to our expectations ($$)
- Waiting for the room (this can't be blamed on anybody as it was a long weekend) but the couches and lounge chairs to take rest really compensated before we got our room. 

Overall, I recommend this hotel if your intention is to see the fireworks from the room without standing in any crowds near the East River. However, I would recommend other hotels in downtown New York (like Grand Central Westin or Hyatt, etc) if your intention is just to explore downtown. I only deducted a star due to the room service and understand it's due to covid, but some requests could have been handled better or some communication if there were delays. 

The price was high (which was expected), but it's worth it if you want to just see the fireworks.

title: Avoid - all but closed
text:
Beware - this hotel has stopped most services and amenities. There is no room service catering, no laundry service, and the swimming pool is closed. The rooms are clean, a little tired,but bare, not even a pen and paper or any guidance on what is in the hotel - I think the answer is nothing much! There is soap and towels in the bathroom, but no amenity kit. The mini bar fridge is filthy and empty. There is a coffee machine and some coffee, but no tea or milk. There is an iron, but it has either melted nylon stuck to it or the surface coating has corroded, either way not usable.

The staff, including the manager who I kept being referred to, are apologetic but clearly frustrated. I’ve never stayed at a Hilton where after a long haul flight I’m heading out to find food and a laundry service… I hope this stay gets better in the 7 days I am here but I think I will instead look to move.

It hasn’t got better. So I head out to the laundry recommended by the hotel, and it closed an hour ago at 7pm. The staff don’t even know the times - if they had told me at check in when I had asked I would have made it on time. I then walked around other laundries to find they had also closed. I then went into the Hampton by Hilton, just one block away, cheaper and they have a laundry service, but by then it was too late for the overnight service - but too marks to the Hampton front desk staff for actually being very helpful, unlike the UN Hilton.

More problems. The carpets are filthy in places. One area looked like the remains of a murder scene.

The Skyline Lounge is permanently closed, so nowhere for Gold members and above to go and relax. And I’ve got light switches in the room without covers - shocking!

So this is not a 4 star hotel, it is in a shoddy state and it is misrepresentation by Hilton to claim it is. Keeping everything closed with the excuse of Covid long after other hotels in the neighbourhood are fully operational, even in their own chain.

Avoid.

title: In die Jahre gekommen, mit dreckigen Zimmern und dem unfreundlichsten Personal, das ich je in einem Hilton erlebt habe
text:
Das Hotel ist in die Jahre gekommen und leider nie restauriert worden. Die Teppiche sind dreckig (alte Essenreste etc), die Zimmer dunkel und dreckig. Die Schränke innen waren in den Ecken und Schubladen bestimmt Jahre nicht geputzt.
Das Personal (besonders Avery) frech, unfreundlich und arrogant. Eine echte Frechheit. Der Blick aus den Corner Rooms ist Klasse. Aber das ist das Einzige und gleicht den Dreck und die Unfreundlichkeit nicht aus. Ich kann nur von diesem Hotel abraten

title: Personal unaufmerksam, unfreundlich
text: Der Blick aus dem Zimmer ist fantastisch. Das große Bad sehr angenehm. Für ein 4 Sterne HOTEL ist die Ausstattung an Kosmetik Artikeln mangelhaft, die Minibar ist leer. Die Angestellten unhöflich und nicht hilfsbereit. Auf die Frage was das Frühstück kosten würde, weiß ich nicht, fragen Sie im Restaurant. Ich fliege mit einem Freund jedes Jahr zu unserem Geburtstag, (ein Tag Unterschied) irgendwo hin. Bisher hat jedes Hotel egal wieviel Sterne reagiert und eine kleine Aufmerksamkeit auf das Zimmer gebracht. Hier gar nichts, keinerlei Reaktion und dass in einem Hilton 4 Sterne Hotel. Sehr enttäuschend. Nur der Blick ist toll aber das haben andere Hotels für 3000 Euro DZ eine Woche auch aber sicher mit besseren Service. Fazit : Nicht zu empfehlen.

title: Great stay
text: This is a lovely hotel beside the United Nations. Nice and quiet location. Staff are great especially Hibab in the Ambassadors grill.  Very friendly and personable nothing was a problem to him was always smiling even when working on his own and very busy. Breakfast staff were very welcoming too and efficient. Ate for 3 nights in hotel for breakfast and dinner and every meal was very good.It was nice to have beds made and things replaced that we we’re running out of every day. We were here from England touring for our Ruby wedding anniversary and this was the best hotel we had stayed in so far. We used cabs and we also walked quite a bit too.

title: Great hotel and location
text:
This was my 1st time staying at this hotel and 1st time I have stayed in the east side of the city  and I was really surprised how much I preferred the location.
Within walking distance of Central Park, Times Square and much quieter location in general.
We had a great view of the city from our room.  The room was large with 2 full size beds, a comfy chair and a chaise longue and a desk chair.  Also had a fridge which was great for keeping drinks cool.   Also had a safe.
Staff were friendly and was wonderful to be greeted by a dog when going into the hotel.
Didn't use the coffee shop. Looked a bit pricey but a few bagel shops around the corner.
Loved the area and loved the hotel.  Definitely my goto hotel whenever I'm back in New York.

title: Best hotel to get to know NYC from
text: My husband is a diamond member of the Hilton group so we have been searching for Hilton hotels in Manhattan and had chosen this hotel for our first trip to NYC. It was one of the best decisions we could make. The hotel is situation across the street from the United Nations HQ in East 44th street, midtown so basically right in the middle between east and west. Both parts of Manhattan was easily Accessible from here. The Grand Central Terminal is also 5 minutes by walk so the subway station is as right at our feet as well. We were upgraded to the 35th floor and had the most breathtaking view of the city EVER. The hotel is clean has nice bathroom and spacious rooms we could sleep like a baby, undisturbed without any noise coming from the hotel or from outside. The staff is very nice and friendly they take care of all your needs. We did not book breakfast but we had 36$ credit daily to spend in the bar or at the coffee shop which had a great Sortiment of cookies, coffee or egg dishes in the morning and salads in the afternoon. We highly recommend this hotel cause we would go back anytime as well.

title: Tolles Hotel
text: Perfekte Lage; sehr sauber; freundliches Personal; bequemes Bett; relativ großes Zimmer für New York Verhältnis; tolle Aussicht; 7 Min zum Grand Central Terminal; weiter zu empfehlen. Herzlichen Dank!

title: Fab hotel, excellent location & friendly staff
text:
This is a fantastic hotel which is ideally located for all we wanted. Only a 15/20 min walk into Times Square passing other landmarks on the way including grand central station. Easy walking distance to most attractions. We enjoyed the quietness of the area compared to the hustle bustle of times square and felt safe at all times. Staff were helpful and friendly from moment we arrived to minute we left - doormen helping with luggage, front of house staff very helpful - I wish I had for the ladies name as we spoke with her on reception every afternoon/early evening and she was always happy and helpful. We mentioned on arrival that we needed to keep medication cool and we’re going to keep them in the mini bar in the room - she arranged for a small fridge to be delivered to the room and it arrived before we did. The night before we left this same lady advised us on process for late check out - lucky for us the duty manager was sitting and he arranged it for us there and then. Nothing was too much bother and we were grateful for this. Luggage was stored safely on our last day whilst we waited to be collected. 
Previous posts mention rooms being dated - this was not our experience. We were located on the 40th floor - the views were just WOW!!! Especially at night all lit up, it was amazing. Rooms were always kept clean and tidy, toiletries replaced daily and no complaints from us. Corridors and public areas always immaculate. 
Wi-Fi throughout the hotel worked well and no issues for us with this. We even managed to run our Netflix account through the tv in the room. 
All in all this was a great hotel with fantastic staff and I wouldn’t hesitate to recommend it to others and will hopefully be back.

title: Just right
text: The location and the views can't be beat, and the price was reasonable for midtown. Some of the recent reviewers seem to overlook all the problems everyone is having with staffing these days during covid. While not everything was perfect, the staff were friendly and professional.  Anyone looking for a 5-star experience should go to a 5-star hotel. For me this hotel was just right and I would definitely go back.

title: Wundervolles Hotel mit schöner Aussicht in Top Lage!
text: Traumhaftes Hotel, wundervolles Zimmer mit schöner Aussicht und absolut perfekter Lage wenn man gerne spazieren geht. Bis zum Rockefeller Center sind es gut 1,5km. Preis/Leistung hat auf jeden Fall mehr als gestimmt! Absolut empfehlenswert!

title: Gute Lage ... aber überteuert
text: Lage und Ausblick sind top, die Preise leider auch. Manhattan halt. Teppichboden im Zimmer verschmutzt mit Brandlöchern, Kaugummiresten und sonstigen Fremdkörpern versehen. Inkludiertes Frühstück ist eine Frechheit und bedeutet $30 an Guthaben, entweder kalt vom Buffet oder ein mediokres cooked breakfast mit Kaffee oder Tee oder Orangensaft. Nicht und, sondern oder! Unfreundliche Bedienung, die sich auch noch einen Tip erwartet.

title: They stopped caring
text: I've been coming to this hotel for several years now. It feels like they just stopped caring. It's poorly maintained, and the rooms are outdated. The towels had stains. The bartender in the restaurant was extremely rude. The people at the front desk were uninterested in helping me out. We had no hot water one night. The wifi service was insufficient to take a call. I'm a diamond member and the breakfast credit isn't enough for the continental breakfast. The coffee maker in the room was dirty and had dirty water from previous uses. I asked for a kettle, they said they didn't have one. I'm not coming back and don't recommend it. For the price, there are many other options in the area. Employees look extremely unhappy and unwilling to help.

title: A bit outdated
text:
I stayed at the hotel for 18 nights on a work trip. My room was in the more modern tower (I think more west) and the decor was really nice. The room was cleaned pretty much every day which was a treat (but maybe not necessary for such a long trip). There are a few snags following COVID - no room service but the info on the TV still says there is, the restaurant is very average but a little pricey. The gym is small but has everything you need, and has brilliant views!

I was originally put in a room next to the lift shaft which was quite noisy but thankfully the staff moved me at my request. The toiletries in the bathroom are lovely and restocked regularly (the teabags however weren't?). On one of my last nights however I unfortunately found a cockroach on my bedside table (I know they are rife in NY but not what you want to find so close to where you're sleeping).

title: Outdate and misleading
text: Hate to say it but this hotel is not worth the cost. There are comparably priced hotels in Manhattan that are much nicer (Conrad Midtown is one example.) I got the two story queen loft and it looked nothing like the pictures. Everything is clearly outdated. There's a coffee table in the photo that's not in the rooms. (The front desk attendant was even like I don't know they put that in the photo.) I also read I was supposed to have a fridge. I don't. I called asking about keys to the upstairs door and was told I had to come downstairs and get a separate key. But when I got down there, it turned out I did not. The key works in both doors on both levels. Had such high hopes but won't be staying here again.

title: So disappointing and money grabbing
text:
Booked here few months back for a week visit from the UK - we usually like to stay with a chain name for the security and standards but this fell so short! 

We arrived to a nice lobby - to be greeted by a rude woman on reception - no hello, no welcome, took my name and my money and then slapped my room card down and when I didn’t know what floor we were on she proceeded to just tap the card as it to be like ‘just
Take a look, duh’ 

Negatives: 
- lifts broken and no one bothering to look at it 
- no mirrors in the room, only bathroom 
- coffee pod machine broken and would leak and only had 1 dairy free creamer powder for the week and had rang for more which never came - cleaners never replaced it 
- plugs at the desk didn’t work
- original shower head didn’t work and the replaced one flopped and wouldn’t stay up so had to crouch to wash 
- wasn’t allowed to use the mini fridge for our own drinks etc 
- asked for a quiet room but was put right next to the lifts and the walls are paper thin - heard every elevator noise, conversation, cleaners trolley, noisy neighbour at all hours 
- only bed side table at one side 
- the place where you put your suitcase was right under the tv so blocked the view 
- tv had bad signal and would conk out when moved
- no ironing board just the iron 
- check out staff also rude  

And by far the worst negative of the whole stay… they want £14.85 a DAY for WiFi!!!!!!!!! Free In the lobby but want it in your room? Not like I had already paid 2k for a week stay you want wifi money too?? We came from the uk and had no data so struggled to get around and plan 

Positives; 
- good location to grand central 
- the doormen / bag concierge were lovely and can order you a taxi back to jfk 
- nice room views 
- bed comfy and clean 
- clean towels always changed 
- cute dog that was with security 
- pretty lobby area

Over all, for a Hilton, they really don’t care for the tourist guests - want as much money out of you as they can and don’t make things easy or welcoming

title: Viel Geld für wenig Standard
text: Mehr als enttäuscht von einem Hotel mit solch hohen Zimmerpreisen. Check-In erst ab 16 Uhr möglich. Personal am Check-In unfreundlich und nicht hilfsbereit. Trotz Gold Status nicht mal kostenloses Wifi sondern 15 Dollar am Tag für einen Basis Service, den ich jeder Absteige umsonst dazu bekomme. Das ist nicht State-of-the-art und einfach dreist. Unser letzter Hilton Aufenthalt und die negative Erfahrung werden wir auch allen Freunden und Kollegen mitgeben. Schade, dass dieser miese Service einen Schatten über unser lang ersehntes Urlaubserlebnis wirft. Nie wieder.

title: Don't expect a luggage cart if you need one....
text:
Business trip,  with approximately 10 rooms booked.  My colleague and I arrived around 11 pm,  with ten large cases. Imagine my surprise when the front desk clerk refused to give us luggage carts, saying they "were all locked up", and when asked a second time,  "we don't provide that service".
And upon checkout we pretty much had to just take one from the front counter after asking and being told,  "i didn't see anything" by the day time front desk person. I would really expect more from a property such as this. Very disappointed.

title: Couldn’t love this hotel more!
text: We’ve stayed at the Millennium Hilton multiple times and every stay is so lovely. The staff is so friendly and helpful - really great service. The rooms are very comfortable and spacious, and the views of the city and water are absolutely stunning!! We stayed in a suite this time around and it was huge! The coffee shop on the main floor makes legitimately good lattes and the food was really fresh and delicious. Really amazing mixed fruit cups with huge berries. The hotel is clearly well-managed and updated. Honestly, we can’t wait to go back.

title: Weekend Getaway
text: This is our go to hotel to stay at in Manhattan.  Great location within easy walking distance to Rockefeller Plaza and Broadway, clean room with nice amenities and a very helpful staff.  Highly recommend!

title: Missing Expected Touches
text: The hotel has larger than expected rooms for NYC - and the room was nice, clean and quiet.  BUT, the room had no working USB ports - be sure you don't count on it because you will be disappointed.  Great proximity to UN. AVOID the lobby food and sundry shop. Wonderful NY Bagels, snacks, fruit coffee, food options within walking distance.  The shop is a shameless Rip Off.

title: Two Bedroom Suite 3931 with "wow"-views and excellent setup
text: I had booked a loft king bed suite and as diamond hhonors member received a generous upgrade to the two bedroom suite 3931. The view from 3931 are phenomenal - both over UN headquartes and east river and across Manhattan with Empire State Building, Chrisler Buildling, One Vanderbild and many other buildings; the view in my opinion is as good as from the Edge or from the one vanderbild tourist installations. The beds are of very high quality. The small kitchenette with microvawe and the large dining table make it also ideal to have a simple family dinner after a long day in Manhattan; and the large couch area is also perfect for relaxing.

title: Yuck. Omg don’t stay here.
text: This place is tired and gross. It’s not as bad as a couple other notoriously disgusting Hiltons in the city (Hilton Fashion District, I’m looking at you), but yuck. I’m in a corner king - I guess their “mid-level” room, and yes “omg the view is amazing!” (or whatever people like to say). It’s a hotel. You sleep in it. I don’t care about the view. Certainly not in lieu of cleanliness and comfort. I can go out and sight-see from the tall buildings during the day. Anyway: cracks, leaks, stains, grime and scum in books and crannies - this hotel has it all. And I wouldn’t quite characterize the staff I dealt with as rude, but they certainly weren’t nice. I think they might be “surly”, but I’d have to look that word up to be sure. I’m a Diamond member. It was not acknowledged once and I did not receive any “privileges” of this status other than two bottles of water. Whoopee! I’ll try to savor those. The ceilings in this room are 7 feet! Yes, you read that right. Over the 90 or so square feet that cover the bed, there’s a cutout to make it 8 feet. Just. And I’d surmise that the floor of next floor is a foot above that, given the surprisingly loud volume of the foot traffic I hear. And I’m sorry, the room is not 387 square feet. It is about 330, and a good chunk of this is taken up by the long, dark, empty, useless 3 foot wide hallway that leads into the room itself. It feels like I’m walking into the archives section of some dusty relic. So all in all, I’m glad paid what seems to be on the lower side of room rates - having booked this way in advance. Any more than the couple hundred or so per night I paid, and I would be so pissed. Hope this is helpful.

title: Lage und Ausblick hui......aber sonst........
text:
Auch ich empfand das Personal eher muffig..........und das schlimmste waren die mit wirklich völlig speckigen Teppichen ausgelegten Flure..........alles andere als einladend - und das war der erste Eindruck auf dem Weg ins Zimmer.
Ein großes Plus verdient die Aussicht, die man hat (und das scheinbar von jedem Zimmer), außerdem gute Betten....das war's dann aber auch schon. 

Vorhandene Kaffeemaschine war nicht einsatzfähig , die Minibar (Modell uralt) stand für nichts und wieder nichts im Zimmer (nicht angeschlossen, kein Inhalt) - man fragte sich, wofür? Beides also nicht einsatzfähig - sollte dies mit der Pandemie zu tun haben, hätte man diesbezüglich wenigstens einen Hinweis erwartet. Die nötigsten Dinge im Badezimmer (wie z.B. ein Zahnputzglas) waren nicht vorhanden. Wenn die Lage nicht so super wäre, hätte dieses Hotel meiner Meinung nach höchstens 2 Punkte verdient.

title: The male receptionist is mean, dog security check is wired.
text:
The male receptionist is mean, dog security check is wired.
We arrived Hotel around 9:00pm, right after my Boston marathon. The whole family was tired. The booking name is my agoda account name instead the name on my passport. I explained everything, but the receptionist still refuse us to check in. I called agoda try to sort it out, but the hotel’s number is not reachable after almost an hour. The receptionist gave me another number claimed it’s his manager’s number but the number kept engaged, clearly he’s not try to help. Finally we checked in after more than 1 hours waiting. The facilities are old, wifi was on and off. There’s only 1 usb charging port is working.
The two stars I gave was for view from the room and room clean service.

title: Pasqua a New York
text: In vacanza con mio marito per una settimana. Camera molto spaziosa, bagno grande con doccia e vasca, pulito, ottima vigilanza all’ ingresso con cane addestrato per esplosivi.posizione centralissima per raggiungere qualsiasi attrazione. Peccato la metro...non vicinissima..ma a New York sono poche le fermate..strano ma vero

title: Disappointing
text: The room was not as requested but they changed it upon complaint. The bill in the end contained costs for a coffee bar that I had never visited and a wrong room rate. The room was not fully equipped, slippers were missing and other amenities. It appears as if they simply wanted to safe money. They were very reluctant with a later check-out despite being a HH member. The air conditioning was extremely loud. All in all, not really a Hilton experience. Disappointing.

title: Ideal for a budget stay
text:
Rooms were clean and location was good. The lift was outdated and could do with being modernised to keep up with the newer parts of the hotel interior. 

Staff could have been more helpful and welcoming. We did ask about getting a taxi once and weren’t offered any real help with it so had to book an Uber. 

Would be better if the restaurant was open everyday as we arrived late on the first day and then had to go and find food after a very long day of travelling. 

Staff were really friendly in the little UN cafe and we found that useful. 

Would stay again as it was good value with our BA package.

title: A definite pass
text:
I am a pretty loyal hilton brand traveler and for the most part I am generally happy with my stays. I needed to be close to a location, so I chose this hotel. I was told on the app that my keyless entry was ready but when I tried it at the hotel it was not ready. I then was asked to pay for my stay in advance which I found odd for a domestic hotel. Since when does Hilton require you to pay the entire stay on arrival?

There was a general lack of cleanliness all around the hotel including the elevators and rooms. All you have to do is look down to see all the dirt and especially in the elevators. It never got clean during the three days we were there. Likewise around the room, it was a two-story suite, but equally devoid of a high cleanliness standard you associate with Hilton. Dated and stained carpet. I saw more people cleaning the elevator doors at the various buildings where we looked at properties than at the Hilton.

The bright spot was the small coffee place near the entrance. The morning employee was especially helpful and friendly. It was also a good place to get food on the run.

Will not return- not a 4 star hotel by any standard.

title: Limited services provided
text:
We arrived on the red eye, so we got to the hotel quite early in the day but they allowed us to check in, which we appreciated.
The room was not at all what is pictured on the website, but it was clean and quiet. The club lounge is not operating at this time and the hotel bar is closed Sunday and Monday. Breakfast is available in the restaurant every day. They do offer daily housekeeping which a lot of hotels have dropped, so it was appreciated. We noticed that there was no bellman assistance offered around the clock and a couple (elderly) arrived and were told that they could borrow a cart to get luggage to their room. Road construction on the street caused intermittent road closures throughout our stay including Saturday and Sunday. The staff were generally friendly and helpful but spent a lot of time interacting with one another, which when combined with other issues we witnessed and experienced leads to the conclusion that the general manager is not a strong presence at the property. I doubt I would go back.

title: Perfect stay!
text:
We stayed at this hotel and enjoyed it very much. They have a great customer service, excellent location, delicious food. Totally recommend it!
On our last day we asked if we could leave our luggage at the hotel until later, since the flight was not until the evening hours and the check-out was at 11am. We were pleasantly surprised to find out it was fine and we even got the taxi reserved for us while out and about.
Excellent hotel and a super friendly staff.

title: Nicest staff! Am I at WDW or NYC?
text:
Staff are above and beyond helpful, especially the front desk and bell captains, who practically act as concierges getting us cabs to LGA and restaurant directions. Frank even advocated to get us an early check in when he learned we had been traveling since 3am, and the front desk (Diane? A petite brunette) found us a room as soon as she could. I've never been so grateful for a nap! 

To all the negative reviews - not my experience at all. Pretty is as pretty does. If someone has done something extra for you, a tip is nice, or at least a sincei thank you. Early check ins or getting a cab is extra, and can't be given to you every time when it's busy, so be understanding. It isn't personal, sometimes they just can't give it

title: wonderful view and comfort room
text: The hotel location is easy to most famous tourists places. such  as Time square, Grand Central Station, New York public library and Modern Art Museum. To metro station is by foot few minutes. The room is big and comfort. The bed is high quality. The staffs are friendly and helpful. The price is reasonable. The hotel is just opposite of Unite Nation building/ From room window you can enjoy wonderful view of sun rise and sun set.

title: Ideal for us
text:
If you’re looking for the hustle and bustle of NYC this hotel probably won’t be for you but it was ideal for us.
Our nice room on the 36th floor had great views over the East river and Lower Manhattan and was well serviced. The staff at the hotel were all friendly and efficient but these three deserve a special mention. Wendy in the Cafe, Hussain at Breakfast and Frank on the front desk as they all went “over and above” in their duties.
There was only one slight downside as far as we were personally concerned and this was the restaurant. 
The menu was quite limited for a 4 star hotel especially as there was only one real vegetarian option. Somewhat unusual these days. As my wife is a vegetarian it did mean that we had to eat elsewhere most nights. Not a major problem as there were some good eateries in the local vicinity. The hotel restaurant was also closed on Sundays and Mondays. This may be due to lack of patronage on those days. Perhaps a change of menu might resolve this should this be the case.
Overall though it was a great stay and we would return if or when we go back to New York.

title: Below Average, would personally stay somewhere else
text:
ROOMS: Had multiple rooms in this hotel.  One with 2 full beds and another with 2 doubles with a city view. While the rooms where relatively clean, the rooms we had needed lots of maintenance. Noticeable old carpet stains. Missing mini fridges. Broken lights and other various broken gadgets in the rooms. For the price of the hotel, it needs a lot of refreshing. Even the hallways look old and are covered with carpet stains. Views were great, however. All of our rooms had nice views despite only one being booked as a city view. 

HOUSEKEEPING: The attendants were awesome and extremely attentive. They were about the only positives of my stay here. 

STAFF: Encountered kind staff (like the housekeeping team), but encountered more rude staff than kind. Upon check-in, the front desk woman was extremely short and rude with me when answering questions. Additionally, every time my family and I entered the lobby, the doormen and concierge stared at us like we did not belong in the hotel. It was the oddest thing and I never experienced that before. 

LOCATION: Not bad. In a quieter area of Manhattan. About a 10 min walk to Grand Central Station/Chrysler building. Nearest subway I found was about 10 mins away. Times Square is about a 15-20 mins walk. Or you can take the Grand Central shuttle to the area as well. Stay here if you don’t mind the walk. 

Overall, I would not stay here again simply because of how worn out the hotel is and how unaccommodating the staff was. It’s unappealing when you’re walking around your hotel and the carpets are dirty as hell - in the hallway and in your rooms.

title: Always An Wonderful Experience
text: I have recently started staying at the Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza on a monthly basis due too both business and leisure stays. I only had great experiences from the hospitality displayed from the Front Desk Personnel and the Housekeeping service that made my room look like how it did the first day I have arrived to my room. The rooms are great with beautiful views of the city during the day and night. I was able too stay in both a King Room with city view and a 1 King Bedroom Suite and I was blown away from any of the options that I have chosen so far. I always had easy check in with the Digital Key feature. I look forward to future stays to hopefully be able too experience the other suites and two story loft they offer.  Maybe see one day since I frequently stay at this establishment if I get offered any upgrades in the near future. I would recommend this hotel.

title: Lovely hotel with great views
