text: Great views over the river but being on the edge of Manhattan meant quite a bit of walking to get anywhere.  Couldn’t fault the hotel, didn’t eat there or use any facilities but the room was lovely and spacious and good comfortable bed so we got good nights sleep

title: Unusual decor
text:
Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights stayed on the 32nd floor,incredible views of new York and the right next to the UN building  at night the view is even better. Friendly and helpful staff aswell.  The rooms are well equipped with huge 50in tvs and free WiFi. Restaurant is OK but not a massive choice,I wouldn't use it unless you want to re mortgage your house!!! $10 for a bottle of beer!! We had 4 mains,4 drinks and 1 desert ,totaling over $300!!!! New York is an expensive city anyway.  
The only negative I would say is the very unusual and dark decor!!the carpets look grubby and dated and the brown walls in the corridors look very 70s!! The hotel is generally dark.

title: Clean & Spacious Rooms, Great Amenities, Rare Views, Helpful Staff, GREAT CAFÉ!
text:
I want to begin by stating that I am sympathetic to the plight of the service industry and that many hotels have had to scale back their level of service or amenities in this trying time. That being said, my first trip to Millennium Hilton at the UN in Covid times was simply outstanding. 

Our suite was surprisingly spacious and impeccably clean. The views are as wonderful as you'd expect in this prime location. The staff, from the helpful bell people and desk folks to the cleaning crew were all above reproach. Very good!

However, I want to draw special focus to my experience at the UN Cafe. So many cafes that enjoy choice locations in hotels, even nice ones, are an afterthought, offering subpar coffee and food to desperate customers. Not the case with the UN Cafe in the lobby of the Millennium UN Hilton. It was legitimately good enough to be a standalone cafe anywhere in the city, and this is coming from someone who lived in Seattle, the home of great cafes, for near a decade. My family and I ate breakfast from the UN Cafe every morning of our stay and we were impressed each time with the quality, and perhaps more importantly, the consistency of our service, food, and drink. Great handmade cappuccino and lattes, hot breakfast platters, and special recognition to the fresh cut fruits and berries. This place was busy and the single barista was able to crank out custom orders at top speed with no compromise in quality. 

While my families' entire stay was top notch, and the views, service, and amenities with beyond my expectations, the memory that stands out were the wonderful breakfasts from the UN Cafe. I am already looking forward to my next stay.

title: Horrible stay.
text:
This is a hotel located in a setting next to the UN in NYC, but their staff has the manners and manipulative nature consistent with the least trained professionals  in NYC. Evicted from our stay with extremely unprofessional staff. Followed that with refusing to provide names of staff so we could further realize what the problem was.
Don't waste your money or time, there are plenty of better options.

title: Stunning view
text:
We currently are staying at your amazing Hotel.
We requested a room in the West Tower with an amazing view as said wanted to surprise my son and just one word stunning view. Staff at the front Desk is friendly and helpful we didn't book via the honor program still get treated like honors. Can definitely recommend this hotel for an amazing stay. Clean room and super friendly cleaning lady. Highly recommend this hotel to my family and loved ones.
Only downside I can say is that we never seen anywhere mentioned of a deposit of 75 dollars per day, since we are Europeans we never like to use credit cards and our Master debt card wasn't accepted sadly.

title: Front Desk Brandon FTW
text: Brandon, the gentleman who checked me in at the front desk, is an all-star. As an HH member, he offered me the two complimentary water bottles. When I declined them on the basis that NYC water is perfectly fine and that the world doesn't need two additional empty plastic bottles, the thanked me, and upgraded my room. I had already reserved a pretty decent room, and every room in the hotel is fine, but the upgraded views were pretty incredible. This man should be promoted, and this is a notice to everyone to treat others nicely and stop drinking water from plastic bottles.

title: Excellent hotel in prime Manhattan location
text:
I stay regularly at this hotel and cannot
praise the wonderful staff highly enough.  It’s perfectly situated and has the most spectacular river and city views.
From the moment of check-In (contactless should you wish) it’s clear that guests are well looked after.
The rooms are very big by New York standards - and the corner rooms in particular are charming

title: I feel ripped off
text: So, overall our stay at the Millenium was okay, however we did encounter a few inconveniences. To begin, we called the hotel a week before arrival to see if we were able to get an early check in as our flight landed earlier than the regular check in time. The woman we spoke to was very nice and told us that we were able to check in at 12 pm. We called again around two days before arrival to confirm and a different lady who helped us told us that we were good to check in at 12 pm. Upon arrival we let the lady at check in know that we had called to request an early check in and confirmed that we could check in at 12. However, she told us that the room was not ready yet and that they cannot guarantee an early check in and is based on availability. While this did make sense, this is not what we were told over the phone. Not once were we told that our early check in was not guaranteed; on the contrary we were told that in fact our early check in was confirmed. This wasn’t too big of a deal but it did delay our plans as we had been traveling since 5 am and were hoping to at least be able to shower and change. Moving on, when we were finally able to get in the room we noticed that the room was not a city view which is what i had paid for, it was mostly a view of the building next to us and some of the city in the very corner, Regardless of the room being very nice, we did pay for a city view and again over the phone were told that we would get a full city view. We went back to check in to explain our concerns and the lady at check in asked for the room number. Upon telling her the room number she said “hmm that’s weird that’s not a city view.” She then looked it up on the computer and said “well it is a partial city view.” And then proceeded to say that all of the full city view rooms are currently booked and that we can come back tomorrow and check if any open up. This is ridiculous considering the fact that I literally paid for the full city view and not only did she straight up lie as she had just told us that our room was not a city view, but again we were not told that it was a “partial city view” over the phone. The pictures on the website are also very misleading as they do show a full city view. This really upset us because we paid a lot for a city view and it’s not what we got. Finally, on one of our nights there we asked the front desk if they could call us a taxi since it was snowing extremely hard and very cold outside and they told us that they do not call taxis at this hotel and that we would have to flag one down somewhere else… which we did. Then on our last day, we see another employee calling some other guest a taxi from the very same desk that they just told us they don’t call taxis from, so we asked and he told us that they do call taxis and it is one of the hotels included services, and proceeded to call us a taxi right from the desk . Lastly, the hotel itself is beautiful and the room was very nice  looking but it wasn’t all so clean either, there was so much hair in the shower drain which wouldn’t let the water fully drain, the tv did not work, there was some blood on the sheets I had to ask for clean ones, the shower head did not work you had to use the handheld one, the coffee machine leaked water everywhere which i had to clean up. there did seem to be a lot of contradiction between the staff and although they are nice with their tone of voice they’re all pretty unhelpful besides a few.

title: Tips for staying at this hotel
text:
This is my second time back in a year.This hotel is quirky and can be great or not great at all depending on which room you get. Here's my take.
1. For the 2nd time I was unable to choose my room on the Hilton app. My advise is to call ahead and do everything you can to politely insist on getting a room in the west tower. The rooms are much nicer and if you reserved a room with a view it tends to be nicer as well. If you read these reviews you will see some very negative and some very positive reviews. I think it has a lot to do with the rooms someone ends up in.
2. You are given a credit to spend at the bar, restaurant, or cafe (with store). I think IMHO you should skip the restaurant for breakfast and spend money on snacks from the cafe for later in the day. There are plenty of great restaurants in the neighborhood to eat at.
3. Get to know the people working at the hotel. If you are nice to them they can make some nice things happen for you. 
4. I liked the layout of the king rooms better than the corner rooms, but that's just me.

To the management I want to point out and thank Bobby and Avery who were at the concierge desk, you're lucky they work for you.

title: Bad service allround
text:
Bad service all around:

- Cold and rushed check-in & check-out
- Room service ONLY every 2 days even though it is a 4 star hotel
- The walls are SO thin. You can hear everything through the walls and the staff does nothing to keep the noise down

The fire alarm went off at 4:30 am one night when some drunk people chose to turn it off. We had to go down the stairs from the 33rd floor and wait for everything was ok to go up again. The hotel gave NO compensation, not even breakfast at their expense.

We paid $ 450 in deposit for 6 days and were told these would be released on the day of check out. We checked out on February 14th so OVER 2 weeks ago and they are still not released!! This is far from okay. It is impossible to get in touch with the hotel we get repeatedly transferred to different people (even housekeeping!) or greeted by a manager's answering machine who never returns the call. So poor service and unacceptable service. Hope to get in contact with a manager that at least kan solve this problem…

title: Great New York Trip.
text: We were in New York for my daughter's appointment at Kleinfeld Bridal.  Kleinfeld's appointment was as wonderful as our stay at the Hilton.  The staff at the Millennium Hilton were wonderful in every aspect of the trip, from check in, service, restaurants and snacks, to the concierge and availability of cabs or using Uber.  We will be returning in May.  My daughter would like to stay at the Millennium Hilton One UN Plaza again, and we Will!!

title: Gold Member No Upgrade
text:
I am a Hilton Honors Gold Member and was looking forward to get a nice upgrade for my stay as normal. I know that the upgrade is only possible if rooms are available. However, I am disappointed. There was no attempt of the Hotel staff to help me or even try to give an upgrade for the next days. 
The always advertised upgrade was the main reason for me to become a member of Hilton Honors. Could you please have a look of an upgrade is possible for the coming days? Otherwise I have to seriously rethink the membership.

title: The worst hotel in NYC
text: The manager Maria it’s the worst manager you have on staff. I had picked a room ..she lied and told me due to construction I had to move to a lower floor by the elevators with a broken TV . She did this because I had a Priceline reservation. I’m also a Diamond member and this type of treatment was humiliating!…I’m sure you had complains on this person . Someone really needs to look into her . She’s ruining your brand and setting a bad example!

title: Rude staff noisy rooms
text:
Staff attitude is very poor. They do not seem friendly or happy for you to be there at all. Rooms were clean. The ceiling height seemed very low. We were able to hear everytime someone in the corridor opened or closed their door - which seemed to be very often. Someone knocked on and opened our room at 8 am and then said sorry wrong room. Coffee in the restaurant was $5. Breakfast for 2 was $62. They add the gratuity in the invoce. 

Must have been a nice place to stay 15-20 years back. They cant change their facilities but they staff can change their attitudes....

title: business hotel
text: the room walls are not sound proof and could hear noice and speaking from the adjoining room  resturant only one choice  . long wait to check in. disinfectants no longer by elevator, bellman insisted to get on to the same elevator when I wanted to social distance. he was trying to call security on me for refusing to let him in. as a senior citizen social distancing wearing masks. priority. not too visible of such precautions except for the staff behind the front desk, it is a decent hotel . will only repeat for convenience of location and price.

title: Hôtel vieillot
text: Service très moyen, il n’y a personne à l’accueil la plupart du temps, le lobby est un lieu de passage pour les gens ne résidents pas à l’hôtel, il y a très peu de produits dans la salle de bain et le wifi est payant. La vue des chambres est agréable cela dit

title: Quality hotel
text: Excellent hotel, well positioned to enable me to walk to my office. Free upgrade to suite on 37th floor was gratefully appreciated. Polite and professional staff, very clean and fabulous room. Just wish they had room service and the shop/cafe stayed open for longer hours.

title: Disappointed
text: Just not a great experience  and I expected at least the level of service I have received from millennium downtown. It was rude, slightly dirty, food was below average and the staff was just unhelpful.

title: Excellent Hotel
text: It’s hard to find a hotel fairly close to the East River, in this case for an event at the Water Club, which is located right on the river. Hotel staff was unfailingly cheerful and many rooms look out across the East River toward the 59th Street Bridge and Queens. Pricing in January, 2022, was a bargain, presumably because of Covid.

title: Basic hotel in good location with limited service
text: This hotel is functional but rather basic. I am a Hilton Diamond and was denied an upgrade despite availability (on some of the days of our stay). Dirty coffee pods were not removed for 3 days from the room, and coffee was not filled up either in the room. There were tea bags but no way to boil water. Shampoo was not available either and we were told to use shower gel to wash our hair. I flagged these (and other) shortcomings with staff but no attempt was made to rectify them. The $30 credit per day is - to put it politely - a joke and shows how not just this hotel but Hilton USA has gone from a service economy to a pure money-grabbing business. There is barely any item on the breakfast menu for $15 or less per person so that you de facto end up paying extra for your breakfast. Moreover, many executive lounges across Europe and the Middle East are open but not so here (or indeed elsewhere in the US despite much lower Covid incidences than in Europe). For example, one could have at least handed out free drink vouchers to Diamond members. What is the point of having a genuine elite membership (earned through stays and not via a cheap credit card deal) if all I receive as a Diamond member is bottled water? Many staff lack even the basics of hospitality in this property. On a more positive note, the location is very good and the view from the room is great too. Overall, however, this property cannot be recommended and falls well short of international Hilton standard.

title: I will be back
text: Barry at the front desk was very friendly. Gave us a free upgrade to get a better view of the city! As well as a $30 credit each day for the restaurant (Hilton Diamond members). Clean and the views were great. Went for my 25th birthday and I will be back when it’s warmer.

title: Best Hotel ever!!!!
text: I absolutely love this hotel. It’s quiet around the area. The hotel is clean, the rooms are beautiful and the views are insanely gorgeous. Staff members are professional and friendly. The inside of the lobby is also very well kept and cozy.

title: Not happy with cleanliness
text: This was my second time at this location. The first time there was blood but I did not report it because of plans I had that night. This time the room was dirty. Spoke with the manager and he said he didn’t have any other rooms to move me to but will send housekeeping up. The room should have been cleaned before me entering that room. I was exhausted and wanted to relax. I’m very disappointed with my stay and do not see myself going back

title: Amazing
text: All the staff was very helpful especially Bryan and they were very accommodating to me and my partner we had something come up and the helped us through everything and kept us in the same room and guided us through it!

title: Mala actitud de gran parte del personal
text:
Lo bueno: La vista divina y el tamaño el cuarto muy bueno. La persona que te da la bienvenida muy cálida y bien predispuesta.
Lo malo: la gente en la recepción, súper mal predispuesta, No solucionan nada ni les interesa. El cuarto de los 5 días que estuve no me lo hicieron dos porque no tenían personal y no se disculparon ni les importó cuando reclamé. La cefetería cerraba muy temprano y varios días el restaurant estuvo cerrado asique no conseguías ni un café en el hotel, ni hablar comida apto celiacos que en mi caso era fundamental. Lo peor el maltrato del front desk.

title: Nice bellboys - lousy housekeeping and management
text:
My family and I travelled to New York from Washington DC (in DC we stayed at the Hilton garden inn - amazing!) and stayed at the millennium one Hilton UN Plaza for four nights. The rooms are worn and torn with clear stains on carpets and a few holes (plus a broken hinge in one of the wardrobes), but we were met with kindness from the bellboys and front desk - especially Ainsley. The fridge in the room didn’t work, but they brought us a new one (but left the old one there (?)), and we had to put in on the floor. 

On day one we noticed that housekeeping seemed a bit rushed and perhaps were not that thorough, but things got worse on day two. 

We came home from a long day in town to find that the only thing housekeeping had done was to empty (some) trash bins, make the beds and hang up (dirty) towels. Used coffee cups were left out together with dirt on the carpets and no new coffee capsules or sugar etc were left. I immediately rang front desk and received apologies, and they sent up new coffee and promised to do better.

On day three - again coming home from a long day in town - we discovered exactly the same thing. We also noticed that one of the beds (which my daughter had slept in) was In fact broken (broken springs?)- no grown-up can sleep there. Feeling very disappointed, I phoned the front desk who referred me to housekeeping (if it is my job to talk to housekeeping myself, what purpose does front desk serve?). I explained the situation and was told that housekeeping would speak to her boss and get back to me. 

No one returned my call.

The following morning, during checkout, I explained my disappointment to the front desk (a nice guy named Brandon) who asked me to contact the director of front office, Matthew Waller, who would be there at 1 pm. Again - why is it my job to track down the right person to complain to? What is the purpose of front desk? Who represents the hotel?

I/we came back at 2pm and asked for Matthew, who - conveyed through a flustered front desk lady - said that he didn’t have time to meet me but that “Wayne” was on his way (apparently head of housekeeping - why should I speak to him?).

Waited for “Wayne” for 10 minutes in the lobby. No one came. 

No compensation has been made, and no effort from the hotel to reach me has been made.

I am very disappointed with this hotel and can not recommend it to anyone else.

title: Hotel mit spektakulärem Ausblick und Toplage
text:
Besser geht es nicht, ein traumhafter Ausblick ( wir hatten die Zimmer 3618 und 3718)! Rechts das UN-Gebäude, der Eastriver, Queens, BBridge, Downtown, OneWorld weiter schweift der Blick nach links über Manhattan Südspitze bis hin zum Empire State, Chrysler, The Edge und abschließend das Vanderbiltbuilding!
Wenn man kein HiltonHonorsMember ist zahlt man leider 14 Dollar p.Zimmer//Tag. für WLAN und 40 Dollar p.P./Tag fürs Frühstück- das geht gar nicht! Teppiche in den Etagenfluren und teilweise auf den Zimmern müssten mal ausgetauscht werden!
Die Zimmer sind aber sehr geräumig, Betten groß und bequem, Bad groß und ok!
Sehr nettes und hilfsbereites Personal, tolle Hotelbar und eine super Lage! Wir können es nur weiterempfehlen!
Thomas, Silke, Paul u. Johanna G. aus Malgarten/Westgermany

title: Bad service
text:
With my wife we were very disappointed with the welcome and service of the hotel staff.
Some examples:
1_we asked the front desk staff to make an important phone call to a covid test center on our own, but they didn't want to do it, and so we had to ask a taxi driver.
2_ every day we did not find tea and coffee in the rooms for the kettle supplied, we asked a room cleaning lady who told us that that room was not within her competence
3_ during the whole stay we found some renovations in the hall, which was therefore non-existent, without a bar and tables where to stop

title: Sehr schlechte Erfahrung
text: Schon bei der Ankunft hatten wir Probleme mit dem Einchecken. Das Personal war sehr unhöflich und hat uns nicbt wirklich weitergeholfen. Wir hatten 6 Koffer und niemand hat uns geholfen sie ins Zimmer hochzubringen. Unser Zimmer war klein, eng, dreckig und sehr kalt, Trotz der Lüftung. Unser Zimmer wurde 2 Tage lang nicht geputzt, danach kamen, die von der Putzkraft schon um 9 Uhr morgens rein und wollten putzen. Noch dazu kam, dass zum 500,- Depot eine Rechnung von 780 Dollar von meinem Konto abgehoben worden waren. Als ich die Managerin darauf ansprach, sagte sie mir, es wäre fälschlicherweise abgehoben worden. Ich hatte schon mehrere schlechte Erfahrungen mit Hilton, aber das war die Krönung. Ich werde nicht mehr bei Hilton buchen.

title: GREAT view of Chrysler Building
text: Nice and spacious room and bathroom. Staff was helpful. Booked this hotel specifically for a view of the Chrysler Building. We booked a corner room on the upper floors. I made multiple efforts to ensure that I had a room with a view of the Chrysler Building (emailed, called when we landed, requested at early check-in). The first room was on the wrong corner with a view of the river. After some finagling, Sylvia at the reception desk, found the right room for me :-)

title: Great stay and friendly staff
text: Although the hotel is a little out from the centre of New York the staff are very friendly and very welcoming - nothing is too much trouble. Lovely and clean hotel. Felt very safe.  Great city view from my room.

title: Super
text:
Nous avons été très bien accueillis et bien compris. Le hall de l’hôtel est superbe avec sa déco de Noël, les chambres sont très bien et la vue du 38ème magnifique.
Nous recommandons cet hôtel bien placé pour les couples désirant visiter tous les quartiers de New-York à l’aide du Subway.

title: TERRIBLE. DO NOT STAY HERE. STAFF IS EXTREMELY UNPROFFESIONAL
text: Never have I been more disappointed with a hotel stay. Do not come here unless you want to be forcibly removed from the hotel because of the color of your skin. Staff was extremely unprofessional and failed to let us know that our music was playing at a non suitable volume. Instead, they decided to remove us from the hotel at 12am on New Year’s Eve for noise, without giving us any warning. When I asked for a copy of the bill, silvano the manager refused to give it to me. I believe this is because when I finally got a copy of the bill we were falsely charged a $250 smoking fee, when  even the staff themselves who came to our room said that there was no smoking happening in our room. Besides this, accommodations were mid grade for the price charged, and hotel was not very clean. Don’t stay here.

title: Horrible service and room smelled of marijuana. Unfriendly and no smiles. Bathroom Door creaks really loud.
text: I booked 2 rooms , and only one room was only available to check in at 3.30pm. So, we checked in one room at 3.40pm and another one not till 12.30am (midnight) . When we checked in at that time, my room smell marijuana , and they did the ozone machine for half hour while my husband and I had to wait at our Children’s room. The hotel has about an additional 7 hours to clean and sanitized and prep the room but was not done. Then we found out that there’s no fridge. They said they’ll bring in the next day but never did. When I asked for bottle water, I was told that it’s only for gold and diamonds members which I feel it’s so discriminatory.

title: Buena opción de hospedaje pero mal servicio en recepción.
text: Buena ubicación, habitaciones de buen tamaño pero muy viejas y llenas de polvo. El personal de equipaje excelente muy servicial y amable, los dos señores que conocí fueron muy atentos con mi familia  pero las señoritas de recepción muy groseras y con mala cara todo el tiempo, tuve mala experiencia con ellas y presencié la misma actitud de ellas con otros clientes.

title: Lovely Stay
text: Great location & views. Quiet and tucked away from the businesses of the city. The Door Man Robert & Bell Man George, were wonderful & pleasant. Nice bathroom. Needed room service & microwave in rooms (main downfall).

title: Pre-Xmas Trip
text: Hotel is well located but needs continued maintenance to ensure TVs work and fixtures are usable. Receptionist did not manage well our notifications regarding problems with TV and towel rack.  Location is very nice.

title: Outworn hotel
text: Poor service, bad maintenance, very dirty carpets all over the hotel. Very long waiting times at reception, understaffed. No recognition of longtime loyalty. This is below regular Hilton level but they do charge for it

title: Rudeness
text:
I was very disappointed with the welcome and service of the hotel staff.

A few examples:

1_we asked the reception staff to make a very important phone call to a covid test center on our own, before going to the airport to leave, but they didn't want to make the call, and they didn't want to hand me the phone to make the call.
We had to get help from an Uber taxi driver who phoned his personal phone

2_ every day we did not find tea and coffee bags in the rooms for the kettle provided. We asked a room cleaning lady who she replied that that room was not hers to do.

3_ throughout our stay we encountered renovations in the hall, which was therefore non-existent, with no bar or tables to stop.

title: Fantastic Hotel -  the little things making a difference
text:
Lovely hotel, friendly staff, awesome location.  I was luck to get a high floor to take in the view!

I came for a business trip and wasn’t disappointed. 8 minutes to Grand Central Station, 10 minutes door-to-door to work, and 15 minutes into the heart of midtown shops. 

It’s the little things like the staff noticing I’d doubled up my blanket on the first night - to find a spare blanket on my bed when I got back to the hotel that night. 

How’s that for customer service !

title: Million dollar view
text: I booked late in the game so ended up with a corner suite in the west tower. The views were stunning and the space was impressive. As suggested, I downloaded the app for contactless check in and electronic key - that worked great! I had zero contact with the staff so unfortunately I can’t comment on how great they are! I did noticed that they had complimentary cider and donuts in the afternoon, which was nice. The young woman at the cafe was delightful. The bar area seemed fine - the guy there directed me to a convenience store when we needed a quick snack. I was dismayed and surprised by seeing a few staff members without masks, I was also annoyed by a few guests in elevators that crowed in or didn’t wear masks. NYC is being hit hard with covid right now so wearing a mask in the elevator should be a no brainer. We tried calling the front desk a couple of times but didn’t have luck reaching anyone and we found that the phone would randomly ring for no reason.we had a great stay and would come back. We like a more quiet area.

title: Stayed strong despite challenging times
text: The service at this hotel is superb- from front desk, to room staff, to those in the newly re-opened restaurant. They really go the extra mile.  Also a big thumbs up to Hilton for keeping the bulk of its staff on the books even when the pandemic shut everything down.

title: Business Trip - December 2021
text: Overall, a pleasant experience.  I was disappointed that the Executive Lounge and Health Care facilities, due to Covid 19, were closed during the entire stay.  In contrast, other Hilton facilities in Manhattan did not close their facilities but offered their guests limited services.

title: Nice hotel with a great staff
text: Nice hotel and decent room.  Staff was the best thing about my stay. Staff was great from check in to check out. Had a neighbor playing loud music at 3am and security hopped right on it. I would stay here again. Oh, and the city view was outstanding (I think the other option is a river view l)! Seemed to be in great location, with the United Nations directly across the street.

title: Great Experience
text: I had an overall great experience with the Hilton. I have no complaints what’s so ever! I’d recommend to anyone looking for a skyline view stay. We loved our view, our room and the friendliness of the staff. 10/10

title: Special Family Holiday
text:
The hotel has some good and some bad features.

Good
o Location - 10 mins walk from Grand Central Station
o Views - from higher floors
o Coffee Shop Attendant - she is gorgeous and the star of the hotel
o Doormen - so friendly

Bad
o Manner of some staff (I think its a New York thing) but rude nonetheless
o Exec Lounge currently shut
o Carpets very tired on 37th floor
o VFM of breakfast in restaurant 

I wish I could give 3.5 but actually closer to 4 so went with that.  The views over Manhattan and Brooklyn are stunning so that scores well in anyone's book.  the local area is quite businessy so still i suspect a little quiet (some shops are shut).

title: The Millennium Premier Hotel - Accommodating, Nicely Appointed & Appreciated
text:
My expectations for requested accommodations & considerations for a 2-night stay, 3-play weekend at the Millennium Premier Hotel at 133 West 44th Street, Broadway for my Wife's Celebration Weekend  on Broadway were GREATLY exceeded! My gratitude and appreciation to Monique and her colleagues are sincerely heartfelt. I had shared my special "requirements" with the Millennium Premiere staff/management in advance of our arrival (several weeks prior, to be exact), and Monique and her colleagues at the Front Desks were absolutely phenomenal in their attention and professional execution of my request - which ultimately EXCEEDED my expectations ...and MOST importantly, my Wife & Best Friend  was overwhelmed by the Hotel's reception gift and Birthday sentiments...! We've been SO taken by the hospitality and professionalism of the staff, that we've already planned a whole new series of overnight Broadway theater and dinning "gettaway" weekends in the City JUST so that we can lodge at The Millennium Premiere Hotel - did I mention how nicely appointed our suite was in terms of cleanliness, furnishings, space, views and ease of access to ALL that Broadway has to offer right off 7th Ave. and 44th Street near ALL of our favorite shows, sights and eateries which were WELL within 10-15 mins walking distance of the hotel???
I am making recommendations to my company's Travel Service Management leaders to ADD this "hidden Gem" to our Corporate Travel "preferred services" online portal, thanks to the accommodating appointments of the hotel (location, amenities, furnishings) and Monique and her colleagues!!
We will been sharing our NYC Hotel experiences on social media, with our Friends by word of mouth  - and are looking forward to RETURNING for a series of weekend "overnight stays" because WE LOVE NEW YORK and my Wife and I have found  A VERY NICE & ACCOMMODATINGLY SAFE place to lodge in the Heart of Broadway's energy center on Manhattan Island.
You would DO WELL to privilege YOURSELF and CHOICE COMPANY with a stay-visit at The Millennium Premiere Hotel - 133 W44th Street, NYC!!      - Ulysses & Tracey from Connecticut

title: High Octane Hotel!
text: Second visit this year and the Property is even better since some restrictions were lifted. Staff very helpful as usual-Frank at the door is attentive and helpful. Room was cleaned every day and small issues such as a new TV changer and Coffee machine were handled quickly. So happy they re-opened the Ambassodor Grill.

title: Poor
text: Tremendous praise for Sheldon, who helped confirm my booking. Other than that, this was a terrible stay. I’ve had better experiences at Garden Inns than this place and that’s saying something. Towels were dirty, coffee mugs were dirty, power outlets didn’t work, tv didn’t work. None of the benefits of being a gold honors member were accessible. I had to go to a deli 3 blocks away to get ice of all things! Their little canteen was closed - a whole mess of a time when I just needed to settle in for a meeting the next day.

title: Clean , Spacious , Views
text: We spent 3 nights here . Our room was immaculately cleaned and we had daily room service. The views are stunning , the room is “slightly” dated but true to the photos on the website. A massive TV , coffee facilities etc . We had breakfast included and what a bargain that was , super food at the on-site restaurant filled us up everyday. Slightly out of the way of the NYC buzz with a 30 min walk to the centre need which can be quite tiring . The door staff are pointless as they didn’t carry out luggage both on arrival and departure and spent most time inside we saw a number of people struggling with the heavy rotating door . The staff all seemed friendly and helpful .

title: Maybe once was great, now it badly needs a renovation
text:
- door was creaking
- wind was whistling through the windows
- room was cleaned, but deep stains were everywhere, on the couches, on the carpet, even less visible parts of the sheets
- underneath, the sheet protection was ripped
- mini-refrigerator was deeply stained
- all these, together, made you sick, were repugnant
- the room was heavily used, albeit functional
- the shower wall connection was splashing
- receptionists were tired and lack enthusiasm or joy
- lobby looked weird, with a mesh protecting from dropouts, like a grenade mesh sustained by ugly steel columns painted in black. I've never seen anything like it

Hotel has great potential, but needs a revamp. I will never choose this hotel again and will never recommend it to anyone else.

title: Unsafe, dirty, delapidated
text: Do not stay in this hotel.It is unsafe, dilapidated, noisy and has terrible service. I found our door left open, a person unconscious on the floor outside our room, elevators are unsafe and falling apart, staff in reception not wearing massk

title: Location, location, staff, staff
text: Fantastic service, location and cleanliness. Would stay here again. The staff were tremendously helpful with small requests, rooms (several families traveling together), and concierge res's during the week-long stay. The rooms were very nice but they are showing some age. The only 'ding' would be the beds themselves; modestly comfortable but not great.

title: Short stay
text: Too noisy, requested a refund to just take the train back out of state at 10 PM. Management was accommodating and kind, but there were no other available rooms to switch to as the one I was in had a connecting door and you could hear the people next door just making conversation.

title: Did not meet service expectations
text:
Upon arrival, hotel staff was NOT accommodating. When I approached the check in desk, the clerk did not give me any information. No room number, floor, directions to the elevator, nothing.
When my husband arrived, I had to wake up out of my sleep, get dressed, grab a mask, and pick him up from the lobby even though he had a digital key.
Aside from that, the view was amazing, the room was cozy.

title: Mediocre
text: Some of the appliances didn’t work. Including the shower, television, and some of the lights. Not to mention we literally found a pair of underpants. They failed to mention that our $700 stay would include a giant building in front of our “city” view room. And they attempt to charge you $75 to access your room if you’d need to go in earlier. Regardless of all the things I blame the hotel for, the staff here is amazing and I don’t place any of the blame on them.

title: Awesome views, excellent location!
text: The views of the Hudson River and Roosevelt Island are simply stunning. The room was spacious very comfortable in all aspects. I think the hotel is a gem for anybody visiting New-York but wanting some good rest

title: Extremely noisy room
text: Do not let the hotel give you room 3801.  It's next to the elevators, and any time they operate you will hear pipes/metal will bang around in the ceiling.  It's like a hammer hitting the wall / ceiling.  We slept very poorly even with ear plugs.  Cannot recommend this hotel.

title: NYC Birthday
text: I like the location but will probably go back to midtown and Chelsea. The view was amazing. The staff was very friendly and welcoming. The rooms were ok but need cleaning. Carpets were filthy. The paint and wallpaper were peeling in one of my rooms.

title: Views are amazing, staff just as great!
text:
I have stayed at this hotel off and on since the 90s. Still the best value for a 4 star hotel in the city - and I’ve tried dozens of others through the years! 

Amazing vews of the river and/or all of lower Manhattan are available in every room I ever had here (particularly corner rooms, but all amazing). However, the staff is what really makes this hotel special. 

Go visit Jeffrey at the Ambassador Grille bar, get to know Ozzie & the other Bell staff who will assist with every need, registration was a pleasure with Dorca and others (all endlessly helpful and patient!), cafe management when you need that first morning coffee (to supplement machines in each room) is cheery and fast, even security are warm, while astute (excellent, as hotel is right across the street from the UN!) and housekeeping is cheery and accommodating. 

If your want to be at the center of all the NYC action, this may not be your spot. But if you want a slightly off beaten path option where you won’t get pushed and pulled through the typical tourist shuffle - and you want some slightly quieter areas to walk or run daily - with the warmest and most helpful staff in town - at the risk of sold out nights for my next visit snd possible rising prices, I will say this hotel is back at the top of my NYC list - a city I used to live in and still love to visit!

title: Fantastic option near UN
text: I cannot speak highly enough of the convenient location, great room views, well-stocked and convenient cafe shop, and as well the polite and friendly staff of this hotel. The Millenium UN Hilton has become my go-to choice.

title: Bad Customer Service
text: Rooms are good - high floors. The reception area is dark and a bit tired, as was the service. We left a pair of jeans in our room at check out and when we called, housekeeping said they had the jeans and would hold them for us so we could come pick them up. We called twice to confirm, speaking directly with housekeeping both times. When we drove 90 minutes round trip to pick them up, housekeeping told us they have no jeans and no idea what we were talking about. Will not be staying at this hotel again.

title: Very Rude Customer Service
text: Adina Was a very rude customer service, we asked for any possible upgrade as Diamond status and she instead of saying no we are sold out or not more upgrades available, she made us feel like if we were begging her for a complementary upgrade without status. We contacted customer service and nothing was address I just spent the whole day answering emails and that wasn't the purpose of my trip. other than that It was a good stay

title: Hilton Didn’t Disappoint
text: From the moment we arrived to when we departed there wasn’t a time we weren’t impressed by the entire staff (dogs included). We appreciated the safety measures taken to keep the hotel guests and staff safe and healthy. Our room had incredible views and was comfortable and clean. Great location as well.  We will be back and highly recommend this hotel.

title: Poor Service.
text:
There was no benefit for being a gold member and I was not offered any food or beverage credit.  In fact, I was charged for a breakfast I never took.

The room was not up to the usual Hilton standards except the view of the city was good.

title: Amazing service!!
text: I love this hotel and their service. Always welcoming and all the staff are super nice!! Their rooms are huge and extremely clean, well organized. I’ll definitely always come back here and enjoy my stay as always!

title: Great Views at a Great Price
text: This was my third stay at Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza, and I had a great time again. Check in staff were very friendly, as well as the housekeeping staff. I hope to be back soon for my next visit!

title: NY Trip
text: We loved our Room. There service was great. The cleaning of the room was amazing. The credit of $15/person for food was wonderful in helping with NY prices. Thank you so much for the wonderful stay. We will definitely come back and Stay.

title: Enjoyable visit
text:
I've stayed here twice now, and plan to stay again when I get to New York. The hotel is in a quiet neighborhood, and the subway is 3 blocks away (some bus lines are closer). My room was larger than most I've stayed at in NY, and was quite comfortable with a super view. Housekeeping came each day of my three-day stay, which was a nice bonus. 
The only negatives: the floor lamp in the room was practically falling apart and didn't work, and neither did the desk lamp. The alarm clock was two hours slow, and I couldn't adjust it, so it was useless. And when I checked in, the agent didn't tell me that I got a food credit with my Gold status. I didn't notice that until I got the final bill. If he had told me, I would have bought more at the little food market in the lobby.

title: Terrible experience
text:
Dear sirs,

My name is Berta Montalvao and I stayed at your hotel from 21-27 September. I am using this platform to claim about the terrible service and experience I had during the days I spent at the hotel. 
The service and conditions of this hotel was terrible. Staring from the high prices applied due to the UN week (the hotel was so crowded and without enough space at the lobby), the service provided by the reception was more than bad, including the Manager. The team was always doing mistakes and providing wrong information. Some of our delegation members were treated without respect, namely the Minister that was part of this group. The room service didn't exist and this information was only provided when I was trying to make an order and not at the check-in. 
The hotel is not a real 4 starts and from my perspective it's too far from a Hilton standard service.

title: Stay at the New York UN Plaza
text: Really friendly and accommodating staff. Great location and front lobby is beautiful. Only problem was the carpet in our room was really stained and dirty. As well as the carpeting in the hallways were stained and looked dirty. Hopefully they’re able to replace them but overall enjoyed my trip with them and might consider staying again

title: Very nice stay
text: We stayed at this property from 09/09/2021 - 0/13/2021 and had an excellent experience.  After a very disappointing issue with Hilton Honors reservations (our reservation at the Doubletree midtown Manhattan for the same dates was cancelled without even notifying us, I wrote another review about that) the time in this hotel was great.  The entire staff was very friendly and professional.  They were conversational and always interested to know if we were having a good stay and if there was any way they could help.  Upon arrival our Hilton Honors gold status was honored and we were upgraded to a higher floor with an unbelievable skyline view of Manhattan.  We were also told that daily housekeeping had been restored - this is the first hotel I've stayed at since the pandemic started that has done this without needing to make a request.  The room was clean and comfortable, and we found it to be more spacious that most comparable Manhattan hotels which are known for tiny rooms.  About the only thing that I could point to as a negative is that the hallway carpet on our floor was badly stained and worn, much in need of replacement.   But overall this was a great experience and we will definitely consider staying here again.

title: Time to renovate
text: The hotel is one of three Hilton Millenium properties in Manhattan. It appears to be the oldest of the three (the other two being Downtown and Times Square). It’s time for a renovation. The rooms and public areas are showing their age (carpet stains, worn furniture,

title: Labor Day Weekend in NYC
text:
We decided to head to NYC for Labor Day weekend. I wanted to stay somewhere that wasn’t smack dab in the middle of a tourist trap (ie Times Square) and came across this property. Since I have banked a lot of points on Hilton Honors the stay was covered. We arrived, and got our luggage out. I had already checked in on the Hilton app and had selected my Room had the digital key prior to arriving. My partner went to find a parking lot and found one up on 46th and 1st, with a Daily Rate of $35, which wasn’t bad at all. 

There was whoni assumed to be one of the managers outside who was kind enough to point me in the right direction. Security is present with a dog that has to inspect your luggage. Safety definitely being a priority. Found my way to the room, got into the room and was amazed. At first the Windows seemed small, but when you get to walk over to them and look out, there’s the city, we could see the Empire State Building as well as a very recognizable cityscape. THIS was the New York City I missed. 

The accommodations were comfortable. The room was clean. Getting transportation to explore the city is a breeze with Lyft and you’re located adjacent to  FDR DRIVE. Would highly suggest utilizing Lyft if need be. I think the most we waited was 10 minutes. 

The cafe in the lobby had a nice selection to choose from if you are crazing a snack or something sweet. We didn’t have a chance to try The Ambassador or Room Service. 

We had to check out on Monday, but hadn’t planned on leaving until later, so the bellmen were awesome and stored our stuff for us until we returned back to the hotel. 

Overall satisfaction has been met. We liked it so much we’re coming back in two weeks.

title: Fantastic Stay
text: Had an amazing experience this previous Labor Day weekend. Stayed here for my trip to the US Open and could not be more pleased. Clean, modern room.  Friendly staff (from front desk to management) and great area. Will 100% stay here again. Could not ask for a better stay. Thank you!

title: Disappointing. This hotel makes your American Express/Hilton Card decline
text: This hotel did not accept a Hilton platinum card…Lost all of my points that I was supposed to gather after my trip. I had to use another card to authorize and pay for the stay. Staff was not helpful in getting involved.

title: Gross
text: Our room was fairly disgusting. A foreign substance was on multiple walls that had obviously not been cleaned. There was also a stain on the sheets that was very unsettling. Front of house service was very rude and unwelcoming. The television did not work for the duration of the stay. Doorman was the only bright spot of the hotel.

title: Impeccable Service & Cleanliness
text: I cant say enough about my start during the weekend of August 28th.  The staff at the hotel were extremely helpful and provided amazing customer service from the time I entered the door.  It's an amazing location within walking distance of pretty much anything you need. Thank you for an amazing stay!

title: Poor cleanliness
text: No room maintenance available after several request. No towels. No toilet paper. General poor responses made to simple requests. The hotel itself is in a great location, but service was terrible. Requested assistance from management via this survey.

title: Barely A 3-Star Hotel
text: Facilities in need of updating, carpet stains everywhere, furniture in lobby is clearly worn. My room when I first arrived was barley cleaned with crumbs and dirt on the table, counter and window. Made me concerned for how they cleaned between for covid proceedure. While here, I don’t know if it’s b/c covid, but our sheets weren’t changed simply the bed was mad and we stayed 5 nights. Water was left all over the counter with some of my stuff left sitting in it. Additionally we found mold our last day there, which probably explained my nightly headache, and reported during checkout and was told a manager would follow up. They have yet to do so. Rooms don’t have microwaves nor is there a common area one, also no ice machines (which I could understand limiting during covid) but it seems there isn’t one regardless. The saving grace for this place was truly just the Bellmen and cafe workers who were very helpful and polite each time we came back in.

title: Cleanliness issue
text: Unfortunately the first room I was in had a dirty bathtub and the second room still had previous guests belongings. I have never had a problem at the Hilton so this was very upsetting. Front desk was nice to offer another room but I wish had gone the extra mile to accommodate.

title: Excellent service
text: We really enjoyed our stay. We had an issue with the room we were in because the AC didn’t work and the front desk moved us immediately. They were so kind. We felt safe there and felt like we were there for longer than 3 days. Everyone remembers you and says hello and is friendly.

title: WONDERFUL STAFF AND QUIET PROPERTY.
text: My wife and I decided to take couples trip to New York City. We had an amazing time and the property was quiet compared to Times Square. As soon as we pulled up we were greeted by the bell staff., thank you for that. The front desk staff were amazing an allowed us to check in early since we had a red eye flight. We stopped at the café down the hall from the front desk and were kindly greeted by Wendy. She gave us so many recommendations for different restaurants in the area and outside of the city which we loved! Wendy my wife and I thank you so much for your hospitality.

title: Girls trip
text:
Great experience! Nice room
Beautiful view and friendly staff … everyone made us feel welcome. I love that housekeeping decorated our room with the stuffed animals we had bought. Also loved the security of needing a room key to get on elevator. Great experience all around

title: Best hotel
text: Enjoyed my stay. Hotel was clean and staff were friendly. Had corner suite and views were stunning of the city and water. This hotel was in a Great location and parking was very easy to find. Would definitely stay here again

title: Great stay
text: Amazing view of the city!! The location is also great, quiet neighborhood and central location. The rooms and hotel were clean and the staff was very friendly and courteous. Overall we had a fantastic stay here during our trip.

title: Amazing place?
text: We were greeted with such warm and friendly staff:) The hotel was very clean and quiet. The rooms were very well put together & very clean. The beds were very comfortable as well as the pillows LOL. Couldn’t have asked for a better place

title: The best hotel experience in the City !
text:
I know quite well Midtown and we wanted a nice hotel close to 42nd street. The room had an amazing view with enough space for 2 people and a kid.
Staff is very nice and helpful : We would like to thank Franck who was very helpful during our stay !
I would strongly recommend this hotel to anyone willing to make a trip to NY .

title: Same price no service
text: I do understand the COVID-19 restrictions but at least reduce the rate per room if you no longer have the amenities.  No vip lounge, no pool, no restaurant, no gym, no room service.  All you get is a room that the staff make you feel that they are doing you a favor to stay there.  I have always used Hilton but after this experience I will be looking for another hotel brand.

title: Love this place
text: One of my fav hotels in the city,love this place and the staff , it’s at a perfect location not too far from all the tourist attraction but Also not too close…. Love how patient and kind every worker and staff were

title: Great place to stay and relax
text: Great Hotel, management is amazing. The front desk agents where amazing, welcoming, very knowledgeable of nearby stores to get flowers and other essentials. I would definitely recommend staying here to my guests.

title: Great location and friendly staff
text: We needed a place for a couple of nights for some hospital visits mixed in with fun. The hotel is wonderful. It’s close enough to hospitals we needed and also close enough to restaurants, cafes, etc. Also near buses for easy access up and down town.

title: The UNCafe is amazing!!
text: The UNCafe in the lobby and its employees are so kind and make amazing coffee drinks! It’s super convenient  and delicious! Worth the visit even if you’re not staying at the hotel. Would definitely recommend the food and drinks!

title: First time New Yorker
text: Quality Hotel for the price. Central location. Approximately 10 minute walk to Grand Central Station. Staff was extremely nice and accommodating. I would definitely stay again. Covid restrictions followed. Diamond members can expect to have a $15 food credit per day. (Able to use it for whatever you want in the cafe; including alcohol). They also include baggage check for earlier arrival or late departure. I was also allowed to extend my checkout time. I am very pleased with my stay.

title: Could be better
text: Room was not cleaned when I arrived (empty soda cans etc). It also felt run down overall. The staff were friendly but there was no amenities/breakfast included. Overall would not book for personal stay

title: Amazing views!
text: The view from the 40th flood was incredible! Came out for the weekend for my boyfriends birthday and we had a great time. Only downside was finding parking, it was lucky that we found a garage nearby that wasn’t too expensive but other than that the room was great, would definitely return!

title: Solid hotel in the city
text:
We did a couples weekend here just me and the wife. 

We got a king room with the parking package. Totally worth it since the daily parking would’ve been $60ish. 

The room was clean spacious. It had two day beds, the drawer with the tv, a desk and chair, a small round table, two nightstands and a king size bed. You are not wishing for more space when in this room. The bathroom was also spacious. The feel is definitely business geared. So could be a bit boring but the views do make up for it. We got a city view room and we could see the Chrysler and Empire state buildings easily. You can see the Freedom Tower on a good day one side and the skyscraper residences by Central Park on the other. 

We easily got a room change since the first room reeked of smoke. Super easy when we called down to the front desk. 

Location is great if you care to drive, uber, taxi or plan to walk a lot. It is not the most convenient if you expect to use the subway.

title: Quiet stay in the city
text: Was promised an unobstructed view of the East River July 4th fireworks display from my corner room, but was only partially visible due to the United Nations building. Carpets need cleaning, otherwise an acceptable accommodation for the price & location.

title: The worst Hilton I have ever visited.
text: . I don’t think the bed had been changed before our arrival. There was a sweaty odor to the sheets. One day they didn’t clean our room at all. And even when they did, we were missing bath towels and coffee supplies. As a 20+ year Hilton Honors member I was bitterly disappointed

title: Unsatisfactory
text: I would not stay here again. Overpriced for the quality of the room. The corner king is not the same room shown on site. So sad!! The bell captain and the maintenance We’re great. I expected more so sad

title: Wonderful staff but the services were not up to par.
text:
We in France understand how difficult the Covid pandemic has been for all businesses but we were very disappointed by the conditions in the Hilton at 1 UN Plaza.  Arriving on a rainy night from Boston, we found there was no restaurant in the hotel and only a pick-up coffee bar off the lobby that charged very high prices for not much (2 mediocre sandwiches, waters and 2 cookies, $41).  The carpet in the hallway leading to our room was stained and dirty, like a third-world country.  One light was out, and our TV did not work, plus the view was of an office building about 20 feet away.  The hotel was certainly not full, so why put us in such a poor location?
I had chosen the hotel because it was close to a dear friend who is failing in health--we could get to her quickly for brief visits.  But I promise I will not repeat the mistake.

title: Dirty rooms. Hilton's clean stay standard seemed to be missing
text: The first room we were given had dirty walls. When I looked under the bed cover, it was apparent that no one ever checked under the bed. (photos attached) The second room we were given looked as if no one had vacuumed under the bed for a very long time. After much frustration dealing with the clerk at the front desk who had the nerve to say that she did not think anything woul satisfy me, the manager finally appeared with a key to a clean room. I will never stay here again. How dare the hotel advertise a clean stay when the rooms are not clean?

title: Great lobby staff and location!
text: The rooms were your nice standard hotel rooms. Did love that they had a bidet! But I appreciated the Bell Hop, Door Man, and other staff who graciously chatted with us about living in NYC. One man had worked at that hotel for 42 years!!! Amazing!! Speaks to the quality employer they must be.

title: Excellent
text: Everything was amazing. The views were amazing!! The staff was very friendly. Had no problems with anything at all. My digital key was not accessible due to my phone dying, so front desk issued me a card key & had security escort me upstairs to verify my ID to confirm I was a actual guest. They were very nice & I was very pleased

title: Weekend stay at Hilton Union Square
text: I’ve stayed at this hotel many times and always had a enjoyable experience however this time I had two instances of housekeeping issues between housekeeping staff walking in the room while I was in bathroom and spouse was sleeping also had issues with dirty sheets that normally would be unacceptable to most... I will give the property the benefit of the doubt being that it was a holiday weekend and busy but hopefully issues can get resolved

title: The worst hotel stay ... ever....
text:
This was by far the worst ever stay I have had in a Hilton Hotel.  The room was filthy, ripped carpets and in general disrepair.  The hotel was lacking any sort of soul and the staff.. even worse.  

I waited over two hours for towels to be sent to the room. The clean promise was certainly not promised, nor delivered on this occasion.  

Nobody answered calls when calling the front desk, concierge.  It was a good job that there was no emergency!

On all the location was fantastic and the view from the room was spectacular.  However .. that was as far as I can credit.

title: The Hilton Name Should Include Shame
text:
We finally were able to travel post-Covid and booked a trip to New York City to visit and bond with four grand nieces and nephews born during the Covid lockdown.  We decided to book into the Millenium Hilton at U.N. Plaza as it is a newer property and is probably kept up as it no doubt receives worldwide visitors to the U.N.

The staff was friendly and assigned a wonderful room with a view; however, we discovered upon entry that the carpet was stained and dirty, used coffee packets and sugar, crème and napkins accompaniments had not been replaced.  Also, there was dust on the shelves in the closet (there was no dresser with drawers as the hotel design was based on the European model).  Finally, the batteries in the safe were discharged making it unusable.

Upon leaving for the day we spoke to the front desk who called in the manager and requested that we be moved.  We were told that we would be given a higher floor with larger windows and to check back upon our return.  We came back at 10:30 P and received a set of keys to the new smaller room (five floors higher) but set in an inner corner with virtually no view.  Also, we had to move our own luggage as there were no porters on duty.  We had a bedside lamp that could not be turned off using its own switch but was regulated by the main switch just inside the door.  The lamp on the other side of the bed worked perfectly.  Being tired, we settled for what was given and went to sleep.

The next day my wife asked the manager if there could be an adjustment made.  She responded that that was not possible as the room was booked through a third party.  However, she would try to give us some points.  Again, we went out for the day to spend time with friends and relatives and did not return until late the second evening.  Upon entering the room, we discovered that the bed was not made up nor were used towels replaced.  While we had new packets of coffee, tea, sugar, et al, there were no stirrers.

Again, we called the front desk and they did send someone up with fresh towels.  During this phone call, my wife was told that we would have to request that the room be made up and supplies replenished and that it is not “automatic.”  It would have been nice if this was conveyed to us upon our check-in the first day.  On the third evening, we returned to a room that was made up and towels replaced.

We have booked Hilton hotels for years due to their reputation and fine service and we did stay at a Homewood Suites by Hilton during our visit to Long Island for the next three days.  That property was like night and day as compared to the Millenium Hilton.  We realize that some services had to be curtailed due to lack of staff during Covid, but at least communicate with your guests and let them know the true situation and the full extent of lack of services up front.  The Millenium Hilton did not communicate to us and it appeared that they didn’t care either.  Apologies are cheap and we kept getting those but very little else.  We will probably go with another hotel chain in the future.

title: Sólo un hotel
text:
El hotel se encuentra ubicado a sólo unas 3 cuadras de la Grand Central Station.
La zona del hotel es buena y segura, tiene varios lugares 24 horas en sus alrededores como CVS y otro tipo de minimarkets.
El hotel es un poco viejo, pero se encuentra bien mantenido y sus habitaciones son bien, estan bien distribuidas.
Realmente, los puntos negativos del hotel son su atención. 
1. Tienen un app super chic, muy moderna en la que puedes hacer check in/out, escogdr tu habitación, contar con una llave digital, pero ellos no la usan.
2. Debes solicitar en recepción la limpieza de la habitación; esto se entiende perfectamente por protocolo COVID, pero no entiendo por que no avisan en el check in. 
3. Debes solicitar la limpieza con 24 horas antes.
4. Cuando te hacen limpieza, puede ser que sólo te cambien las toallas.

Creo que hay opciones más centrales, más cercanas a central park o time square que son igual o económicamente más favorables.

title: Nice hotel with subpar customer service and appreciation of diamond members.
text:
Nice hotel with subpar customer service and appreciation of diamond members. 

Late checkout wasn’t available since they were “sold out”, yet if you pay 1-night rate the room magically becomes available.
No free breakfast, but little food stop downstairs is open for business.  Covid must be very selective. 

But rooms are nice and we had a killer view.

title: Fabulous location, but seriously in need of a face-lift
text:
Definitely no longer a 4 star property - it's barely worth 3 stars. We did have a room on the 45th floor with a spectacular view of the World Trade Center but the room itself was sad: worn carpet with a big stain on it, toilet cracked in 2 places, and furniture was badly worn.  Most alarming in these days of "extreme cleaning," when we entered our room for the first time, there was a bottle cap clearly visible on the floor. Deep cleaning? I think not.  At our request, they did send up a housekeeper to reclean while we were out for dinner

Obviously, the hotel's location is fabulous, but sadly, the property itself is barely acceptable and a makeover is seriously overdue.

title: Unfortunate Travel for Diamond Frequent Traveler
text:
It was unfortunate that such a respected hotel chain couldn’t be bothered to provide a better experience for a frequent Diamond business traveler. Although the location is very convenient to most areas needed during the trip, tge service was negligible!!
The guest rooms were less than splendid for cleanliness too. The exterior hallways were filthy and carpets were in need of deep cleaning or replacement due to smell, stains and just plain nastiness. 

There was a complete lack of any amenities for any Diamond members. No microwaves available or even access to one in the lobby to heat food ! RIDICULOUS !!! No vending at all ! What a shame !!! Disappointing for HILTON  !!!

title: Hilton Going Down
text: Hilton quality is not good anymore. Third Hilton from NY to FL and they are horrible. Would have given a one star but stayed the night to get checked into another.  Will not use Hilton brand again.  Marriott is maintaining even through COVID

title: Underwhelmed
text: The world is coming back to action and this Hilton is still fast asleep.  Minimal staffing NO services and NO amenities.   A place to at least have some coffee in the morning would be nice.  On the bright side, the location fit my needs and they accommodated a late checkout for me.

title: Pick this one
text: You will not be disappointed in your stay. They even offer advice as to where to park for a fraction of the cost. All staff are accommodating and a pleasure to speak with. You must pick this one as you will not be disappointed in your stay. All are welcoming and friendly.

title: Weekend in the City!
text: Amazing views of the Hudson!!!! That definitely was the highlight of the stay. Service was great at check in. Very accommodating. I will definitely be staying again. Wish there were more restaurant options.

title: Dirty and poorly managed
text: This hotel has a great location, with a suggestive view from the upper floors.  And here the positives end. The rest is a total disaster that embarrasses the Hilton chain. Lack of cleanliness, a fact even more serious considering the Covid pandemic, when all the other structures have increased the attention and service in cleaning. Upon arrival they inform you that to have the room cleaned you must request it the day before. However, it is not possible to make a request on the day of check-in. And anyway, even when we made the requests, they "forgot", perhaps deliberately to clean, twice! In six days, we were able to have the room cleaned only once and only because we were lucky enough to meet the cleaning lady on our floor, who asked us if we were checking out, clearly implying that cleaning is done only and only at check-out, regardless of requests. We have repeatedly reported this disservice to the reception, always receiving arrogant, rude and absolutely indifferent replies to our complaints. Safe box unusable because the battery was low and it was obviously unthinkable to be able to have it replaced. NYC is able to offer much more welcoming and above all clean hotels. Stay away from this place !!!

title: A week in NYC
text:
This review was during so I can't rate the following: restaurant, members lounge, fitness center. Also Bell service only on weekends - but very professional. And with no ice machines or restaurant or in room freezers well...
So why 4 stars? The view was great - you'll feel like the King of Manhattan every evening. Housekeeping on request was very good. Room was good sized. All the basics - refer, safe, large closet, espresso machine. Rooms were quiet, bed in good shape. The hotel is 3 blocks from Grand Central 6 min walk - great unless you are staying in winter. I would give 5 stars but without all services - I couldn't make that determination.

title: Won’t be back again
text: The stay was ok I after I was asked to change the bedding by myself when I first arrived. I also sanitized the room by myself with Lysol and alcohol spray since Hilton probably has different definition of clean during the pandemic…. There is no breakfast (it could simply be breakfast to-go) and no communication or not having breakfast when booking the hotel. There is not a vending machine either in a four star hotel. For sure won’t be back again.

title: not impressed
text: Hotel room was ok; amenities-restaurant and avaialability of necessities such as filtered water and ice were not available. We had to ask a few times for fresh towels. At the same time, we felt very safe in our room

title: Lack of communication
text: Mangers need to communicate better with the staff and guests. Wonder why the staff are rude because the management is awful I was promised a rolling bed never got one I booked a room for double beds but need up getting only one bed when I informed the staff I’m traveling with kids one bed is not enough they didn’t care or show any concerns

title: Do not stay here
text: Worst Hilton I have ever visited. Room was dirty and not cleaned properly. Bed was broken and a vape pen was found which I guess housekeeping overlooked. Elevators are old and shake. Hotel manager does not return calls. Creepy bald security guard that gives out predator vibes. Don’t waste your time or money here if staying in the NYC area.

title: Great view but look under the bed......
text: We requested a change of room because the first one was dirty-the rug wasn't vacuumed and there was a plastic food container and cigarettes ashes under the bed.  I always look under the bed otherwise we would have not noticed.  The second room was better but not the Hilton member standards that I expected.  Also, the front desk clerk was  rude to my husband saying she had no control of the condition of the room.  True, but that's not an appropriate or professional response.  She should had apologize and let us know that housekeeping will be informed.  Very disappointed at the Hilton who claimed such high level of sanitation.  Apparently housekeeping managers/supervisors are not supervising.  They are doing less since they don't come to your room to clean, change sheets or towels and it's worst than before the pandemic.  There was dust on the lamps and the tables. In addition not all rooms are "created equal" apparently: the first one didn't have a fridge but the second did.  Aren't they supposed to be all the standard rooms the same?  Hilton is definitely NOT what it used to be.

title: Not so pleased
text:
Prior to the virus, I stayed at this property many times. 

Based on the floor map which is on every door, I was assigned the smallest room on the floor. Not what I expected by being a Diamond Member. The room was not cleaned satisfactorily. There was a penny by the bed which should have been removed if the carpet was vacuumed. The furniture looked as if it had been obtained from a local flophouse.  There was dust on the shelves by the coffee machine.

title: Would return again
text: It was a really nice place for a good price with a very nice city view I would definitely return again. There are delis that are open 24/7 nearby which was very convenient when you get back late and nothing is really open & everything is walking distance

title: Lovely Location but Terrible Customer Service
text:
A couple of my friends and I were really excited to travel to New York for a night and have a girls' trip. When we arrived at check-in, the reservation was under my friend's name and the concierge told me I wasn't allowed to check in without her unless we called TripAdvisor and switched the name of the reservation. Because this is most likely standard procedure and it was the middle of the afternoon, I'd understood his impatient tone and went to fix the reservation. But I could also understand complaints from other guests who were checking in that afternoon that the customer service was unsatisfactory.

All that aside, when we arrived in the room we'd booked, everything looked fine except for some black stains on the floor. We hadn't thought anything of it because they were by the foot of the bed and we had planned to be out for most of the time. The next morning for check out, we checked out on time and cleaned up all of our trash.

So I was certainly surprised when I received a $544 deep cleaning charge on my bill. Throughout multiple attempts to get in touch with the hotel managers Saritza and Thomas, we learned that the deep cleaning charge was a result of those black stains on the floor, that were a result of smoking in the room. Neither of my friends nor I smoke––as one of us has asthma, and carries an inhaler around at all times. Beyond that, a $544 deep cleaning charge seems excessive. 

I understand that it was the fault of my friends and I for not reporting the black stains when we first arrived in the room, but I'm really disappointed that I have tried multiple times (at least nine different times) to get in touch with the hotel managers, who have yet to answer my phone calls or return any of my messages about this. I'm really confused by the customer service we're receiving from an institution that has so many great ratings from other guests.

title: Amazing view
text: the view was spectacular, I literally slept in front of the empire state, I really liked the hotel and its location, everything was clean and beautiful.  I did not like that I chose to reserve a bathtub in the bathroom and when I entered I did not have it.

title: Manager needs Sensitivity training
text:
In the past my family has enjoyed coming to this hotel for years. We've really appreciated the attentive service of old timers like, Frank, Eddie, and Avery and Barry at the front desk.

This visit was beyond disappointing. Upon arrival there was no-one to assist with our luggage, a great inconvenience as my father is wheel chair bound.

Our rooms were in the West tower so we had to navigate around the stairs with the wheelchair to get to the elevators.

The rooms were not “sealed” as advertised, and certainly could have used a thorough cleaning.
 
We settled into our rooms and were assaulted with an overpowering odor of smoke. After several calls a security guard came, took a report and told us the manager should be contacting us.

In addition we had multiple uncomfortable encounters with a guest and his two bull dogs during our stay.  My father is highly allergic and my wife is afraid of dogs. The pet owner was very nonchalant about our discomfort.

When I finally explained my concerns to Thom Caska, he was flippant, telling me there was nothing he could do. He blamed the GM for lowering rates resulting in people “like that coming in,” and he nodded toward a group of young African Americans.

Clearly he didn’t realize that two of the young men were my biracial sons. He basically inferred that if you are African American and wear a hoodie, or your hair is braided you are not welcome at the UN One Hilton. 
Not that it should matter, but both my sons happen to be in medical school.

This small minded mentality was an insult not only to my sons but to my wife and my entire family. We are a multi-cultural, biracial family, and I was highly offended by his rationale that the level of service is based on the clientele. That is called bias my friends, and worse.

In case Thom Caska didn’t know it, my money is just as good as anybody's and in the future we’ll be taking our business elsewhere.

Service is the heart of the Hospitality business, no matter who the guest is. It’s attitudes such as Thom Caska’s that’s cause so much discord in the world.

title: The Worst experience ever
text: The first impression nobody helps you at the door with the baggage , in the room the first was a dirty toilet paper under the bed, the fridge did not working , the bed  sheets were dirty,  the restaurant was closed, the coffee shop in the lobby only opens on weekends. In conclusion, all the amenities on the Internet are false. False advertising!!!

title: Meh
text: I was expecting to have all those clean room seals that were talked about on the website and the toilet and remote wraps to denote that is been cleaned thoroughly. I found  none of that. I guess it was a good thing that I traveled with my own Lysol wipes and spray to clean. I was also expecting to have some in-room dining but that wasn’t the case. The little cafe in the hotel had modified their hours to be open only Friday-Saturday for like 6 hours a day. Overall, it was just a place to sleep. You couldn’t really relax and order room service. You had to go out and get all of your meals even when you didn’t feel like it. They also didn’t even provide bottled water.

title: Almost One!
text: My wife and I were pleased with room selection. Nice City views at night. We needed a coffee maker and microwave oven. Front Dest supplied us with both as well as needed daily coffee pods. The illy coffee was excellent. I would return here.

title: Run down
text: My recent stay was disappointing. The suite was run down with portions of the carpet missing. Room Cleaning came at 7;00 pm! No restaurant wax told to walk up the street for coffee. The in room coffee maker was never serviced. Overall a disappointing stay. I was in a 1 bedroom suite. I have stayed there other times- this will be the last time.

title: Poor Arrival Communication
text: I was quite dissatisfied with my arrival experience. I arrived on site and zero information was given. Basically gave my name and got a key. That’s it. I wish they would have given me at least some information on the amenities available at the time I stayed there and maybe a local dining location or info about on site dinning.
