title: Stunning views and generous rooms
text: One of a kind views of NYC are the focal point of their king room. The hotel was comfortable and clean. The staff is nice and accommodated our last minute reservation. The only negative (sadly common in hotels now) is the coffee situation. There is a mini Keurig type of maker with two pods of coffee. A NYC morning calls for some real coffee. There is a cafe where you can get coffee in the hotel but it is only open on the weekends.

title: COVID Protocols Lessened Our Enjoyment
text: With COVID-19 protocols in place, we found that what is billed as a 4 star hotel was more like a 3 star. Service was GREAT, our view of the East River, Roosevelt Island & beyond to Queens, both day & night was just GORGEOUS (check out my pics), but the cutback on hotel amenities lessened our enjoyment. Coffee shop closed, gym closed, no "Welcome to the Hilton" greeting, & our room seemed kind of bare because of the lack of typical items that make a room feel warmer & welcoming. Again, I assume because of COVID compliance. On the other hand, as mentioned, we were thrilled with our view, with the size of the room (although the sectional couch took up a disproportionate amount of space), the service, when needed (there were no coffee cups in the room upon our arrival & barely-hot water in the shower-both issues fixed immediately, & we were allowed to check in early & check out late without typically extra fees-why does a 4-star hotel charge extra for early check-in anyway & why does a 4-star hotel charge $15 for internet use??) & we found the east side, midtown location to be ideal.

title: Great view
text:
Never thought I'd spend another night in the city not for leisure or business but doctor's appointment. Millennium Hilton is located in a place very convenient for my doctor's visit, so since I have an early appointment, I decided to stay here for the night. 

From reading the reviews prior to booking, I thought this would just be another business-y hotel. Due to Covid, the area is not hustling and bustling, so it was rather a quiet and nice stay. In fact, my room had a great view of the East River which brings me so much calm and peace during my stay. I was also able to open the windows slightly which definitely helps to balance my claustrophobia these days (I wonder if I could ever go back to stay in a shoebox in New York City post-pandemic).

title: Great staff!
text: Wanted a nice staycation... and that's what I got. The area is quiet. Places all along 2nd ave for any need you have. The staff was helpful and nice. The room was clean and was everything shown on the website. I wIll definitely come back.

title: Moderate
text:
Just to make things clear i stayed at the hotel during Covid time when there was almost nothing available but i will overlook that.
 First I stayed at a very high floor (37) the carpet was dirty and dated. Housekeeping was made upon request a day before.  Sine breakfast is included in the price but the dining room was closed I would expect Hilton to make a designated app for breakfast so people can order from a set list what they would like to have and pick it up form the lobby the nest morning but that wasn't the case.
So my stay was disappointing, did expect more.

title: Miss representation of non-cleaning policy
text: The hotel does not reveal that they do not clean your room if you stay more than one night unless you ask for it the night before. So when I got back after a hard days work nobody clean my room. When I insisted that my room get cleaned I was told that I should’ve asked for the night before. When I told them that nobody explained that to me the assistant manager told me that it was not their policy to explain it to me that I had to know it in advance otherwise my room would not be cleaned. Catch 22 to the nth degree and Fraud

title: Dissapointed/ Covid 19 excuses all over the Hotel
text:
Briefly,
1- This hotel has not gym opened, other gyms around in NYC are opened.
2- I have arrived with 3 bags and 2ea Hilton's workers at the door did not bothered to help with my bags or to open the main entrance door.
3- The Receptionist no polite at all, felt like we are staying for free or not paying to be at this Hotel.
4- Food and Beverage service: Not Available for room service, asked for coffee bags to be delivered to the room and wait long for it. 
5- Clean Rating: posting a picture probably would be the best but did not bothered. The room is dirty, dust all over and actually found 1ea long boot under the bed, discusted.
I have sent an email to the main hilton at this location, is already been 3 days delivered and no one has the decency to reply.

title: TLM10023
text: This hotel is absolutely filthy, stains all over the room, items from the previous occupants were left under the bed. Staff does not care when you complain, the frontline staff is rude and the managerial  staff  is patronizing. DO NOT stay at this hotel you will regret it.

title: Clean and Safe
text: During the pandemic, it is reassuring to stay at a clean and safe hotel. The location is convenient and transportation is easy.  I have stayed at the Millennium for years and they have maintained the same quality of service during this difficult time.

title: Do Not Stay Here!
text: My stay was nothing other than a disaster. I decided to stay here the night before my wedding. WRONG DECISION! I woke up in the middle of the night to bed bugs on my pillow and bite marks on my arm. The staff was not helpful at all and in fact gave me the attitude. The night manager , Maria was very nonchalant which tells me this happens very frequently ( even tho she said this was the first case). We live in NY so we know that there is NEVER only one bug there is always several. After changing rooms I was informed that a “technician” did not check the room until hours later and was told that my “assumptions” were false and there were no bed bugs. I actually had pictures of the bugs and the bite marks but even after providing proof I was told “ the technician knows best” completely disregarding the facts. Then I was insulted and told that I probably brought them in there. I was supposed to stay 2 nights but decided to leave after my first night. When I went to check out the same manager , Maria was on duty and refused to come out and speak to me. Extremely poor customer service and very disgusting hotel. Let’s not forget to mention the old stained and bleached carpets and the walls that look like blood was splattered. DO NOT STAY HERE!!!

title: Worst Hotel Ever, BED BUGS and LIES
text: Yesterday was one of the worse days of my life. I was in midtown manhattan for a wedding and stayed at the Millennium Hilton  New York on 1 UN plaza. This is the worse hotel I ever stayed at and an embarrassment to the Hilton brand. They have rude staff, no house keeping unless you request it the night before (which wasn't told to us) , no trolleys to move your stuff, broken fixtures, no ice or vending machines, what seemed to be blood splatters on the ceiling and oh yeah BED BUGS. On our first night we woke up to bed bugs in our bed and bite marks all over us. I recorded the bug showed the staff and asked for my room to be changed. Management was unapologetic and called our new room to say that no bugs were found after their "technician" checked. Another party that was in town for the wedding had the same issue on a different floor and was told the same thing. This hotel refuses to deal with the bed bug problem and instead acts as if it doesn't exist. On top of this issue the sprinkler went off in my room for over 5 minutes soaking everything and everyone inside with dirty black water. There was no smoke or fire. I stood in the hallway for over 30 minutes soaking wet begging for a new room before anyone from management approached me, and when I was approached it was just to place blame on us. No hospitality no assistance. At this point i am now moving my soak and wet items to a third room ( not to mention the hotel has no bell boys or bell trolleys to move your items around) and received no help from the staff. Not only did all my clothes for the wedding end up being damaged but also I the "Best Man" ended up missing the wedding due to this traumatic experience. We decided we had enough and went back home instead of staying another night and risking being bit by bed bugs or worse bringing them back into our home. I spoke to management (Maria) on the way out, they showed no remorse was unapologetic and offered no compensation in any way. When I asked about filing a claim for my damaged items she said to call Monday and also reinstated that there was no bed bugs even though I showed them the video and bites. Maria the manager also refused to come out and speak to the other party that was bit by bed bugs. She locked the door and wouldn't come out. This hotel is disgusting and should be shut down.

title: Review
text:
Great room. Blown away by the size/spaciousness and magnificent view. This was a very convenient location for me in terms of ease of travel to my business. 

Only thing was that the bathroom did smell a little bit. Additionally, there was neon yellow liquid all over the carpeting in the hallway. 

Overall still very nice.

title: Thin Walls & Unclean Room
text: Thin walls & floors while TV didn’t work & room was not clean. There was an alarm the majority of the night in the hallway & I was able to hear the couple next to me having “relations” or banging the bed against the thin wall.

title: Average Hotel
text: Hotel has nice views of the city. Beds were comfortable, room is outdated and does not match to pictures on the Hilton App. Windows  in the room had dust and the windows did not appear to have been cleaned lately. Tried to get a cup of hot water for my coffee but to no avail. Front desk advised to get a cup of hot water from any outside coffee shop. I expect more from Hilton as a Diamond member.

title: Quiet room midtown
text: Easy location to walk to lots of things - museums, shopping, coffee shops. Currently the restaurant is closed and also the gift shop. No mini bars now. Small coffee maker. I liked that it had a bathtub with a shower. So many hotels now have only showers. Towels and sheets very nice quality. Ask for an upper level room. VIEWS!!

title: I would recommend
text: Overall , I had a pleasant stay at this hotel. The views are amazing and you can see the Empire State Building from the window. My only issue was the cleanliness . There was hair on the bed sheets and the countertops was filthy. I had to use sanitizing wipes to clean it. The front desk man wasn’t really welcoming, he had an attitude. He could’ve been more welcoming. Overall, it was a great stay and I’d recommend this hotel.

title: No ice dispensers and rude lobby employes
text: I checked in on Thursday and the person at the front desk seemed really rude, did not welcome me and my wife. I asked about Hilton honors but she rudely said I didn’t qualify to collect points but that she would give me a free wifi passcode. Also, this is a Hilton Hotel and you don’t provide ice dispensers for customers? Not even a vending machine. So. I was told to walk two blocks away. Never expected this for a Hilton.

title: Stay at the next hotel on your list
text:
I originally wasn’t going to say anything. Chalk it all up to covid stress. I’m in hospitality myself so I get it. But after these first two occurrences I listed that occurred at the end of our stay - it really pushed me over the edge, to the point where I feel I should warn people before they spend money here. This hotel stay was absurdly unprofessional. They shouldn’t be called a “business” even. More like a robber who stole $338 from me and in return I got to sleep in a dusty room with stained furniture. 

•930am(1hr30m before checkout), housekeeping walked in, WITHOUT knocking, while my wife and I were completely naked 
•housekeeping then called one hour later at 10:40am (20minutes before hotel checkout) and says [yes, this bluntly and informally] “hi, when are you leaving?” So I say “um, isnt check out 11?” And they say “ok good so you’re leaving at 11 great” then HUNG UP without saying anything else

ARE YOU KIDDING ME?! this isn’t a covid-related business “oopsy”. This is blatant, horrid customer formality. Who says that? Who walks in without knocking? anyway.. let’s continue.

•A USED KLEENEX WAS SHOVED INTO THE TOP OF THE KLEENEX BOX(this should literally be a crime in times of covid. If you can be arrested for spitting on someone these days, you should be arrested for housing someone in a germ-infested room. 
•Upon entering, soon realized the room hadn’t been cleaned in any recent time. bedside tables, windows, tv, couch, ALL covered in a layer/thick film of dust. I could LITERALLY DRAW IN IT!!!
-No regular coffee packets, only decaf
-Only one shower head worked(the smaller, weaker one)
-by time shower ended, I was standing in shin-deep water 
-Plug for tub drain broken(had to physically remove drain in order to open it)
-Safe was locked, couldn’t use it
-Front desk wore masks 10% of the time + housekeeping didn’t wear masks AT ALL walking hallways/cleaning rooms. 
-Soaps and lotions in bathroom ALREADY OPENED and partially used
-never visited room to make bed/take out trash/restock linen/restock coffee/etc(even after I REQUESTED a cleanup)
-clock not set in room - had to set it ourselves 
-couch in the room had numerous stains on it

It was as if a guest was here before us a month ago and all they did when they left a month ago was tidy up/make the bed and change out towels. Literally. That’s it. I’m positive my sheets were dirty, based on the rest of the room. No amenities refilled, no new soaps, safe was locked, films of dust everywhere, housekeeping walks in on you naked without knocking, maskless staff, I could go on and on. 

I’m not one to write reviews. As I said, I’m in hospitality. I hate what Yelp and TripAdvisor have done to our industry. But my god this whole experience was downright atrocious. No business should be proud of this. I understand it’s covid right now... but my lord.

title: Great stay
text:
Great stay I had a beautiful view from
My room only down side was there was no ice machine/ no where to get ice or any beverages I’m guessing that is because of covid but other than that I loved it and will definitely stay again

title: Amazing
text: The people at the hotel where great and treated us with respect, the facilities were clean and the veiw was breathtaking over looking the river and the United Nations building, we look forward to staying again

title: Very clean.
text: Service, staff, and cleanliness were excellent. Mattress and pillows were not.  - not terrible but certainly nothing to write home about. Location was good for my purposes. Good value for current price ($170 for corner king bedroom).

title: OK
text: Good facility in good location with mediocre service. We did have an early checkin and were grateful to be able to rest after redeye. Hotel did not recognize HH status on checkout. Late checkout $180, I had Diamond desk contact facility night before checkout and still was charged for late checkout. Housekeeping walked in on me naked at Noon anyway😬

title: Not covid friendly
text: The location was perfect for us and the staff was responsive.  However, most often, the staff did not wear masks, sometimes even when you walked up to the counter.  One of the security guards often sat in the lobby without his mask on.  This is not acceptable in this day.  If you're pretending to care about covid by not cleaning rooms daily, at least wear your masks.

title: DISGUSTING
text: Hotel was filthy. No clean seals on room, hair in the sink, old coffee pod in machine, stains on sofa and carpet. No water as per normal for diamond members, no breakfast. I ordered Uber eats and put wrappings outside door - it sat there for 24 hours. So much wrong with this hotel, we just checked out early. DISGUSTING

title: Hotel review
text: Front desk people were extremely helpful and friendly but when I called that morning due to a funeral running late the room key was turned off and had to go up to room 4 times before they finally called security to unlock room for me .... was then charged for staying later past check out every person I dealt with was very nice I just did t think I’d be charged after the hour of trying to get back into my room

title: Not worth the price
text: Very noisy, ok rooms, unprofessional staff, messy hallways, definitely not a four star hotel, it’s too close to the UN headquarters and there are many consulate offices around will not go back again!!

title: Never again
text: It’s not worth the money...no room service no microwave or a refrigerator and none of that is advertised online when you book your room.the room is small but if you get a ocean view it’s ok but overall not worth the money!!!

title: Millennium UN Plaza
text: The website had incorrect information listed. There was no valet available or any parking for that matter and in addition, the address on the website was completely incorrect. The hotel should definitely update their information so that guests are better able to plan their trips.

title: A great hotel in a great location with a FANTASTIC VIEW!!!
text: I've taken the most beautiful pictures of Manhattan from this room. Considering Manhattan, the room is spacious and steps away from the M15/M42 bus that can get you to Grand Central/Times Square in about 5-10 mins. There were no benefits nor upgrades for Gold members which is why I rated it 4 instead of 5 stars. Hotel is clean and extra precautions were taken due to COVID

title: Just okay
text: The room was nice and cozy, Cleaning was normal for it to be a pandemic I thought I would see more cleaning. The offsite parking is very far in the cold. Check in was smooth, when I first got there I notice a bug coming off the elevator, the carpet is very out dated and stained! We got the non smoking however you could smell marijuana as soon as you get off the elevator. The rooms and view is nice however.

title: What happened to this place?
text: I visited this hotel last year AND wow what a difference a year can make. Under the guise of “COVID” the customer service has ceased completely. I stayed in this hotel again thinking that my experience was going to be the same; I could not have been more wrong. The sheer RUDENESS of all the front desk staff was appalling. It’s not “New Yorker” rude because that kind of attitude I very much can vibe with. It was the “I don’t know what you want me to do during Covid” and just SILENCE when I would suggest alternatives. There is COVID everywhere and customer service is STILL a plausible goal attained elsewhere. Shame. Side note: the red fake flowers of death? Really?

title: In/out
text: To start. The customer service is AWESOME! The front desk people were so personable and accommodating. I’m not sure what happened as of recent but I absolutely expected more from a Hilton property. My first room reeked of smoke to the point I had to be transferred. The new room, cleanliness wasn’t a priority. At a time where we are depending on cleanliness to stay healthy. It was a bit concerning. There was hair in random places in the bathroom, the tub didn’t drain properly, old coffee filters (still wet) in the coffee machine, the refrigerator was disgusting and overall just felt passable on the surface. We’ve lost a lot during the pandemic, but a standard can’t be one.

title: Update, yup, listen to the reviews.
text:
I am grateful  for the amazing staff at the Millennium Hilton UN plaza!
I have been a Hilton Honnors gold Member for well over 20 years and am truly blessed, staff Linda and Jason found us beautiful rooms last minute after the original hotel was not helping us with bike parking.  The bikes are extremely expensive and we can’t just leave them on the bike rack in the parking garage. 

Linda and Jason literally SAVED US!!!
We were originally booked at the millennium in Times Square and it was an absolute train wreck, they wouldn’t help us with where to put bikes, they wouldn’t allow them in the hotel at all and wouldn’t advise us on where we could check or store them.  Thankfully LINDA AND JASON made my sons birthday happen.  What an amazing staff!  Not only did they  save our weekend, but Linda took care of ALL THE LOGISTICS for everything.  The Millennium Hilton at UN one UNited Nations Plaza is by far the most helpful and has a remarkably kind and helpful staff we have ever encountered.  Linda truly knows her way around New York and where to eat, Millenium Hilton is Luck to have such a New York savvy/knowledgeable staff!
Thank you Linda, in over 20 years I have never had a staff member so accommodating

title: THE BEST LOCATION
text: y room was clean, recently renovated and looked new. The king size bedroom was tight but I was in an out for business so that was not an issue. Bathroom was nice, glass wall/door shower, all was newly finished. Parking was validated for SP+ parking next door so that knocked off +$50 from my stay and made it worthwhile. I ate at the restaurant next door connected to the hotel lobby so didn\'t have to walk out in the cold, food and atmosphere was decent.

title: Horrible
text: It was my first year wedding anniversary. It seems the hotel staff really takes advantage of covid. I had a rude employee that obviously didn’t want to work. He told me there is no parking garages but when I booked the hotel the guy told me there was. So he made me download an app and search for a garage to put my car. This was so stressful. On top of that I told him it was our anniversary and nothing. No nice gestures or complimentary anything. He hands off my key without telling me where to go. I ended up going on the wrong side mind you I  had heavy luggage. No body can help and there wasn’t even a cart to put your luggage on! Oh yea because of “covid” oh please I stayed in nicer hotels where covid is around but they followed precaution and still had bell boys to help. This hotel should be 20.00 a night. The front desk saw me come back down to the right direction and he just stared and said “wish I can help but you know covid” it’s just horrible service. He just was very dismissive and really ruined our first year anniversary memories where you cherish for a lifetime. We made the best of it but it was still sad. Go elsewhere not here! Oh yea his name was Barry. Please change your attitudes or just don’t work at all!

title: Well worth it
text: Amazing location for this hotel. So close to Grand Central terminal and many subway lines. The views of both Manhattan and Queens are incredible. Service was excellent. Lobby was very clean and beautifully decorated. Rooms were very comfortable

title: Best Deal in Town in the Covid Era
text: This is a really nice hotel in normal times but in the era of covid the hotel's advantages really shine. Yes - the covid protocols are in place and daily cleanings, the gym, lounge, room service and breakfast are a distant memory. But this hotel has big comfortable rooms with plenty of room to spread out and relax, excellent TVs with all the channels, and huge bathrooms with high quality toiletries. You are also a quick walk to restaurants and bars with outdoor seating. Prices are also competitive with the traditional limited service hotels (hilton garden inn, hampton inn, etc).

title: Worst Hilton hotel ever. I would stay somewhere else.
text:
So many things went wrong with my stay and as a gold member of hilton, I was not happy. The front desk lady was rude when I checked in and was dismissive when I asked about upgrades and basically just kept saying nothing was available and I was telling her that I was a gold member and I was hoping to get a better room than just an upgrade to a king size room. She said nothing was available.  I checked in on a Monday during a pandemic and nothing was available for real?  She kept cutting me off without listening to me and just wanted me to get out of her hair.  The gym was closed even though I stayed at a Marriott the night before and their gym was open so it couldn't be a law mandating all hotels to shut down their gyms. No breakfast and no water either for members and she did not care to tell me this.  The check in person did not even tell me about the WiFi situation, just handed me the keys and sent me off. 

I came to the room and so many things were wrong. There were stains on the pillows which I had to ask them to change. Coffee and wine stains all over the walls.  Old furniture in the room and smelly closet and bathroom.  There was a huge hole in the wall above the TV. I had to take out my own trash, change my towels, and the pillow cases myself. The towels were razor thin and not fitting for a 4 star hotel and I was disgusted using them.  They were worse than rags and I didn't know why they would have such poor quality towels. 

Another incident was that a person with the same last name checked in on the second night and they gave that person my room key to my room. Luckily I came back to the hotel at the exact same time this person rode up the elevators with me and then I watched him using the room key that the front desk gave him to open my room.  If I did not come back at the right time, this person would have had access to my belongings in my room, what a scary thought especially during Covid.  This happened on the second night and I was so disturbed by this because how could they check a person into a room that has been checked in already the day before. Aren't there safeguards to prevent that ? Like oh it seems like you already checked in yesterday so how could the front desk person check this stranger to my same room on the second day of my 3-day stay. 
okay fine, mistaken identity but don't you have to check IDs before checking a guest in ? He couldn't have the exact same name.  It was a very jarring experience.  Another frustrating thing was that I called the front desk about this incident then she said that I must contact security, then I talked to security and then security told me that I must talk to the front desk and the manager. So this was their fault and then I had to be on hold and be passed around like a hockey puck waiting for a response on what happened.  The manager did change the keys and explained to me the next day what happened that they accidentally checked another guest into my room but honestly how could that happen and the staff at this hotel seemed like they did not care about their jobs.  

Lastly, I asked for a two pm check out and around 1130 am on the checkout day, someone from housekeeping called me and asked me , "hey when are u checking out?" I said I'm checking out at 2 and they said oh not 1 pm? So that is when you are checking out? I said yes 2 pm , I'm checking out at 2 pm. 

The conversation was unpleasant as if they didn't want me to stay there for long and wanted me to leave earlier than 2 pm but couldn't say that so she was passive agressive on the phone.  Honestly all my years of staying at hotels, I have never had housekeeping calling me to double check on my checkout time when they could just look in the system. This was a terrible experience and I felt like they just dropped the ball on so many levels and then when push comes to shove , they were like sorry, pandemic time so yeah sorry. It is really unacceptable and I would not stay here ever again or other hilton hotels if this is how they treat customers. I had a great experience even during the pandemic for two nights at a Marriott.  They really need to retrain their staff and make sure their rooms are clean.

title: Unprofessional staff, unclean hotel
text:
I stayed at this hotel for one week and would recommend looking at other hotels for this price point. 

1. Staff were rude and unprofessional, often cutting you off halfway through a question to say they couldn’t help you
2. Staff either did not wear masks or wore them below their noses, which is unsafe for guests
3. Carpeting in hallways is disgusting — completely dirty and stained
4. The strong smell of weed permeated multiple floors for much of the stay and nothing was done to remedy this
5. It is not clearly advertised but there is NO free WiFi — you have to pay ~15 USD each day for bad internet. This is not made clear and certainly not in line with other hotels at this price

title: Unacceptable
text:
It is unacceptable to use the COVID-19 pandemia as excuse to cancell the dairy cleaning of the rooms. Even the change of towels was elimitated.
In the other hand, if you choose a city sightseeing room you will not be disapointed.

title: Final Straw with Hilton
text:
I have traveled around the world and stayed in properties ranging from cheap & cheerful to ultra luxurious, but my three worst experiences have been with the Hilton Hotels & Resorts brand. This stay topped it off. I spent Saturday night in a King Corner Room booked through Expedia for a weekend getaway in NYC - I got the wheelchair friendly room as I wanted a corner room and the price was better than a regular King room. Well, you get what you pay for. The actual room did NOT look like the one pictured on Expedia, but that was just the beginning of a nightmarish stay. 

My husband and I checked in around 9 PM and we booked an overnight stay for the sole purpose of catching a good night's sleep before exploring the city some more the next day. We were assigned room 3038 and as soon as we got off the elevator on the 30th floor, I knew it wasn't going to be a restful night as we could hear music blaring down the hallway from one of the rooms. Turns out, that room was right next to ours. The hotel thought it was a good idea to book 3 ladies and us in connecting rooms with very little soundproofing between the rooms. Their loud music was frequently interjected with talking/shrieking/cackling making it impossible to relax, let alone sleep, and I called the front desk three times - the last call was around 12:30 AM. To their credit, security did make two trips to the room next door to reason with the ladies, but we couldn't fall asleep till much later because of all the commotion. So much for getting a good night's sleep. I asked front desk if we could be moved to a different room and they said they were full for the night. I found that a little hard to believe given the size of the hotel, but I guess you should have very low expectations with the Hilton brand unless you're a Honors gold or diamond member.

As for the room itself - an utter disappointment. Furniture and light were old and stained. Hair from previous occupant was next to the soap holder in the shower and the tissue box on the sink. One of the blackout curtains was missing from the windows facing the foot of the bed (if the hotel manager is reading this - check room 3038 and you'll know what I'm talking about). The water container in the coffee maker looked like it hadn't been washed in a while and had a slimy residue at the bottom (unfortunately only discovered that after I had already consumed my morning cup -  ugh!). Carpets were old and stained. And no, there was no button to automatically close the window blinds in my room. Obviously, we were assigned an older room with very little maintenance and upkeep. Other hotels have made obvious efforts to sanitize rooms more thoroughly but this was clearly missing from this hotel.

In short, after disappointing experiences at Hilton hotels in LA and Bali, this stay has me convinced that I'll never book  a Hilton Hotels & Resorts room again.

title: The most wonderful stay in New York
text: Wow! I genuinely feel like this hotel has the best view in town. We stayed here during our first visit to NYC (pre-Covid - im very delayed writing this review!) We booked because of the reliability of Hilton, and for the amazing views. We booked a regular room so just really hoped we had city views - and they far exceeded our expectations. Views of the Empire State all the way down to the One World Trade, as well as the East River. Will never forget the feeling when we walked in and the whole city was lit up! The service was amazing - everyone was very friendly and helpful. The room was impeccably clean and the bed super comfy! Bathroom was fab too. The hotel is very central with easy walking / subway links to all the top spots. When travel restrictions are lifted again (we’re from the UK) we’ll be back and couldn’t stay anywhere else!

title: Horrible hotel
text: Where do I start. This hotel was the worst hotel I’ve ever stayed at. I was in town for my friends engagement. Based off the reviews we’d thought this hotel would be a great choice, but I was wrong! On the website it states that they offer valet parking for $78.00, when we arrived at the hotel there was no valet parking. I had to park my own car a few blocks away and walk back. My mother is disabled and the hotel states that the hotel would be able to accommodate at least with a wheelchair. The hotel gave me such a hard time about getting a wheel chair for a disabled veteran. They told me that the wheel chairs were locked up and could not be used. I had to argue the concierge down about getting a wheelchair. They wouldn’t even allow us to use a cart. How the hell was I supposed to carry a person and the luggage. It was terrible the customer service is completely horrible! I understand that we are dealing with covid and so forth but this hotel just needs to be closed during these times if they are unable to accommodate something as simple as a wheelchair! The hotel room was disgusting the carpets are dirty, disgusting the odor in the room was terrible and made my mother sick. Lastly once I parked the car in the parking garage the garage tried to charge me another $78.00. The parking garage attendant told me to walk back to the hotel in the pouring rain to talk to the concierge, and to have them call the garage in order to get my additional monies back. I have stayed at several Hilton’s hotels in the past but will never stay again.

title: Viaggio a New York
text: Ci siamo recati a new York con amici per il viaggio nella grande mela come da film, le camere sono incantevoli ,finestre con vista sulla strada , da sogno.colazione super ottima , pulizia eccellente personale molto serio, anche se non parlano italiano...

title: Solid choice in midtown
text: I am a Hilton loyalist and this hotel is an example of why. Service and high standards are always on point. Stayed for two nights and other than some loud neighbors, it was a great stay. First room smelled of smoke and we were immediately moved to a new room which was much appreciated. Great views from the room. The contactless digital key and high standard of cleanliness was appreciated, especially during the Covid era. The staff we interacted with were all friendly and kind. It’s location is central, close to public transport and within walking of pretty much everything you need. Would recommend and stay again based on staff friendliness. It makes a difference and this Hilton lives up to it.

title: Family reunion
text: Where to begin? As a diamond member we where automatically upgraded, the view if to fall in love with having the iconic empire state building view, at arrival we got to our suite I am very picky with the room been clean, and even tough I do search for it, everything was done to satisfaction, the bathrooms where clean. We called the lobby for extra blanket and the service attendant brought it up and show us the room control, the lounge was close, but the staff is well trained and always helpfull I big plus for me was security love it, we are heading back to this property to celebrate Christmas this year with family once again. Thank you guys for giving us lots of back to  normality

title: A comfortable & joyful hotel for a stay
text:
Near UN HQ and it's quite convenient to many spots. The lounge is very great to see NY skyline, I like it so much since it is also quiet for breakfast and you can enjoy the peace of NY city.

The staff are good and the room is spacious. 

I would like to visit this hotel again.

title: I know it can be better!
text:
Pros:

-Very spacious room

-Amazing view of the city and Empire State Building (where we were located if you look to the extreme left you can see downtown Manhattan and World Trade Center. 

-Curtains open/close by pushing buttons on the wall. An awesome feature!

-Huge bathroom!

-Toilet with a bidet in it; a remote with all the options on how to get cleaned is on the wall (I had the accessible room so I am not sure if this feature is in all the rooms)

-Toilet seat actually warms you

-Very comfy bed

-Sitting areas with a table so you can properly dine. Very comfy chairs

-Cool staff (just wished we were able to be moved to a different room. See Cons)

-Quiet

Cons:
-The accessible rooms have a tub, which is why I requested one because I have a bad back and hip. I thought the tub was deep when looking at the pictures on the website but found out that the tub sits high up and isn't deep at all, making it limited to shower or take a bath. To make it worse, the tub is VERY slippery. Myself and fiance both slipped the first day, which wasn't cool. I did inform the staff 3 times about changing my room for a regular king bed room. Front desk sent someone with a tub mat (which let me know this is something that is complained about quite frequently) and it was sort of helpful, but didn't help with how awkward the whole thing was. HUGE negative for me. 

-Carpets were very dirty; they were not steamed for a while, which you can tell, and weren't vacuumed. Very gross so my slippers stayed on for most of the stay.

-Also mess on the walls

-Both lights on my side of the room didn't work

-Back to the bathroom; shower curtain was too long for the tub (which added to the awkwardness because it is easy to slip on) and they had mildew on them. 

-Elevators seem old and not too clean

-Remote control wasn't very clean and it needs to be replaced; have to press extra hard on them to change channels or input information

-Surfaces weren't cleaned well 

-Didn't know how to turn on the second shower head

-Gyms were not opened

-Smelled faintly of cigarette smoke the first day (window opened a little so we were able to air out the room over 2 days)

I will visit again because it is a really nice and roomy. I just won't pick an accessible one ever again. Bring your own paper towel and multi-purpose cleaner just in case.

title: Hotel mit unbezahlbarem Ausblick
text: Wenn wir nochmal nach NewYork fliegen, dann wieder in dieses Hotel. Es ist super modern und gemütlich eingerichtet, super Bett und vorallem DIESER Blick!! Wir konnten über ganz NY gucken bis hin zum OneWorld Trade Center.  Das Empire State und das Crysler Building war direkt vor uns. Fußläufig alles super erreichbar, ca. 15 min zu Fuß zum Times Square. Wir hatten ein Eck Zimmer im 30 Stock (kann auch etwas höher gewesen sein ist schon paar Monate her Sorry) . Nur zu empfehlen dieses Hotel!!! Und um die Ecke gibt es ein lecker Diner mit super Frühstück.

title: Avoid it
text: I really do not like giving bad reviews and I chose this property because of its progressive approach to supporting Covid 19 health workers. However. The front desk personnel was less than useless. Particularly the gentleman working the desk during the day on Saturday 25 July. First, after being kept up ALL night by the neighbors and their music which was still going at dawn (no attempt by hotel management to address it, space people out better on a floor, etc), I asked for a checkout at 2 pm instead of 11 am. The clerk gives me 12 noon. Okay fine. When I ask to leave my bag in the baggage room off the front desk because I still have two hours to wait for my transport there is simply a curt: we have no place to store the bag. Nothing more, no offer of help, no suggestion for how to handle the situation such as ‘you could leave it at your own risk’ etc. The whole attitude was just ‘couldn’t care less’ ‘please leave as soon as possible’ and ‘I am not customer service.’ This hotel used to be good but has apparently fallen on hard times. The staff makes or breaks such an operation and this one is truly broken.

title: Perfect city views
text: My husband and I travelled here for a 5 night trip, check in was easy, we were blown away by the view from the room on the 29th floor. The view alone warranted a 5 star review, but the facilities in the room didn't disappoint either. The room was HUGE by New York standards, large comfortable bed, walk in closest, large bathroom (first time I have ever encountered an electric toilet which had automatic seat lift and a heated seat), decent shower, small fridge in the room. We ordered room service one evening which was delicious. There was a small coffee maker in the room, and also a coffee shop in the lobby. The lobby is very bright and sparkly. The hotel has a sniffer dog outside with a handler (unfortunately I don't remember his name) who were extremely friendly, upon returning to the hotel each evening he asked about our day and gave us some great tips on where to eat, attractions etc. The hotel is conveniently located right next to the UN headquarters a few blocks from Grand Central Terminal. Many attractions are within walking distance, including Empire State Building, Rockerfeller Centre, and Times Square all within 30 minutes stroll. Plenty of bars and restaurants in the vicinity too. I have rebooked this hotel for a trip with my daughter in December (providing covid19 restrictions have been lifted). The one negative point I have is that the WiFi is expensive at $15 per day but it's only a small niggle. Overall one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in.

title: Do not stay here during COVID19-not worth your money
text:
I stayed at the corner room with king size bed in the past (twice). This time around, I got a room half the size. When I called the reception, I was told only certain floors are available. They don't open the floors where nurses stay at during COVID19.
It makes no sense to me that I paid a few hundred bucks to stay at smaller room with no other options. I am grateful that the city is offering free hotels for healthcare professionals especially since I am a healthcare provider myself in NYC, but I regret choosing to pay to stay at this hotel. Do not book for another month or two (FYI, my room is bigger than the hotel room).

title: Great view and location
text: Lovely hotel in midtown NYC, nicely fitted out room with a beautiful view of the Hudson river and NYC. I received perfect hospitality during my stay here. The price was fair not too expensive given the great location. I would definately recommed staying here if you're on a business trip or a couple.

title: Christmas trip
text:
The hotel is in an excellent location for walking to most attractions in a quieter part of town by the UN building well equipped gym and even an indoor tennis court.
This is our 2nd stay.
The breakfast has an excellent choice of hot and cold selection cooked fresh from the grill this isn’t worth having and sets you up for the day.

title: Perfect Hospitality
text:
Stay there for 7 Nights for vacation & Birthday at NYC. Although the challenging time due to the corona virus situation the team do all he can for give us a good stay!
We must mention Patrick Goad for his affords to give us a memorable stay!   Actually this was my third visit this year and each time I enjoyed my stay but this time was a real  "stay to remember" Patrick do all he can for us and all the others, in front desk and restaurant during breakfast give us a perfect feeling - we absolutely will be back!! also we should mention very good hot breakfast large rooms and nice Jim.

title: Tolles Hotel mit fantastischer Aussicht und guten Service
text:
Service und Hotelpersonal haben unsere Erwartungen mehr als übertroffen.
Das Zimmer bot einen Atemberaubenden Ausblick und verfügte über eine
moderne und saubere Einrichtung. Hier stimmte das gesamte Paket.
Aus diesem Grund haben wir sofort wieder gebucht und freuen uns schon sehr
auf ein Wiedersehen im April 2020.

Die modern eingerichteten Zimmer waren zu unserer vollsten Zufriedenheit.
Morgens konnten wir aus dem Bett heraus den Sonnenaufgang über Brooklyn und Queens miterlebten. Einfach Traumhaft.

Ein Begrüßungs-Snack in Form von etwas Obst erwartete uns bei Ankunft auf unserem Zimmer.
Sehr nette Geste, die man nicht in jedem Hotel bekommt.
Der Service war Großartig und das Personal bekommt von uns ein dickes Lob.

Die meisten und bekanntesten Sehenswürdigkeiten von New York, kann man
zu Fuß erreichen.

title: Terrific experience at the Millennum Hilton
text:
Terrific experience at the Millennum Hilton
The location is so convenient, the staff are terrific and UNIONIZed so I could feel good about being there (knowing the staff were paid reasonably well). and the service was great.

title: Wonderful and attentive staff
text:
Location close to work. Staff were very attentive and made the stay awesome.  Executive lounge had a nice view of the city and staff in there takes good care of visitors. Rooms were clean, and large for NYC. 
Front desk staff and bell staff were pleasant and helpful.  

Restaurant Ambassador Grill was good food and good value.  Staff were great.

title: Good locaton and fabulous view
text: This was our first time in NY. We were given a room on the 33rd floor with a view you would never forget. The room cleaners were friendly and helpful as were the conceirge. The security with the dog are friendly and the dog is adorable. Some people may not like being checked before entering but this wasnt a problem for us as it made us feel more safe. This is less than 10 mins walk to Times Square/grand central so good location without all the noise! We would stay here again.

title: Weekend in NYC
text:
Hotel is situated just a 5-10 minute walk from Grand Central station so good location. After a day walking round NY however still seems quite a way!! The rooms are nice and well equipped with great views over the river however the actual beds are tiny! We had a room for 3 people which was meant to have 2 king size beds in but in reality they weren't even standard doubles!  We did ask to change rooms but no luck there and they were a little rude at the time as well! The porter staff however were helpful and friendly at all times. Do not have a drink in the bar unless you have won the lottery!! 1 gin and tonic was 20 dollars!!! 
We didn't have breakfast at hotel but there were some great cafes just at top of street, also a good supermarket a couple of blocks away that sold everything you could need.

title: Ok business hotel
text:
Stayed here several times. Dated executive lounge but with extremely friendly and serviceminded staff. Functional and clean hotel rooms. Front desk staff overall on the verge of being rude or not serviceminded. 

When visiting in February the executive lounge was shut down after 2pm daily due to "repairs" but no signs of that when visiting it. Also no prior info that it would have limited business hours. This hotel needs to work on its business behaviour.

title: Central location.  Convenient!
text: The station is right in front of hotel.  So convenient to get subway to anywhere.  Bathroom is old and need rennovation or maintain better.  Got a junior suite with pull-out sofa but sofa has broken spring. Carpet is old and smell.

title: Great Hotel but verify
text: It was a great stay. The hotel is in a great location and good staff overall. If you are a diamond member you are treat great. The only issue I had was the late checkout I did a triple check but still it was an issue. Always verify with the staff and make sure the notes are in the system. It was a headache especially on the last day. This would have been a 5 star rating otherwise. But I would recommend and will come back if in the NYC area.

title: Hilton UN Plaza
text: Next door to the United Nations is a wonderful Hilton Hotel waiting to treat you with Diplomat level service. My room had a great view of the East River and I could walk next door to the United Nations. The room was spacious and beautifully decorated with a lounge sofa and King Sized bed. The front desk and bell service was top notch and I just loved being in my room after a hard days work. Superb!

title: Overall very good with one big negative...
text:
First the good; hotel is well located, great views (we had a city facing room in the West tower), very limited street noise, beds are comfortable and the rooms are a very decent size for NYC.  Renovated bathrooms stocked with tons of towels and toiletries. Staff we encountered were all very helpful and friendly, especially the sniffer dog. Club floor breakfast is quite good for a 4 star Hilton; pastries, yogurts, cold boiled eggs, toast and bagels with peanut butter and cream cheese, jams, juices and cereals, hot tea and coffee that your could take to go. Really nice fruit! Strawberries, pineapple, blueberries, melon.

Now the bad; the walls are paper thin! We could verbatim hear our neighbours conversations, tv and snoring through the walls.

Would stay hear again in a heartbeat but for that one rather significant negative. Even the blackout curtain sheets were good, if only they had better insulation!

title: 200美金预授权不退还
text: 糟糕透了！！！于19年年底入住三天，booking定过来的，入住的时候要我交了预授权200美金，按理说这个本应该退房时立即退款，但这都两个月了还是没有退还到我的卡上。我在香格里拉也工作过也知道前台流程，挺震惊这里的工作效率这么低。我期间也打电话发邮件去过，只回复了一封邮件，如图，如果在别的酒店fom应该会立即给我发邮件道歉吧，这还fom助理还隔了段时间发的（我就在加拿大也不存在时差问题，他们服务态度就是有问题！）接着就是回复的邮件，只要看过客人profile就知道我是女生，邮件居然是Mr？？？逗我？？

title: Amazing hotel with great staff
text: What a fabulous hotel. I booked this hotel for my Wife's 50th & Daughters 18th Birthday treat. I emailed the hotel and asked if they could get a nice room with a view and what a response. Patrick the Reservations Manager picked out his favourite room with a view and he nailed it. Amazing views of the Manhattan skyline and even better at night. The hotel was immaculate and all the staff extra friendly. Hotel is central to all the main attractions and most within walking distance. i would definitely recommend this hotel.

title: Unas magníficas vistas desde una magnífica habitación
text:
Hemos estado pasando nochevieja 2019-20. Hotel bien comunicado. A 7/10 minutos de Gran Central St. andando y 15/20 minutos de Times Sq. Al lado de UN. 
Ubicados en una planta 37, los ascensores funcionan perfectamente.
La habitación muy amplia, con dos camas grandes, pero no es adecuada para 3 personas. Tuvimos que solicitar una cama supletoria para poder dormir los 3 de manera adecuada.
Totalmente exterior y esquinada, las vistas son increíbles. La limpieza muy correcta y el personal muy amable. La cafetera y cápsulas en la habitación junto a la nevera nos permitieron no salir en ayunas y tener algo para comer. El baño completo, con bañera con las cortinas en curva, lo que da más amplitud. Secador y espejo con luz, otro acierto! Habitación dotada con caja fuerte, soporte para las maletas y tabla de planchar. 
Lo único mejorable es que la parte de armario no estaba cerrada y resultó incómodo. Por los demás, altamente recomendable!!

title: Worst experience at a Hotel to date! Would give a 0 if possible!
text:
I dont usually do reviews on sites such as Tripadvisor unlessi am either massively impressed by something or really disappointed- in this case im afraid it was the latter.

Due to no fault of the hotel we had a massive delay in JFK airport (i think it was Presidents day when we arrived so very slow!) but when we got out we were so tired and really looking forward to getting to the hotel, having a nice shower and hitting the road to see what NY had to offer.

On arrival at the hotel, things didnt seem to bad. There was no porter, which you would expect at a large hotel but there was a nice security guard who welcomed us with his dog. No front of house staff, so myself and our wife has no interaction with anyone other then the security guard. I wish this continued.....

We went to reception to check in like 2 excited kids (first time in NY) and greeted the reception staff how we would have been expected to be greeted- the response was a lift of a head (from her phone) and a short, not warm- “checking in”. We let that pass, however not a good impression.

Me and my wife are celebrating our 5th wedding anniversary- so as you cheekily do, requested a new view, maybe an upgrade if possible- the response was “your room is allocated, and i can do anything about this”- which completely contradicts the other reviews from guests who have? Anyway, again let this slide.

We went down a dark dingy corridor behind reception and got in our lift to our room. We got to our room and it wasnt too bad, the view not great but nice and it seemed cleaned. How wrong were we? Pubic hair in the sink, really dirty cups in the room, no water (would have been a nice touch)- i could continue but i hope you all get my drift! At this point we thought dont worry, have a shower and crack on- the pressure in the shower is basically non existent- quiet possibly the worst shower we have ever used!!! 

Determined to not let this get in the way off us enjoying the rest off our holiday, we got ready and went to reception to see if they had any tips on the whats around, how to get around town etc. We avoided the extremely rude receptionist we spoke to initially (who was still on her phone) and went to speak the other one. Her response “Google it”- i mean for god sakes! Just appalling service.

We are not 2 nights into a 4 night stay and honestly the staff have been nothing but rude, unfriendly and unhelpful. Note to management- if you want to represent your brand in the right way, employ individuals that have the same care for customers and experience as you advertise. The guys you have working here honestly dont!!

Never will i return to this hotel and as someone who regularly uses the Hilton group i will be avoiding you going forwards.

We are still staying in the hotel for another couple of nights so if anything does happen to change my opinion i will happily consider updating this review but as it stands- STAY AWAY! Actually considering checking in somewhere else if this gets worse and will be complaining to British Airways also (we booked a package deal through them!)- sometimes money just is not everything!

Positive: bed is comfy but hotel needs an update in general!

Awful awful experience from a very unhappy customers!

title: Great Pricee & Service
text:
Doormen were friendly, front desk check in and check out was friendly great experience. Room is dated (looks like reno's happening though) but comfortable. 

Executive Lounge wasn't open during my stay but had great breakfast and drinks at the Ambassador Grill.

title: Annual date night
text: My boyfriend surprised me with a hotel night stay at this hotel.... was able to book a room in 2019, upgraded with our Hilton Rewards. The corner rooms are absolutely gorgeous with the complimentary robes. Came back for 2020 Valentine's day. This time stayed in the regular king room. Still absolutely gorgeous views and stunning accommodations. The room was very clean except for one critique,  the air vents had some slight dust. There is no room service until after lunch time but there are so many many restaurants and bars within one block walking distance.

title: Great for the price!
text:
20 min walk to Times Square, gorgeous view of the river, clean room!

Currently being renovated,  so some minor stuff, but overall, it's a gorgeous hotel!

The coffee shop in the lobby comes in handy in a pinch, and the restaurant is decent, as well!

title: Save your pennies and stay in a suite up on the 55th floor.
text: Amazing experience!  Love the views and I actually slept great in that Governor's Suite.  More than enough space and the suite was quiet.  October in New York is perfect and the weekend I was there offered the perfect Fall weather.  Views from this place are amazing!

title: Great views, good location
text:
The Millenium Hilton at One UN Plaza is top tier. Staff was great and exhibited excellent  hospitality throughout our weekend stay. 

Room service was fast and decent. Breakfast at the Ambassador restaurant was great. If you have business at the UN, this location can’t be beat. 

If you’re in New York for fun, you’d only be three blocks from Grand Central station and the chance to hook up with the tour buses. Northwest Corner rooms on high floors have commanding views of both midtown and the east river. 

So far, my favorite location in NYC.

title: New York 50th
text: What an amazing hotel from arriving to leaving the staff were so attentive and friendly. There is a  fantastic coffee shop on the premises with lovely fresh pastries and cakes. The room we had on the 40th floor was jaw dropping gorgeous with stunning views.

title: Outdated
text: The service is good. The hotel itself seems outdated and definitely feels like needs a renovation. It’s in a good location if you don’t wanna be in the middle of the city. But it definitely needs some attention when it comes to upgrading the building. Feels old and crusty.

title: 5 Star Experience!
text: Brandon and his Manager Patrick were absolutely amazing and so generous! They both went above and beyond without hesitation and both have the most welcoming personalities. Writing reviews aren’t really my thing but they both definitely deserve the recognition! Thank you gentlemen so much for a smooth experience with the most amazing views!

title: AMAZING
text: Brandon & Patrick were nothing less then amazing !! Their customer service was impeccable and they are very welcoming, personable and informative. The cleanliness of the hotel is Outstanding as well!!

title: Great location and an even more great Reservation Manager
text: We had booked a room for 5 nights in October 2019. Because this was a special trip that I was goona to propose to my girlfriend, I asked for a room upgrade. My expectations were very low, as this is a rather expensive hotel and thought that they would not pay attention. But I was SO wrong!!! Patrick, the reservations manager replied to me the same day that he upgraded our room to a suit! In addition, a very nice of red wine was waiting for us. That made our stay so beautiful and we felt like royals :D The only negative I can say, is the breakfast which was nothing special and very expensive. But all in all, we will definitely visit Millenium Hilton again! They won our hearts.

title: convenient location with unbelievable bad service
text:
we stayed here 4 nights in February 2020 in a king size room. I have a gold status and stay regularly at Hilton/Conrad/Waldorf, etc.  though, the service that I experiences is by far the worst that I have seen in the last couple of years. they simply dont care about your well being. 
nobody helps you with luggage when you arrive. then they check you in the wrong room,  then you have to go back down and up in another one - obviously carrying your luggage. 
the 2nd day you find your room, not cleaned/tidied up and the only explanation you get from the manager is: we dont know why - the housekeeping said they had done it. then they want to make up for it with a free coffee downstairs and the next colleague attacks you that you cannot have the cappuccino but only the filter coffee, and the Cheese cake is a desert and not pastry so you have to pay extra - this 'make up' experience converts into another service frustration. on the day of our check-out (depite gold status late check out) - the house keeping lady knocks three times on our door to 'check' what time we d leave. at 10, 10.45 and 12h. (even though her colleagues granted us 13h check out).  
Another issue was the noise the hotel personal would do in the morning between 7-9AM when joking and running in the hallway. 
on the check out, they simply show you a copy of the bill that has been depited to your credit card without checking. It obviously charged us a breakfast that was initially complementary. and last but not least, the executive lounge is only open in the morning with a miserable breakfast buffet and broken instant coffee machine. the regular buffet in the restaurant is decent but the blue berries were moisy and I found some hairs in my omlette..... all these things are just not acceptable for a hilton in that category. 
To leave on a positive note, if you come to work for the UN/meet someone around the UN building, the location is perfect. Though, I ll certainly will stay at a different hotel during my next visit.

title: City break.
text: A great place to stay for a visit to new York. Located in a peaceful and tranquil setting opposite the world trade centre and memorial gardens. Easy access to all attractions and places. Jump on the subway right out side the door central park about 15 minute ride. Walk to wall street and the financial centre of New York. Plenty to see and do.

title: Fantastica location nella città che non dorme mai
text:
Albergo molto bello anche se un po' datato e con la necessità di qualche intervento di ristrutturazione.
È davanti le nazioni unite ed a tre blocchi dalla grand central, dall albergo è facile raggiungere tutte le attrazioni della città pur restando in una zona tranquilla e sicura.
La lounge offre bevande e snack tutto il giorno e la sera qualche cosa da mangiare.
Le camere sono ampie e pulite, la vista sulla città e sul fiume è magica e la colazione è pazzesca.
Ci sono stato 4 volte e credo che ci tornerò presto

title: Great city views
text: Fantastic views of the city; Like I’m saying one of the best views of a hotel I’ve ever had. Skyline breakfast was fantastic. Staff are extremely friendly from start to finish; gorgeous property! Loved my visit.

title: Comfortable
text:
Three night stay.

Warm welcome and thanks for being a diamond member. Upgraded room on 37th floor.

Explained about the exec lounge lounge only open to 2pm and handed $25 per day vouchers to use in the restaurant.

Room was spotless and great views of Empire State and Chrysler Building.

WiFi worked really well.

Used the gym daily which is in the other tower and on 27th floor. Had all I needed and is spread across two sections on the floor with views of the UN and River.

The exec lounge had a continental offering but the restaurant had all the usual fare. Was warmly greeted daily when there.

Chef made omelette as requested and Nabil served fresh juice and coffee and made sure the glass was topped up.

Thanks a lot to Ticia at reception who helped me print off my ticket to the Knicks game when having issues. She was brilliant every time I saw her on duty.

Walking distance you can find supermarkets, pizza outlets and more with about a 15 min walk to 5th Avenue and little less to Grand Central. Had a meeting at UN and it’s literally to the left and across the road.

Only reason why 5 star rating was the exec lounge although Mohammad and other staff were welcoming was the timings and when I arrived from the airport the colleague saw me coming into the revolving door - he walked through it and left it spinning - and wandered off. 

All in all a very good stay and some really good staff around and accommodation.

title: Peace and quiet
text: The hotel was quiet and peaceful. Slept really well. Only complaint was that the vanity set was not replaced and the water was cold in the shower on 2 out of 3 days. Also the bed side clock  was not working. However I would try it again

title: An Amazing Hotel
text:
This hotel mixes the best of everything NY has to offer. It is just a few blocks away from Grand Central and is tucked away in midtown. It is a very quiet location, but you are close to everything. The rooms are a good size and the views are amazing!

What really makes this hotel special, is the staff. If Frank or Robert are on duty as the bellmen or Diana, Dorca, Silvia, Avery are at the desk, you are in good hands. Also, make sure you visit the lobby cafe and have Jesus make you the best Latte you have ever experienced. This team makes sure you have a concierge experience no matter what room or how often you visit. I travel to NY for business frequently and will talk to Patrick, who oversees reservations, if there is not a room available. I was never a fan of the Hilton chain until I went to this hotel! Now I choose it over Westin, Marriott or any other hotel in NY when I visit, which is frequently!

title: Vue +++
text:
Chambre au 40 ème étage, vue panoramique sur la skyline de New-York. Magnifique !
Chambre très propre, literie impeccable.

Le restaurant de l'hôtel est plutôt bon malgré la salade césar sans poulet... 

Le personnel est sympathique SURTOUT les bagagistes !!

title: Great City and River Views
text:
I visited this hotel in January 2020 and in March 2019. My overall impression is that the hotel is very nice, however, they are very bad at communicating.

On my last visit, I was given a different room to the one I had paid for. Originally I booked the 2 Story Loft Suite with King bed. I emailed the Diamond desk to request that I was allocated the exact room booked as it was a surprise for my partner. They forwarded my request to the hotel directly. After a few weeks with no reply, I then emailed the hotel directly to see if they can could confirm my request, again no reply.

I hoped that if they didn't reply they would at least have actioned my request. Upon arriving at the hotel check-in desk very little was said and I assumed that I would be allocated the correct room, I couldn't ask if this was going to be the case as it would have ruined my partners surprise. Unfortunately, when getting to the room it wasn't as expected. There were two bedrooms and only one floor, the original room was supposed to be 1000 sq ft but the allocated room was 100 sq ft smaller with additional wasted space in the form of the second bedroom.

After returning home I complained that the room wasn't what it should have been and I got the reply 'the hotel has contacted you directly'. They hadn't, I even included in my complaint that the hotel has never contacted me. Customer services went quiet once more, even after chasing multiple times.

Finally, I raised the issue on Twitter where customer services were very quick to assist and informed me that the 'hotel is having renovations at the moment' and this is why I was not allocated the correct room. It would have been nice to inform me of this before we arrived or even at the front desk.

From experience Hilton Hotels that are having renovations clearly state this on the hotel website, so I am unsure if this was true or if I have been fobbed off. I was given 30k points, but this really doesn't cover the fact that I wasn't allocated the room I booked and the Executive lounge was closed the entire stay after breakfast, supposedly for the same reason of being renovated. Though there were no signs of any work being done.

I would consider another Hilton on my next return to New York.

title: Wonderful stay at the Millennium Hilton UN Plaza
text: The staff at this hotel make it great, in addition to the location. Rooms are well equipped, nicely furnished and comfortable. Views are beautiful over the East River. Being able to open the window, even a crack, was a treat for a welcome bit of fresh air.

title: Great Hotel with amazing views in an excellent location!
text:
We had the most memorable and amazing holiday made all the more special by the fabulous room/suite we had on the 31st floor which Patrick specifically chose for us.  

The room was wonderful and the views of the city and river were amazing.  The room had everything we needed and was perfect place for us to relax and unwind after a busy day sightseeing.  The location is perfect for exploring New York, so close to Grand Central Station and a Hop on Hop off Bus Stop outside hotel.

Patrick arranged a bottle of wine and cakes on our arrival to celebrate our 25th Wedding Anniversary and my 50th Birthday.  The room was spotless and cleaned daily and the staff were very friendly and helpful.  We would recommend this hotel to others looking to visit.

title: Do not stay here!!
text:
I’m a Hilton Diamond. I will never stay here again!  Awful!  

Upon arrival, employee in my room. Scared me to death!

No coffee or condiments and both coffee cups dirty. One cup had a tea bag in it. 

WiFi didn’t work. 

Executive Loung is a joke. 

Hotel loung is a black HOLE!

Don’t stay here.

title: Great Stay- Great View - Great people
text:
This is the 5th time I have stayed at the Millennium this past year. The staff goes out of their way to be helpful regardless of the position. The front desk are very accommodating, Igor in the executive lounge is friendly and helpful and Patrick is always available to assist (even on vacation). I always request a high room with a view as the view across the river to Brooklyn and Roosevelt Island are spectacular.
It is my go to hotel in Manhattan, it should be yours as well.
MHH

title: Gute ruhige Lage, aber nicht mehr Stand der Zeit
text: Hotel ist gut gelegen, direkt gegenüber der United Nations. Lobby und Eingang recht unübersichtlich. Service beim Check-In sehr freundlich. Hotelzimmer (West Tower 38 Stock) war vor kurzem renoviert worden, aber heutzutage könnte man schon eine Zimmertür erwarten, wo man nicht alles vom Flur aus hört. Executive Lounge im 30 für das Frühstück aufgrund des Ausblickes gut, aber so dunkel & am Ende des Lebenszyklus. Fitnesscenter für die Größe des Hotels auch sehr übersichtlich, aber mit gutem Blick auf die UN & Hudson River.

title: Mixed experiences in comparison to other Hilton hotels
Excellent.
text: Hotel is just in the right location. Just walking distance to the office. Room is very clean and spacious. Hotel staff are very attentive, friendly and helpful. Breakfast is very sumptuous and the staff at the ambassador grill gave excellent service.

title: Fabulous Time
text: Stayed at the Millennium Hilton over the weekend.  Had an amazing experience.  Hotel was very attractive and inviting.  Rooms were beautiful and the staff were very helpful.  Planning my next visit at this location.

title: Consistently good
text: I have stayed at the Millennium every month for the last six months. The location is perfect for me. The rooms are comfortable and many have great views of the East River and Brooklyn waterfront. The concierge staff is always friendly and helpful. The experience has been consistently good and I will continue to stay at the Millenium for work or leisure travel.

title: Zeker een aanrader
text: Mooi hotel met vriendelijk en behulpzaam personeel. Uitstekende clean up service en goede ligging: kwartier van Central Park en 10 minuten van kortste metro station. Nadeel, betalen voor wifi op de kamer.

title: Friday night date
text:
I enjoyed the stay. Staff is super friendly. Request a high floor room w. City views if available. Only reason it’s not 5 stars is I felt the room could’ve been cleaner. It was NOT dirty but didn’t have a clean feel. Bed was comfy pillows felt like gel
Memory foam. The bathroom was nice did have to wait for hot water to shower around 11pm. I would stay again.

title: Excellent Hotel with Great Views
text:
Myself and my family stayed in the Millennium Hilton at One UN Plaza in December in the run up to Christmas. We hadn't stayed in the hotel previously however we enjoyed it so much we've already booked to stay again.
From the staff to the rooms to the spectacular views the hotel is excellent and has a really good location, which although at first may seem out of the way, is actually really accessible. 
I would definitely recommend the hotel to anyone looking for somewhere to stay and we are all looking forward to returning in December.

title: Muy buen hotel
text:
Muy buen hotel. Limpio, cómodo y  tranquilo.  Camas muy cómodas para descansar después de patear la ciudad.  A 10 minutos de la Grandú Central que es la parada de metro más cercana. Impresionantes vistas. A nosotros nos tocó una habitación que veíamos desde la cama el Empire y del otro lado el letrero de Pepsi en Long Island. Si hay que poner un pero diría que las camas son cómodas como he dicho pero no amplias. Reservamos 2 camas dobles para 3 personas y no son las típicas camas grandes americanas. Más bien escasas para 2 personas. Cafetera con cápsulas y nevera gratuita en la habitación.
Volvería a alojarme sin duda.

title: Dreamy
text:
Our stay at Millennium hilton was superlative.
We booked a corner room, n. 3140, 31 floor, we hoped to have a higher one but as we entered the room and we saw the view we were definetly shocked by that beauty. Go! Book it!
Moreover, since we forgot some medicines in the fridge, We contacted the reception, and Liz called a taxi for bringing the medicines to the airport. 
A special thanks to Liz! 
Also, the rooms were perfectly clean, this is too important for us.
Great service, confortable bed, strategic position, warm lights in the room, TV with Netflix, large room, can we add anythingelse? 
If you want to experience a great luxury vacation in NYC, this is the right place.

title: Great Location, Not so Great Hotel
text:
I first want to say this hotel is located in an amazing location. Blocks away from Grand Central and the Empire State Building. Amazing views of the City and River. The hotel room was clean and looked nice. However the overall hotel experience was lacking...
Upon check in they way over authorized and charged my card. When my friend and I got up to the front desk, we told them we wanted to equally split Room and Tax (RT) between us and they ended up authorizing my card for the full amount of RT and also charging me for my half of RT as well. So almost all my funds I've saved up for my vacation got tied up into the hotel. When I looked at my bank account and noticed this, I had to speak with multiple people just to get this problem resolved. I didn't get my authorization back until days later. Causing the first few days of my vacation very stressful..  I also had an issue with the TV in my room. When we turned it on the screen would be bright and normal then almost immediately start to dim and turn so dark it was hard to see what was happening on screen. I had to call for an engineer multiple times to get this problem resolved. They canceled my consecutive reservation and when I got the email and when I went to speak with them about this, they blamed me for the canceled reservation and  I had to book my room again at a higher rate than what I originally had for my consecutive stay... they also tried to charge me $89 for breakfast even though I'm a gold member. That did get resolved quickly though, which I'm grateful for. 

Overall the hotel is beautiful and in a great location, but the experience was greatly lacking. I don't think I would be staying at this place again.

title: wonderful stay in NYC!
text: I stayed Jan 3 - 6, and had a great experience. The hotel was a 20 - 30 minute walk from the Times Square/Central Park/Broadway things we wanted to do, and there were a couple of great inexpensive restaurants (Slice, John's, and a bodega that I didn't get the name of) and a pharmacy less than a 5 minute walk away. I arrived from Newark and took the Newark Airport Express, which was very easy, and a ~10 minute walk between the Grand Central stop and the hotel. The room had a fantastic view, was very quiet and comfortable, and I thought the price was quite reasonable. I would certainly stay here again.

title: Adequate, but a little disappointing.
text: The hotel, was clean, safe and quiet for my family of 6 staying at this property. The staff was very kind and accommodating.   Breakfast was hot and service was excellent. The executive  lounge was just ok.  The food was minimal and when items ran out well before the end of the reception, they were not replenished (bread, cheese, fruit, egg rolls, etc). I probably wouldn't stay here again, just because the location was a hike to public transit and the "perks" of the hotel (free breakfast and executive lounge access) were not worth the sacrifice in location.

title: Piss poor staff
text:
Our stay began with a less than stellar experience with the bell staff. A younger man started by taking our claim ticket (we had dropped off bags earlier), and then looking rather irritated, began looking for the bags. Once he found them he asked, as if hoping the answer would be "no,"  "do you need help taking your bags up?" When we replied that we did, he asked the older gentleman behind the desk who was engrossed with something on his phone, "is it your turn or mine?" Discovering it was his turn he again looked none to pleased and said he would meet us at our room. We had booked what we thought would be a nice suite that turned out to have two floors. When the bellman arrived we asked him to bring the bags to the entry on the second floor, 29M. He then got lost apparently going to the 30th floor and knocking there for a while before calling our room and sorting out there was a sub-floor.

The room itself was in questionable repair for a "suite." Cracked paint everywhere, the showerhead in the main floor bathroom was only partially functioning, a very loud fan in the main floor bathroom never shutoff, reader lamps on the master bed were burned out, the TVs were laughably small, and the master bedroom TV seemed to be stuck noticeably dimmer than the living room TV.

On departure, we once again had the "pleasure" of engaging with the bell staff. The morning bellman asked me to help him roll the bags into the small storage room. Once we were alone he started by bad-mouthing his colleague, insinuating he was an idiot for not having a pen. Then, to make sure our interaction was sufficiently awkward, he informed me that, "we don't charge for storing bags but we do appreciate tips." I let him know I didn't have any cash on me and would try to bring some back later when I picked up the bags. To which he replied, rather disappointedly, that he might not be around later to receive the tip.

The bellman on duty when we departed, a tall, grey-haired gentleman, was probably the only good interaction we had. He was cheerful and seemed happy to help. He let us know the yellow cabs would probably be a little cheaper than Uber for our trip to JFK and secured us one large enough to fit our 4 bags.

Overall the majority of staff interactions were terrible. Most seemed less than excited to be at their jobs and not afraid to let you know that you were inconveniencing them. The value of the "suite" was sub-par and we would have liked to have seen what was supposed to be a hig

title: Fantastic !!
text: This is a great hotel. We had an easy check in and out,  the rooms were lovely, clean and had an excellent view. The staff were helpful and friendly and the hotel was in a good location. Would definatley return and recommend.

title: Superior Customer Service
text: We have always booked with Hilton Hotels.  However, our stay at Millennium Hilton NY - One UN Plaza was exceptional. Patrick Goad went above and beyond to ensure our visit was memorable. He and his team provided the best customer service. Our family was extremely happy and comfortable during our Christmas 2019 vacation. Thanks again Patrick, Cristina and Justin from Orlanfo

title: Wonderful Hotel
text: Staff were always very friendly, welcoming, and helpful. Stayed in a king room with corner view on top floor and the views both day & night  were incredible!
