We were able to drop off luggage until check-in time so we could start exploring the city as well as leave our luggage after checkout since we scheduled our flight later at night.  Close to subway. Would stay here again.

title: Toller Aufenthalt in wirklich guter Lage
text:
Das Millennium Hilton liegt direkt am UN Gebäude und daher in einem eher ruhigeren Gebiet. Dennoch sind die Grand Central nur 7 Minuten entfernt und auch bis zum Bryant Park sind es nur 15 Minuten zu Fuß. Wir hatten ein Upgrade in eine 1-bedroom Suite mit herrlichem Blick über den East-River erhalten. Zudem konnten wir zum Frühstück und abendlichen Snacks in die Executice Lounge. Das Hotel ist gut gesichert, die Angestellten sind überwiegend sehr nett und gehen mit kleineren Problemen sehr gut um. Das kontinentale Frühstück in der Lounge war besser als erwartet, die abendlichen Snacks nett. Kostenlos gab es Wasser und Sprite/Cola, gegen Gebühr auch Wein und Bier.
Das King-size Bett war sehr bequem, das Bad mit einer Regendusche und zwei Toiletten ausgestattet.

title: Eccellente
text: L’hotel è situato al centro di Manhattan,la metropolitana è raggiungibile in 5 minuti a piedi.la struttura eccellente con tutto il personale anche la colazione di qualità superiore. Giudizio ECCELLENTE

title: Absolutely Fantastic Hotel!!
text:
I am writing a review from the UK - This is my third visit to NYC. Stay 1 - Hilton Times Square, Stay 2 - Hilton London NYC, Stay 3 - Millennium Hilton UN Plaza.

Without contest, The Millennium wins hands down.

First of all, thank you for responding to all my emails, and facebook messages prior to our visit, promptly and efficiently.

We booked a corner king room, a friend of mine who works for Hilton kindly asked the hotel if they could do anything for me (i am a member of HH), they made sure we had the best view possible on floor 40, and access to the lounge. This was already prior arranged and assigned and i could not wait to get there!

The check in process was easy, quick, friendly, hassle free basically. The room they assigned me was given to me, as well as instructions for the lounge access. 

Entering the room had a wow factor. My previous view from the stay at the Hilton Times Square took some beating!! But this beat it!! My corner room was clean, cosy, new, and the views were amazing (see pictures). We had an issue with the TV (it simply didn’t work), being in NYC i didn’t even get round to reporting it until day 3, however when i did it was promptly fixed by maintenance.

The lounge was just perfect for us at Breakfast, nothing to heavy but enough to set us up for day, free coffee and soft drinks all day long, and they did let me stock up our mini fridge with waters and diet coke (without taking advantage too much!). Again the view from the lounge while having breakfast was great, however the windows need to cleaned.

Having been to NYC 3 times, the location of this hotel was perfect. Its within 15-20mins walking to main attractions, 5 mins walk to Grand Central that takes you anywhere you want to go in the city, we enjoyed the experience of the Subway. There is also a lot of little bars, shops and food places locally (not silly money like times square either) if you like a Guinness like we do :-) we found a great Irish bar called Mondoons.

We had a fantastic time at Millennium Hilton Plaza, and i would like to thank you personally for making our NYC trip so amazing. When (not if) we return to New York there is only one place i will be staying at - The Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza.

Thank you Again!!!
Jez & Chelsi

title: Millennium numero Uno
text: Fantastic from arrival to departure location easy midtown East. Exceptional views from floor 30 upwards. Suite amazing. Coffee shop at lobby quality illy and assorted pastries etc 44th street is at the heart of the city with an easy 3 to 5 block walk

title: Silvester in New York Midtwon Manhattan
text: Nicht zu empfehlen.  Der Service an der Rezeption einfach unfreundlich und es gab bei Nachfrage nach einem Regenschirm eine Absage .Sie haben keine. Versprochener Kofferservice vom Reiseveranstalter wurde auch nicht eingehalten. Das Zimmer in der 31. Etage war sauber aber abgewohnt. Die Zimmer waren max bei 80 Fahrenheit deutlich zu kalt da der Wind auf die Fenster stand. Bei leichtem Sturm knarrte das ganze Zimmer durch die Stahl und Allu Konstruktion. Die Badewanne war eher eine zu niedrig geratene Fussbadebecken, zum reinlegen und baden nicht geeignet. Sehr hellhörig die Zimmer. Das Frühstück völlig überzogen,hoher Preis für geringe Qualität. Also unbedingt meiden!!!

title: Close to everything YET QUIET, lovely service, excellent views
text: We had two rooms at the Hilton millennium UN for my family and our guests. Excellent value overall. Nice perks for Diamond members, such as you would expect: room upgrades, executive lounge with great views. We had young kids and we walked to Times Square and beyond and then took a taxi back. The extra distance away from the crowded areas was nice = no shady folks wandering around, no crowds however grocery store, restaurants and bars are within two blocks. I will go back and I will recommend.

title: Nicht empfehlenswert
text:
Äußert dreckige Zimmer, auch Zimmertausch hat nichts genutzt, gebuchte Reservierung aufgrund des Zustands storniert. Als Entschuldigung hat man uns kostenlose Übernachtung bei nächstem Urlaub angeboten...
NEIN Danke !

title: Fair at best
text: Hotel is in a great location, close to everything NY has to offer but not quite in the middle of the craziness. I booked a 1 bedroom suite with a half bath and pull out sofa. I booked this room type, so that my son wouldn’t have to go in and out of the master bedroom to use the bathroom at night. When checking in, my rate was incorrect. The front desk rep suggested that is was due to the taxes not being included in my online booking, I showed her that the taxes were included. She asked me to email my booking confirmation to the manager so that this could be corrected (this is the second time at a Hilton this has happened to me, so check your rates). She wouldn’t provide her name though, so I could jot down who I spoke to. Not a huge deal, the manager corrected this immediately, I just thought it was odd. The room didn’t contain the half bath, but instead it had a kitchenette area that contained a sink, coffee maker and what appeared to be an old in room bar/snack refrigerator. Only the bottom shelf could be used for keeping anything cool since it was designed to sell snacks and not as a true refrigerator. Upon inquiring about the room, the manager comped me 7k points since there wasn’t a room that had both a sofa bed and half bath. The complimentary breakfast was pretty good, no complaints there. I had to dispute 1 days charge for breakfast since I was charged for 1 breakfast, that was corrected at checkout. The complimentary Skyline bar, charged me $8.00 for the “complimentary” drink which was a lukewarm beer. I emailed the hotel and it was corrected. I ordered room service for my son my first night, since he was sick and we couldn’t take him out. It was basically an adult burger cut in half and overcooked so 30 plus dollars wasted. The view in the room was lovely, we were on floor 31. Overall, the hotel is fair at best.

title: Incredible In Every Way
text: This hotel is truly exceptional! We did digital advance check-in and selected our room. What a great choice! Our corner king room was spacious, wonderfully equipped, and the view was absolutely stunning!

title: Fantastic Hotel. Very Modern and Great Location
text: This is a renovated property and they did an excellent job. I thought the prices were very reasonable and the staff was excellent. I did not use the restaurant, but the fitness area was adequate to get in a decent workout in. a 10-15 minute walk to shopping on Madison or 6th Avenue. Very nice suites....could not have been more pleased.

title: Above and Beyond
text: Our flight arrived very early so we were at the hotel prior to 10.  We asked about the possibility of checking in our luggage so we could take advantage of NYC right away.  Mr. Barry, who helped us, not only worked magic to get us in a room so we could freshen up some first, he provided us tips on where to go and how to best get there, even the best order to do things.  He was amazing!  As a single mom and school teacher traveling with my two girls on their dream trip to NYC but on a budget, his advice and kindness was so appreciated.  One of the girls' favorite part of their trip was checking in with Mr. Barry each morning to tell him about the prior day's events and to get tips for the new one.  I had to laugh when they described him as "kinda like a grandfather but way cooler"! Our room had two double beds; it was simple and clean and the shower had great water pressure and plenty of hot water.  Being a Hilton member gave us free wi-fi which was an added savings.  The entire staff was kind and helpful, from bringing us a microwave, to housekeeping providing extra cups so girls could enjoy hot coco and popcorn in room.  When we spoke with Patrick Goad, the reservation manager, about how kind everyone was, he genuinely listened and appreciated our feedback.  It was nice to find people who cared and were personal yet professional.

title: BEST HOTEL STAFF & STAY!
text: This hotel went above and beyond during my stay at NYFW! Not only was the whole hotel sold out but as a complimentary upgrade, due to the limited spacing, we ended up with a penthouse suite on one of the top floors! My friend and I each had our own bathroom and bedROOMS. Yes-rooms!!! Was so spacious for a NYC hotel. The water was hot and pressure was never an issue. We could see the river and the NYC skyline (Empire State & Chrysler buildings), and the sunrise and sunset every day!!! The breakfast was also worth going to. The fruit was fresh and had more berries than fillers. Even if you don't stay--forget the local Starbucks and go see Wendy in the lobby cafe for a mocha latte made with illy coffee ! She's so incredibly nice, tried to get one every day from her before we ventured out :) The gym is also great if you don't want to run outside and they have a full-size indoor tennis court. I definitely recommend this hotel and would totally stay there again!! Patrick sent up champagne and macaroons as a cherry on top of a wonderful stay since I briefly mentioned it was my first time in NYC for Fashion Week! Never met more thoughtful hotel staff!! Seriously, thank you!!!

title: First time I've been disappointed with a Hilton hotel
text:
Our stay at this hotel was over the Christmas holiday and we had hoped that a warm Christmas atmosphere would have been the least we could have expected at this time of year, nothing could have been further from this!
Location of hotel perfect, away from the noise but within sort walk of central manhattan. Nice building, clean  and good size rooms, some damage to fittings and fixtures, the fridge was too small, not even enough room to chill a bottle of wine. Charging for internet connection in the room is unacceptable in this day and age - 14.95 USD per day. 
Reception staff not very friendly, or polite and offered no assistance with bags, similar for bell staff. Also bell staff couldn't find bags when left with them at check out, indeed they were very impolite.
Restaurant and lounge bar was closed during the day, and the main restaurant area was closed off throughout our 8 day stay, very disappointing.
The Coffee Shop staff were the exception, they we very nice, alway friendly, and always chatted with us.
If all you need is a bed and clean room central to manhattan then this hotel is for you. if you like something a little more then look elsewhere.

title: Excellent location and friendly staff
text: We stayed for a week from 21st to 28th December. It was for my husband's 60th birthday year celebrations. I asked for a nice view if possible and we got it. Views of the Chrysler Building and Empire State. Patrick also organised a little treat for my husband of wine and cakes. The only downside is the cost of drinks at the bar. At $12 a beer it was a bit rich for our pockets. Shame not more affordable or some specials. We would have visited more than once. Also bar man was not very welcoming. Overall a great experience.

title: Staff went (way) above and beyond for our Christmas holiday
text:
Our usual family holiday plans upended by an unexpected surgery, we had to make it work for young grandchild and parents to join the grands for a NYC "staycation" instead of Christmas at home several states away. Our biggest concern was how to protect a youngster's belief in Santa while keeping stress level to a minimum. Enter the brilliant guest-centered and creative Res Manager, Patrick Goad who understood everything immediately. 

We settled on a (gorgeous) 1 bedroom suite for grands and kid, plus another room for the parents. AND, so Santa could do his work in the suite without a child looking on, one add'l room for Christmas eve. All very close together. 

NYers for more than 3 decades, we have never experienced such spectacular views from wall to ceiling windows looking east, west and south from the suite and rooms. We had ample space for a Christmas tree, dining table, family of 5 lounging and very comfortable sofa for grandkid. We saw Empire State Bldg's light show, Chrysler etc skyscrapers in their nighttime glory, sunrise, sunset and the spectacular working East River with water taxis, barges, tugboats, yachts etc. Beds were heavenly. Coffee/tea in room much appreciated.

Patrick went all out as our "Hilton UN Christmas coordinator" to reassure a young boy that his liaison at the North Pole had already contacted him to get the room numbers of kids staying at the Hilton instead of at home. The milk and cookies on arrival and his  explanatory note sealed the deal. Santa arrived and all was wonderful.

The hotel is very well located between 1st and 2nd Avenues, with buses and subways within a few blocks that can take you anywhere. Ambassador Grill in the lobby and Skyline lounge made everything easier. The UN/Grand Central neighborhood is not the jumping hot spot of the Village or SoHo. It's more reserved and business oriented. 

We had a worried child, harried parents and one member recovering from major surgery. The hotel staff from friendly security dogs to bellmen, to front desk (Patrick, Brendan, Nina, Teicia et al) to housekeeping--especially lovely Victoria--to restaurant and lounge staff treated us all as VIPs. Almost without exception, they all went above and beyond. Not only to give expected good service, but to reassure and understand the intangible needs of our family in somewhat stressful circumstances.

This is Hilton service at its very best. Any minor deficiencies or older property issues mentioned in some (unnecessarily churlish) reviews pale in importance when the STAFF treats their GUESTS as our family was. 

We were so comfortable, the grandparents stayed over in the suite another day to decompress and enjoy those WINDOWS.

We will definitely recommend the Millennium Hilton UN to visiting friends and family.

title: !!THE BEST HOTEL I'VE STAYED IN NYC - THANK YOU VERY MUCH PATRICK AND SYLVIA FOR THE HOSPITALITY!
text:
I visit NYC at least 4 times a year for work and have stayed at several properties! I must say that this is THE BEST HOTEL I've ever stayed at - exceptional service! Thank you very much Patrick for making our stay extra special and the surprises (WOW) to celebrate my daughter's special occasion more amazing! Love your staff! 

We were greeted with beautiful smiles of Sylvia at the Front Desk and Frank at the Bell Desk Station. The hostess at Ambassador grill was so nice and greeted me every morning.  Babu at the lounge made sure that I had enough appetizers and drinks. The lobby had a beautiful Christmas tree and so festive! The view from our room was breathtaking and our room was very clean.

I finally got to meet Patrick to personally thank him for making our stay unforgettable. Patrick was so hospitable, kind and warm. Hilton is very lucky to have him. His energy is infectious and you just feel his positive attitude, love for work and zest for life  - LOVE Patrick!

I also love their location. Within walking distance to Grand Central, Times Square, Broadway, Rockefeller Center, 5th Ave and Central Park. 

Thank you very much Patrick, Sylvia, Frank, Babu, Hostess at the Ambassador Lounge (sorry I forgot your name) for making our extraordinary and exceptional! Hilton is very lucky to have you as part of their staff. Happy Holidays and Happy New Year!

title: Sterile Corporate  Vibe
text: For my Christmas four-day stay, my room was stifling hot because the AC unit was disabled. Yes $139 seems like a great deal, but from there on lodgers are subject to pay a premium for anything else. Maybe the stars were misaligned, but as a frequent NYC traveler, this neighbourhood lacked character.

title: Very Disappointed
text:
My family and I just spent 5 days thru Christmas at the Hilton UN Plaza. We had 3 rooms.
3 college age children, my wife and I.
The hotel is worn out.
The rugs in the hallway are stained.
The bathrooms showers did not work properly. Toilet paper holders fell off the walls.
The air conditioning did not work. Our rooms were between 73 and 77 degrees.
The bedding has been washed so many times it stiff.
Staff was not attentive.
They did not hold doors or greet you.
The breakfast buffet was over priced and average at best. You would be better off  not eating there.
This hotel is not what you would expect from Hilton.

title: Awful experience. Seriously, find another hotel - it's New York, there are much better options
text:
On arrival, a very abrupt and rude receptionist claimed that our package holiday had not paid them (British Airways) and we could either pay $1000 immediately or have to leave. They refused to call BA. They refused to give us a number for BA. They refused to confirm this in writing.

Checking Google reviews I found this is s common problem - they say that the reservation wasn't paid (it was paid months in advance) and demand full price, saying "claim it back off [BA] later".

When we eventually managed to get hold of BA, they confirmed everything was paid, rang the hotel for us and it was sorted - no apology from them though.

The stress this caused at the start of the holiday was indescribable. We were even calling our insurance company at one point trying to arrange fights back rather than sleep on the streets as we couldn't afford that $1000.

Seriously, this is New York - there are lots of hotels, all of excellent quality and most others don't have numerous reviews of this nature - save the risk of this happening to you like it did to us, and seems to to many others and book somewhere else.

title: 4 Year Anniversary Celebration...Perfection! Amazing Room, Views, Service, Management
text: This review is long overdue. Apologies to the phenomenal staff, specifically Matthew and Jacqueline for making our 4 year anniversary an incredible one! Spent one night, upgraded to the Presidential Suite after booking the two bedroom suite. The views were spectacular, the suite was more of a luxury apartment with the added benefits of room service, a lovely executive lounge, and every detail perfect...even complimentary champagne and delicious pumpkin cheesecakes. I did not want to leave! We were so impressed that we spent more time taking in the views and enjoying the theater, living area, and every other luxurious aspect of the room than we did venturing around the city. I have stayed at this property before and loved it, especially the views, location, and lounge. The bathtub was magnificent, the closet space and changing area, the office, additional bathroom. I would live here if I could. Marble floors, sculptures, pictures will never do it justice.  I will certainly be back very soon. As always, one of the reasons I am a Hilton Diamond Member, enthusiast, and loyal to the brand. Thank you to everyone who made this happen. Will be posting photos and review on @johnwhotravelswell instagram as well!

title: Not worth the price.
text: This hotel was listed as a 4 star hotel with a city view.  My wife’s & I’s room certainly was not.  The room had an odd layout, there were stains & rips on the floor, and dust on appliances, also I felt like something was going to fall on me from the ceiling.  They did not provide any in room water or on floor ice.  There wasn’t a sundry shop as well when I needed Tylenol or a soda.  Also the concierge at the desk was misinformed (intentional?) about the prices of shoes.  She quoted prices considerably above ones we found elsewhere online.  I have stayed in NYC many times before & have never had a bad room until now.  Not worth the price in my opinion.

title: Tried it one time.
text:
We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights checking out on Dec 22.  Check in was easy, room had a great view from the 38th floor.  Bellman were first class. There is a lot of noise because of the elevators going up and down.  I mean a really deep roar you can hear while lying in bed.  Hotel rooms are starting to show a lot of wear and tear. Housekeeping missed our room and it was not cleaned until Friday. We called and emailed the hotel to let them know.  No response from the email which I discovered in other reviews is normal. 
Biggest disappointment is how they gouge you on food.  A simple breakfast buffet is $35 per person.  They have a little store that sells food in the morning as well.  A single yogurt is $4.50, for example.  We learned quick and found several close diners with great breakfast food for regular, fair prices.  While the views were great, I would not stay here again.

title: Bon hôtel mais le lounge exécutif est moyen
text: L’hotel est bien situé, devant l’edifice des Nations Unies et assez éloigné des centres touristiques.  L’hotel est propre et facile d’acces.  Le lounge exécutif se trouve dans une tour alors que ma chambre était dans une autre tour.  Donc, 30e étage descend au lobby et remonte au 30 pour le lounge.  On y retrouve un semblant de déjeuner... je suggère de déjeuner au lobby puisque le déjeuner y est inclus aussi si vous êtes diamant.

title: Bad smell
text: Our room had a horrible smell. The front desk reps were very rude and made no attempt to move us or try to get the smell out. I called them multiple times regarding this and it was never addressed. It wasn't a great way to spend my anniversary.

title: Best place to stay while in NYC
text:
We celebrated my inlaws 60th Anniversary with a show on Broadway and a stay at this beautiful hotel.
Besides a great location to get in and out of the city we loved the views at night from the rooms. The staff was more than generous and welcoming. We had special needs and requested a fridge which came to our room in 20 minutes. 
The beds are very comfortable as was the entire room. 
We had a wonderful breakfast in their restaurant the buffet was beyond belief. When it came time for the theatre we didn’t need Uber since there were a fleet of cabs parked at the door. 
Shout out to the bellmen who were very friendly and accommodating. 
If your staying in NYC this is the place to be. 
A big bonus is the huge selection of resturants in the area in walking distance.

title: Thanksgiving weekend
text: Can’t say enough about this hotel. The view from our room was amazing. But more importantly the staff and amenities were outstanding. Everything from the thanksgiving brunch to the skyline lounge to the breakfast buffet was perfect. Thank you for a wonderful family experience. Can’t wait to return.

title: Great hotel well located in quiet area a couple of blocks east of Grand Central
text: Stayed at the hotel for five nights and was impressed by both the hotel itself but also the friendliness and capability of the staff. As a Diamond member got and upgrade and access to the lounge. Lounge was a great place at night we found with good views and comfortable surroundings.

title: Best hotel in nyc
text: Have stayed in many nyc hotels. We live here haha- Got a clean spacious corner king room. Amazing views of the water(just what i asked for) great house keeping, extra security at the door since its UN hotel. Everyone was very helpful. Price was right!  Bed was so comfy we took a ‘nap’ for 6 hrs lol

title: Love this hotel!
text: We have stayed at the Millennium Hilton about 4 times in the past two years, and love it. Every room has an absolutely gorgeous view - truly unbeatable. The suites are huge and all of the rooms we stayed in were up to date and very clean. Whether we had a double room or suite, we always had enough room for our family, which is rare for NYC hotels. The staff is so friendly and very welcoming. We love the convenience of the location - it's a comfortable walk to a lot of restaurants and activities. The food in the restaurant keeps getting better - I recently had a gnocci dish that was so yummy, and their breakfast buffet is really good. Overall, we would definitely recommend this hotel and plan to come back ourselves.

title: Outstanding Stay!
text:
My family and I had a wonderful time at the UN Hilton. Friendly and helpful bell staff. Excellent club room breakfast and snacks. Restaurant fish entree was delicious. Location is great for views of East River and NY marathon. 

Excellent baked goods selection in lobby cafe. 

Pro Tip: solid NY pizza slices on at the corner joint one block north.

title: Ok location (walkable, not near subway), bad food, understaffed, NOT recently updated
text:
If you like to walk and aren't going to spend much time at the property this can be a good option in NYC.  What drew me here w/ family was the availability of suites w/ bedrooms, but it really disappointed me.

Location:
Lots within a 15 minute walk, but not near the subway, which is a bummer in NYC.
Staff was super friendly but hard a hard time getting the front desk to even answer the phone from the room.  This is unacceptable from a 4 star.  WAY under staffed.
Stayed here since I thought it was renovated in 2017, but it does NOT look like it. 
Food in the ambassador lounge is TERRIBLE.  Don't go for the $20 burger special combo advertised in the elevator - dry, overcooked, and worse than fast food :(
Breakfast for gold/platinum members is abysmal.  The exec lounge breakfast not even worth going to.  Hard boiled eggs and cereal.

title: Best staff/venue ever!!
text: I held my companies executive team holiday dinner here and they made it perfect! The service from start to finish was impeccable, and the food (from the restaurant in the hotel called Narcissa) was top notch. Fitz, Maya, Teresa, Kira, Heather and literally everyone were fantastic! If you are in NYC and looking for a place to hold your events, do yourself a favor and check out The Standard East Village!

title: Very nice atmosphere and great location
text: I have had relatives stay here  before and they are always very happy with the Millennium HIlton NY One UN Plaza. The staff is unusally kind to my son and the views are amazing. The restaurant is also very good. I had a very good experience working with Mr Goad recently. Thank you Mr. Goad  for your compassion. I hope to have more family and friends stay at your hotel when they are visiting.

title: Good location & clean
text: Rooms were clean. Beds are more of a larger twin version than full. Beds were clean and comfortable for a good nights sleep. Front desk was accommodating due to room not being ready when we arrived. Location is close enough for walking distances. We walked to Rockefeller Center, Saks on 5th and Macy’s one evening and back. Plenty of eats around. View was amazing from out room

title: 44th & 1st
text: Hotel is on Midtown East, just across the UN [uBer & Lyft usually drop you on 45th]. Hotel is your typical Hilton, nothing fancy. The lobby is always busy because people have meetings on the side. The rooms are semi outdated [compare it to the Marriott / Hyatt], but the hotel is nice. You defiantly feel safe because it's across the UN. The hotel staff is really nice. Being a diamond member [the manager is sweet I got an amazing view of the city] you get the typical perks like lounge etc. The breakfast at the lounge is better then the restaurant [staff is rude]. Gym is small but busy.

title: Great place to stay.
text:
I recently returned from my first trip to New York where I stopped in the millennium hilton Hotel.
The hotel is lovely and clean, everyone was beyond nice. I actually liked the fact that there is extra security including a sniffer dog. 

The room was big and very clean with fantastic views of the river. 
Lots of space for clothes and shoes. 
I love the fact that there is a safe in the room. 

The best thing about this hotel is the fact that you do not pay any resort tax.

title: Rude nasty housekeeping
text: I stayed at this hotel this weekend for a birthday getaway.   By mistake, instead of turning the sign outside to do not disturb, it was turned to the side we needed service.   When housekeeping tried to get in my room and I was not dressed, I quickly said that I was in there and could they please come back.   With that, right at the door, she started to mimick me and laughing with another housekeeper.   I went to the door undressed and told her I could hear her.   She repeated that the sign was turned the wrong way then.   I was adressing her rude comment to me, not the sign.   For over $400 we paid, I will never return to such ill trained staff.    The hotel should train them that if they have nothing nice to say, keep your rude mouth shut.   Will be following up on this.

title: Horrible hotel
text:
Unfriendly and rude staff
Dirty rooms
Requests had to b repeated more than once with a min 30 min wait
Tom service items left in corridor for days on end without being cleared up
Complaints were brushed off

title: Great Property
text: This was our 3rd time staying at this hotel. Each time we’ve stayed there we have enjoyed it. We received a great discount with Hilton Honors & friends & family. The suite on 36th floor has unbeatable views. Highly recommend this hotel. The staff is very pleasant & professional. We always feel secure there with security for UN on premises.

title: Nära FN högkvarteret
text: Bra hotell på first ave alldeles mitt emot FN's högkvarter. Rummen är stora och tysta, åtminstone på den höjd jag bodde. Har man tur, får man en vacker utsikt över floden. Fritt Wi-Fi ingick i mitt rum. Däremot får man leta sig ut på morgonen om man ska ha frukost till rimligt pris.

title: My home away from home
text: I stayed here for 3 months.  The staff was fantastic to get to know me, fulfill requests, and accommodate every need.  From the bellman to the front desk to the restaurant staff, and hotel managers, everyone offered great service.  The rooms are large with fantastic views.  I felt safe in this location.  It was also convenient to restaurants, midtown activities, and the subway.

title: Amazing
text: Absolutely an amazing stay.   From the greeting of Robert  the doorman to the front desk you couldn’t find great customer service.  I was given an upgrade and it was beautiful.  The breakfast for Diamond members is top notch. Overall 5 star hotel.

title: Very nice rooms
text: Enjoyed my stay. Rooms are well appointed and renovated. You cannot beat the fantastic views. The window opened a few inches which was wonderful in the overly warm room on the 37th floor. The illy espresso machine in the room was a wonderful surprise and helped me to start my day off right. This is a large hotel room for Manhatten- luxuriate in the space!

title: Don't stay here! Avoid!
text:
My family were so disappointed with this hotel. Despite emailing 11 months in advance asking for a city view we got a river view. They changed room but the room we got a dirty room, had a carpet that was very worn and stained, a chair that the leather had split and was literally crumbling through rot, the bathroom stank of urine, the coffee machine was gross and there was a partial ceiling collapse. Raised this all with the hotel who cut away the worn carpet and made a half arsed attempt to clean the large stain.

We paid £1,160 for a 2 double bed room, but they only put tea/coffee out for 2 peoplw each day even though there were 3 people staying. Was really not made to feel welcome.

We got one night "complimentary" and some breakfast vouchers but this was nowhere near good enough. As a family we are still deciding whether or not to sue/initiate a chargeback for the full amount.

Avoid this hotel. Overpriced, tatty, disappointing.

title: Amazing Staff and Location
text:
On my last stay the hotel did everything they could to make my vacation both enjoyable and not stressful. I can not stress how amazing the view was from my room of the entire sky line. 

From the moment I checked in the hotel staff greeted me like I was the most important person checking in to the time I checked out. Every time I passed by the lobby I felt like they always said hi or enjoy your day. 

As far as location goes it is less than a 5 minute walk to Grand Central which makes getting around via Subway or train very easy. Will definitely rebook with them!

title: Nice hotel with perfect view
text: Das Hotel liegt gegenüber von der UN. Ich hatte ein Zimmer in 39. Stock mit genialen Blick auf die Stadt.  Aus dem Fitness Studio hat man einen tollen Blick auf die UN und den Fluss.  Service ist gut, Frühstück auch.  Einziges Manko: wlan kostet extra.

title: Great experience
text: I usually stay at the New York Hilton Midtown but decided to give this hotel a try. I loved the location, just in front of the UN Plaza, within walking distance of all the main midtown attractions. The person handling my check-in was very nice and even though I arrived hours before the usual check-in time, my room was ready. I was given a room on the 36th floor which was very large for NY standards and comfortable, with a good sized bed, a great chaise longue and desk. It had a walk-in closet which I loved, as I could chuck all of my shopping in there keeping the room tidy. The bathroom was also a decent size, with the usual Hilton ammenities. All in all, it was a great experience and I might adopt it as my go-to hotel in NY.

title: Family Visit
text: This is a good hotel, convenient to many attractions. We stayed in a room with city view. The bathroom was clean and nice an bed comfortable. Carper needs to be replaced but overall a good hotel. Their gym was in the other tower but was nice.

title: Great location and excellent staff.
text: Gorgeous views of East River. Pleasant hotel. Comfortable beds. Clean. Very lovely staff. We got a good rate during Thanksgiving holiday. Neighborhood has lots of coffee shops and other reasonably priced services available.

title: My 50th Birthday
text: Fantastic Hotel,Staff and everyone we came into contact with in this Hotel. We checked in was so easy the gentleman who checked was friendly and very happy, the room was very clean and great views.The food and drink was slightly expensive but I suppose that's expected in the city.Taxi were easy to come by and the sights where only a short drive away. All in all we had a fantastic time with great service. Thank you to all the staff who made our stay great.

title: Love This Hotel
text: When we travel to NYC this is where we ALWAYS stay. Rooms are clean, staff is friendly, and the view is great. It's right by the UN so it's a relatively quiet area which suits us. There are great restaurants sprinkled around the area as well.

title: Best hotel in new york
text:
Just returned from a trip at this fantastic hotel.
It was my husbands 40th birthday and we were allocated a corner suite which has spectacular views of the Chrysler building and Empire State.
All the staff are a credit to the Hilton brand they were so lovely
Thank you for another memorable stay we shall definately return.

title: Very big rooms !!
text: Pleasantly surprised by the  large size of the rooms at this place. We had a double and there was tons of space. The bathroom is functional but small. The location is amazing- between 1st and buzzing 2nd avenue. The staff was helpful and the breakfast offered with the room was also very good value for money.

title: Good hotel
text: Good hotel, clean rooms, nice view, convenient location. Good place to get around by walking as well as via taxis. One hour from the JFK airport via taxi. The receptionist were not that helpful when asked for anywhere to eat for dinner. They seemed to not know anywhere to recommend. The concierge did recommend a very nice place breakfast which was better than the hotels breakfast. It is called johns and is just down the road. Two minutes walk. Room large, with a large tv and not much noice. Nice view from my window. Would recommend and stay again. Decor in lobby a bit odd but the rooms are nicer and neutral.

title: Pre Christmas Break
text:
This was my first time in New York in about 13 years. I hadn’t stayed in the city previously, just visited twice. The experience in the hotel was excellent from start to finish. Staff are efficient and friendly, rooms are spacious and cleaned daily. We had a beautiful view of the river and the room is large enough to feel like you have your own space. 
We did not use most of the hotel facilities as we were out from early morning until late evening daily. The hotel is 5-10 minutes from Grand Central Station. In this respect you are connected to the entire city and beyond. We purchased a metro card for 1 week - costing $33. Walking to Times Square takes 20-25 mins - it does not feel tedious as you take in the sights and lights of the city. Most of our holiday was very active, we walked mainly everywhere or to the subway when tired. 
I would stay here again and recommend anyone to stay. A shuttle can be organised to the airport as well as private transport. The only negative of the stay was check out. Check out is at 11am (extremely early), when your flight home is 8pm, late check out can be purchased but we declined this. Overall I was very pleased with the hotel!

title: Business Trip
text: Great location near UN. Staff super kind and easy to work with. Room service was expensive, if you call down to the restaurant and grab it yourself you will save money. Rooms were clean and the view was amazing from the tower I was in.

title: Unbelievable Staff
text: I am not a fussy traveler. Do not need a whole lot of flash or prim. Nice firm bed and pillows, clean and safe to explore NYC. Just need a room to sleep. That being said the Millennium Hilton New York UN Plaza is a outstanding hotel if for no other reason than there phenomenal great staff. Everyone was professional and friendly. They actually seem to really care about the people staying at the hotel. Of special note was a young Black woman who was working in the UNCAFE on Sunday morning between the hours of 9 am and 11 am. Such a pleasant, professional beaming person. Should be made the face of the hotel and hotel chain for her wonderful being. Although the hotel is on the far east side of Manhattan just a short (less than $10) cab ride to he Broadway theater section. Directly across from the UN. In walking distance(two minutes) to various stores and restaurants.

title: Magic
text: Soggiorno perfetto a New York. Le camere sono ampie e pulite e permettono di rilassarsi veramente dopo una giornata di giri per la città. La cosa migliore rimane comunque la vista spettacolare che merita da sola il soggiorno

title: Great experience
text:
We surprised our daughter and brought her to NYC to celebrate her 13th birthday. We could not have been more pleased with our stay at this hotel!  We were on the 32nd floor and our views were amazing!  The staff was very friendly and helpful, the rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable. The lobby is beautiful and location was great for walking or catching the subway. 
(Picture is from our room at night)

title: Not a pleasant stay but ok.
text:
Stayed in this hotel for a UN program. It is the closest hotel near the UN. The view is beautiful from the river view room. But the service is not up to the mark. The carpet is stained in the hallway. Lift button was electrified and giving a shock on the 13th floor. Front desk people are gossiping each other when you are waiting to get service.

The breakfast was good though. the bed is comfy. Toilet and room were clean. Not a pleasant stay but ok.

title: Lovely hotel
text:
My boyfriend and I stayed In this hotel last week. Firstly, the views were amazing! I’ve stayed in other New York hotels for similar prices and they do not live up to this hotel! We only paid for a standard room and weren’t expecting it to be that big or spacious either. 

The hotel itself is pretty central to everything so no need to travel ages to get places. 

Lovely helpful staff, clean and modern hotel. 

This hotel is definitely worth the money. 
If I were to go back to New York I would 100% stay here again.   Thank you!

title: A perfect place to stay with spectacular views and amazing staff
text:
We stayed in a King Corner room with spectacular views over the East River, Roosevelt Island and Midtown Manhattan. All the amenities are provided so no worries here. We stayed at the 37th floor and the views are breathtaking! The elevators are very quick and we never experienced any trouble. The hotel itself is located a little bit away from the Times Square but thanks to that it's very quiet up there. A perfect place to wind down after a long day of sight-seeing. 

The bed was insanely comfortable and the breakfast that followed our good night's sleep was divine. The orange juice is delicious, so are bagels and croissants - truly exquisite. We were only slightly surprised that there is no complimentary wi-fi available in the rooms, it's available in the lobby only so it might be troublesome for travellers with no mobile data to spare.

The staff deserves a special mention - everyone at the hotel is very hospitable, especially front desk clerks. We were greeted by Sylvia who was amazingly calm and helped us since we had a bit of problem with our credit card. The staff at the breakfast, the housekeepers and concierge did all amazing work to make us feel welcome. Everyone just went out of their way to ensure that our stay was perfect. Top-quality service at its best!

Given the price, service, room standard and the views... it's the best hotel you can get in Midtown Manhattan.

title: 11.15 Trip
text: This trip was meant to have fun in couples and friends and explore New York City as a whole during the day and also enjoy the night life different areas in the city have to offer. I was absolutely satisfied with my stay and I plan on returning. The service was great, the staff was helpful and the view from the room was perfect.

title: Great location.  The Skyline lounge staff were excellent.
text: The view from the hotel was spectacular.  The staff in the Skyline executive center helped me with the computers in the business center, explained the buildings I was looking at through the windows, and the food was fresh and delicious.  Best part of my stay.  I wish the bed was more comfortable.  Just used to the cushiness of my bed at home.

title: Presidential Suite and other things...
text:
Had the best stay in NY and I’ve stayed all over the city.  Got to stay a night in the presidential suite on the 28th floor for a birthday get together and I gotta say it was the best experience.  Hotel staff were awesome in every way including accommodating it after my initial reserved 2 bedroom suite was sold out.  Check in was seamless.  Its a close walk to 42nd grand central station.  Tons of food options around as well.  The stay was overall perfect.  I’ll definitely stay here again even if not in the presidential suite. 

Room details:
-Huge master bathroom with dual sinks, rain shower, high tech toilet with water and bidet. 
-Additional half bath. 
-Huge Master bedroom with own tv, king bed, couch and views
-Tons of closet space
-Long walkway from the door
-Dinning table that could seat 8 with room
-living area with tons of couches and another TV
-The views are the best part of the suite.  Floor to ceiling windows allll over the suite with views of midtown, Chrysler building, freedom tower, and river. 
-Connects to double bed room if more bedding is needed.

title: First time visit, will return!
text: This was our first visit to this property. We were not disappointed. We had a nice room on the 38th floor w/ a lovely view north. There are many excellent restaurants in the area. The location is w/in walking distance of Grand Central where you can find all sorts of transportation options. The staff is very personable and accommodating. We will return. Good internet service - nicely appointed room - comfortable sleeping.

title: Amazing hotel
text:
It is my first time to stay at this hotel, but I am sure I want to stay here again for its great views, exceptional services, convenient location and most importantly, people.

The view of East River is breath-taking.  The corner rooms have huge ceiling-to-floor windows, giving guests unblocked views of UN and the East River.  One of the windows can be opened a little bit that you can take nice pictures of peaceful sunrise and sleepless skyscrapers in NY.

Sky Lounge is also a great place to view the city.  The top of the Chrysler building is just in front of you.  It feels that you can touch it.

The interior design of the hotel is very artistic.  At the lobby, look up to enjoy the skylight and the unique design that leads your eye to the sky.  Throughout the lobby and restaurants, the hotel is very creative to use glass to extend views, to present extraordinary views from good views.

Hotel service teams are great, warm and helpful.  They are not the typical New Yorkers, who might be too efficient to care.  Guests staying here are also nice to each other by greeting strangers a good morning.

I didn’t realize that how close it is to Central Park, Grand Station, the fifth Ave, Chrysler Building and of course UN.  It is within walking distance!

The very rare thing is there are security dogs in the hotel.  At first I thought they are just hotel doggy hosts like some of the Canadian hotels do.  In fact, they are security dogs to keep dangerous luggages away from the hotel. There are a dozen of them.  All of them are Labradors.  They are very playful, letting you pad them and rubbing their bellies. 

There is a sky lounge on the 30th Floor exclusively for HH Diamond members only.  It is a great and quite place to have breakfast, which starts at 6:30 pm.  The Ambassador’s Grill also offers free breakfast to Diamond members.   Between these two places for breakfast, the basic food items are the same, but Ambassador’s Grill offers made to order omelets and more hot items.  So if you want to eat a big breakfast, join the crowd at Ambassador’s Grill.  If you prefer a more exclusive service and a nice view, go up to the Lounge.  The gentleman managing the Lounge is amazing, cheerful.

The Sky Lounge also has food, snacks, drinks in the evening.

My only wish is the windows of the Sky Lounge were cleaner so that nice, sharp pictures of the city can be taken.

title: Perfect !!!
text:
Wonderful Hotel The lady upgrade me to king executive with the lounge access very appreciate! 
The hotels is fabulous new and elegant 
The views for the the city is fantastic 
I definitely back so far is the best hilton in Manhattan

title: Awesome Experience
text:
This hotel is a must stay!! The reservation manager Patrick is awesome. He made special accommodations which made my stay a memorable one. The staff was great! The corner rooms are breath taking! This experience exceeded my expectations! I was looking for a simple get away and instead got a luxury staycation.

LK

title: Amazing Experience
text: We booked the Millennium for my early 21st celebrations and we were not disappointed. This is up there with one of the best hotel experiences I’ve ever had, made even more special by the fantastic team of staff. A mention to Tyera and the rest of the team for making my stay so special, they even surprised me with Prosecco, cheesecake and a mattress with a bday card in our room which was just fantastic! The room itself featured comfortable accommodation and amenities, however the feature that stood out to us was the spectacular view of Manhattan and the Empire State Building. I listened to music most nights with the bright lights of the city in total view which was literally the dream. I couldn’t believe how amazing our experience was for our first trip to NYC and we will definitely book to stay here again when we get the chance to come back to NY again.

title: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza is WONDERFUL!!!
text: ALL aspects of the hotel is GREAT from location to staff to comfort of rooms!  It's a large hotel that has an intimate feel to it!  The staff is truly focused on their guests.  Surprisingly, the attention and focus on the guests is apparent from the moment we set foot in the hotel!

title: Excellent, Quiet, Comfortable Hotel in Great Location
text:
In my experience, the Hilton Millenium UN plaza hotel differs from other hotels in one major way - they really look after Elite members with regards to complimentary upgrade. 

On our recent stay, we were upgraded to a very very nice modern suite, with sweeping views of the East River (many thanks to Matthew Waller and Oskarina Reeves). The room was luxurious, quiet and very comfortable with large TV screen. 

The Hotel is conveniently located within walking distance (10min) to the Grand Central station, which provides easy travel around Manhattan. It is right next to the United Nation which I recommend a visit if time permits (book tour online in advance - highly recommended). 

Elite members have access to the Concierge Lounge (Skylounge) offering breakfast and evening canapes, and drinks/snacks/fruit. Being Diamond members, we were also offered complimentary full buffet breakfast at the Ambassador Grill, which was nice. We feel very safe in the hotel due to the special security.

We really enjoyed our stay at the hotel, and would recommend this hotel (and especially if you are Elite members - thanks Matthew!!).

title: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza is GREAT!!!
text: This hotel is centrally located.  It has a 'boutique' feel to it even though it's a large hotel.  The entire staff is laser focused on their guests.  We were greeted and acknowledged the moment we set foot on the hotel property!  The rooms are contemporary styled and our bed was super comfortable!  The Executive Lounge is great.  The view of the NYC skyline was beautiful and the amenities and food was great!

title: Fabulous room but some drama
text: I got upgraded to a suite which was fabulous. Did have some drama late a night with all of the fire alarms going off and had to evacuate the building. Would have been helpful if the staff had made an announcement with instructions or something. The sky club on the 30th floor was great.

title: Amazing
text: Amazing! Brandon was so helpful and kind. The service was great and the staff were very responsive. The room was clean. Everything about my stay was great and I would definitely come back and stay here.

title: Family trip to New York (part 2)
text: This was our second hotel in New York having stayed at the Conrad Downton for three nights, we spent two nights at the Millennium - and so glad we did! After sharing a room with the kids for a few nights even in a luxurious room, we were so happy to move on to stay in the best room we could have arranged. We booked the two bedroom, two bathroom suite with a huge lounge and fantastic views of the New York skyline - including the Empire State building and the Chrysler Building. We were allocated a corner suite on the top floor, so could see West,south and east and it couldn't have been better to round off our city experience. The breakfast buffet (included because of my Hilton Rewards Diamond membership) was great - not quite as good as the weekend buffet at the Conrad, but still enabled us to set up for the day exploring the sights. Would highly recommend staying there, and if we go back will definitely be staying there again ourselves even though it costs a little more, it certainly left a good impression on all of us.

title: Special occasion visit
text: Upon our arrival the staff were very friendly, it was my wife’s 40th birthday surprise which they knew about and had 2 small bottles of champagne on ice for us in the room with a card from the hotel. The room was clean with a lovely view. The desk staff everyday were smart, very friendly and helpful. Barry was amazing. Also felt very safe as they had great security due to being part of the UN building. Thank you so much to you all that made our stay so special.

title: Fenomenalt boende!
text: Bodde här i 4 nätter med min sambo. Vi fick ett rum på 38:e våningen om jag inte minns helt fel. Detta var min 4 gång i New york och detta hotellet överraskade oss både. Stilrent, snyggt, trevlig personal och de var hjälpsamma i receptionen och även dörrvakterna var riktigt trevliga. Detta hotell rekommenderar jag verkligen! 5/5!!

title: Mantenimiento
text: Si la calefacción falla en estas fechas, se debe actuar con prontitud, contestar el teléfono cuando se llama al conserje, canales de películas más de uno por favor, indicar donde están los apagadores porque están ocultos

title: Wonderful Staff, Incredible Views
text:
Just completed a lovely anniversary weekend here.  Staff were extremely generous and gracious, sending us a bottle of wine and cake.  Our room on the 38th floor had a most magnificent view of the Chrysler Building and Empire State Building.  Picture postcard perfect! 

Things I’d improve:  Skylounge (food/decor was subpar and less-than-fresh food led to GI problems); stairway to tennis court on top floor (unsightly); restaurant/bar - needs refreshing.

title: Millenium Hilton, UN Plaza, New York
text:
Loved our stay at this hotel. Great location, fantastic staff and spectacular views from the hotel room. Would like to mention Racquell and Paul who made our stay especially memorable after a poor start to our holiday.

Will definitely stay here on future visits to New York

title: Expérience très mitigée
text:
Hôtel de la chaîne Hilton qui manque à mon sens à un grand nombre de ses devoirs d'''hospitality''. L'accueil à la réception n'est pas des plus chaleureux voire même à l'opposé.Nous sommes restés 7 jours, 6 nuits dans une suite de cet hôtel à la vue Magnifique sur les buildings et notamment le Chrysler. Jamais un bonjour ou un au revoir ou autre chose de la part de l'équipe de réception très accaparée par contre à rire et plaisanter avec les collègues.Aucune aide pour les bagages et pour nous amener à la chambre.Celle-ci avait dû être faite en urgence : il restait un ballon gonflé caché derrière un fauteuil et des confettis dans la grande salle du bas et une moquette avec des taches ainsi qu'un des fauteuils. J'ai montré la photo que j'avais prise à la réception qui n'a pas eu l'air de vraiment s'en préoccuper.Le lit enfant n'était pas prêt: appel à la réception pour qu'ils viennent réparer leur oubli. Pas de bouilloire pour le thé alors qu'il y avait le thé: tél à la réception pour avoir la bouilloire seulement  le lendemain soir avec un cordon de  prise pas assez long pour être branchée ( il aurait fallu la mettre à même la moquette pour qu'elle fonctionne). Le réfrigérateur était en panne : il a été changé le surlendemain de notre arrivée.Aucune décoration dans la suite : même pas un petit bouquet de fleurs ou un petit mot de la Direction.(Vu le standing et donc le prix : Très surprenant). Le petit déjeuner était servi en sous sol alors qu'il avait été dit sur la pub de l'hôtel qu'il était servi en hauteur avec vue. Apparemment la piscine avait disparue aussi mais nous ne l'avons su que lorsque nous l'avons demandé au concierge. Le portier était lui très sympathique dévoué ainsi que les personnes qui s'occupaient de la boutique cafétéria : très agréables personnes.Le séjour a été effectivement très plaisant même si le lit d'appoint de notre fille était terrible en terme de confort. Les chambres ont été faites régulièrement avec l'attention qu'il fallait: changement des serviettes et des produits d'accueil chaque jour. Nous n'avons pas pu accéder à un bar qui était réservé apparemment aux Guets Honors d'Hilton étonnant:  car étant dans une suite avec étage supérieur nous pensions avoir au moins le droit de visiter ce bar où consommer pour voir la vue qui est mise en avant sur le site de l'hôtel mais : un grand refus , nous n'y avions pas droit. Donc cet avis va s'arrêter là en soulignant bien sûr que nous ne choisirons certainement pas cet hôtel lors de notre prochain séjour à New York. 
Sincèrement

title: Quiet Attractive Hotel
text: If you need to be on the eastside, this is a great choice. The rooms are updated and well appointed, very clean and a good size for a Manhattan hotel. It is very quiet and the staff was most accommodating.

title: В центре Манхэттена, напротив ООН
text: Отличное местоположение, виды из окон завораживают! Отель очень достойный, хоть и не новый. Просторный чистый номер, бесплатный Wi-Fi, кофеварка, добротный завтрак. А еще очень гостеприимные сотрудники, это приятно. Цены в баре немного расстроили, но вокруг масса кафе, ресторанов, пабов где можно отлично провести время.

title: Business trip
text: Hotel is nicely located for my needs. Super easy for Ubers to find and access.The staff was fantastic and they took great care of me especially when I needed to switch rooms because of an unexpected issue with my reserved room. They definitely accommodated me as a diamond member. Some of the interior space is a little dated in the hallways and spaces in the west tower.

title: Top hotel met een waanzinnig uitzicht!
text: Top hotel met een waanzinnig uitzicht En op een super locatie!! Alleen de WiFi is niet super. Als je premium hebt en smorgens opnieuw moet inloggen moet je eerst naar beneden om met de gratis lobby WiFi in te loggen.

title: Great View from the 28th Floor
text: The four of us spent the night after coming to NYC to see the premiere of my niece's play.  Last time I'd been in the building was for a UN-related conference in the 70's, and everything has changed.  The hotel has gone from dingy to almost deluxe and it's been taken over by the Jilton chain.  The rooms are clean and functional.  The views if you're in a South-facing room are spectacular (see photos). And the staff -- including the "Welcome Waggin'' bomb-sniffing dogs when you first enter the building-- are friendly.  Fine location convenient to mid-Manhattan.

title: Outstanding service
text: Well, I can’t rate my experience so far high enough. On arrival after a tiresome journey, Ticia, and Adina got myself and the other people in my party checked in quickly and with a smile. They made helpful suggestions on what to do and where to go and listened to what we were looking for from our room. We got an amazing room over the Hudson River and the Empire State Building on the other side. The team have been exceptional and the location is perfect for using as a base with high quality accommodation to rest in, at exceptionally good prices. If you want quality, this is the place to go. Patrick the reservation manager told us all about the Transit Museum which we are going to try out today. Thanks guys, you’ve made a great impression on our first day here. Good job Millennium Hilton!

title: Well Located & Comfortable
text:
Firstly this is a good base to explore NYC from - it is located less than 10 min walk from Times Square and you can easily walk to TImes Sq, Central Park, Rockerfeller, Chrysler, Empire State, 5th Avenue, etc from here.

Check In was slow (ie queues) and we had to wait for our room to be ready. In fairness they do say check-in after 4pm, but I had hoped at 3.15 it would have been ready. Alas not and queuing up twice was necessary.

When we did get to our rooms we noted the trash can hadn't been emptied and neither had they replenished the shampoo, soap, shower gel, conditioner etc. After a call to Housekeeping this was corrected, but it shouldn't have happened in the first place.

Room was of a good size and very quiet and comfortable. Nice view of the East River from the 34th floor.

We didn't use any of the hotels facilities, but also we noted that we actually hadn't been told about any of them either.

For a hotel of this standard, I would have expected bottled water to be provided, but this was not the case.

In comparison to other hotels in NYC, this was fairly priced and I would stay again.

title: Splendido soggiorno
text: Ottimo albergo, posizionato in una zona abbastanza tranquilla ma allo stesso tempo vicina alle vie principali. Eccezionale la vista dalle camere che danno sul fiume Hudson e sulla città. Servizio e cortesia eccellenti. Colazione abbastanza variegata e internazionale. Unico difetto a mio modesto parere è la mancanza di un frigo bar in camera. La mia era una stanza deluxe con vista corner ovvero su due lati sita al 32° piano!

title: Great location
text: Stayed here for 4 nights over the weekend and found the hotel to be an oasis in all the madness of New York.  Location was perfect for sightseeing and eating out as we were in walking distance of subway and Times Square.

title: Spotless
text: Prior to the visit we had contact the the reservation manager mr. Goad, how helped to arranged a nice room etc. From check in to check out we only felt polite, warm and friendly staff, which made is feel like home. Location is excellent, short walk from attractions but still far enough away to avoid the crowds and 24/7 noise. We will for sure come back! Thanks all in Hilton One UN plaza :-)

title: Its ok
text:
I’m going to start with the positives of this hotel and that has to be the view from our room, it was so nice to see when we arrived in our room at night! I was traveling alone with my 13yr old son. Also I would rate this as a great location, not far from Grand Central station where you can easily catch the subway. Its also within easy walking distance to the Rockefeller centre and central park. I would say its a quieter location rather than times square and if you walk along you can find cheaper supermarkets and restaurants. 
Ok the negatives, its sooooooooo expensive, don’t buy food or drinks here. I bought a cappuccino and it cost over $5 When we arrived it was late and we had been traveling a very long time due to delays, my son was really hungry so we ordered a pizza, it was $29 and was not very nice, I’m sure it was a frozen pizza and not fresh. Be careful of prices because the tax is added on after.
When we arrived the lady on reception was not very friendly at all or welcoming! Basically got handed my room key, asked me to pay $250 and that was it, no information about the hotel or anything, we were the only people checking in at the time so she wasn’t busy. When we got to our room I had to call to ask about wifi etc, no information about the hotel facilities in the room either. The cleaning isn’t up to scratch, the dust in our room was awful! I went to make a coffee and both the cups were dirty. Felt like it needed a really good hoover and clean. When I bought my one cappuccino there was a lovely friendly member of staff on in the cafe in the lobby, unfortunately I didn’t catch his name. 
If I was to go to New York again I probably wouldn’t go back here in all honesty even though the location and view was pretty good.

title: Surprisingly good
text: I didn't have high hopes of this Hilton, but I was surprised by the quality of rooms, customer service, and breakfast.  The hotel is centrally located - close to the UN but only a short walk from Grand Central station and Lexington Avenue shops.  My room had a stunning view to midtown Manhattan and it was well furnished with a large comfortable bed, tea and coffee making facilities and a modern bathroom.  The breakfast was well stocked with a made to order omelette station.  Overall, I would stay at this hotel again.

title: Stunning hotel, fantastic location
text: Spent six nights at this beautiful hotel situated opposite the United Nations.  Had stunning views over Manhattan, including being able to see the Empire State Building. Extremely friendly and helpful staff.  Great Executive Lounge, first-class service, excellent selection of food. Located about 10 minutes' walk from Grand Central Station.  A tour of the UN is highly recommended! Would definitely stay at Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza when next in NYC.

title: A really good and well located Hilton
text:
Stayed on business at this Hilton for 2 nights. I arrived very late on the first night but used digital check in to my room (3333) so literally walked in, used the lift and in my room under a minute. So easy.
The room was very spacious for a Manhattan hotel and was spotlessly clean and well appointed. Throughout the stay everything was exactly as it should be and on the 33rd floor it was also quiet all night long. Really good views out across midtown Manhattan too.
The location near to Grand Central is helpful and I like the residential nature of this part of town - so much more relaxed than around Times Square.
I used the lounge on the 30th once and it was one of the better I have used - light, great views and well stocked.
Staff were welcoming and helpful at every opportunity.
If I could make one small change it would be to have creamer or milk supplied with the excellent coffee machine.
I will definitely stay here again.

title: Excellent Stay
text:
We stayed at this hotel for 2 days in the middle of october, and it was a wonderful stay. The hotel lobby was very elegantly decorated and everyone was very friendly. The valet was the only off putting person; he was very nice but waited for a tip [and the valet which was the only parking option was very expensive being $80usd per day]. The older gentlemen at the bell desk was AMAZING, i wish i remembered his name, he gave us the "nickel and dime tour" as he called it of NYC as it was our first visit to the city. 
Our room was a deluxe room with 2 double beds.The room was spotless, the bed linens and towels very also very plush and clean. The view from our room was of the United Nations Headquarters and of the water and Queens, fantastic view!!! The bathroom was also a very good size, quite spacious infact and the shower was massive!! The room overall was quite a good size! The hotel felt safe, and was well maintained. It also wasn't too far from Times Square being about a 10 minute Uber or taxi ride!

title: Hilton One Un Plaza
text:
Fantastic hotel, however the service overall was poor.

When checking in we were given no information about the available airport transfer which would have been very helpful to us.

We weren't given any information about where gym facilities were or anything about breakfast/dinner timings.

I made a request for room decorations as this was our honeymoon. I was told this would be done, however when arriving to the room, this was not completed.

Small issues, however when you spend over $600 for two nights stay, you deserve and expect better.

title: Great Visit
text: A very good 4 day visit during a family trip to NYC for a wedding.  The hotel management are really attentive and helpful at all times.  The room views are great, the rooms in good condition.  Executive Lounge in west tower on 30th floor is a bit dated and the offer limited compared to other hotels with executive lounges but still great to have such a facility in an NYC hotel.  Abu and Nabil (breakfast waiters) were particularly nice.

title: Quick Birthday Trip
text:
It was a quick birthday trip, and our first to NYC, so, we had little expectations regarding location and "value".  I called ahead asking for a bottle of champagne in the room for my boyfriends birthday.  The guy on the phone was very nice and funny, and assured me he would do so, and asked extra personal questions about the birthday, making me feel like the Hilton would be extra special....  Never happened.  Pretty bummed regardless.  

The room was clean, nice, big, the beds and pillows very comfy.  The room was legit.  I appreciated this home away from home. 

Location is hard to say, as we were not native NYC, and wouldn't know a good location, as it is very dependent on your trip.  I will say we were 2 easy blocks from Grand Central Station, and easy to get a cab at any time.  

DO NOT BUY ANYTHING FROM THE COFFEE SHOP UNLESS YOU ARE WILLING TO SELL YOUR CHILD FOR IT.  2 REGULAR SODAS, A MINI CHEESECAKE, AND MINI CHAMPAGNE OF NO LABEL WERE 57 DOLLARS!

2 LATTES AND 2 EGG SANDWICHES WERE 45 DOLLARS.  

Yes, we were dumb to pay this but we did it separately, without telling each other, because we were very embarrassed at our idiocy.

title: Not all Hilton’s are created equal
text: So this Hilton is situated in a very nice location— UN Plaza and 45th St. ( for those unfamiliar with the City it is Mid-town East side) The lobby is very nice. The room is rather generous given that you are in Manhattan.  I did not like the corridors at all.  The carpet was gray and burnt orange squares and the walls were prison gray- Very depressing. I also wasn’t very impressed with the Ambassador Grill.  The people at the desk and other staff were great.  Rooms - clean.  So it was all in all a good place, just don’t know what the fuss was about as far as decor...totally not impressed.

title: Great Stay
text: Very easy to get to by subway or car. Across the road from the UN. Close to great places to eat. Check in and check out was seamless. Extremely clean room and great service. I recommend it to anyone looking to stay near midtown.

title: Gute Lage, tolle Aussicht auf den East River
text: Gute Lage, tolle Aussicht auf den East River; Service top u zuvorkommend; Zimmer u Bad für New Yorker Verhältnisse relativ geräumig; Zimmerpreis für EZ relativ teuer - Kategorie nicht unbedingt mit europäischen Spitzenhotels vergleichbar (in dieser Preisklasse ohne Frühstück). Trotzdem empfehlenswert.

title: Wonderful views, kind and helpful bell, concierge & coffee shop staff!
text:
I stayed for a week. It was a wonderful experience. Close to so many things. I really loved the room and the view was spectacular. I realized how non sound proof the walls were when I heard my neighbor but luckily, for the most part, everyone was thoughtful and quiet. 

The bell staff took very good care of me on my last day when I had a big project to finish and needed their assistance finding boxes from Fed Ex and getting them to me ASAP in the morning as well as  carrying everything down. There were some time constraints and they helped it run smoothly. They got me off to the airport in time. 

The coffee and pastry shop staff was wonderful as well. Wonderful cappuccino and an easy grab and go breakfast or lunch!

Housekeeping was spot on- not one thing out of place. 

Front desk was helpful and accommodating too. 

Thank you, Hilton UN Millennium!

title: Nice rooms - Honors Lounge personnel are excellent, evening Hilton Honors fare so-so.
text: Stay here 3+ times per month on business. Lots to like including spacious rooms with a view of the Chrysler Building or East river. Front Desk staff is pleasant and efficient as is the Honors lounge staff. Breakfast in Honors Lounge (30th fl) is cold buffet. Cereal and fresh fruit + hard boiled egg and pastry + coffee is fine. Hot breakfast is in Ambassador restaurant off lobby is very good if you have a little more time. My only suggestion is to up their game on the evening Honors Lounge fare. It has been cheese and fruit platter + veggie platter + chicken wings and empanadas for months and months. The view is great and the staff super nice. A little imagination with the appetizers would be nice and very much appreciated by your loyal Hilton honors guests.

title: Awesome location
text: This Hotel is updated and in a great location for my stay in New York.  The staff is amazing from the front desk staff, house keeping, and the Concierge service.  They have security dogs at the entrance 24/7. It is easy to obtain a Taxi as well if needed.

title: "WE WILL MAKE THINGS RIGHT"
text:
The Millenium Hilton is a luxury property located near the United Nations Building, & a short walk to Grand Central Station and many other subway stops.

We were visiting our son in NY, and had a 3 day stay here.

Having booked a corner room with a view of the river, we were shown to our charming room, with great views.

Only when we had unpacked, did we start to notice some problems.
Dust on the table pedestal & window sills, children's finger prints on the window glass, luke warm shower water, the bathroom sink would not drain, some bulbs were burnt out, the bedside clock was broken and the TV was very dark & unwatchable at night.

All of these faults are fairly minor, but when added together became more serious!

A sign at the Reception says that they will make right any problems.
We reported the various problems to Susan at reception, & found her to be most helpful and empathetic.
All we wanted was for the problems in our room to be fixed, but instead we were given the remaining 2 nights in a 2-level suite.
She did try to "make things right"

The suite was very tired, with old brown carpeting, and there were cigarette burns on both bedside tables.

There were 2 small bathrooms, 1 with a shower, & the other with a bath tub.
Both had a single sink, & modern square fixtures.

Unfortunately there was no full length mirror, & no coffee cups beside the coffee maker. It was small details like these that made us think that no supervisors were giving final approval before guests were moved in to each room.

In both rooms the beds were super comfortable, although there was no night time turn down service. Different pillow types are available.

Security too was excellent. To gain access to any floor, the room key had to be swiped, & WIFI is free.

Some rooms are newly renovated, but many are not!

Our feeling was that this potential 5* hotel was being managed in a 'Hit & Miss' fashion, & didn't deserve a higher rating at this time.

title: NYC trip
text: business trip to nyc convenient location on east side.  maintenance needed on facade.  staff are fabulous and rooms are very clean.  tech is spotty at times (wifi and cable service).  fitness center recently updated.

title: Best hotel staff in New York City
text: Since they transitioned to Hilton I have stayed at the Millennium Hotel a number of times and the experience has always been consistent. In addition to having a great location, view, and amenities – their staff is the best in New York. They go above and beyond their duties as a hospitality team and make you feel like family. Sylvia L. represents all the qualities of their incredible front desk team. Always welcoming, always willing to help, and always brightening our day. Frank, Ozzie, Aimsley (sp?),Paul, Vince, Robert, Joey, and the rest of the Bell Desk are guaranteed to make your stay as easy and pleasant as possible. Their collective personalities make this hotel SPECIAL. I've never been to a hotel where the General Manager is so closely aligned with their guests. Stefan does not hide out in his office, but regularly engages people staying at the hotel to make sure they are completely taken care of. Imagine hosting all of the World Leaders, their staff, and security personnel for an entire week every year during UNGA. These guys are battle tested and the best in the business. Can't forget to shoutout the Executive Lounge and Cafe staff either.

title: Solid hotel, great views, pretty good lounge
text:
Solid hotel with large rooms and great views. The East tower seems more dated than the West tower but both offer decently large rooms that are clean. One caution about rooms in the east tower: the mini refrigerator is in the middle of a wall, across from a mirror, and has a bright LED light that is always on (thus illuminating the room). I unplugged mine to turn the light off. 

The beds are comfortable and the bathrooms, for the most part, are updated and clean. The tv selection is quite good (hbo go is a huge plus).  The fitness center isn’t huge for the size of the hotel but has great equipment. 

The lounge in the west tower has the best views in the city—you can see all of Midtown/downtown, LIC, UN, bridges, etc. The food is extremely boring but the staff is so, so friendly and attentive. 

The lobby can be understaffed at peak times. Staff is somewhat friendly but not particularly warm. Elevators can be very messed up (I can’t tell you the number of times I’ve stepped into an elevator on the west side to have the doors close and the elevator not move). 

Overall this hotel is solid and not a bad choice.

title: Took our breath away!
text:
Wow.......I travelled with my 2 daughters to celebrate 21st and 18th birthdays, and to go to Elsie fest in Central park. We booked a two bed suite. On arrival to the suite, we were blown away by the space and the view, the room on the 38th floor was stunning and we could have sat there all day in the lounge area looking at the city view from one side of the room and the un plaza and the river from the other side!  Laying in bed in the smaller bedroom next to the floor to ceiling windows almost felt like you were flying over Manhattan. 
A lovely gesture of wine, cards and cakes as well for my girls’ birthdays - thank you Hilton. 
As a travel agent I will certainly be recommending this hotel to my clients wishing to have a hotel in a great location, just a few minutes walk to grand central station made it so easy to get around.

title: Amazing view!
text: This was my second stay at Millennium Hilton UN Plaza and I had an amazing time!  The room was huge, modern and luxurious, with a super comfy bed and nice bathroom.  The staff were very friendly and helpful.  The hotel is just a 10 minute walk from Grand Central Station, so it’s easy to get around the city.  The best part is the views! Stunning views of midtown, especially at night! The Empire State Building, Chrysler Building its just beautiful. I will definitely be back!

title: Average NYC Stay
text:
Underwhelmed by this place. 

Best part? The bellman taking our bags before check-in. Super enthusiastic, hospitable, and remembered us 6 hours later. 

Cons:  Lobby is small and underwhelming. Was walked in on unannounced, no knock, by cleaning staff. Received two spam calls meant for "hotel staff" at odd hours. No complimentary bottle of water or room service menu. Yet, when I said I didn't have a menu and wanted an alcoholic beverage, i wasn't given a price and felt grossly overcharged afterward. Nothing BAD, but just inferior service for a Hilton.

title: Customer Satisfaction Still Counts!
text:
My wife and I recently stayed at the Millennium Hilton UN Plaza while in New York for business.  The hotel confirmed beforehand that they offered valet parking services for a reasonable fixed daily rate; more on this later in the review.  While we were acknowledged by reception as being Diamond Members, it was only after requested that a room upgrade was offered.  Unfortunately, this lack of acknowledging Diamond program benefits at check-in seems to be fast becoming the norm across Hilton properties.
