The upgraded higher floor room was incredible.  In comparison to the size of a typical New York City hotel room, this was more than double the space.  The floor to ceiling window view from the room of the nearby Chrysler Building was amazing and truly memorable.  Furnishings in the room were modern and comfortable, and the touchscreen electronic lighting and air conditioner controls were quite impressive.  One strange note to the room was that it had absolutely no overhead or lamp lighting near the oversized desk.  The bathroom was huge with a fully tiled and glass walk-in shower.

Our visit to the Executive Lounge was truly uninspiring.  The lounge was open for evening refreshments and lite food for another 30 minutes when we got there on a Saturday night only to be greeted with a warning of the closing time.  A minimal selection of alcoholic beverages is available for a charge, with only soda, coffee and tea being complimentary.  The food selection was truly spartan as most of the serving trays were empty.  We questioned the lounge staff and were once again reminded that they were closing in 25 minutes.  I am sorry but you are either open or closed and we were left to feel like we were imposing on the staff.  After a few crackers and celery sticks, we left in disgust.

The next morning was a spectacular contrast to the night before.  Breakfast in the restaurant downstairs was top shelf.  The many selections on the buffet were fresh and well-stocked.  My wife ordered an egg white vegetable omelette that looked and tasted outstanding.  The service was extremely professional and our table was very well attended to.

Now getting back to the valet parking.  At checkout, I was informed that there would be an extra $24 fee for oversized vehicle added to my bill.  I informed the front desk that my vehicle was actually a 'compact SUV' and in no way oversized.  After some back and forth between the front desk, the third party parking service and myself, they removed the charge and printed my receipt.

The following day my credit card was alerted to a single charge of $24 from Hilton which initiated over a week and a half of back and forth attempts at resolution with the local Hilton staff who offered no more than an acknowledgement of the charge.

Now for the happy ending.  I was finally able to get my issue escalated beyond the billing department and spoke with Patrick the Reservations Manage at Millenium Hilton UN.  Patrick immediately acknowledged my Diamond loyalty to Hilton and listened to the series of events leading to the call.  Patrick saw my experience as a training opportunity for some of the local staff and offered to refund the parking charges in full.  Customer satisfaction is sometimes a difficult task and you never get a second chance at a first impression.  Patrick was instrumental in turning my experience at Millenium Hilton UN from a strong negative to a positive.  I am now looking forward to staying at the Millenium Hilton UN on my next trip to the city.

title: Amazing view from 3027
text: Arrived this past Friday at noon and was curtly told my room wouldn’t be ready until 4:00. Killed some time by taking a walk, which wasn’t easy since I have issues with my ankle. The front desk told me they’d call me on my cell when the room was ready. No one did. At 3:45, I approached the desk and asked if it was ready and it was. I had booked a king corner room and the view was spectacular: East River, Freedom Tower, Chrysler Building and Empire State Building, which was lit up orange and blue for the New York Islanders home opener. Really didn’t want to leave the room...totally worth the wait! I did take off one point for the indifference of the staff; they weren’t very friendly at all.

title: Comfortable hotel, awesome view, good spot
text:
I visited New York for five days, together with a friend. The location of the Milennium Hilton we found to be very nice! It's in close proximity to Fifth Avenue, Central Park and Grand Central Station. Also, it's just a 10 minute walk to the closest boat stop on East River (East 34th Street); this is practical if you want to go to Brooklyn or Williamsburg. 

We got a room on the 32nd floor. (It seems like the hotel floors start from floor 28). This means that you - most likely - will get a room with a view. We had a room facing south, with a magnificent view of East River and Manhattan. From my bed, I had a clear view of Empire State Building, which is quite a sight during night! 

The beds were very good, as were the bathroom facilities. Housekeeping always left our room tidy and well cleaned. 

On the minus side:
Reception staff treated us a bit indifferent on arrival. So, the welcome was not the best. (However, this seems to be the norm at many hotels in New York City.)

The playlist at the hotel bar downstairs was totally out of place, taken into consideration that you are at a hotel next to the UN. The music made us feel that we were at a bad 90s party. 

On the plus side: 
-good beds
-marvellous views!
-nice bathroom 
-good housekeeping!
-very welcoming and friendly bell boys! (Compensated for the sourly welcome)

All in all, I'd stay here again.

title: Incredible service paired with a quality product
text: When arriving at the property we were met by Barry at the Front Desk. He was extremely welcoming and friendly. He made the check-in experience quick and easy. From there every employee we encountered was polite and greeted us with a genuine smile. Our room had an incredible view and was in great condition. We only experienced amazing things during our stay

title: Thank You
text: I really enjoyed my stay. The rooms are spacious with amazing views. The breakfast is heavenly. My favorite spot was the coffee shop. This is by far my favorite coffee shop in Midtown East. The coffee is so good and the staff their are very professional and friendly, especially Wendy and Tatiana. This Coffee shop makes the stay at the hotel just perfect. Its also ideal for meetings. Just get your coffee from there and sit at the lobby or at the stools in the shop.

title: Ottimo
text:
Approdata con la famiglia in questo hotel per caso, sono rimasta piacevolmente sorpresa.
Situato sull'east river, di fronte al palazzo dell'Onu, è in posizione tranquilla, ma con tutti i servizi necessari nelle vicinanze. La camera ampia e confortevole, situata al 36mo piano, con vista meravigliosa sull'Empire e il Chrisler Building, era molto pulita, fornita di macchina per il caffè, minifrigo e una capiente cabina armadio.
Una breve passeggiata e si raggiunge la stazione della metropolitana. Nelle vicinanze possibilità di mangiare per tutte le tasche, dalla colazione alla cena.
Un disguido avvenuto in fase di check-in è stato prontamente risolto dalla signora Martinez, pertanto posso dire che l’attenzione per gli ospiti è senz’altro al primo posto, con un eccellente servizio clienti.
Sicuramente un hotel da consigliare e in cui tornerò volentieri in un futuro viaggio a New York.

title: good location
text: nice hotel right next to the wtc so good place to stay if you are wanting to do things up in that area. room was clean, fair sized, staff was nice. hotel needs to work on a few of the little things that guest need, first the business center at least in the early morning was difficult to work with, computers were very slow or did not work at all and as it has an indoor pool and I am one who enjoys swimming and the reason we booked it, as they provide staff when pool is open to be a "lifeguard" they need to make sure they have this person there on time! over our weekend stay when they open later at 7, for us that are early risers and then need to get on with our days activities this is important, unfortunately this did not happen even after multiple calls to the desk and being assured there would be someone there in 5 minutes or so and several people waiting to get in by 735 I finally gave up and proceeded with my days activities. it may not seem like a large thing with all of the hustle and bustle but for the customers using your hotel they are important details

title: Excellent
text: Comme à chaque voyage aux USA le décalage horaire se fait sentir, vers 7 heures un dimanche matin il n'y a pas grand chose d'ouvert. Comme nous étions au one WTC nous avons décidé d'aller y prendre un petit déjeuner. Service grande classe, un buffet excellent et un confort intérieur irréprochable. Nous avons grandement apprécié ce moment  de détente et de confort.

title: ❤️ don’t believe the bad reviews
text:
This hotel was amazing!! Close proximity to everything and to top it off the room was huge! We visited our families rooms in other hotels and there’s were tiny in comparison! 

Great value for money and our trip was amazing!!

title: Wonderful Hotel
text:
I am a regular visitor to NYC and the Millennium Hotel at the UN truly stands out as exceptional. The level of service is outstanding and every interaction is one that continues to exceed expectations. 

Sylvia, at the Front Desk, is especially impressive. Her constant willingness to go above and beyond truly makes me think of the Millennium as my home away from home. 

I give the hotel my strongest approval and recommend it to anyone needing a room at or near the United Nations in Manhattan.

title: 밀레니엄 힐튼 브랜드의 명성에 먹칠을 한 곳
text:
뉴욕 방문시 가장 최악의 호텔. 3성급보다 못한 서비스.
리셉션의 응대는 매우 사무적이고 딱딱함.
벨맨은 고객이 캐리어를 끌고가도 아무 신경도 안씀.
2박 3일동안 로비 문한번 열어주는 직원을 보지 못했음
욕조에서 녹물이 나와서 안나올때까지 한참을 틀어놓았음
뷰때문에 코너룸을 예약하였으나 창문이 통창이 아니고 높이가 낮아 개방감이 들지는 않음
창밖으로 보이는 뷰는 아주 훌륭함. 하지만, 뷰말고 만족스러운 부분은 없었음.
박당 40만원이 넘는 수준은 전혀 아닌것으로 보임
밀레니엄 힐튼 브랜드가 아까운 호텔

title: Skyline
text: I had a wonderful stay at the Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza. The welcoming staff (Shane, Liam, Brian and Sylvia) were very professional and helpful. Llany was exceptional at the Skyline. He made me feel special.

title: An all around yes!
text: I am so very glad I stayed here. Upon check in late Friday 9/20, I was greeted by Raquel. She was very efficient checking me in. I requested a room with a view if possible and she delivered. Views are spectacular here! They were so good, I left the blinds open so I could catch the sunrise. The room was spacious for NYC accommodations and very nicely decorated. I loved all the lighting options available as well, esp for putting on my makeup. The person who worked overnight was able to point us in the direction of wine a block away (thank you). All around, the staff is what will make me return to this hotel. They were all very nice- housekeeping, front desk, the bell men, the Reservations Manager. All a big thank you. It was also super cool to hear that I was staying at the safest hotel in the World due to the UNs General Assembly. Being a manager at a hotel myself, I knew what to look for and I found it all here.

title: Beatiful view but uncomfortable double beds
text:
We stayed in this hotel in August 2019 for four nights. Our room was on 30th floor with the panoramic view on United Nations building, lower Manhattan as well as Chrysler and Empire Buildings. We booked two double beds room for four guests.
All was okay: big room, cleanliness, good bathroom, even toilet bowl with heating and automatic control. The only disadvantage was the size of two beds in the room. The width of each of them was only 120 cm that is 1.5 size bed instead of double bed which were declared.
For this reason it was very uncomfortable to sleep on beds. We were very tired sleeping during nights.
It is necessary to take into account for travellers when booking rooms with two double beds for three and more people.

title: Perfect
text: Stayed here for 6 nights. very spacious, beyond comfortable, exceptionally clean, perfectly quiet, fantastic views of the East river. Great location. Less than 5 minutes walk to grand central,(subway-which we recommend the use of.$33 for 7 days) Friendly staff.Couldn't fault it whatsoever.We would highly recommended.

title: Hilton
text: An extraordinary hotel as location and services. Quick access to Time Sqare, Central Park and Empire and many other tourist attractions. It was an amazing holiday for us and I am sure we will return to New York and here again. Thank you Hilton!

title: Millennium Hilton One UN,NY
text: An extraordinary hotel with an amazing view on the Hudson river! The accommodation and hotel staff were of the highest quality 👍. In my opinion the best hotel in Manhattan! I would definitely recommend!

title: Lovely
text:
Great hotel with great views of the Hudson. Nice quiet area with good local shops and easy access to Grand Cebtral Station just a few blocks away. 
Coffee shop in the lobby is handy but a bit expensive

title: Millennium UN- great value great service
text: Vintage, super friendly classic New York Manhattan but without all the hustle and bustle. Coffee shop is amazing. River view rooms are incredible- view of Long island Roosevelt Island and the UN building and grounds. Gym is top notch- overlooking the river. I’ve stayed in many hotels for work in NYC and keep coming back to this one because of its charm!

title: Valuable Place to stay!!
text: The Hotel is located close to the UN HQ and at the same time you're almost in the middle of Manhattan. The Hotel is really recommendable and the service is excellent and customer related. The lounge is very narrow but the rooms are comfortable and very clean. The overnight price is compare to other places a bit too high.

title: A Real Letdown
text:
As a Hilton Honors Gold Member I stay in Hilton Hotels all over the world. We had been really looking forward to our NY stay and given the price we paid we were expecting top quality. Unfortunately this hotel is decidedly average through and through. The lobby area has an unwelcoming environment and the reception staff always seemed disinterested and bored, never looking up to say hello or greet guests.  

Our room on the 35th floor was fine but it was the supporting amenities that disappointed. We had access to the Skyline Club lounge on the 30th floor but the lounge was very poor. Breakfast was served in there daily but again this was of limited quality and choice. The air temperature was always very cold in there too so it  wasn't exactly a comfortable, relaxing environment.  

I doubt I'd consider staying in a Millennium Hilton branded hotel again in future.

title: 満足です
text: 国連の真正面でマンハッタンにしては静かです。一泊しただけですが、今まで周辺で泊まった同クラスの中でも部屋やスタッフの対応も良いように思いました。

title: Expensive and underwhelming
text:
Overall a well maintained mature hotel ideally located for UN business. In fact it very much has the feel of a business hotel which is reflected in the prices (I paid over £600/$750 with a weekend discount)for three nights to get a perspective...note it's a 15 minute walk to the nearest subway,which is Grand Central.
This was a vacation trip with my son. We are both diamond members, but that cuts little ice at the Millennium UN -
Check in : less than warm. No early check in.
Room: clean with great tv, Inc Netflix but the room felt dated and the beds were not comfortable.. Worst of all was the room faced the other wing of the hotel directly opposite other guest bedrooms. There were however side views of the Hudson.
Lounge : Friendly staff. However only coffee and tea are free with limited snacks. The worst part was charging $8 for a beer !  Underwhelming and disappointing.
Breakfast: below average in quality, fresh fruit not replaced . We kept being presented with a bill for $86 for two people, then being told it was our job to remind staff breakfast is comp. 15% gratuity included 'for our convenience did feel injected some humour into the whole experience. Bear in mind this is a buffet breakfast..!
Check out : late check out is 1pm for diamonds and you can get 3pm for $75 otherwise full price .
Without status you will be out by 11am and be looking at a very expensive breakfast.
Hilton like to talk about the Hilton family. This place was all about the business and if you are on expenses and working nearby it's a viable option. I will be looking elsewhere next trip..

title: Ultimate Hotel Accommodations At The Millennium Hilton 1 U.N. Plaza
text:
Unequaled, unprecedented service by any hotel staff that made the Ultimate Stay for our friends and for my wife and me!!

Special thanks to Patrick, the Reservations Manager, for going overboard to make accommodations set for royalty, totally unexpected!

My wife and I stayed here during Christmas and was treated wonderfully along with great accommodations, so when we decided to bring our friends for their first NYC visit there was only one choice, The Millennium Hilton 1 UN Plaza Hotel.

We made our reservations early and asked for rooms near each other with great views and higher floors.  City views, especially the Chrysler Building are very important to us.

As arrival time neared I contacted the hotel staff several times and was treated with so much courtesy and respect, just more confirmation we chose the best hotel.

We arrived a day ahead of our friends and again contacted Patrick, who so graciously went way beyond hopes or expectations by accommodating our friends in a corner suite, which had the best city and East River views.  Patrick’s hard work and magic made our friends’ stay extra special.  In fact, they are planning their next trip because of their special accommodations and exceptional service.  

I want to recognize Patrick and EVERY staff member with whom we came in contact!  Everyone displayed genuine interest and concern for our needs and desires!

Thank you!  Thank you!

I encourage everyone who plans a trip to New York to make the Millennium Hilton 1 UN Plaza their hotel for their stay.

title: Molto buono
text: Bellissime le stanze, soprattutto quelle con vista (noi alloggiavamo al piano 38 nella camera angolare vista città). Competente e disponibile il personale. Un po’ imprecisi nella pulizia delle stanze.

title: Buono, piccole cose da migliorare.
text:
Abbiamo soggiornato in questo hotel in occasione delle nostre vacanze a NYC.
nel complesso buono, vista spettacolare, e locali molto ampi, pulizia delle camere buona e camere discrete, bagno ok con doccia super.
Unica cosa, receptionist scorbutiche con neanche un sorriso, e unico neo pulizie della camera un giorno non effettuata alle 18 di sera, alle mie rimostranze, neanche una scusa, ma alla reception ribattevano dicendo che avevano tempo fino all 20.00.
Bastava dire che avevano avuto qualche problema, e tutti capivano ed accettavano l'accaduto, ma rispondere in modo scorbutico ed in quel modo non mi sembrava il caso.
nella media, comunque ottimo posto vicino a tutto.
migliorate i rapporti reception/clienti e sarete il massimo, anche sé siete grandi, il cliente è sempre un cliente.

title: Прекрасно!
text: Прекрасное расположение, потрясающий вид из окна на Эмпайр и башню Крайслер. Номер просторный, чистый, убирали каждый день. Я прям от души рекомендую! Мы первый раз были в Нью Йорке и нам хотелось чтобы отель был хорошим. Единственное, нам 3 дня не могли принести бокалы в номер. Мы звонили, спускались в лобби и напоминали, но их так и не принесли. Но этот факт никак не повлиял на наше впечатление об отеле в целом

title: Si puo’ fare di piu’
text:
Sentimenti ambivalenti su questo hotel Hilton che mi aveva creato delle aspettative elevate.
Prima sera ci assegnano una stanza con il rumore del vano ascensore improponibile. Dopo aver fatto le nostre rimostranze, il supervisor molto cortesemente ci assegna una stanza in upgrade solo per quella notte, meravigliosa. Con un panorama mozzafiato. Le notti successive ci assegnano la stanza giusta, carina ma per due sere consecutive portano letteralmente un terzo letto dentro la stanza, nel senso che lo tolgono la mattina e lo riportano la sera. Chiedo le pantofole che non arriveranno mai. Chiedo le bottiglie d’acqua come Hilton Silver member (2 per soggiorno) e mi si risponde come se le avessi gia’ chieste altre volte e mi stessi approfittando della situazione. Insomma, nel complesso il servizio reception non mi e’ sembrato particolarmente efficiente e soprattutto il personale in 4 casi su 6 mi ha risposto in modo poco garbato e paziente. Sorrisi neanche a parlarne. Peccato perche’ le stanze sono belle e l’ hotel merita una visita.

title: great hotel, great service
text: Had a very pleasant stay here.  Great location, located across the street from UN Plaza.  The rooms were spacious.  Great view from the hotel room (side note, this would be a great hotel to watch fireworks).  Friendly staff, especially the cute bomb sniffling dog employed by the hotel.  The lounge has good food and a nice refuge for drinks and afternoon snacks.  Highly recommend this hotel

title: Wonderful stay at Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
text: If you are going to New York and want to be near the UN then the Millennium Hilton New York UN Plaza is the place to stay.  Since the guest rooms are only on upper floors there are great views.  The rooms are clean and laid out very efficiently, and the staff was helpful.  Also, there is an inviting lobby to use as a meeting area.

title: Poorly Handled Check In
text:
I am staying at the hotel for a week and had pre registered the night before as my flight was getting in at 0700 and wanted access to my room.  Arrived to be told as I didn’t confirm before 2am they sold it!  Even though I was on a  19 hour flight!  Poorly handled by the reception who told me to “wait to speak to the manager and he couldn’t get the guests out of the rooms any earlier!” And worse - maybe I could get some compensation!!  3 hours later I finally get to my room.  You can do better than this Hilton!  Very disappointing start and poor service attitude. Let’s hope the week gets better!
Tried to send message on Hilton honours website but it doesn’t recognise you if you’re not from the USA!

title: Disappointing start
text:
We arrived at the hotel at 8.30pm after a long flight. We went to check in, told the lady on check in we had 2 rooms booked, she told us we only had 1 so I got my booking confirmation out and handed it to her. She then disappeared out the back with no explanation, we waited over 10 minutes and I did ask the man on reception what the problem was, he was very rude replying she is sorting it and carried on looking at his computer screen! Do feel after waiting so long he could have gone to find out what was going on! Lady eventually came back and gave us 4 key cards, 2 for each room no explanation or apology. Despite this the rest of the staff were excellent, very helpful and friendly. Hotel in a good location, rooms were pleasant and the small shop was great for a quick breakfast snack. 

Hilton, teach your reception staff some manners please! they are one of the first point of contacts and are letting the rest of your team down.

title: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plasa
text:
Lovely hotel, the hotel staff were very friendly and helpful.  The breakfast unless you pre book with room or have Hilton Honors is quite expensive at $40 per head. But
They do have a small shop that sells coffee and pastries etc if you want a quick bite. The only reason I dis not give an excellent score was we used the hotel bar on a couple of occasions and one of the bar staff made my husband and I uncomfortable, he was just very unapproachable, not what you expect of a bar person.

title: NYC Trip
text: Great trip! Loved the location and all of the amenities. The breakfast spot had great quick morning fare and excellent coffee. The restaurant was incredible, great wine selection, terrific food and a killer breakfast buffet!

title: Terrific!
text: Wonderful! Location was incredible and the staff were all top notch. We would absolutely stay again and hope to in the near future. Really liked the sky lounge (forget the exact name). Views were great!

title: MEGLIO NON RIPETERE
text: tempi in cui vengono rassettate le camere inadeguati. In una circostanza dopo ns sollecito, ciò è avvenuto alle 17.30 e in un altra abbiamo rinunciato dopo che alle 18.10 la camera non era ancora stata pulita e sistemata

title: Great staff, beautiful room, outrageous views
text: We stayed here last night and had a great stay.   We were upgraded to a king suite, room 3131.   The room was beautiful.   View of the UN, downtown, Chrysler and Empire State Buildings.  Was a nice touch as a Diamond member to get a full buffet breakfast with an omelette station .    Check in and check out was easy and the team members were very nice.  Highly recommend

title: Excelente servicio y gran comodidad.
text: La habitación resultó super cómoda con el agregado de una excepcional vista. El servicio fue impecable y el personal siempre atento y dispuesto. La ubicación es particularmente conveniente para viaje de negocios o por placer.

title: Excelente
text: Sin duda volvería a este hotel. A 7 minutos de la estación Grand Central donde salen la mayoría de conexiones.Habitación impecable! No dispone de piscina. Hay una tienda de tro del hotel para comprar cualquier cosa de comer/beber. Atención personal perfecta.

title: Great Location
text: This hotel has a perfect location opposite to UNICEF offices and the UN Plaza. Walking distance from the hotel, there good Restaurants. This is a perfect choice in Manhattan if you are there on business.

title: Excellent Service from Reservations Department at Hilton One UN Plaza
text: I have been a frequent visitor for over 25 years to this hotel, which is by far my favourite when staying in NY.  My almost entirely positive feelings towards this establishment were confirmed on my most recent stay.  Due to circumstances beyond my control I had to postpone by two days my arrival in the city.  Even though the booking was non-refundable and I was quite happy to accept this, the reservations manager at the hotel changed my booking and informed me that as the hotel was fully booked they could benefit from having a room freed up for two nights and so they would waive the charge for the two nights in question.  I mention this example because the Hilton would have been justified to have charged me but staff used their discretion to treat me as a guest not just a source of revenue.  Obviously, in the long run satisfied and happy customers will bring far more benefit for the hotel than the two nights they could have charged.  Sadly in my experience too many hotels do not play it in this honourable way and focus solely only on the short term.

title: Good price for a prime location
text: The front and location of this hotel is 5 stars, super close to the WTC and the R Metro line, great for going to the upper town, Korea Town and others. 10 minutes to the Fulton Station for JFK airport. Inside is kind of old and not maintained. Even we had cleaners visited everyday but very dusty on the furniture. Shower water pressure is terrible and they have the smallest shower head I have never seen at a Hilton hotel.

title: A well located hotel for visiting NYC
text:
We booked this hotel for our visit to New York due to its fantastic price and location. The hotel was approximately 10 minutes walk from Grand Central Terminal and the hotel has lots of amenities around.

The hotel was excellent and the whole experience of the hotel was great.

The check in to the hotel was easy, and the staff were extremely friendly and helped with any questions we had regarding our stay.

The room itself was spacious, the bed comfy and the view (corner king room) was incredible and worth the extra cost to experience the skyline's sun rise. The facilities provided were as expected for the hotel, which including an iron, safe, ironing board and a hair dryer. The housekeeping team did an excellent job in keeping the room extremely clean and changed the linen on a daily basis.

Upon check out, the hotel stored our bags due to the time of our flight, and this was extremely helpful, as having to carry the bags round New York would not have been great. 

Once we had collected our bags, a member of staff helpfully flagged down a taxi for us to take us to JFK for the flight back.

We would thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting New York.

title: Excellent location, service and views!
text: I love this hotel and stay as often as possible when visiting NYC. The location is perfect with close access to the subway to go anywhere in the city! The views of the city and river are beautiful. The staff is so attentive and kind, and the rooms are more spacious than most other city hotels.

title: average with some flaws
text:
I’ve been there for a short weekend in New York.
I checked-in very early and the room was not ready. I can’t complaint about that, since staff assigned me a room as soon as they could. 
Location I really nice. Rooms have amazing view over UN building, the Hudson river and the midtown as well.
Rooms are mid-size, quite well furnished with a king size bed and a chaise-longue to enjoy the view from the window. 
Said that, windows are quite narrow and I did expect something more. 
Bathroom is pretty small, very average, nothing to talk about. Toiletries from Evelyne and Crab. 

Service is pretty anonymous. Staff does its job without any interest in you. None of them is really dedicated to you, neither tries to anticipate your needs. 
As a gold member, while I got the benefits related to the tier, no one really recognized my status or made me feel really welcome. 
This is an area where the management should work hard. 

Club Lounge is old, and I mean old: it stinks, spaces are narrow and all the things saw better times. Breakfast In the lounge is just sub-par. Nothing you’d fancy of when you think of Hilton. 
But breakfast in the restaurant (which – by the way – costs 10$ for the upgrade as gold member) is not that better: located in the basement, while staff is ok, food selection is quite limited and could be definitely better in terms of quality. 

As a final note, on my folio I discovered I was mistakenly charged 2 times for the breakfast. As none gave me the receipt on check -out (they send it to you via e-mail), when I read it on my mobile I was surprised. I know mistakes may occur, so I promptly email them about the matter. 
Luckily they were more than professional in fixing it. 

It’s a pity, because the hotel is ideally located and has some very good things, but all this made my stay very mediocre and I don’t think I will stay there again.

title: Superb service, excellent comfort
text:
If you have any reason whatsoever to stay in NYC, the only place worthy of staying is the Millennium Hilton here at One UN Plaza. Personally, I was taking the weekend away to celebrate achieving some goals of mine; the Millennium Hilton made this celebration one to remember. Upon arrival which was late in the evening, the front desk agent Adina was very friendly, warm and welcoming to me; she saw that I was waiting in line and even though she must have just begun her shift and was logging in, she called me over to her desk and helped check me in. The overnight front office manager Stanley was also at the desk and greeted me kindly and enthusiastically. Come to find out, the reservations manager Patrick had upgraded my room to the Hemstead Suite - I guess he saw that I listed “celebration” as the reason for my stay when booking my queen room and really wanted me to have a celebratory experience! The Suite was immaculate and exquisite from the moment I entered the door. Two floors connected by staircase in the room with a gorgeous chandelier, double master baths each with extra large showers, spacious living room area, and the king bed on the room’s second floor with nearly floor-to-ceiling windows overlooking southern Manhattan and the East River, with direct sight of Freedom Tower/One World Trade. An amenity of wine and a handwritten card from Patrick were waiting for me in the suite wishing me a great celebratory stay; Patrick and his team went above and beyond servicing me as a guest and making sure my time in the city was enjoyable. Access to the lounge was also a part of the surprise upgrade, and I loved all of the options available. I went with the continental breakfast, but even so, the selection of muffins, pastries, beverages and other items was wide ranging and nothing was lacking. Eating breakfast in the lounge with a great view down 44th Street has its perks too.

Again, this hotel is really where you want to stay if you have any reason to be in NYC. It’s within the UN complex, and with that brings a level of stature and presence that conveys “I’m here, I’m important, and I’m going to have a great stay”. Transit access is easy - just a 10 minute walk straight down 44th Street leads you directly to Grand Central Terminal, complete with subway access to virtually all points around the city (4/5/6 give you Bronx and Brooklyn via the east side of Manhattan; 7 gives you crosstown Manhattan via the newest hotspot Hudson Yards and Queens; the S shuttle takes you to Times Square where you’ll find the 1/2/3 with access to Bronx and Brooklyn via the west side of Manhattan, the N/Q/R/W with access to Brooklyn and Coney Island via Barclays Center and Queens, and the A/C/E with access to JFK on the A, downtown/World Trade Center on the E, Central Park on the C, and Penn Station on the 1/2/3/A/C/E). You can get EVERYWHERE. I never felt isolated by staying at the Hilton; rather, I felt the whole city was my playground to explore.

The entire team of staff does an amazing job of making sure each guest is well taken care of. Each day of my stay, my room was serviced promptly by housekeeping with keen attention to detail. While I relaxed in the lounge, staff were always eager to make sure I was enjoying my time and always offered assistance should I need anything. Even as I was checking out and leaving the hotel, Suzy at the front desk was warm and attentive, making sure that every part of my stay had gone smoothly and that all of the billing was correct. My experience with the Millennium Hilton left me feeling refreshed and glad I had chosen to stay there for my celebration. If you are looking for wonderful comfort, with wonderful amenities and a wonderful, top-notch staff while staying in NYC, you are guaranteed to find all of that here at the Millennium Hilton One UN Plaza.

title: Beautiful and breathtaking view from the 33rd floor
text: Beautiful hotel and extremely clean.  The bed was very comfortable. Our view was gorgeous. You could see the whole city and easy to plan out your day.  A lot of security on site.  We felt very secure and safe.

title: Amazing views and service
text: Amazing views, stayed on 28th floor with a view of the city, was gorgeous. Staff was friendly from moment we checked in. We felt as if we were VIP's when indeed we were just regular guests. Rooms were nice. Bathroom was nice and spacious. Very clean in and around hotel!

title: Toccare il cielo con un dito
text:
Centrale é centrale considerando che in dieci minuti a piedi si raggiunge la Grand Central ma la vicinanza all'ONU lo rende tranquillo e riparati dalle orde dei turisti. Il soggiorno a NYC è stato perfetto anche grazie all'eccellente posizione del Millenium UN Hilton Hotel.
Situato in posizione tranquilla, “all'ombra” del Palazzo di Vetro dell'Onu, permette di tuffarsi in pochi minuti a piedi nel traffico travolgente della città che non dorme mai.
Utilissimo il NY Ferry (fermata nei pressi dell'hotel) per visitare Brooklyn e tutta la zona downtown.
Massima gentilezza e disponibilità di tutto il personale, attento e scrupoloso. 
Ancora grazie a Patrick Goad – Reservations Manager – per averci assegnato una suite al 35°
piano con un' indimenticabile vista mozzafiato. Servizio wi-fi e ogni richiesta soddisfatta.
Hotel consigliabile sotto ogni punto di vista. Ci torneremo! 
P.s. a seguire le foto della vista incantevole!

title: Not bad for a work room
text:
Nice room while i was working in NewYork.
Fully stocked fridge and a cracking view of the Hudson.
Breakfast was brill but room service was a bit ropy with the pizza.
Needed to get suits dry cleaned and hotel did not have a 24 hour option, so we had to go downtown To get suits cleaned. 
Easy to run security operations from the 48th floor and my client was very happy.

title: Bad executive lounge good breakfast!
text:
Bad executive lounge good breakfast! 

There is basically nothing in the lounge during evening hours. They charge wine for $5 per glass. 

No upgrade as a diamond member. 

Everybody is so friendly at the property and their breakfast at the ambassador grill was good!

title: Beautiful views and AMAZING staff!
text:
This hotel has the nicest people working there. As soon as we checked in, the gentleman behind the desk made us feel so welcomed and comfortable. I wish I had gotten his name, but we can't say enough about him. The gentlemen who held our bags the day we checked out was also incredibly nice. Lovely people!
Our room was absolutely perfect and we had a great time. I ended up recommending this hotel to a friend and she said it was exactly what she was looking for. Thank you for a great stay.

title: Great stay
text: nice rooms.  great staff.  valet team is great.  There is plenty to wald to as far as meals or just a quick cocktail.  east side is quiet and easier to get to where I need to be in the mornings.  Park and stay is a good deal too.

title: Perfekte Lage
text: Times Square usw. bequem zu Fuß erreichbar, Grand Central Station in ca. 10min erreichbar. Sehr sauber, großes Zimmer mit tollen Ausblick. Frühstück sehr teuer - es gibt aber in der nähe genug Bäcker bzw. Geschäfte. Negativ ist das kostenpflichtige Wlan zu erwähnen...nur in der Lobby frei. Anreise ohne Auto von Vorteil, Parkhäuser in der Nähe- aber teuer. Manhattan grundsätzlich mit dem Auto sehr gewöhnungsbedürftig. Taxis stehen immer vor der Unterkunft bereit.

title: Manager went above and beyond
text:
I want to compliment the reservations manager of this hotel, PATRICK GOAD, for excellent customer service.   

We made a reservation at this hotel through Trip Advisor,  However when I was asked for payment, the company that actually made the reservation was a company called Cancelon. 

After I made the reservation, I immediately called and cancelled because I booked the wrong Hiton Hotel.  Even though I cancelled within minutes, Cancelon charged me a $186 cancellation fee.  

I disputed this charge through Trip Advisor, Cancelon and American Express.  But my disputes were denied.  However when I contacted Patrick Goad at the hotel, he called Cancelon and got them  to refund my $186.  Thanks Patrick  

We ended up staying at the Hilton Garden Inn on 54th which was great.

title: Nice hotel with a nice view
text: I was stuck at Laguardia airport after a combination of errors and weather ended up causing my flight to cancel. Our company travel service found a room for me at the Millennium Hilton at the UN plaza. I checked in late after a long day and was happy to find out the kitchen was still serving. I had a nice chopped salad with chicken that satisfied my hunger. The bartender was cordial and provided good service. My room was on the 35th floor and had nice views of the city. The room was clean and quiet and I woke up rested.

title: All Ones Needs for Business
text: When traveling for business, being close to meeting locations is prime concern. Next comes a comfortable place with all the services needed. This hotel ticks all the boxes and more. Rooms were comfortable and had everything needed, including a human-sized bath which is getting harder to find. Coffee service in the Lobby did end too early. Otherwise, everything was Just what was needed.

title: Nice room but shame about the service
text:
We booked this hotel because it was well priced for NY and is a short walking distance from Grand Central. We knew the area a little.
On arrival we were met with a long queue at reception and both the staff on reception seemed less that aware of the build up and were generally pampering to a large group who were basically being difficult. Check-in took AGES! On check out there was no pleasantries and they didn’t even ask about our stay.
The hotel public spaces and the room was well presented, clean and very nice. The room was quite spacious for NY and can’t really be faulted. No noise and the air con was very effective.
There is no pool and the gym is not worth trying. Just a weights section plus a few machines that nobody ever uses in a gym. No bikes accept for a single large crank spinner. The view from the gym was good though, right over the UN grounds and the East River.
We had a late check out on our last day, but someone came to our room at least every half hour to check one thing or another. It was very irritating.
We would stay again but be aware of its faults.

title: Pleasantly surprised!
text: This will be my staple hotel when visiting NYC. The hotel room was spacious, clean and we'll appointed. The view of the water was amazing!  Front desk attendees were friendly! The on site cafe had great options that didn't break the bank!

title: Quiet street with fab views
text:
The Hotel is on a quiet street, but plenty of shops in the area. It took us 10 mins to walk to Grand central Terminal and 25 minutes to walk to Time Square...taxi to time Square cost around $10. 
The hotel is clean and rooms large, however our beds (2) for 3 people sharing, were only queen size and a tight fit for 2 people to share (booked through BA), I'd definitely recommend checking you have a room with 2 'full bed' if there are more than 2 people sharing. 
Check in was a little stressful as at 4pm our rooms were not available and we had to wait another 45 minutes until they were ready. We also had to pay $200 per room on a card to cover any breakage or bar Bill's....(we did get it put back on our card when we checked out)...would we stay again ..yeah it was a nice hotel and the views from the rooms were amazing.

title: Tolles Hotel, sehr gute Lage
text: Sehr schöne Aussicht, sehr freundliches Personal. Wir haben uns sehr wohl gefühlt. Einziger Krtikpunkt für mich: das Wifi war leider nur gegen Aufpreis erhältlich, sollte bei diesem Preis beinhaltet sein.

title: Spectacular Views
text: If you are looking for a hotel to stay at in New York, this is the place. Amazing views, great staff, and even better service. This hotel is extremely clean & the lounge is a great place to relax after all the walking and site seeing the city has to offer. This hotel is great locations to all fun things in NY.

title: Nice hotel away from the hustle and bustle
text:
This is a hotel situated across the road from the United Nations Building on 44th street.
Hotel is quite big and our room had a great view of the Empire State Building and the East River.
Hotel is situated not to far from Grand Central Station and the Chrysler Building. 
Please be aware there is no pool and hasn’t been for a while. 
Taxis park outside so ther is no problem if you want to get one got the sights. We e
Walked a lot to 59th street for the main shops and Central Park. 
All in all a very nice hotel and I would book here again if we ventured back to New York

title: Marvelous Views
text: Amazing views from this hotel! We stayed in a corner room that had views from both sides.  We enjoyed amazing wine, room service, and food from the sky lounge.  The staff was friendly and knowledgeable. I can’t wait to return!

title: Comfortable rooms
text: Comfy beds!  Great views!  Wonderful staff! Very impressive service and attention to detail.  The continental breakfast was yummy and certainly enough to make it to lunch! Can’t say enough about the staff and how friendly and helpful they were.

title: Great stay!
text: We had the most amazing view of the city from the 38th floor!  The bed was comfy.  It's always a toss up if I am going to be able to sleep at a hotel, but I slept so well.  The water pressure in the shower was awesome.  The bathroom was really nice!  The hair dryer was powerful.  The clock had a phone charger.  The staff was all wonderful.  Very happy with our stay!

title: Very nice hotel with great location near UN
text:
A modern hotel recently remodeled just steps away from the UN.  The lobby, coffee shop, gym are top notch (the gym has exceptional views of the river).

Service is very attentive. Lots of good restaurants in the area. Ambassador Grill in the hotel itself has a very nice breakfast buffet but is meh at best for dinner.

title: A great Hilton property
text: This is my third stay here and the hotel staff have been really nice. Helpful and friendly! I arrived late and was quickly checked in after a transatlantic flight. The room was really nice with views over the river. The exec lounge is on the 30th floor and has great views over manhattan! By NY standards the price was also reasonable!

title: Best experience of New York ever!!!
text: We had a double upper apartment!! Wow wow wow views staff food breakfast!!! Can’t complain very central will be back love it !!! Stayed for a week ... I would ask for a upper level for the view of the Hudson River , also very close to shopping and all other attractions

title: Molto bello
text:
Hotel scelto per la vicinanza alle Nazioni Unite.
Camera al piano 30 con una vista straordinaria, da downtown all’Empire States.
Camera molto confortevole.
Peccato il Wi-Fi down.
Colazione ricca e buona.

title: Annual trip
text: Excellent location for UN. Service very good and rooms quiet. Porters and security staff very friendly. Expensive as expected for location. Conference facilities good but air con needs work.  Reception staff outstanding.

title: Spectacular Room
text: If you are a Diamond Club member, you have it made. We got a lovely suite on top. The service was great (though the pull out mattress was lumpy). Unfortunately, the lobby could use a re-design, in my opinion. Lots of wasted black space and the seating area is kind of lacking.

title: Mal ubicado , muchas falencias
text:
El hotel esta ubicado al lado de las naciones unidas
Obviamente no es céntrico para la ciudad de new york
La seguridad es nuy buena ya que se hospedan diputados , senadores y otros
El edificio quedo muy antiguo
El lobby sumamente pequeño, tan pequeño que pareceria no tener ninguno
Tiene 2 torres en una tiene el club ejecutivo y en el otro tiene el gimnasio 
El gimnasio quedo como en un pasillo, una parte del mismo ( pequeño donde hay maquinas) y otra pequeña parte donde estan las 3 cintas y una bici. La vista realmente es muy bonita.
No tiene piscina
Aclaro porque es fundamental en verano
La suite tiene un sofa cama que sentis todos los resortes en la espalda. Nos quejamos las 2 primeras noches y nada ni nadie lo resolvieron asi que les dimos nosotros la solucion tan sencilla de traer otro colchón de otro cuarto, por el cual la tercera noche fue algo mas agradable pero se rompio el aire acondicionado durante la misma, asi que imagínense en verano sin aire.
Otro inconveniente cuando llegamos tuvimos un maletero Jonathan que queria que le demos dinero solo por entrar las maletas al lobby, fue muy rudo y desagradable la situacion.
Ni la recepcion ni la housekeeping pudieron entender en los 6 dias que estuvimos que eramos 4 para los amenities. Asi que dejaban todo para 1.
Atencion mala e irrespestuosa de hally en el club ejecutivo ( de habla hispana, canoso y bajo en estatura). La comida muy pobre de 17 a 20 ni vale la pena ir.
Personal a destacar en el hotel rosa martinez gerente de la mañana y geri manager de alimentos. 
Tambien agradezco la gran ayuda de Sylvia lozano
En el desayuno la atencion era pesima , nunca vi mozos tan descorteses, excepto abdul que amablemente hacia los omelettes con una sonrisa, y el mozo sultan y los ultimos 2 dias tuvimos un . en el desayuno muy eficiente.

title: Visite de New York en famille
text:
Visite en famille de New York 
Hotel bien situé avec une magnifique vue sur Manhattan, a proximité de time square et du métro grand central. 
Central park à moi environ 30 mn à pied.
Hotel recommande pour petite famille

title: Unsatisfactory Service
text: Stayed at this location for a weekend. When my friends and I arrived we were told we weren’t able to check in until 4:30 (hence the 4:00pm check in time displayed on the website and confirmation email). This hotel is very overpriced especially for what you get which is mediocre rooms and service. When we were checking out my friend payed for parking she later checked her account a few hours later that day and seen that she was charged an extra $50. The individual who was working the front desk at the time did not tell her that she would be charged that extra fee. She has called multiple times for this to be resolved but this location has not been able to rectify the situation. Which is terrible. Futhermore! another friend was charged an extra $555 this location was stating that it was a hold on her account However, that amount was taken out the same day we checked out. This is ridiculous she needs her money back ASAP.

title: Not a good experience
text: Poor service at front desk, no stocked mini bar, limited room service, overpriced wifi. Hugely overpriced hotel. Central location. Clean. But would definitely not stay here again on account of service

title: Disappointing
text:
I booked this hotel based on my experience of Hilton hotels in the UK and Europe, as well as traveller reviews. It was not a cheap option either. One of the two rooms booked did not have a safe or a fridge and the amenities in both rooms were poor. The coffee machine was limited and only creamer was provided. There were no drawers, only wardrobe space and a kettle cost $13.
On our second visit to the hotel bar at 11.45 pm we were served a drink but told the bar was closed. We were then asked to leave the bar at 12.10am. I have never experienced this issue before in a Hilton and was very surprised - so much for New York being a 24 hour city!
In conclusion, I would say that this hotel falls below the standard expected of a Hilton.

title: Largest hotel rooms we have ever had in NYC
text: As a Hilton Honors member, we love visiting all the Hilton Brands.  Our first visit to the Millennium--we were shocked by how large the hotel room was.  And the large windows!  This is very unique in NYC. EXTREMELY cool to see Empire State and Chrysler Buildings from your room!  Obviously great location to tour United Nations, but perfect base for us to explore all of NYC. Grand Central Station a few blocks walk--and that opens up all of Manhattan for you.  Little Italy, Main Line, Yankee Stadium, Broadway--all very easily accessible from this hotel.  We did not take advantage of any of the hotel amenities--as we enjoy exploring NYC.  But the room made our vacation.  Front desk and bell staff were very helpful & friendly.

title: Great place to stay
text: The location was great, nice view, nice room, friendly staffs, and great food. Our family enjoyed and loved to stay at Millennium HIlton One UN Plaza. We sad because we were not stay long enough. For sure, we will be back soon. I would recommend friend and family to stay here.

title: The Best Kept Secret in NYC
text: This Hotel is one of the Best Hotels i have ever stayed at. The Location is great, the staff of the Hotel are friendly and helpful and the views from the rooms are awesome. A number of fantastic restaurants just around the corner in each direction on Second Ave

title: Excelente opção em NY
text:
Excelente opção para quem for ficar em Nova York, especialmente a trabalho. 

Os quartos são amplos e modernos, com bonitas vistas da cidade de ambos os lados, próximo a Grand Central, o que garante fácil acesso a toda a cidade.

title: Excellent Location
text: Walking distance from everything Manhattan, St. Pat’s Cathedral, fifth avenue, Times Square, restaurant row, Grand Central Station, Broadway plays, everything you need in New York, or want to do, is accessible from this Hotel, absolutely worth it!

title: 国連からのアクセス至近
text:
国連に関する仕事に参加するために宿泊。あらゆる施設に徒歩で行けるためとても便利。
また、グランドセントラルステーションまでも徒歩で10分程度なので、どこへ行くにも便利。

title: Recent stay
text:
Firstly location and views from this hotel are without doubt for the price range the best in my opinion you will get in Manhattan .
I had a corner room 3218 and the views are all that and more .
I had to wait a good while after check in time started for my room but hey it was worth it to get the room I wanted .
Staff were polite and professional.
cleanliness of the room and a few minor issues escalating over my stay lead me to voice them to Silvia on front desk , she was very approachable and couldn’t do enough to try and correct these for me , for this Silvia many thanks , eventually Jessica the DM , came and upgraded me to a suite for the last night of my stay . Which was a nice touch and appreciated.
Minor issues could be addressed within the hotel and this would be the perfect stay .
I would definitely return to this hotel the next time I’m in the city

title: Avoid Ambassador Lounge
text:
This is not a family friendly restaurant, although it is the only place to eat on the property. One night we were not feeling well so decided to eat there and brought a 2 1/2 year-old, very well behaved child with us. The waiter acted mad and rude from the get go. We had to argue with him to get silverware and a plate for the child! There is no kids menu, and he didn’t seem to want to help with smaller portions or any adjustments for children’s food, despite being the only hotel in the restaurant. That was fine, we were willing to pay full price if we could have just got some service! The waiter never refilled our glasses or came back and asked how our food tasted, among other things. My order was not correct, but I had to eat it anyway as I could not get anyone’s attention, let alone our waiter. The restaurant was not busy that night. When I complained at the end of the meal, (which was the only time our waiter came back) about the service and the food all he said was “I’ll give you a free dessert“. The next day I went to the front desk and spoke to the very personable and nice front desk manager. He took notes and told me he would have the restaurant manager call when he came into work that day or when we got home the next day. I never got a phone call but I did get the full price of the meal refunded. That was nice but it tells me that they’re not very interested in the way the restaurant is run.

This Hilton has an absolutely wonderful breakfast buffet with more items than I’ve ever seen! Everything is fresh and delicious and the service is amazing. We ate there every morning and no one at breakfast seemed to have a problem with the 2 1/2-year-old! She got silverware, drink and a chair without having to ask. Everything was refilled promptly and dirty dishes were taken away quickly. The difference between the morning service in the evening service was unbelievable!

We had a beautiful room and very good maid service, but the rooms had a smell that seem to be coming from the carpet. It smelled to us like urine. I called the front desk once about it and talk to the maid another time but nothing seemed to be done.  The rooms need a maintenance person to go and check them, as there are nice amenities but a lot of them don’t work. Also seems as though the upholstery and the carpet need to be cleaned.

title: My Review
text: Great stay. Wonderful room, terrific breakfast. The only thing I didn’t like was all the creepy U.N. folks hanging around.  Because basically, the U.N. sucks. But loved the hotel. Service folks were great. Loved the dogs all over the place to protect the creepy U.N. folks.

title: 3-Stars and here's why
text:
First, I will say that we found the service at the Millennium Hilton UN to be exceptional. From the doorman to the front desk, they were all pleasant and wonderful. From the first time I called this hotel to research info about the area, I spoke with Linda and she was awesome. Speaking with Linda was like talking to an old, dear friend. Because we share the same birthday and she wanted our first time in New York to be special, Linda had champagne, chocolate cake, and strawberries delivered to our room. How sweet is this? Thank you so much, Linda, and the wonderful staff at the Millennium UN. Your service was seamless and exceptional! 

That being said, I'm very disappointed to share my family's experience in regards to the accommodations at this hotel. With such a great staff there, I believe this location is in need of a renovation. The building has somewhat of a musty odor, along with worn and stained carpet throughout. The lobby furniture appears to be dated and stained as well. 

Our room was on the 28th floor. While we appreciated the view of New York, we were not fond of the spiral staircase, as the staircase was rather tall and steep. The carpet on the stairs was not clean as well as areas in the room. Having teenagers who hated the stairs because of how steep they were can be very telling. One of my daughters said the stairs gave her anxiety and this was her least favorite hotel to stay at. And while the kids had their own bathroom downstairs, they had to climb the stairs each night to shower (there isn't a shower downstairs). 

In addition, rooms at this hotel are not equipped with a microwave and they do not have ice machines like traditional hotels. Also, there is no option to receive a complimentary breakfast like other traditional hotels. However, we knew about the breakfast option going in. 

Lastly, (IF) I could rate the customer service at this hotel alone, I'd give this location a 5-star rating. However, by a family vote, I'm giving this Hilton property a 3-star rating (and not because of the staff!)

Hilton, you can do better than this!

title: Wonderful service and amazing hospitality
text: We were lucky enough to have a beautiful corner suite in this lovely hotel to celebrate my daughter's 21st birthday.  The staff could not have been more welcoming and went out of their way to insure my daughter's birthday was truly special from the balloons they left her to surprise her in the room, to a complimentary bottle of prosecco waiting for us when we returned from the theater.  All in all, this is a beautiful hotel with lovely views and a truly caring staff.  It will continue to be our "home away from home" when we visit NYC.

title: Bad service in a mediocre hotel.
text:
After traveling for 14h to this hotel and walking to a receptionist with no customers online I was told: "Dont come here, before I ask you to". What a nice greeting. I felt the front desk were very entitled about their mediocre hotel. 

After waiting for 15minutes she notioned that I was allowed to come. Before this, we had booked and paid for the hotel in Finland, my manager sent several emails and driver license pictures to the front desk person for me to avoid having to use my own credit card upon arrival. Despite this, the front desk refused to give us our room so we were forced to pay for the entire stay with my credit card (including a 200dollar deposit).

What followed was about 20 emails, 4 phone calls from Finland to confirm the old credit card, about 4 front desk workers, and none of them helped me get my charge back. Finally I contacted my bank, and they said I would get it back the next day, after showing the receipt for the hotel. This was 2 weeks later.

We stayed in a suite around on the 31st floor and the view was great. However, the room was fully carpeted and very dusty. The furnitures were worn out. There was a noodle (piece of food) in the minifridge, which I complained about twice and it never disappeared. There was splashes of liquid stains on the walls, and they didnt disappear even though I complained about the dirtiness of the suite. I took a piece of paper and water and tested if they can come off, which was possible, so it was just due to laziness. The bed was fine and I slept ok.

The suite did not have a very large room height. It felt like around 6'6feet or 2 meters in many places, a bit claustrophobic even for a 5'8 foot/170cm guy.

The bathroom shower handle was loose. 

The windows were semi-dirty, which ruined the view a bit, which was otherwise nice.

The coffee machine had an absolute gross, green water holder, which I complained about, but which never got cleaned. And so I never used the coffee machine.

The breakfast was good buffet-style, and the chef made good omelettes.

The hotel had 3 elevators from which 2 broke down, and it took us a 10minute wait to get downstairs to eat break fast.

The TV was sufficient, but they had an automatic log-out every day at 11am. And when it was thundering outside we were watching a movie from netflix and it got shut and logged out at 11, and we had to input our login credentials again to continue, which was frustrating. ( I know, 1st world problems, but not expected from a 400dollar/night room).

I do not recommend this hotel.

title: Amazing Hospitality
text: This hotel, the staff, and the room were all exceptional.  We had an amazing meal in the restaurant and the staff were simply wonderful. I would recommend this hotel to anyone coming to NYC. Front desk and housekeeping staff were all friendly and welcoming.

title: Bad service in an average hotel.
text: Be careful handing over your credit card here...Despite pre-paying, this hotel charged another $1000 on to my credit card, and despite numerous phone calls (where no-one seemed to have the authority to do anything, they just suggested I call my bank...) it took 12 days for the charge to be reversed. Thanks so much! It's the second time a Hilton hotel has done this to me, but it won't be happening again!!! There are plenty of other hotels in New York....

title: Perfect For Our Wedding Anniversary
text: Thank you to Stefan, Patrick and Gerry for making our celebratory stay at your beautiful hotel truly memorable for all of the right reasons.  We had a superb room with amazing views of pretty much everything south of 44th Street – even including part of the Hudson River.  We dined in the restaurant on the evening of our 15th anniversary and the meal was beautiful and the staff were brilliant.  This is definitely our new favourite hotel in New York.  We can’t wait to return.  Thank you all so so much for making it truly wonderful.

title: Very clean, spacious rooms, beautiful views of NY’s skyline
text:
I stayed here 5 nights. I enjoyed my stay. My room on the 39th floor has amazing views of NYC skylines. 
My room, king size bed, was spacious and very clean. 
The products in the bathroom were very good. 
The service was also very good, all the staff were very friendly and helpful. 

The small minus; I missed a bathrobe as well as slippers in my room. 
The gym feels quite old, the machine are out dated ( and are not functioning well) and I missed a gym mat. 

I worked across the street, the hotel is otherwise a bit off ( if you are visiting New York for vacation).The price is good, though. 
So if you want an affordable 4-star hotel and will be willing to take transportation plus walk , than the hotel is recommendable!

title: Professional Staff
text: Excellent location, friendly and professional service and wonderful view over mid and downtown. Can recommend to stay there anytime. Breakfast buffet is also worthwhile visiting. Applies also to the gym.

title: Manches Hampton Inn ist besser als diese Hilton Hotel
text: Der Empfang war sehr freundlich. Die Lage ist für Touristen nicht so besonders. Bis zur nächsten Subway sind es ca.20 Minuten Fußweg. Die Lounge in der 30.Etage ist etwas in die Jahre gekommen. Die Qualität der kostenfreien Getränke und der Snacks ist sehr einfach und langweilig. Wein und Bier muss bezahlt werden.

title: Great rooms if you like red wine stained carpets
text: The upgraded room had a lingering vomit smell and red wine stains in the carpet. I called the Front Desk but only to be told there is nothing they could do at that time and I should talk to the Front Desk when I check out .

title: Our favorite hotel in NYC
text: My husband and I started staying here because the location is convenient. Now we don’t want to stay anywhere else. Views of the city and East River are breathtaking. Rooms are spotless and comfy. Staff is courteous and accommodating.

title: Millennium Hilton, NY
text: We booked a suite as we were travelling with our teenagers and wow, what a suite. We travel extensively but this really was incredible and the nearest comparison was an apartment in Sydney. Fantastic views of the NY skyline in multiple directions, great amenities over 2 floors which provided that rockstar feel. The hotel is impressive, staff very courteous and attentive but as we weren’t really high rollers they weren’t in our faces. Given the price for our 3 night stay for 4 people it was really good value. Location is great; a couple of blocks from Grand Central Station and a shirt walk from the 34th Street waterways terminal, providing plenty access to all parts of greater New York.

title: Very nice hotel
text: Overall, this was a great hotel. Very clean and wonderful air conditioning! Everyone was very friendly and helpful. We had breakfast included with our room and the food was good. They were accommodating with anything I needed. This was the first time that the breakfast servers remembered us! Most places don't seem to.  The room had everything we needed. I loved the espresso machine! The only reason I am giving this a 4 instead of a 5 is the fridge in the room is a little pointless. It could at least have been a dorm fridge. You can't even fit a bottle of water in it. So that is a much needed upgrade. If you don't plan on using the fridge then it is really worth the 5 stars. The only other complaint I had, not against the hotel, was that it was further than I thought to Times Square. It made for a very long walk when we wanted to see that area of the city. But excellent hotel and we would stay there again.

title: Une expérience inoubliable !
text:
Une chambre d'angle qui bénéficiait d'une vue exceptionnelle sur Manhattan. Une literie top et des aménagements luxueux. Un excellent rapport qualité prix . Une chambre confortable et silencieuse située au 38ème étage
A proximité des Nations unis mais trés proche de manhattan . 
Je recommande, juste parfait

title: Simply lovely hotel
text:
Stayed here for the first time.  We loved the hotel, staff and amenities were first rate.
Our room was gorgeous with wonderful views over the East River.
It was a pleasure staying on this side of Manhattan, quiet and peaceful, and bus
transportation was excellent to all parts of the city.
Wonderful restaurants close at hand particularly Japanese ones.
Would definitely recommend this hotel

title: Corporate hotel, reasonably comfortable, the staff need energising
text: Comfortable hotel very well located. Rooms are quite well appointed but the standard rooms are a little dark due to small windows. Most of the guests at the hotel are affiliated somehow with the UN - there is high turnover of guests - the staff deal with hundreds of people every day and it kind of shows - they are friendly but matter-of-fact.  On one occasion I called room service during peak evening rush - the phone operator was so rude and abrupt that I guess his wife had just left him. So yeah, its a functional business hotel but it won't break your heart.

title: My favorite Hilton in New York
text:
This hotel is a hidden gem. Formerly run by Hyatt International the staff is fantastic and welcoming. 
We ate at the bar and shared a laugh with the bartender. The Gold lounge is terrific. Can’t say enough.

title: Beautiful views
text: When writing a review about a property in New York City one always needs to keep in it context that it’s in New York City. On the good side it is a very nice property that is well maintained and clean. On the downside we found the front desk staff and some of the restaurant staff to be less than helpful. For example, as a gold member we were supposed to get free Wi-Fi. Twice I asked how we can do this, and both times the instructions they gave us did not help.

title: An Amazing Stay at Millennium
text:
My Complete Family after travelling around then States ended up at this Hilton Chain in New York.
Already used to the High Standards of Personnel in this Chain But was Pleasantly surprised by the High Standard of Hospitality displayed by the staff esp the Front Desk Ambassador AVERY. 
He gave us an Embellishment that will be remembered for a long time to come.
Mr Avery is an Asset to the Hotel and I do hope he is recognised for his Warm work ethics 
Overall experience...A Pretry Awesome Stay.
Tq Hilton.
The  Sarnas of Malaysia...

title: Best Hotel Team
text: Our recent stay at the Millennium Hotel was the most pleasant experience.  We enjoy making personal connections with hotel staff and Patrick in particular gave us such a wonderful impression of his hotel and the city in general.  Our room was wonderful and the view was amazing!! You cannot go wrong staying in this hotel.  Happy Planning!

title: Home away from home
text: I've been staying at this hotel for years when I have business at the United Nations and it's like a home away from home. The staff are all excellent from the doormen to housekeeping. I don't want to name names as I'll probably leave someone out but my special thanks to Avery, Suzzie and Dorka at the front desk, Robert, Frank, Ansley, and Ozzie at the front door, Dorna in the kitchen, and Stefan and Thom in the front office. I look forward to my next work trip there.

title: Most expensive and worst value across 50+ countries visted
text:
I traveled 23 hours to be at a United Nations workshop. With only 10 hours from touchdown at JFK to my event, I opted to stay at the UN Plaza for proximity and to optimize on sleep. I hoped to use the morning for extra sleep or breakfast, rather than on flagging a cab during NYC rush hour and commuting from another hotel. After a long journey, all I wanted at midnight was a hot shower. But no, that simple requirement was too much. I filled the (small) bath but got tepid water. Shivering, I tried the shower. No better. I let the water run, I tried running the tap in the sink too (hoping to kickstart heating somewhere, while feeling guilty about wasting water!). Nothing. 

When I called housekeeping, I got the operator who said he’d send someone “to show me how to use the shower”!! That was patronising and deflected fault from them to me, which is ridiculous. As a middle-aged frequent traveler, I’ve handled hotels and showers across 50+ countries: “it’s not me it’s you”. Someone checked it out, agreed it was cold, thought it might have been wrongly installed, yet said there was nothing he could do and would let the front desk know. They called and sent someone else, who tried his best and managed to reset it by 10 degrees, to a temperature still less than the minimum temperature required by NY regulations for landlords. All this while, I’d been browsing for other hotel rooms because in addition to this issue, the room was freezing even after switching off the air conditioning. When all you want is a hot shower and sleep, and can’t get that at a hotel you paid almost $500 for, you’d even consider moving at 1am after a very long journey! 

I was too exhausted, and finally opted to settle for the slight improvement rather than wander NY at that hour. Having wasted so much time, I thought I’d order breakfast through room service as a “wake up call” to ensure I didn’t miss my meeting. Guess what? No room service menu in the room, no breakfast card to hang on the door. I tried calling room service, no response to several calls. I then tried checking the TV for a menu, and they only had options for dinner (5-11pm) and nothing else. No late night service, no breakfast options. 

This is a hotel whose main reason for existence is the United Nations next door, with diplomats and international travelers arriving and departing round the clock, and they don’t cater outside of 5-11pm?? This makes no sense. 

Other issues: there was a cavity where a fridge/mini bar should been, and a “potential door” propped up behind it (images attached). There’s tea/coffee sachets, no kettle, no spoons, no creamers or sugar, no bottles of water. No bathrobe, no slippers, no stationery, nothing. This is the room time forgot. 

There’s a sign on the 37th floor saying it’s under renovation. You only see this when you exit the elevator. Nothing in the lobby, no mention at check in, and certainly nothing on the website, let alone a reasonable price to compensate. Yet, so many of these issues stem from neglect rather than a botched/incomplete renovation effort.

I’ve never stayed in a hotel this expensive, yet got so little. I’ve stayed at Travelodges and cheap motels during sold out conferences like SXSW and got better amenities and service. This is a cruel, cruel joke. Except it isn’t remotely funny. 

I will never use the Hilton again, anywhere, on principle. This is unacceptable. I need to stay another night after all, but I’m glad I didn’t extend till I got here. I’ll give my business to absolutely anywhere rather than this. I now have 5 hours before my UN meeting, so that’s shot too. Thanks, Hilton!! You can have 2* for the location that I needed, but it was a fail on every other count. Shocking.

title: Great views and rooms. Poor staff and service.
text:
Our room was not available or clean until hours after check in. Staff was generally unfriendly and unaccommodating. Check in is a slow process and staff at the ambassador lounge were both unprofessional and incompetent than.

That said, the rooms were clean and nice with great views.

title: Terrible Service - Bellman and Front Desk
text:
I was a solo female traveler. I stayed at this hotel because I had a transit in NYC in the middle of a long trip. I hate to say this but the bellmen at this Millennium Hilton hotel were all worst than any of the Uber or cab drivers that helped me along the way. The front desk was also no better.

I arrived late afternoon, and after I got off my Uber, a bellman saw me but pretended he didn't see me. I had to wave at him to get him to help me with my suitcases. I had four suitcases. He asked me "you need help?" Well yes obviously! He then walked to me very slowly with his cart with an unhappy face. Afterwards, he slammed my suitcases onto the cart, with wheels down. He pushed the cart into the lobby (literally 10m distance). While I was checking in, he interrupted me and told me his job is done, that someone else would help me take everything to my room if I needed it. I thanked him, but he didn't walk away. He continued standing there. At that moment, the front desk associate helping me check him said to me, "Robert has helped you, and his job is only until here". I nodded and turned my head to thank the bellman again. He still wouldn't leave. The front desk associate then said, "he helped you, so..." This was when I realized that both of them were expecting me to tip the bellman. I really did not want to tip anything because I didn't like the service, but I was obligated to do so! I took out a $1 note and gave it to him, and he frowned and still didn't move. I ignored him completely from then on and he finally left. 

I asked the front desk if any upgrades were available as I am a Hilton Honors Gold member, he just shucked his head without even checking the screen. I am very sure there are still available rooms for an upgrade because I booked my room on the day (only a couple hours before my arrival) and I saw all sorts of rooms still available for booking. Even if everything is really sold out, I would expect the associate to look into possibilities first before relentlessly turning me down. Furthermore, I did call the hotel right after I made the booking (so around midday) to ask if they could upgrade me, and the person who answered the phone said they will, and that I will get it during check in. The person I spoke to on the line was also a lot more polite than the person helping me at the front desk. 

The next morning as I was leaving, I brought all four pieces of luggage down to the ground level. This hotel has two wings and the wing I stayed at is a short distance away from the concierge. Three bellmen walked past me and no one offered to help me with my luggages. 

All in all, I couldn't understand why all the staff working at this hotel seemed very unhappy. Every Uber driver that I came across during the trip would voluntarily leave their car seats to help me load and unload luggages, with a big smile on their faces. I felt very sad that I booked a Hilton property and felt less welcomed by the staff there than the Uber drivers. The front desk even pressured me to tip when he clearly did not know what kind of service I had experienced. 

I will not stay at this hotel again, and I do not recommend anyone who cares about service and hospitality to come here.

title: Great stay at Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza Hotel
text: We reserved a city view, corner unit with a king-sized bed on the 33rd floor. The room was clean with a pleasant interior. The view was stunning! This added even more flavor to our travel experience. Breakfast was hearty and tasty. Hotel service was excellent! The hotel is within walking distance to the most well-known attractions.

title: Below average
text: Was below average, I had a better experience in Hilton Toronto. The room had hair and lipstick marks on window and sofa had a weird smell. I expected better with the amount it cost me for the corner room.

title: Fabulous views
text: We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite on the 37th floor of the hotel and the views were stunning ! Although frequently in NY, this is the best views i ever experienced in an hotel - I could have spent hours starring though the windows at different time of days ! The 4 rather than a 5 rating reflect the room being a bit tired - carpet was threading in a view place and the decor overall is very 80’s.

title: Excellent stay!
text: Excellent stay!!!  Staff was very professional and extremely helpful including Patrick who we met at the front entry.  He had a warm smile and asked how he could help us.  Turns out he books the rooms and had put us in the presidential suite!  I just had to give him a hug to say thanks.  Views were incredible!  Thanks Hilton staff for allowing us to have a pleasant stay in a luxurious hotel. I travel frequently and stay at different Hilton properties.  This is the best one yet!

title: Good location, but unjustly expensive
text:
The good: 
nice location, good coffee shop and fitness center. The fitness center has good and new machines, cooler, towels and everything you need. The coffee shop had good variety of pastries and coffee. (I've drunk there the best cappuccino ever). They handled a plumbing situation they had with our room not bad. 

The bad: 
The lobby is small and less than average looking. Hotel staff: especially in the reception/front desk most of the staff aren't very nice. Some treated us as we were customers in a supermarket. 

Breakfast is outrageously expensive and the quality of food they serve doesn't justify the high price. 

Pillows have pillowcases. Blankets don't have a cover. That was disgusting and not hygienic. 

The staff couldn't help us with info about transportation from the hotel to the airport. They said the guy who can help works at specific times but we didn't get the chance to see him/her before leaving, so we had to dig the internet to find ways to go to the airport.
