Also, be prepared to get your baggages sniffed by dogs before you enter the building and without notice. That's how guests are welcomed in this hotel. Humiliating and shocking I'd say.

title: Vistas fantásticas. Personal y limpieza estupendas.
text: Estuvimos en la planta 29, con vistas al río, al Empire, Chrysler, etc. Fabulosas. La limpieza, comodidad de la cama y el moderno váter, estupendos. Disponen de nevera y cafetera/tetera. Personal muy amable en todo momento. Wifi gratis si te haces miembro.

title: Do NOT stay here!!!  I’ve already cancelled my next reservation for next week!!
text: As a Hilton Diamond Member, who goes out of her way to stay at Hilton properties when I travel for business or pleasure, I was very disappointed with my stay here.  I was assigned an upgraded room which was CLEARLY available on both the Hilton website and the hotel’s own website for he length of my stay.  I confirmed my upgraded room on my way from the airport to the hotel.  However, when I got to the hotel, the front desk took one look at my reservation, refused to check me into the hotel room I had been assigned and confirmed to and MOVED me to a different room!!!  This was AFTER I showed her my app indicating the room I had already been assigned and confirmed to!  She proceeded to tell me the hotel was booked, and when I went online to show her that Tre hotel was still showing rooms, including the one that she moved me out of, she proceeded to tell me that the website was wrong!!  She then put me in a different room that was not really nice at all, and continued to insist that the hotel was completely sold out even when there were rooms available to book online, including the room she had removed me from!  To appease me, she gave me coupons for a free hot breakfast, which was completely pathetic!!  The fruits were not fresh and the offerings were very limited.  I will NEVER stay here again!!  I should have known this the last time I stayed here and was treated rudely at the Executive Lounge that this was NOT the Hilton to stay at!!  In fact, I’ve already cancelled my next reservation and opted to stay someplace else!!  Totally not worth the money or the aggravation.  If you are Hilton Diamond, find someplace else, or consider switching your loyalty to a different hotel chain!!

title: Birthday celebration holiday
text: Room clean and housekeeping excellent, felt check in could have been more friendlier.  Great location and lots of great places for breakfast nearby.  Amazing views of the Hudson River from room.  Prices for food in hotel overpriced was $80 for 2 chicken wings starter and one portion of fries with 2 beers and a coke!  Doormen were lovely very friendly and helpful.

title: Amazing hotel !!
text: What an absolutely amazing hotel. From the minute we arrived, I knew we had picked the right one. It's close enough to walk to everything but far enough away from the hustle and bustle. Every member of staff we met were so friendly & helpful. The room was so much bigger than I expected but the highlight is THAT VIEW it's out of this world. I woke up to the sight of The Empire State building without lifting my head off the pillow,  just breathtaking. I can't wait to return to NYC and I will without a doubt book this hotel again.

title: Great Hotel
text: I couldn’t decide if I wanted to stay in Times Square of off the path a bit. Glad I decided to stay here. It didn’t have all the tourist traffic and the staff was amazing. Robert the doorman provided incredible restaurant suggestions and knew us by name after the first interaction. I had planned to stay at another hotel at the end of my trip to check out a different part of the city but we liked it so much we decided to stay. Will definitely return.

title: Perfektni hotel
text: Perfektni poloha hotelu u sidla OSN, kousek na metro a vyborna poloha k hlavnim pamatkam, krasne vyhledy z pokoju. Mily a ochotny personal, vysli vstric vsem pozadavkum. Maly obchudek s kavou Illy v lobby hotelu. Pokoje ciste moderni zarizeni. Absolutni spokojenost 👍🏻

title: Great hotel great location
text:
You can not get a better location right by the east river next to United Nations a few minutes walk from attractions Central Park Times Square grand central terminal.
When I first read about the hotel it said it was built in the early 70s but you would never think that as it looks modern and up to date. Well worth a visit and I look forward to revisiting soon.

title: Ideal und recht ruhig gelegenes Hotel in Midtown
text:
Das Hotel liegt in Midtown, schräg gegenüber vom UN-Hauptquartier und nahe des East River. Der Eingang befindet sich in der E 44th Street. Da auch UN-Büros mit im Haus sind, wird bei der Ankunft das Gepäck von einem Hund abgeschnüffelt. Überhaupt befinden sich in der direkten Umgebung zahlreiche UN-Einrichtungen, so dass es vor allem auch am Wochenende für Manhattan-Verhältnisse ausgesprochen ruhig auf den Straßen und Gehwegen ist. Möglichkeiten zum Frühstücken außerhalb des Hotels sowie ein paar Supermärkte befinden sich in unmittelbarer bzw. fußläufiger Umgebung. Das Chrysler-Building ist zu Fuß nach wenigen Minuten erreicht, der Grand Central Terminal nach 10 Minuten, zum Times Square sind es ca. 25 Minuten - ebenfalls zu Fuß.
Eine Querstraße südlich vom Hotel gibt es einen kleinen, hübschen Park (Ralph Bunche Park) - wenn man bei schönem Wetter ein bißchen Chillen möchte.

Die Zimmer sind für Manhattan-Verhältnisse ausreichend groß, es gibt mehrere bequeme Sitzmöbel, ausreichend Schrankraum, ein sehr bequemes Kingsize-Bett, Badezimmer mit Dusche (der Abzug im Bad läuft die ganze Zeit), Bedienung der kompletten Elektrik mit einem Pad an der Wand möglich, und vor allem - dieser phantastische Ausblick auf NYC! O.K. - die Auslegware zeigte an einigen Stelle schon deutliche Abnutzungserscheinungen, aber ansonsten war alles im grünen Bereich. Die Zimmerreinigung war ebenfalls o.k. WLAN ist kostenlos verfügbar.
Im Hotel sind wir vom Doorman über die Rezeption bis zum Housekeeping nur sehr freundlichen und um guten Service bemühten Mitarbeitern begegnet. Beim Einchecken wurde jedoch leider vergessen, unseren gewünschten und von der Rezeption zugesagten späteren Check-out in System auch zu vermerken mit der Folge, dass wir am Abreisetag am Nachmittag nicht mehr in unser Zimmer kamen. Die Sache wurde an der Rezeption jedoch schnell wieder korrigiert.
Die Hausdame kam jeden Tag vorbei und fragte, ob die Zimmerreinigung in Ordnung war. Das an einem Tag fehlende Toilettenpapier wurde von ihr umgehend mit einer Ersatzrolle aufgefüllt.

title: Good but not 4 Stars
text:
I first visited this landmark skyscraper hotel 35 years ago when it was sparkling and new (before Hilton).  While the views are still spectacular, the property itself has not aged very well.  

The now historic glass and mirror lobby, seemingly untouched, still gives the impression that you have entered a 1980's discotheque (not that this is necessarily a bad thing!).  It was disappointing to see lackadaisical maintenance in public areas, e.g., lobby and hallway carpeting was extensively stained. The narrow room corridors, festooned in charcoal gray wallpaper, had a somewhat foreboding, prison-like quality.  And, room service trays, carts and random glasses and dishes scattered throughout the hallways did not help.
 
My tastefully renovated room on the 32nd floor, decent size by New York standards, was clean but very basic and mostly unremarkable.  It took quite awhile for the room to cool down. The bed was comfortable yet unadorned. The tight bathroom was not at all luxurious with a compact toilet and bathtub.  The illuminated makeup mirror was a nice touch.

Service was merely adequate. I arrived before I could check-in so I left my small suitcase with the bellman.  When I tried to retrieve it later, the bell staff was first unable to find it.  Needless to say, I began to panic.  They even asked me to help them look for it in the storage closet!  Finally, after several nerve wracking minutes, it was located behind several other bags.

The Millennium Hilton One UN Plaza has a wonderful location that's far enough from the midtown hustle and bustle but still close enough to everything.  If you can snag a good room rate and your expectations are modest, this hotel is a good value.  And, of course, you are guaranteed to get those great views.  Now, if they'd only clean those windows once in a while, this might become a great hotel again.

title: Breathtaking views!
text: Wow! Fantastic experience! The views from Millenium Hilton are absolutely spectacular! Amazing location right next to United Nations  we got City Views bus tour and they dropped us off right in front of hotel! Thank you for the hospitality Millenium Hilton!

title: Rude manager
text: Terrible experience. Upgraded me as diamond to a room with one bed instead of two. Needed two beds so had to wait and call 5x to ask for a new room. They took forever even though i said I had to leave for my birthday dinner at 6:30pm. Couldn't unpack or get ready. They said the key to the new room was being sent up so I waited and waited. Finally  asked to talk to a manager who was so rude. Said I reserved a one bed room which she later realized was not on the reservation and instead of apologizing and fixing it she moved me to an even smaller room after waiting an hour with two small beds almost touching. I had no time to even complain bc I was already half an hour late to my own birthday party. She also didn't come out when i stopped by on my way out and asked to speak to her. She had them say she was busy though i could see her sitting in the back. In all my years as diamond and staying at hundreds of Hilton's this was the worst experience I've ever had. Cannot believe the managers attitude after the mistake was the hotels. Oh well. Never returning.

title: Excellent hotel
text:
The room was perfect and comfortable, the view amazing and the hotel very clean and in a very nice location. Quiet but not too far from the center.
We definitely recommend it for families or couples! Can’t wait to be back!

title: Close proximity to The UN
text:
We stayed here as my husband was attending a working group at The UN.
The proximity is fabulous. Right across the road from The UN. We stayed in a King Corner suite with sensational views in one corner to The Chrysler and Empire State buildings and the other to the East River. I never tired of the view!
Beds VERY comfortable and great amenities in the room, including a desk.
6 minute walk to closest subway entrance (Grand Central and 42nd street). Cross town Buses less than 50m away.
Unfortunately we arrived the day before Memorial Day and we had to wait almost 2 hours for our room to be ready. After a long flight it was very tough to stay awake! Only staff we really remembered was Robert, the front door man. The rest very polite and would always greet you when passing.
Great security with beautiful K9 puppies and handlers who checked all luggage (due to proximity to UN)
We didn’t get breakfast at the hotel due to the exorbitant charge but visited John’s cafe (about 100 metres away) daily.
We’d certainly stay again.

title: New York Premier Facility
text: When in New York and you are in midtown, you want a facility that has an excellent location, restaurant and service.  The Millennium is located directly across from the United Nations.  The restaurant and bar is excellent with great service. The rooms are up to date, comfortable and clean. Service is excellent.  The staff are attentive, professional and responsive. If you want a great view stay one of the upper floors and you can see midtown New York.

title: Perfect place to stay in New York
text:
We are a family of four and have just come back from a 5-night stay in New York. The Millennium Hilton is perfectly placed at the quiet end of 44th street and 1st Avenue. We booked a very competitive deal with BA, which is much much cheaper than booking flights and hotel separately. 

I had phoned the hotel a couple of days ahead to specifically ask for rooms with a view over Manhattan. Unfortunately, upon our arrival late on Sunday we were given two rooms with a side view of the East River (which was lovely), but also a full view of a building site! 

Disappointed, as we were visiting New York on a special occasion (our silver wedding anniversary), I went back to the lobby and spoke to Taricia (I think that was her name). She was super helpful and got us a much larger room in the front building facing the New York skyline. What a treat!

All in all everyone of the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. 

Here are a few tips to make your stay even better:

Get a Hilton’s Honours membership (very easy to set up via your mobile). You get lots of perks, like free WiFi in your room, late check out (1pm) etc. 

The breakfast in the hotel is too expensive (even for New York standards). However, they have a coffee shop downstairs in the lobby which is open from six every morning and offers delicious pastries and coffee to take away (or to our room to have breakfast in bed every morning!) Marvellous! 

If you fancy a more substantial breakfast or want to experience a proper New York Diner, visit John’s Diner on the corner of 44th street and 2nd Ave. Their special omelette with home fried potatoes or their granola with Greek Yoghurt and fresh fruit are amazing!

If you have a late flight home like us, don’t bother getting a late checkout, which can set you back $100 to keep your room until 4pm. The reception will store your luggage for you and will give you a key to the restrooms to freshen up or get changed. 

We definitely would stay at the Millennium Hilton One UN Plaza again! Thank you to all the staff who made our stay so special!

title: Good hotel
text: Generally the hotel experience was good. It's location is superb and in close proximity to almost every place in Manhattan. You can actually walk to most places. Staff were generally friendly and helpful with information. Breakfast was good.

title: Rooms are fantastic
text:
As a loyal Hilton member, I was curious how the Millenium would fare for a recent business trip. The hotel did not disappoint! I was very pleased with my room. I stayed on the 29th floor in a standard king room. The room was super clean and modern. I thoroughly enjoyed the large bathroom along with the automated toilet. 

The views from this room of the river and the skyline were great. There was a huge walk-in closet with a safe. The floor was quiet and afforded me good sleep quality.

The hotel neighborhood with the proximity of the UN was very convenient, and there were many restaurants and access to Grand Central. The coffee shop was handy as well. The lobby area was a little sparse, and there was no lobby bar. I would easily stay at this hotel again for its overall value. I've stayed in other hotels in and around the city, and this one is by far the best.

title: A Perfect Spot in NYC
text:
My wife and I just spent the weekend at the Millennium Hilton-New York. Situated right across the street from the United Nations, it is a perfect location to enjoy all that the city has to offer. The room, provided a beautiful view of the East River; the staff were welcoming and attentive; and the restaurant offered a variety of fine food [especially the duck). Close to city buses and taxis; just 4 blocks from Grand Central Station for the subway.

A nice choice if you want to splurge and spend a really special weekend in "The Big Apple".

title: New York Wiew
text:
Hotel perfetto,
abbiamo soggiornato in una camera King Angolare.
Camera perfetta sotto ogni punto di vista.
Vista spettacolare sui grattaceli di NY
Bagno Super
Letto KingSize Magnifico
Pulizia perfetta
Posizione fantastica, vicino a tutto, per fare un esempio a 10 min di passeggiata da Time Square e a 5 min dalla Grand Central Station di NY

La Catena Hilton è sempre una garanzia!

title: The best hotel in NYC!
text: I stay at this hotel every time I am in NYC and it is the best!  I stay at Hilton branded hotels all around the country for work and pleasure and this one has by far the best customer service and experience. Everyone I come into contact with when I stay there is always friendly.  It starts with Racquell who is incredible at the front desk, she is always there to greet me with a smile and make the check-in process perfect.  Dorca helped me check in last week and she as awesome also!  Racquell even remembered that it was my mom's birthday and treated her extra special!  I always come back because of Racquell and the rest of the crew that make me experience great!  The rooms are awesome too, they are spacious and offer beautiful views of NYC.  The location is great too, a quick an easy walk to Grand Central.  I highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in NYC!

title: VERY GOOD LOCATION AND NICE VIEW
text:
Very good location, nice accommodation with wonderfull view.
I was disapointed with the service of reception desk, otherwise the service was ok. Just a note : maids nocked on our door quite early in the morning, in order to make-up the room.
Wi-fi was free everywhere in the hotel and quite satisfactory and quick.

title: Never Valet Your Car
text:
Do not valet your car. $85 per night. Very difficult to valet your car. Impossible to retrieve your car. Find a lot or Park in the street. 2nd day my car was delivered smelly and seat heaters were on like someone sleeping in it. Same day on return no valet. Waiting for a while then I noticed a guy in uniform talking to 2 girls for 10 minutes. He finally came over and told me he was the valet. 20 minutes later I went downstairs to eat. My car was still parked with the alarm sounding. I went to investigate when a different employee was running to the car with the keys to turn off the alarm. I entered. Th e lobby & the same valet was joking with the desk crew how he activated the alarm by mistake. 

Next day waited 20 minutes. Car arrived with seat heaters on again. 

Next day at 6:35am  called for my car to be delivered. I arrived at 6:45 and my car was curbside & no keys or valet. Several times the desk clerk said he was coming. At 7:05 the valet showed up and apologized saying he just went on duty. So the valet went off duty without waiting for me or his relief. I entered the car and the seat heaters were on again and I was lower on gas methane when I parked it.

title: Long Weekend stay for anniversary
text: Great stay with my husband at this hotel.  The location was great and an easy 10 minute walk to Grand Central and about 20 minutes to Times Square.  All the staff were always very welcoming and friendly and it was a great location to explore the city from.  Housekeeping were great and our room was spotless each day!!  We had a fabulous trip and would certainly recommend this property again.  Thank you!

title: Great choice for Manhattan trip
text: Very happy with this hotel choice for a stay in midtown. It's surrounded by a decent few streets and quite close to Grand Central for access to subway. Breakfast is an amazing buffet but a little pricey in my opinion, even for Manhattan. Only other suggestion is the room service could put more creamer or milk and a few more tea bags in rooms as you don't get much.

title: Great view, skip the restaurant
text:
Stayed for one night, late check-in with no problems, friendly welcome at reception on a cold wet night after an afternoon of flight delays. 

Room: Bed super comfortable, lovely view of the river. Convenient that outlets were available everywhere to charge all my devices. Got a special rate that came with complimentary in-room wifi which was a nice surprise, no problems with connection or speed. Quiet despite having room close to the elevators - maybe due to the professional-types who stay here? Not complaining, in any case.

Restaurant: Had breakfast at the restaurant downstairs. Choice of the breakfast buffet (stupid expensive, huge choice of hot and cold items but a normal person can't possibly eat that much to be worth the cost) or à la carte (still overpriced, for food that tries to be fancy but still tastes like cardboard). Slow, indifferent service. Didn't help that the woman beside me was watching videos on her phone at high volume, and the staff didn't tell her to stop disturbing other clients even though they were around. Recommend you skip and find somewhere else to eat, especially if you're in a hurry.

title: NYC Gem
text: Great staff and location. Extremely hospitable team. Hotel a bit dated but very safe. Nice facilities and executive lounge. Fun to see everyone coming and going from so many different countries. Felt like family.

title: View with a room
text: Awesome!! Great beds,pillows and staff... nothing better than these views. Excellent staff and location, modern amenities and very clean. Cafe on lobby level great for morning espressos and baked goods. All in all a 5 star rating from us.

title: Amazing hotel
text: The views, the service, the restaurant for dinner... a perfect NYC stay! Better views than any other NYC hotel. From my room I could see Empire State Building and Chrysler Building! Can’t wait to come back.

title: Sehr gutes Hotel am UN Headquarter
text:
Das Hotel liegt - wie es der Name schon sagt - direkt gegenüber vom UN-Plaza. Besonders Abends ist es hier deutlich ruhiger als in direkter Nähe vom Times Square. Für Manhattan Verhältnisse hatten wir ein riesiges Zimmer - rund 25qm mit sehr guten Ablagemöglichkeiten, die Möbel alle noch sehr neu. Alles super sauber. Der Blick aus unserem Zimmer im 36. Stock war unbeschreiblich, Chrysler Building, Empire State Building scheinbar zum greifen nah. Zur Grand Central Station sind es 10 Minuten, zum Times Square gute 20 Minuten zu Fuß.
Kostenloses Wifi ist im Lobby Bereich verfügbar. Wer sich vorher über die Hilton Homepage registriert bekommt auch kostenloses Wifi im Zimmer. Das funktionierte bei uns problemlos, FaceTime und whats app telefonieren lief sehr gut.
Um die Ecke auf der 2nd Avenue gibt es einen Dunkin Donuts wo man für kleines Geld ein gutes Frühstück bekommt. Für ein Hotel dieser Größe - 439 Zimmer - ist der Check In Bereich recht klein. Gerade einmal 4 Schalter, die meistens nicht alle besetzt waren. Die Mitarbeiter dort machen ihren Job - die meisten aber auch nicht mehr. Da erwarte ich gerade bei einem Hotel dieser Kategorie einfach mehr. Dafür gibt es einen Punkt Abzug. Ansonsten hatten wir einen wunderbaren Aufenthalt dort. Wir würden auf jeden Fall dieses Hotel wieder wählen.

title: Birthday celebrarion
text: This was probably one of the best hotels I’ve stayed at. From arrival to departure, the entire team of hotel staff was extremely gracious and made my friends and me feel very welcome. The views from the rooms are phenomenal. As a Hilton Honors member, we were able to take advantage of the Skyline loving and enjoyed complimentary breakfast. The hotel is very clean. It’s centrally located. I’d highly recommend this hotel to anybody taking a business or pleasure trip.

title: Amazing stay at the Two Story King Loft
text: We had an amazing night in this hotel in the two story king loft. It's one of the most gorgeous spaces I have ever stayed in. Increeibly spacious, with a great view of Manhattan from basically every area of the room. The bed was super comfortable as well. The room looked even more gorgeous than on the official pictures provided by the hotel's page and booking. Just amazing suite!!!

title: Very Disappointed
text: Avoid. Serious facility and service issues. There are surely much better choices. Tiny rooms, 1970’s decor, non traditional Hilton Honors application (free breakfast for diamonds isn’t free), maintenance issues. I didn’t leave angry, I just left shocked. I will say the bell staff were top notch.

title: Good and Bad
text: The property and the staff are very nice and the location can't be beat.  The arrangements for a business breakfast, however, were bungled, the room I had reserved was not available when I checked in, and my efforts to resolve an inaccurate charge has yet to be addressed satisfactorily.

title: Great rooms with view, bad service
text:
4 stars for the room
2 stars for the staff

Check-In/Check-Out
Checking In was pretty standard and check out was as easy as A B C. No problems!

The Room
The room was comfortable with plenty of sunlight coming in. We got a room that has the empire state building, it was pretty nice. Standard TV and the bed was firm. 

The Bathroom
The bathroom got a bathtub and it was clean. Big mirrors and overall it was a nice clean bathroom. 

Restaurant/Entertainment
There is a cafe on site where you can get coffee and light pastries.  

Hotel Service/Amenities
Staff was not friendly at all. We are staying at Hilton and more than ever it was right next to the UN Plaza, you would expect the staff was friendly but oh boy that was not the case. 

Wifi was not free in the room but free in public areas. Although, if you are a Hilton member you can get free wifi in the room. This is where the staff was unfriendly, so I called the concierge and told him that I am a member and I would like to know how to get the free wifi service in room. The concierge was talking really fast but I understand him perfectly. I was telling him that it didn't work and then he asked for my membership number and etc, in the end, he was just telling me to call the customer service to rectify my account (ridiculous just for wifi) 

Then my husband called again and the same thing happened to him. He was not happy so he went down instead to prove that we are members and this should be an easy process, if not what's the point of being a member? So the staff was telling him reasons why and then we said what's the point of being a member if your system doesn't recognize our membership? then the guy was maybe fed up and he just gave the code but he didn't look happy. I found this very unprofessional. I used to work in the hotel industry and I do deal with annoying customers but If I was in the staff shoes that were not acceptable both the concierge and whoever my husband spoke to. Furthermore, we were there during Christmas week, where tourist are everywhere and the staff were unfriendly at all. 

Overall
It was a great location to stay at if you're looking to stay away from the crowd and had a business trip to the UN. It is a 10-minute walk to Grand Central, 2 long blocks from the hotel. Duane Reade was nearby. Overall, I enjoyed the room but not the staff.

title: Room Cleaning Delayed Daily, Have to Ask for Free Water....5* Hotel?????
text:
The check in here was fast and efficient although no help getting into the hotel, bellman hung outt into the hotel and the first one to greet us was securitty with the dog.

Room was on high floor but located conveniently by the elevators.   Layout of the room a bit bad for my husband who had to work and not desk in the room as tv ttook it up.  Would be better if they hung the TTV on the wall so thatt the desk surface could be used.   

Had tto look for maid service daily.  Requested them to clean room by calling as well as by asking the maid staff on the  floor to no avail.  Have to ask for water and coffee supplies daily.  Service is rather lackadaisical here and not sure if they care about you.  Although guest services was great at setting up hair appt.  room Maintenance needs service as coffee area arborite is unglued and coffee all over the place.  Bath tub is very shallow and very basic.

title: Treated Like Royalty
text: I've stayed at this hotel twice and remain incredibly impressed by the entire experience: clean rooms, stunning views of the city, and professional, responsive, friendly staff. They immediately resolved every small problem I ran into, from running extra coffee up to the room to helping me check in smoothly.

title: Hilton Worthy
text:
Wonderful experience at the Hilton located at One UN Plaza.  All hospitality members were very professional and polite. The room was clean and fresh. 

The rooms are huge by NYC standard. Large comfortable bed, fine linens and comfortable pillows. Plus a desk, large TV and a chaise long. The bathroom was expansive and pleasantly fitted with quality towels and hygiene products. There was even a storage/wardrobe/safe room.

Great location if you are interested in checking out the Roosevelt Tramway and Roosevelt Island, the UN and the Chrysler Building. Located an awesome Chinese take away called The East Palace at 819 2nd Ave. Hot, fresh, inexpensive food.

FYI location was fine for us. We utilized the crosstown bus to transport ourselves to the Manhattan Port for a cruise. The bus cost $3.00 each. A huge savings from taking a taxi.

title: This is a disgraceful Hilton Hotel
text:
On arrival three of the four elevators were not working in a crowded reception area.
There was no hot water in the morning, the bathroom tiles were loose, the shower flooded the bathroom and the shower  head could not be retained in the socket provided. Light bulbs were not working in the bedroom and our complaints were met witrh indifference. Even by New York Standards, which I have visited over the past 50 years, this was A NEW LOW! Do not stay in this hotel.

title: Perfect place for a wedding celebration
text:
This review is overdue, as my husband and I stayed at the Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza twice last year - in July for a pre-wedding weekend of fun, and again in November for the actual wedding. We cannot say enough good things about our stay here. Some of the highlights:

- Both rooms we stayed in, though in different parts of the hotel, had killer views. Photo attached is the sunrise view looking over the river.

- The beds are incredibly comfortable, the bathrooms spacious and luxurious, and the amenities excellent. The rooms are modern yet cozy. The bridal suites on the 29th floor were incredible, everyone in the bridal party could not stop raving about them. Two floor suites, 360 degree views and every comfort you could want. Perfect for getting ready. 

- The showstopper was the Landmark Room where we had a cocktail party, and then took photos before the wedding ceremony. Again, jawdropping views - but also incredible service by the staff and an impressive buffet spread of delicious hors d'oeuvres. 

- Also should mention that everyone we encountered who worked at the hotel - from valet, to reception, to dining - was incredibly accommodating and couldn't have been nicer.

Perfect city wedding destination! Thank you for a fantastic stay, and can't wait to return.

title: The Hilton at the UN
text: Just opposite the UN building so not difficult to locate but way east of Manhattan means there is some walking around if you want to get to mid town or Broadway, the amenities in the room and bathroom are new and touch screen enabled (lights and air con) however the carpeting shows some sign of wear but otherwise it does the job, my room was on 34 floor and got some fantastic views of the city , WIFI is good speed and check in staff was pleasant, overall it's a decent hotel to stay but if you are looking at exploring more vibrant bits of Manhattan i would recommend more mid town options , room is of good size.

title: Great room shame about the lobby
text: Great rooms with excellent views. Rooms also well furnished and nice and modern. It just seemed to lack a heart to the place. Not the most welcoming when you walk in nor felt as though a place to relax in the evening. Good location though for all of Manhattan.

title: Beautiful
text:
Stayed in an upgraded room on the fortieth floor with a gorgeous view of the river.
Skyline Executive Lounge on 30th floor with spectacular views of the river and Tutor City Penthouses one one side and midtown on the other panarama.
Manager Stanley was very gracious to me as a Diamond member.
Ambassader Grill breakfast was an add on with Diamond status and included a hot breakfast that was out of this world. 
The cold/ continental breakfast was included in the Skyline Lounge for Diamond members. The lounge also hosts appetizers with wine, cheese, chicken wings, and fresh fruit at 5 pm for Diamond members.
Thanks so much Stanley-

title: Trip of a lifetime!
text: I planned a dream trip to New York with my sister and picked this hotel based on reviews and rates. Absolutely no regrets! OMG All of the staff were SO FRIENDLY, room was perfect, the bed was comfy, the views were stunning! While we didn't stay in the room long (who sleeps in the city that doesn't sleep - on their first ever trip??), I absolutely would book this hotel again in a heartbeat!! Definitely recommend!

title: SOGGIORNO POSITIVO
text:
Buongiorno, siamo stati in questo hotel a settembre..scrivo solo ora questa recensione, esperienza tutto sommato positiva, solo al check-in abbiamo dovuto aspettare 30min perchè non era disponibile ancora la camera. Però poi soggiorno tutto perfetto. Metro vicina staff cordiale.
Saluti.

title: Very Pleasant
text: Staff was very pleasant and helpful and allowed us to check in early.  The rooms are spacious and clean, not overly stylish, but nice and the bed was very comfortable. The area is very walkable and interesting

title: Härlig helg i NYC
text: Mycket påkostat hotell ! Liten och inte välkomna de lobby  centralt läge och väldigt fint städade och påkostade rum bodde i en hörnsvit med fönster från golv till tak med makalöst härlig Manhattan utsikt

title: Large Rooms, Polite Personnel, Not recently refurbished
text:
Nice views from most of the rooms. Larger rooms than the average rooms in NYC. 
Very good shading and black-out in curtains if you cannot sleep well with daylight. 
It is not recently refurbished and some furniture seem overused. 
We didn't have breakfast as it was $50/day/person!!!!
Helpful personnel. 
Good and convenient location avoiding the noise of more central spots. 
I would choose it again in the next NYC trip.

title: Recht zentraler Standort direkt am East River
text: Hotel liegt in 44th East direkt neben der UN. Circa 10 Minuten zu Fuß bis zum Grand Central Terminal, wo auch der Express Bus vom Flughafen JFK hält. (42th East) Von dort kommt man mit der Metro (Subway) schnell überall hin.

title: Great place if you need to be at the UN or midtown East
text: Great hotel located across the UN. The rooms are spacious which is rare for NYC and the views are impeccable. I got a room where I could see my favorite view (Chrysler and Empire State buildings) and the river. Phenomenal. The staff went above and beyond and provided extra treats. I was there for a UN meeting and stayed for 10 days.

title: Great Midtown Choice
text:
Huge rooms by NYC standards
All the features desired in a business hotel.
Close to subway, ferry, and restaurant choices
Purchased room thru Cancelon and got a great rate.
Easy to use consolidator
I'll use them again

title: Great Expectations, Lacking at the Millenium Hilton!
text: While the view is extraordinary, everything else was substandard at the Millenium Hilton New York One UN Plaza.  I probably would have saved 1/2 the amount at a competing hotel, which is a block or two from this hotel and probably would have gotten better service.  Refrigerator model/holding dry and wet goods is totally inadequate, which is the first time I saw that.  Towels are not soft and fluffy as one would expect at a Hilton.  There is no access to ice for cold beverages.  And the closet that houses the microwave is problematic and does not allow for easy access.  The entire design of the kitchen and dining room area is user unfriendly.  The light over the dining room table is low enough to cause physical injury, which was experienced by one of our companions.  My experience at this Hilton property has diminished my expectations of receiving a high caliber of service of the Hilton brand.  Extremely disappointing!

title: First trip to New York
text: Hotel in a good location near Chrysler building and Grand Central staition, The hotel staff very friendly and the hotel is very clean. We had a fantastic time in New York and this hotel was a great base.

title: I’ve got a new go-to hotel in NYC
text:
As a Hilton Diamond member who travels to New York City approx 2X each month, I’ve likely stayed at every Hilton property in the city.  

First and foremost - I was thrilled with the front desk service by Brandon.  Efficient, empathetic, and exactly the quality of engagement and good dude in my corner vibe we all desire in a fine hotel experience but rarely encounter.  

Kudos Brandon for proactively seeking to match my needs to the best room for me, and for the effort - given I booked less than an hour prior to arrival.

Despite Brandon’s downplay and eagerness to do more next time with more notice - The room was fantastic.  Large, modern, very clean, and vastly superior to many of the other Hilton brand options I usually choose.

Super happy with the executive lounge service, security, quality, and overall experience.

New go to property in NYC.  For sure.

Nice job team Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza.

title: Dog Gone Experience
text:
Greeted by a bomb-stiffing mutt euphemistically referred to as "The Welcome Wagging".  While the canine performed its assigned tasks with greater ease and grace than its rather dower handler, our encounters with the bell staff could not have been more helpful and cordial.  Check-in occurred in a manner so quick, pleasant and efficient I hardly recall the event.

But the toilet roll dispenser fell apart during our short stay and 35 minutes before checkout deadline the power went out in our room.  Speculation as to whether ‘lights out’ was a hint that our welcome was about to expire was only a fleeting thought.  Fortunately, daylight saved the day and we able to promptly retreat to the hallway and vacate the room. 

For me breakfast is a perfunctory event meant to provide only the needed sustenance and introspective moments to shake off the last vestiges of disrupted sleep.  Hilton recognizes breakfast as the perfect opportunity to save its guests from starvation, even if its prices bankrupt them in the process.  But I’m just a simple ham and eggs kind-a-guy better able to enjoy a sit down meal delivered with the warmth and congeniality of a New York waitress in the greasy spoon café around the corner.  "Well, what'll it be?”

title: good location, Clean place
text:
Stayed for two night.
Over all good experience. Clean room. good view. Unfortunately windows are small so you have to work to see the view.
Exercise floor is is good with great view made me exercise more. That had big windows. 
they had no Microwave which they need to put in room. Now it is pretty much standard.
only two elevator goes to Gym but nothing there to tell customer about it caused lot of confusion.

title: Habitación acogedora
text:
La habitación en la que estuvimos era bastante grande y la cama era muy cómoda, las vistas eran alucinantes. Tiene una cafetera de cápsulas que te proporciona el hotel, y también un pequeño frigorífico por si quieres guardar alguna cosilla. 
Lo malo es que el hotel no está en el centro, después de estar todo el día andando se nota esta distancia. Para nosotros primaba que el hotel fuera mejor aunque tuviéramos que andar algo más y acertamos.

title: Great place to stay
text: I travel to NY for business a couple times per month, and this hotel is a favorite. Due to its proximity to the U.N., it's not unusual for a working dog to need to check your bag before entry. Check in is typically efficient, and check out is always a breeze. There's one particular staff member who works the front desk who remembers me and makes a special point to make me feel welcome each time he sees me. Rooms are modern and spacious with good views. Bathrooms are great with excellent towels and bath products. TVs are great with plenty of outlets. Location is good with great proximity to restaurants. It is Manhattan after all. Definitely a great place to stay.

title: Lennox family
text: Warm, friendly clean hotel away from Time Square hustle and bustle but within easy walking distance from Grand Central. Good choice of diners close by for breakfast and alike if you don't want to eat at the hotel.Would reccomend.

title: What a wonderful place to stay
text:
I stayed here from April 13-16 with my husband and our 2 kids. Originally the reservation was only for my husband and I but due to some last minute changes we had to bring the kids along. I emailed the hotel to find out if they could add the kids on to our existing reservation without us having to cancel and rebook and they did it with no problems. When we arrived we were greeted by one of the bellmen and he was very nice. Asked us where we were from and even joked with my husband telling him that he looked like one of the famous basketball players. The bomb sniffing dog was a treat too. I forgot his name but we were allowed to pet him. He was so adorable. 

We arrived at the hotel a little before 2 and even though I knew check in was at 4 I decided to go up to the desk to see if any rooms were available. To my surprise they did have a room ready and we were able to go directly upstairs. We were on the 28th floor and the view was absolutely amazing. I had requested an upgrade for a 2 bedroom but it wasn’t available. That didn’t even matter because our king suite was just like a 2 bedroom in my eyes. The living room had a pullout sofa bed, an awesome view for the kids and they even had their own bathroom and closet space. There was also a mini fridge in there. The master bed room had a good view as well with our own bathroom and closet. Omg and the heated toilet seats...never thought I would say this but they were so much fun lol! Clearly we don’t get out much because it was our first time seeing heated toilet seats with all the other great features and even had a remote for it. 

I believe the next day was when I got a knock at the door and someone brought up a tray with a small bottle of wine, some macaroons, and a card that said happy birthday. Absolutely blown away by this. Even though my birthday wasn’t until the 25th. It shows they took the time to acknowledge that and send up a treat. Hilton hotels are the only hotels I stay at and I’ve never gotten this before even when I told them I came to celebrate a special occasion. This hotel gets my stamp of approval. Lovely people throughout the hotel. Not a complaint to say and I will be returning here next year. Thank you all for an amazing visit!

title: Superb service, great spot
text:
We went for a 5 night break. The hotel is right by the UN and a great spot to explore Manhattan. We were able to walk everywhere from here which we love to do and there are good bars and restaurants close by.

On arrival we had an issue with our room which was sorted out quickly and brilliantly. With breakfast vouchers thrown in by way of apology. That set the tone for our experience of the service, which was friendly, quick and helpful.

The room was a good size with a stunning view of the skyline. Breakfast was excellent, with lots of choice and good service.

For Hilton Honours members there is a lounge but other than the view I think it is disappointing. In need of refurbishment and only offering a limited treat ( discounted rather than free drinks). 

We benefited from a discounted rate that the Hilton offer because we had seen a better rate on a website, so the Hilton matched the price and then took 25% off. It made this trip great value for money.

title: Father daughter trip 2019
text: We spend 4 days during Easter and used this hotel as bases. In my view not the Hilton quality you see in Europe. Plus we got robbed already in the first 5 min after arriving. 3 bottles of still water and a coke for $20. In a supermarket close by I paid 7 $7 for 16 bottles of water. Also ridiculous price for breakfast. I travel every week for almost 30 years and never paid this amount of money for breakfast. Not even in Monaco.

title: Views and large rooms
text: Excellent deal booked with BA flight. Right next to UN so probably very busy and expensive when UN is in session. Location gives superb views from south facing rooms and a sense of space as it is along side the East River.  This does mean it is 5 blocks from the Times Square hub of activities. 12USD Taxi, or get on the Hop on-off Bus outside the UN, or walk.  Never felt unsafe walking anywhere in Manhattan, although we were back before midnight. 55min walk to the Met Museum alongside Central Park gives an idea of scale to first time visitors.  If using Yellow Cabs, do not expect any conversation with drivers, the attitude is generally that they are doing you a favour, you will also need the street number and nearest avenue number/name where you want to be dropped. Beds were large and very comfortable, housekeeping efficient. Decent, but very expensive breakfast available, we just grabbed a coffee and pastry from the good coffee bar in the (small) lounge most days, cost around 10USD. You might want to find another place to stock up with water or juice as the pricing was comical, ( 4USD for small water).  Reception and room service was no problem, but watch out for the clown in the top hat and cape who “allocates” you a taxi after check out, he REALLY wants his tip. Overall a worthy 5 stars, probably 4 if you had a north facing room.

title: Great hotel in an excellent location
text:
I travelled with my husband and a toddler. This hotel was in an excellent location (about 10 minutes walk from Grand Central). We had a spacious room with a great view. My toddler loved looking out the window at the Empire State Building!! The room was good value for money compared to other hotels we looked at.
Our only complaints are on arrival and departure - On arrival, after a long flight from London, we had to wait for half an hour at 10pm for a crib to be delivered to our room. I had called ahead and asked for this to be there when we arrived. Secondly, when we left, we were packing up the stroller and got hassled by the concierge that we were 2 minutes late. We then had to ask the bell boy to help us with our bags and he was incredibly rude to us in doing so. This made us leave stressed and unhappy. The staff on duty on Monday 19th April around 5pm did not give us the service we would have expected.

title: Great Location great hotel.
text:
This hotel is located right opposite the UN building and next door to Unicef, a couple of blocks takes you to grand central and 42nd street. It is also pretty close to Times Square.

Before my flight left the UK I checked in using the Hilton App and requested the digital key. By the time I landed at JFK I had a notification advising my room number and that it was ready, not bad for midday considering check in is at 4pm. It seems to pay using the app.

I went straight to my room on 34th floor which was a good size, with a great view over Manhattan. Comfortable bed with lovely clean bed linen, large TV and illy coffee maker. The bathroom was large with plenty of amenities and towels, again good quality and not thread bare.

Indulged in the buffet breakfast in the hotel restaurant which was really good but seriously in all my travels I have never paid $45 for breakfast, in my opinion overpriced, there are loads of places a few minutes walk away where you can get breakfast.

Overall the hotel is great.

title: Great place to stay
text: First time in NYC, stayed at Millennium Hilton,  excellent Hotel and location, short walk to Times Square, quiet location was a plus!! staff was great and helpful,  will always stay here when we visit NYC

title: Great Hotel
text:
In a convenient spot with decent sized rooms and clean. Only had coffee there which was lovely and staff were helpful. 

Decor a bit dated and dark but generally okay place. Probably wouldn’t stay again as more to choose in NY but a decent Hilton

title: Difficult Situation Handled Well
text:
We arrived in the hotel having travelled several hours including two hours trying to get through US Customs and a delayed car pick up.  Arrived at the hotel tired and looking forward to getting into the suite which we had had confirmation of an upgrade to.  However, when we checked into our room it was a king room.  We needed a room with two beds or a separate sleeping / living area.  I went downstairs to reception to get this sorted.  Not particularly friendly reception staff.  However, I then met Patrick who had dealt with my reservation.  He showed me the original "double double" room I had booked and clearly it did not have the view or the amenities of the room we had been allocated with its view of the Chrysler Building or Empire State Building.  The suite was not available, however we had a lovely room with a pull out sofa which housekeeping made up for us each day.  We were also given complimentary access to the Executive Lounge where we had continental breakfast and drinks / canapes in the evening.  This was ideal for us as it was next door to our room and we could go in for a drink or a coffee at any time during the day.  

POSITIVES: Super bathroom (no bathtub, but walk in shower); Illly coffeemaker - but take your own milk or cream and store in the fridge; spotlessly clean; staff in the lounge area and housekeeping were friendly and helpful; location - very quiet even being next to lifts we heard no noise from outside or in the hotel.

NEGATIVES: The hotel is a bit dated with very strange decor colours, unless brown/grey/orange is your thing.  This is NOT a new hotel and maybe some upgrading is due again.

On balance, I would stay here again as the positives definitely outweighed any negatives.  Star of the show was Patrick Goad who arranged for fizz and desserts to be sent to the room on our first evening as a welcome to my daughter for her special birthday.

title: Quite expensive but not quite up to expectation
text:
For a recent weekend trip in March I wanted to give us a special treat and booked a double-floor suite (in doing so I was really guided by the online foto of the hotels own website next to the `offer` of 350$ per night.
Arriving at 12:30 pm we were informed that the room is "not yet ready" and we should try again at 14:00. 
We walked the nighbourhod (UN; 10 mins walk to Grand Central terminal etc) amd returned at 14:00  -  to be told that check-in time for this hotel is 16:00. We changed our day-plan (and finally checked in late afternoon). Watch-out: the official check-ou time of this hotel is 11:00 am!
We were quite surprised that we got a junior suite upon check-in  -  nothing of that two-floor room with its nice warm colours and the view I had booked. That room was `not available` but this one was presented as an "equivalent"  -  it did have a separate sitting room and a `kitchenette` built into a wardrobe. Unfortunately it didn't have the view I was hoping for  -  the view from the bedroom was straight against the façade of the hotel`s other wing ("UN DC 1") . Now, from THAT one there IS a view of the UN, its gardens, the East River and Queens as you can see from the hotel`s gym which is in the UN DC1 wing. When you book and want a view, ask for the UN 1 wing.
The mentioned `gym`: friends of mine who stayed here before told me ahead that their nice pool (with a view!) was closed for good, so I went for the gym. There is no other connection between the wings than through the (dark) lobby, which can be a bit of a nuisance but `ok`, except that when you return you do so pitch-wet and sweaty after a full work-out, as that gym has no showers - whatsoever. Incredible! What is also quite surprising: the gym has just 7 cardio-equipments (3 treadmills, 2 bikes and 2 elliptical walkers) and a few  weightlifting items) and is rater small for a hotel this huge of a size, but it has a stunning 149 lockers in the male changing room only. I suppose another 150-or-so in the female locker as well, and I wonder why so many as all cardio-equipments were already full on a Saturday morning at 09:00. My `take` is that the gym is open to hotel-external non-guests as well, and I don't dare to imagine a busy Thursday after-office time in-there.
Skip the breakfast in the windowless "Ambassador Grill" - not worth the price (of 39++). In summary: it is kind-of `ok-ish`  if you don't expect too much, but you should ask for a definite view in the DC one-building ahead of time.

title: Amazing hotel!
text: Cannot fault this hotel! Everything was amazing from the staff to the room and the service. We will definitely be staying here when we come back to New York! The location was great, we managed to walk everywhere with no problems except down to Battery Park as it’s quite far away to walk. Cannot thank the hotel enough for making our stay so enjoyable!

title: 大変いいお部屋でした
text: 1泊プラス50ドルでコーナースイートに変更出来るということで、お願いしたらとても眺望の良いお部屋でした。バスルームのお湯が赤く、困って何度もスタッフの方に伝えました。3回目くらいでようやくお部屋に来てもらえてそこから1時間ちょっと直すのに時間がかかってディナーの予約が間に合わなくなってしまったのでキャンセルしたのが残念でした。お部屋はとっても良かったです。

title: So much potential
text: This property has the potential to be so much better. With the great location on E44, over looking the Hudson, handy enough to most places. The Hilton team were all friendly and courteous. However, it’s all of the small things that just add up....asking for the shower handle to be fixed and coming back to find that it still falls off. Forgetting to replenish the amenities such as the body wash, charging $5 for a glass of wine in the Hilton Honours Lounge-I’ve stayed at a number of Hilton Hotels and have never come across that before across Asia, Europe and more recently Mexico.

title: 50th birthday celebration
text: We stayed at this well located hotel in mid town NYC.Well located near grand central station and 20 min walk to Time Square. I highly recommend this hotel for tourists as it is clean and fab location near all big attractions.It is more catered for business travellers however suited us.It was clean,quiet and staff were very helpful.NYC was beautiful at this time of the year but need warm clothes.

title: Best bang for the buck.
text: Best bang for the buck if you are looking for a family suite for vacation or events. The location is perfectly central and the views are spectacular. The hotel staff is delightful, especially housekeeping, and the accommodations were perfect for our needs.

title: Tartan Week
text:
We arrived late at night from Scotland for the Tartan Parade. It was my wife’s birthday on the 9th so I wanted a special experience for her. Wow did your team deliver. A bit of advance planning with great help from your starman Gerry Mercado’s. He was the consummate professional ensuring she had a surprise champagne breakfast in the grill. 
We had super help from Dorca in getting our accommodation sorted and she moved heaven and earth for us. Well assisted by Patrick Goad. Can’t thank Dorca enough for her choice of one bedroomed suite. Superb.
The waiting team were efficient and slick at breakfast. In the evening your starmen in the grill were the amiable and entertains Jeff Gould and Ed Valle. They looked after us sublimely. Food was great too so I’m writing in the foyer before our pick up to JFK feeling blessed you guys were the best I’ve encountered in donkeys years of travelling the globe. You gave us a perfect New York experience that ensures when we come back we will feel like we are coming home to you. I can not recommend you highly enough. Brilliant, pure brilliant. A thousand thanks.

title: An unsuspecting gem
text: This hotel is less than a block from the UN buildings, a block from the Chrysler building and a short walk to great pubs and restaurants and the iconic New York sights. The hotel is beautiful and clean with amazing views of the Hudson River and Long Island. Rooms are large and spacious.

title: Really nice hotel, but not for smokers
text:
Travel Agent Review:

Walk into a nice lobby, staff are really helpful. I was on the 34th floor (room 308). Had a stunning view out over the east river, the room was a nice size, big comfy bed, TV/aircon all worked fine. If I'm being REALLY picky the bath tub was a little small, but fine for a few nights. 

You have to pay extra for WiFi in the room which is a bit of a joke these days, however if you sign up to a free hilton membership thing, they take the charge off your room. 

If you are a smoker, the whole road outside the hotel is non-smoking, so you have to walk about 100m to have a cigarette. Not the end of the world, but a bit of a pain if you're popping out for a quick one from your room. 

Location is pretty good if you dont mind doing a bit of walking. I walked from the hotel to central park, then right down to the One World Trade Centre, and back again, so it is doable but incredibly long. You're roughly about 10 minutes away from Grand Central station, probably 15-20 minutes to Times Square. 

I didnt try any of the food at the hotel, so can't comment.

title: Terrific hotel with outstanding views
text:
Stayed for 5 nights in March and the room at lovely views over towards the UN building and the East River with views south over Manhattan where you could see the Empire State Building, Chrysler Building and with the new tower down by the 9/11 museum in the distance . The views were lovely during the day but at night they were spectacular.

The facilities in the room were great with a very large TV, small fridge and one of the most comfortable beds I've slept in when staying in a hotel. 

The staff in the hotel were very friendly and extremely helpful, with the staff at check in making the process very quick which was great after a long flight.

Had tea and coffee making facilities in the room and this was replenished each day as were the toiletries which my wife loved.

It is within easy walking distance of many of the attractions like the empire state building, grand Central Terminal, Central Park and times Square all within a out 15 to 25 mins walk.

Would be happy to return for another stay and we've already begun to plan this.

title: I really enjoyed my stay here
text:
Clean room and bathroom.
Reception desk staff warm and welcoming 
Good lighting in bathroom and bedroom 
Nice view especially at night 
Tv good size I like walk in closet 
Decent room size 
Nice having a coffee shop on site 
WiFi ok
Has Grill restaurant serves nice food 
Complimentary coffee n tea 
But why don’t NY hotels don’t give complimentary water?
Hotel busy hiwevwr not too loud 
Business centre guy friendly 
Gym two parts weight training and Cardio and the cardio section too warm with no way to regulate, gym not busy machines ok.... My only negatives which are 
Under the bed was like many hotels; a bit neglected and was dusty and dirty.plus seating area in foyer/reception area smelt a bit musty

title: A Hilton with a view.
text:
Hotel accidentally put a bottle of wine in my room, I called, explained and they told me to enjoy it courtesy of the front desk.

The room was modern, clean and easy to access; corner king 30th floor. Struggled with HH app for Wi-Fi though.

The lobby was large with plenty of seating and the staff were able to deal with all requests. Baggage, transfers, toilets after checkout ext.

The view from our room was excellent, a real highlight for the trip.

Will stay again, particularly for the welcome dogs. Nice work guys.

title: Great hotel
text: Just back from a very nice stay at Millennium Hilton. We got a room in the 37th floor and the view was amazing. Big picture window as well. We had views of the east river, Brooklyn Bridge, Empire State and Chrysler Building. Couldn’t have asked for better. Room was very comfortable and bathroom looked brand new. The staff we came across were all very welcoming and helpful. Defo go back.

title: Buono per lavoro
text: Ci sono stato per lavoro. Posizione comoda, proprio di fronte alle Nazioni Unite. Location  da albergo moderno. Accoglienza professionale e garbata, ma poco sorridente. Stanza adeguata con tutto ciò che serve. Panorama molto bello. Colazione discreta, ma non ricca. Buona palestra con veduta suggestiva sul fiume Hudson. Prezzo in linea. Lo consiglio per lavoro e penso che ci tornerò.

title: Allez ailleurs!!!!
text: Si je prends le temps de vous écrire à 5:30 du matin, c’est ce que je ne peux pas dormir malgré l’avoir signalé à l hôtel la nuit précédente. Un bruit de ‘ventilation/chauffage’ du couloir infernal. Extrêmement mal insonorisé. Éléments non fonctionnels dans la chambre et chaise sale. Je recommande fortement d’aller ailleurs...

title: Not for tourists
text:
This was booked by my partner as a surprise for me, and after having had a bad experience with Hilton in the past I emailed the front desk to explain this and that I was looking forward to them restoring my faith in the brand, I had a prompt response from Stanley and was delighted to read that he was upgrading our room to a corner room, excellent I thought, perhaps my last bad experience was a one-off. Sadly this was not to be the case. 

We arrived at the hotel at around 5 pm, no wait to be checked in. We were checked in by Avery, and what a "jolly" fellow he was (please note the sarcasm) Don't think I've ever met a more surly front of house individual in my life. I asked if he had my HH details on screen before I could finish my sentence he responds "yes but you won't get your points as you booked through a third party". this was delivered with an almost "ha ha" type attitude all without looking up from his screen. "ok, can you see the details of the complaint I had with Hilton" again curtly response of "no sorry". In addition to his poor manner, he looked like he had slept in his coat! 

Off we went to our room and both agreed this was not a great start, we walked in and low and behold, the upgraded room had not been given, we were in a dark room with a tiny window on the 37th floor. I called down to the desk, and got Avery, "Hi there you've just checked us in and we were due to have an upgrade" I said quite politely. "no, your booking was for a  double room" I was told. I then explained the email chain with Stanley, his response, "well I've not got any corner rooms" sigh. "ok I'll come down and we can discuss" I said, now getting a bit annoyed with his attitude. Surprise, surprise he had vanished. I explained the issue to another member of the front of house team who was perfectly pleasant, saw the issue and rectified quickly and professionally, and magically had a corner room that Avery had said you didn't have, so not only was he rude, but he lied to us. I wanted to raise this, but my partner just wanted to enjoy our trip. 

The hotel lobby is quite small and feels like a train station waiting room, there is a small coffee shop serving snacks and drinks. We felt as we were not wearing suits we really didn't matter to the staff, we both agreed that we have never felt so invisible in a hotel in our lives. 

Breakfast is $42.50 each, so we eat out every day. 

Our corner room was spacious with a great TV and amazing views, the water was not always as hot as it could be. The room was kept clean. 

If the hotel wishes to contact me our room was 3825 and we were staying from 18th - 22nd of March.

title: Super Hotel mit genialer Aussicht
text: Diese Aussicht ist unfassbar! Wir hatten ein modern eingerichtetes Zimmer in der 40. Etage des West- Towers. Das Zimmer ist sehr komfortabel, mit TV, Kaffeemaschine, riesigem Bett, sehr modernem Badezimmer und vor allem sehr sauber. Das Personal war sehr freundlich, wir kommen gerne wieder. Kleiner Tipp, als Hilton Honors Mitglied  hat man auch auf dem Zimmer freies WLAN.

title: Visited this March 2019
text:
It was okay. We got off to a bad start as they put 3 people in a 2 person room despite us being transparent about the number of people staying. When I talked to Brandon guest services he tried to help but nothing came of it until I emailed the managers themselves and then we had to move rooms quite late in the evening. Considering that we had landed that day it wasn’t great to have to deal with this issue. The hotel blamed British airways- the third party we booked with as part of a deal but I still believe it is hotel responsibility and the onus shouldn’t be put on the guests to sort these issues out. 

The rest of the stay was fine, the continental breakfast sufficient. I would say this is more of a business hotel rather than a leisure one though.

title: Rooms with fantastic New York views
text:
I have now stayed twice at this hotel, both times in spacious rooms with superb views of the Manhattan Skyline, the UN, and the East River. My rooms had king size beds and full sofa beds. The rooms were large enough to accommodate walk-in closets. Check-in and check-out were promptly done and housekeeping service was also good. 

Breakfast at the hotel restaurant is expensive, but there is a conveniently located small cafe in the lobby for a quick grab-and-go.

I have heard that the hotel gets very crowded when the UN is in session, but I was able to avoid such times and would love to stay there again.

title: Amazing view, Immaculate Room, Friendly Staff
text: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Millennium Hilton. The staff was very kind and welcoming. The moment we walked into our corner room, we were amazed at the view of both the city and the river. The room was extremely clean, modern, and spacious. I look forward to staying here again,

title: Excellent
text: Très bien situé  pour découvrir  Manhattan  ; chambre spacieuse  literie top et vue de la chambre  absolument  magique  ; je recommande  donc cet établissement  qui   de plus est d'un excellent  rapport  qualité  prix !

title: Nahe am UN headquarter gelegen
text: Direkt gegenüber den Vereinten Nationen gelegen war das One UN die ideale Basis für die Teilnahme an der Frauenrechtskommission der VN, aber auch idealer Ausgangspunkt für andere Aktivitäten. Über Buchungsportale kann man auch günstige Preise finden. Direkt ggü. im Mona Kitchen in der 44. Straße gibt es eine gute und preiswerte Frühstücksalternative.

title: Outstanding service from two all star employees
text: I stayed at the Millennium Hilton New York for St. Patrick's Day weekend. While most of the time was spent out and about, I wanted to highlight two employees in particular who went out of their way to assist me while I was injured and on crutches. Both Llany at the executive lounge and Adamo at the Ambassador Grill were exceptionally friendly and helpful during my stay. Both of them helped me navigate the areas, helped me get some food and coffee and cleared my plates afterwards. They made me feel right at home even though I was in an uncomfortable situation. I hope these two outstanding gentlemen get the recognition they deserve. Thanks!

title: Handy to UN
text: This was a stay for a Lions Club International event for Lions Day at UN. Being directly across the street from the UN was extremely handy. For NYC, this was a very reasonable base price. Of course, one cannot control the plethora of  taxes!

title: Gret location.  Friendly staff. good place to stay
text: We liked the location and the staff was very friendly and helpful.  the down side is the coffee maker in the room.  bad coffee, hard pot to work had to ask for directions!  Would be nice to have a larger coffee maker and a small microwave

title: Location ideal for UN but overall a bit shabby
text: Spent 2 nights at Millennium while attending meetings at the United Nations.  The hotel location is perfect for easy access to the UN. But for the money, it is a bit shabby (stains in hallway carpets, limited personnel for check in or help with bags).  Also, room service options fairly limited.  Was surely nice when it opened in late 80s but seems to be in need for a full remodel.  Rooms have newer furnishings.

title: Terrible
text: If their is ever a real emergency you will probably die at this hotel. Fire Alarm went off multiple times and this hotel was not prepared. Chaos and no leadership. Do not recommend this Hilton to anyone.

title: Uno dei miei preferiti
text: Ci sono stata varie volte, nei we si svuota dei dipendenti delle nazioni unite e si puo spendere meno. Questa volta ero in settimana e ho speso parecchio ma a me piace.la migliore colazione che abbia trovato in un albergo, ricchissima e di alta qualità. Stanza molto grande e bella. Pulizia e cortesia del personale il quale ci ha permesso di andare sul tetto ì, con un impiegato della manutenzione, per poter fare alcune foto professionali.

title: Our Trip of a lifetime
text:
My husband, friend, daughter and I booked our trip to New York staying at what can only be described as a place that made all our dreams come true. It was my husbands 50th birthday and a special trip for our daughter who has her own medical problems as well as helps to look after our 97 year old Grandmother with advanced Denentia. We wrote to the hotel asking for a fridge to be placed in our room for our daughters medication and told them how excited we were to be coming to New York staying with them for my husbands 50th birthday. We had not had a holiday for 8 years. 

Not only did we get a prompt response agreeing to our request for a fridge in our room but we were also upgraded to the Suite. When we arrived the hotel was stunning the people were warm and friendly. The hotel security makes you feel extremely safe. The staff did everything they could to make our stay enjoyable, giving us the best advice on travelling/sight seeing around New York. 

When we walked through the door to our suite, we were blown away by the most beautiful views we have ever seen, simply took our breath away, so much so that we were never in any rush to leave the suite. We had 2 beautiful bedrooms with en-suite, a big lounge where one side overlooked the river and the other Manhattan with incredible views including the Empire State and Chrysler building. The hotel is immaculate, we could not find a single fault. 

Credit to Monique the hotel manager who ensures extremely high standards in every way, delivered with warm, friendly helpfulness. 

A personal thank you also to Monique for making our stay the most memorable and talked about for years to come. 

A personal thank you to Robert also who went that extra mile, our daughter Ellamay still speaks of you now. Thank you for being so warm and friendly. 

Thank you to everyone who works at this wonderful hotel, you are all simply amazing.

title: Great atmosphere for all!
text:
We basically walked around the corner to the United Nations. The closest subway was Grand Central and only 6 blocks away - Amazing Bagel Shop and CVS and Empire State Building along the way! We walked from Central Park near the Plaza to the Hilton!
Everyone at the hotel was friendly, knowledgeable, helpful and full of personality! We were always greeted by many as we entered and remembered! 
The quick food/coffee shop had delicious food, variety and an Amazing staff! Great prices as well.
We would definitely stay there again...no question!

title: Best Staff Ever!
text: This hotel has not only great rooms/views of NYC, but it also contains the most friendly staff I’ve ever had the pleasure of meeting. I would recommend this hotel to anyone! The location is also great.

title: Fantastic Hotel
text: Exceptional value, breathtaking views and world class hospitality...  Our family had a great experience with staff. Very professional and knowledgable (Vince) staff provided us with prompt and  great custoner service.We think this is the  best overall location in New York City....Must return........ 6 stars !!!

title: Lite avsides
text:
Ett fint hotell med bra personal men lite avsides, så det blir en del gående och taxiresor.
Blev uppgraderad till Presidental Suite med två toaletter och kök.
Ett trevligt hotell helt enkelt med ett bra frukostställe alldeles utanför.

title: Value for money
text: This hotel combines everything. It’s at the Manhattan’s heart with unique view. The staff were friendly and the room was very clean also. The only thing I didn’t like was the breakfast, since it doesn’t have that variety keeping in mind that it costs apx 40 dollars.

title: Thanks for a good visit
text:
The staff were very accommodating and helpful. This applied to everyone I met from the reception staff to room service to the exec floor. My room was very comfortable and nice and quiet which led to some great nights sleep! 
I would happily return to this Hilton, great staff and great location. Shame about the snow but I can’t blame Hilton for that!!!

title: Where's The Hospitality?
text:
This review is based solely on my interaction with a front desk manager on 3/1/19.

Based on the reviews and the beautiful views that the hotel has to offer, my significant other and I were so excited to stay at Millennium Hilton UN Plaza. We were booked for a two-night getaway to celebrate a special occasion. Unfortunately, mother nature decided to strike and give us lots of snow, which ended up with cancelled flights and our plans for a weekend away were also cancelled.

We originally did an advanced purchase for our room (And yes, we understand the refund policy that was stated). My first interaction with the front desk manager was at 6pm, I explained everything that happened and asked if she could move my reservation that was for 3/2/19 to 3/16/19. She quickly brushed my concerns away but said, "You are all set. I will change your reservation. You will receive an email with your new reservation. We look forward to seeing you." I was ecstatic. After waiting two hours and still no email, I decided to call and check on my reservation. The rep. told me my reservation was still for 3/2/19. I called the hotel directly and again was told my reservation was 3/2/19 and had not been changed. This is when everything went downhill.

I spoke to the front desk manager again around 9pm and asked what had happened. She gave me the typical advanced booking policy and told me there was nothing that could be done. She then refused to talk to me and only wanted to speak to “The one that holds the Hilton Gold Status”. I have worked in hospitality for over ten years, majored in hospitality, and know exactly how stressing the job could be. I simply asked why she could not call me to let me know my reservation could not be changed. Common courtesy would have just been to call me and let me know that due to my advanced booking, I would have to speak to Hilton advanced booking personally. What a disaster it would have been had I checked into the hotel on 3/16 with no real reservation. Her attitude and her unwillingness to be understanding and help really put into perspective that the hotel does not care about their customers. It is a shame that we do not want to stay at this beautiful Hilton hotel anymore.

Even after all of that, my representative from advanced bookings understood that my safety was much more important than a hotel booking. Thankfully he was able to refund my room, after only he was given a hard time by the front desk manager as well.

title: Nice hotel
text:
Hotel is nice, simple. Rooms are clean and fairly spacious. Concierge staff were very nice and helpful. Good location walking distance to the subway. A good walk to Times square (about 20-30mins).
Worth the stay.

title: Quiet, clean hotel, amazing views
text:
My room was well appointed, quiet, clean and had an amazing view.  

The decor is kind of dark/strange/ “seventies” but is NOT old or run-down (room decor seemed to be quite new/done recently).  Examples: dark grey/black masonry/tile hallway walls in guest-room floors, orangey-brown leather stitched-together squares as bedroom wallcovering, weird disco-ish black marble/chrome /mirrored check-in desk and lobby, odd smoked-glass pear-/inverted uterus- shaped lights on each side of bed.  

The decor was a head scratcher to me and it did not feel like a hotel where I’d want to bring children.  Who knows? It is by the UN and maybe that decor appeals to the clientele.

The bathroom, thankfully was nice, bright, very modern, with plenty of decently sized towels.  I found the tub/shower/hand-held sprayer water controls to be confusing but figured it out.  Tub stopper did not work well enough to permit a proper bath.  

I liked the window that opened a bit...love to get fresh air in my room.

I found the coffee machine to be a challenge to operate...an ily version of a keurig but not as easy to use and no directions provided. Had to hit the “full cup” icon multiple times to eventually get a full cup.

Staff generally pleasant and efficient.

title: Excellence
text: Une merveille !!! Merci a Tyera pour son professionnalisme !!!!!! Cet hôtel est juste parfait. Une equipe à l'écoute et aux petits soins pour répondre aux demandes. Je reviendrais c'est une évidence. Merci

title: would not hesitate about it
text:
The hotel is situated in a building where the lobby is on the ground floor, and then there are several floors of offices (about 29 floors) and then you get into the hotel part. The hotel elevator and lobby have nothing to do with the office people. The hotel has a lounge for those who are entitled to use it under their Hilton honors standing, or who pay for access. The neighborhood is completely United Nations.

The plusses: very kind staff (everybody), perfectly clean, beautiful views of the East River or parts of the city, depending on where your room is. The lounge was very nice, and I had no problem with the $5 charge for a glass of wine or a beer at happy hour. But I'm not sure how I would feel about paying extra for the lounge.

The minuses: the decor feels dated, at least in the room we were given and in the common areas. The neighborhood is really the UN, and has an office-area feel. There's not a lot right there that would interest a tourist. If you like to walk, it is walkable enough to Grand Central Station and many other things noted in other reviews, and that is more valuable in the warmer weather and when the daylight hours are longer. Grand Central is a transit hub, with subways to anywhere in the city.

Would I go back? Yes, if it met our needs again. I like it a lot, but if 5 is "excellent" and 4 is "very good", it's probably fairer to give it 4. It really deserves four and a half, especially if you get a good price by NYC standards.

title: Top view from the room.
text:
We had a corner-room on the 36th floor. The room was always clean and the bathroom was very spacious and seemed to be freshly renovated. 
Stuff was always helpful without telling them first. 
The price was ok for us for 44th Street.

title: Good over all experience
text:
Pros

*Good location (specially if you are there to work in the UN)
* Good sized rooms considering New York standards, with good view of the city.
* Friendly staff.
*What was amazing to us was the ILLY cafe in lobby severing  the best coffee with milk alternatives and on the go food, drinks, and snacks. 

Cons

*Some sheets were stained.
*Fridge exterior was sticky.
*We were allocated near a staff room and cleaning supplies so it was annoying and noisy.
* Had an incident with house keeping placing a wet cleaning towel in my suite case, which was handled by security and we were given one day access to the club lounge and free late checkout.

title: Nice experience
text:
It was first time that we visit USA and New York as a family with grown up childrens. We choose Millenium Hillton hotel because we know Hillton brand and because they have rooms also for three or four people. We have three children so we need one bigger room. 
The service was good, nothing special but the view from the room was ubforgetable. We have rooms in 34th nand 37th floor and it was realy something.
