On the other side I would like to expose the problem of bery drt air in the rooms. I think that this is something very common but for me was quite disturbing. All in all the stay was pleasant and we will be back.

title: Great Location - Comfortable rooms even if small
text:
Located across the street from the UN, it's easy access to middle Manhattan locations, 3 blocks from Grand Central Terminal and a 20 minute walk to Central Park.

Rooms are a little small (my room was a stroll down a hallway to to get to the bath) and my 35th story view was a construction site, but it's New York.  Beds are comfortable. No hot water from 7:30am - 9am so one star removed for that.  Hotel staff are top notch and go out of their way to make your stay exceptional.  Lobby deli prices are borderline rip-off ($5 for a 20 oz coke).  

Overall, a very good stay and I would return in the future.

title: Convenient
text: Very comfortable hotel . Rooms are a good size for New York and have great views . The buffet breakfast is a good spread . Walking distance to Grand Central and Times Square . Service is friendly and the rooms are well appointed . Easy access from the FDR to the city airports .

title: A great stay and hope to come back
text:
I have been wanting to stay here for some time but was unable to get a good rate that my job would allow for.  The desk staff was great.  I got to the hotel around 5pm and went check in but forgot my ID which I left at my families place not to far away.  The desk clerk was unable to check me in without it and even though I had my HH app and could provide all of my information he was not allowed to check me in especially given the close proximity to the UN.  I totally understand and hold no ill will against the hotel for my mistake.  

I was able to leave my bag there and upon my return they checked me in swiftly and upgraded my room which I heard was common for diamond members, which I am.  

I found my room to be very nice, clean and spacious with a great view of side of the Met Life building, the Chrysler building and the Empire State building.  There was practically now street noise heard and I slept very well.  I thought the square toilet was pretty cool too.

The diamond breakfast area was very nice with excellent views of the UN and downtown towards the Freedom tower which I could easily see.  Even though they don't provide any hot breakfast items I found the food to be very good and the fresh fruit was excellent.  I was even surprised that they had lox cream cheese spread.

If given the opportunity I will definitely stay here again.

title: Nice views
text:
We stayed here for 6 nights in February. Overall a very enjoyable stay, large, clean rooms and the hotel has good views of the skyline. Had breakfast every morning in the skyline lounge, the choice wasn't huge, but it was definitely adequate and saved going out for breakfast. 

The hotel is roughly a 20 minute walk from Times Square and 5 minutes ish from Grand Central Terminal. Overall, not a bad location and experience so would return

title: Third time here - always great
text: The location, the view and the friendly staff all contribute to a great stay. This is my third stay here and I have always left with the same impressions.  Note that it's not perfect as it is showing it's age in places (cracked bathroom sink; some dings in walls) but this hotel can be recommended for the things mentioned above + a very good breakfast buffet and clean, quiet rooms.

title: MOTHER & DAUGHTER GET AWAY WEEKEND💕
text: I wanted to give my mom the best weekend that I could to build memories, for she is disable & getting up in age. So, our itenirary consisted of two music concerts, dinner & two different hotel night stays. We enjoyed everything except the hotels! The staff attitude wasn't hospitable at all & the room wasn't what I expected but Ty, the manager tried to resolve the situation with a delayed checkout. Thanks Ty!

title: Overnight by the UN
text:
Hotel from inside and out is high quality and in a prime location next to the FDR and midtown east.  Hotel room had modern amenities including a toilet that had a remote (really drew my attention).  

Front desk staff was polite but couldn't accommodate my request for an early check in that was submitted back in December, instead it's first come first served.  Also, bell hop crew basically refused to help with luggage- was told I had to wait 10 minutes for another bell hop to arrive.

The coffee shop in the lobby is really expensive but is expected given location.

title: A really enjoyable stay :)
text: Me and fiance visited this hotel this Feb. We stayed in room 3315 a corner room with a view on the 33rd floor. We paid a little extra but the views were beautiful of the Hudson in the morning and in my opinion worth the fee. The rooms were very clean and the facilities  perfectly efficient. As a standard booking you wont have internet in your room its charged at a fee of $9.99 a day unless you are part of the Hilton honor scheme which is worth joining as its free but we didn't know this until the day we left we were therefore only able to use the free wifi in the lobby. The Staff on the Bell desk were absolutely lovely very helpful and would greet us every morning which a smile and a good morning :) The food in the restaurant was very tasty but a little pricey! I would recommend this hotel to anyone travelling as a couple or for business!! we would like to say a Big thankyou to the gentlemen working on the Bell Desk :)

title: Outstanding Hotel
text: This hotel is a hidden gem.  Wonderful service especially from the door men who greet you to the bartender in the restaurant.  The views, food, and style of this hotel were amazing.  Nothing cookie cutter about it!

title: Nice hotel in a good location
text:
Just returned from a 4 night stay and would stay here again.  Clean,  friendly staff and good location to explore Manhattan.  Room was a decent size for us as a couple and the concierge were very kind and helpful with taxis. Yellow cab from hotel to JFK is no more than $57  . 
We were also allowed to stay in our room till 1pm as our flight was in the afternoon - nice touch. 
Beds are very comfy. 
Cafe UN is expensive. $4.5 for a small bottle of water. However as a guest ask the concierge and they'll give you a complementary one. 
Good breakfast up the road at John's cafe on 2nd Ave. 
Would definitely stay here again.

title: Plastic cheese = plastic hilton
text:
Second visit to the hotel and second to the executive club this trip. Cheese as previous visit seems to be topped up at breakfast and evening, the older cheese being discoloured. Breakfast has improved but still only chicken wings, second hand cheese and a few veggie sticks.
Rooms are clean and comfortable, good location, but eat out. I tried breakfast once in the main restaurant and it wasn’t any better than the exec club!

title: PERFECT!!!
text: The location is very safe which is always a good thing on a holiday abroad. The hotel was spotless and all the staff were very approachable, friendly and helpful. I had a slight inconvinience with the room I originally booked, I made this aware to the hotel lobby who acted swiftly and smoothly to resolve the issye. As no other room were available of the same spec to what I booked; Patrick (hotel manager) and Brendon (receptionist) went above and beyond any of my expectations to resolve it. They upgraded me to a higher floor into a two bedroom/two bathroom suite which was stunning! The views from any window were breathtaking to the point we spent alot of the night just sat gazing out at the chrysler and empire state building with a complimentary room service dessert (which was superb) and also gave us complimentary access to the Executive lounge with Breakfast included!! To say that this was "excellent customer service" would be a massive understatement! This upgrade was a phenomenal bonus to our trip in the city! Hilton Hotel should take note of the work done by both Patrick And Brendon as they highlighted why I always choose to stay with the Hitlon wherever I go!! They are an absolute credit to the company and ensured my stay at the hotel was more than perfect. Thank you again for a superb stay! Will DEFFINATELY be staying with this hotel in the future! 10 stars!

title: Almost Heaven
text: I stayed on the 40th floor in a two-bedroom / two bathroom suite with breathtaking views of the East River, Downtown, and Midtown. I awoke each morning seeing the Chrysler Building from my bedroom window. The service was flawless and the suite was so wonderful that I spent a lot of time in my room instead of touring.

title: Efficiently managed Hilton
text: Stayed overnight due to unanticipated travel delay resulting from inclement weather. Arrival was met by a sniffer dog - presumably because of its proximity to the UN (not a comforting feeling). Lobby of hotel is somewhat small but check-in was processed efficiently and the staff were friendly. Hallways to the assigned room look refurbished but the ceilings are a trifle low - that made it somewhat claustrophobic. Room was of a good size and gently decorated with a modern motif. It had the expected amenities for a Hilton - only issue was the work desk, which lacked power outlets. Singular restaurant was well managed and the quality of the food was acceptable for the rates. However, I did not appreciate the automatic inclusion of a service charge; waiter did not notify me that he had done that. Overall, a functional and pleasant enough hotel.

title: Hilton treasure
text: Found this Hilton to be a truly exceptional value and efficiently run hotel. Extremely clean, great location and was upgraded without asking. Had a gorgeous city-water view from the 36th floor. Love that it's not one of these mega-huge hotels.

title: The View!!!
text:
I always come back to this Hotel due to the fantastic view. Depending on the tower (A or B) and the side (River or City) your view differs but is always a treat. During my last (long stay) I used 3 rooms to find the perfect view. 

+ Good Location for walks at the river and easy to get to public transportation at grand central 
+ rooms are spacy and have good furniture 
* corner rooms tend to be bigger in size plus have two sides with windows. However, in the tower facing Manhattan, corner does not give that much extra, standard room would be sufficient. 
* the other tower is older when it comes to interior and has less bathroom amenities, older bathroom with tub (instead of modern shower) and less modern air conditioning - but still good quality 
- the Continental Breakfast for gold members in the sky Lounge is ok but no better 
- windows are always dirty, otherwise the rooms are clean 
- all staff is very friendly. Only the staff at the reception gives you almost permanently the impression you would be an annoyance - only exception is Brandon, he really makes you feel like he cares and is very engaged. 
- restaurant is expensive and not the best. 

Compared to other hotels, the price, the view, the quality of the rooms and the friendly stuff make this hotel always my first choice.

title: Very nice hotel
text: Hotel is very well located has nice restaurant within the hotel as well as around  great staff very helpful their breakfast was very good even thought a little pricey. Will definitely come back for the location.

title: Makalös utsikt från en modern och fin svit
text:
Familjen bodde tre nätter i en modern trerumssvit, 3431, med en fabulös utsikt över New York. Sviten hade utsikt mot såväl Chrysler building, Empire state building som mot FN-skrapan, Hudson river och där emellan Oneworld- skyskrapan. Tyst och säkert läge. Trevligt bemötande vid incheckningen. Lobbyn är liten men elegant. Du får hjälp av en bellboy och utanför finns det hela tiden en vakt med hund som luktar på ditt bagage för din och andras säkerhet.
De två sovrummen hade bekväma sängar med med var sin elegant toalett med dusch.  Till masterbedroomets toalett fanns det både en elegant dusch och ett badkar. I vardagsrummet fanns det en bra touchkontroll som styrde luftkonditioneringen separat till de tre rummen. Bra när man vill ha olika temperatur och luftflöden.

Vi hade tillgång till skybaren, 30 våningen, för en Continental frukost. Den var riktigt bra med mycket frukt och bär, yogurt,bagels, goda ostar, juicer,kaffe och te och därtill ett läckert bord med olika bakverk. På kvällen fanns det lite aptitretare, ost och vindruvor och kalla drickor och kaffe. Trevligt att få i sig något litet innan du går ut och äter på kvällen i New York. Vi åkte mycket Uber, som är ett smidigt sätt att förflytta sig lite längre på. Det går snabbt att åka söder ut till Wall Street och på samma sätt går det snabbt att ta sig norrut till Central park, Moma och Naturhistoriska museet. Området för hotellet är trevligt och lugnt och man går tryggt och lätt västerut till Grand Central. 
Rummen är bekväma och moderna. I vardagsrummet fanns det två divaner, ett skrivbord, ett matbord med fyra stolar samt en avkopplande fåtölj med fotpall. I ett skåp finns det micro, kylskåp och en kaffemaskin. Kaffemaskinen just var inte så bra som allt annat. Det fanns bra mörkläggninggardiner. Men de behövdes inte eftersom man ligger och tittar ut över den makalösa utsikten tills man somnar. Hotellet är perfekt för den som vill ha vacker utsikt, bo tyst men bekvämt i den trevliga staden New York. Vi kommer gärna åter...🌞

title: Great place and good location
text:
All the staff were courteous and helpful – everyone including reception, bell desk, bar/restaurant and room cleaners.

The hotel generally and our room (3104) in particular was clean and well appointed. 

Our only real grumble was with the 3rd party concierge. The young lady I spoke to on two or three occasions was never as helpful as Hilton's own staff. If our information request was not included in her collection of leaflets, or (I guess) if it was one where she received no commission, then she knew little about it – specifically she just told us to go to the internet to book the Statue of Liberty tour. On another occasion I asked about the Super Bowl as I wanted to find a restaurant that had no TV in their dining room. She was unhelpful regarding restaurants in general and she had to ask me what the Super Bowl was! However, she did sell us tickets for the Empire State Building which saved us some queuing time at the venue, but didn’t point out that for a small additional fee, we could have had tickets for both a day and night visit – we only discovered that at the venue.

Overall, the concierge issue was quite minor and we had a great 7 night stay.

title: Clean and a great view of the city
text: I thought the check-in people were snooty and the concierge was not helpful.   I didn’t like the lobby for a gathering spot - too crowded, not enough seating.   But the rooms were very nice and the neighborhood has lots of good restaurants.

title: Great holiday experience
text: Me and my mother in law stayed here for 5 nights in late November 2018, had a great city and east river view. Staff were friendly and helpful, clean room and hotel, nice little shop and restaurant. We only had access to Wi Fi in the lobby area but it was easy to get on my mobile. Would definitely stay here again, if you have room only, there is a good restaurant called "John's coffee shop" just up the road.

title: Bel hotel
text:
Très bel hôtel avec une situation parfaite pour notre voyage du 14 au 20 janvier 2019. En plus, l’hôtel est proche du métro et des bus. La vue était magnifique avec une chambre au 32ième étage !! 
De plus, l’hôtel est très sécurisé. Toujours un agent de sécurité présent avec un chien. 
Nous avons été très surpris de devoir payer la wifi 9,95$ pour 24h. C’est bien la première fois qu’on paye la wifi alors que nous avons déjà beaucoup voyagés...
Il faisait assez froid dans la chambre malgré le chauffage réglé au maximum surtout qu’il était très très bruyant. 
L’accueil à notre arrivée était très froid... aucune information sur la wifi, sur l’hôtel, la situation,... très mauvais et non professionnel.

title: Disapoiting
text:
Rooms may have wonderful views on the river and over the UN Headquarters, it is definitely not worth the price. From check-in to check-out, I barely have seen anyone smiling. Although the bed is really confortable, it might be better to enjoy it when the room is cleaned : I had to request for housekeeping at 7PM which hadn't been made during the day even though I had noticed the bell desk at 8AM that I'd be out for the whole day.
It is not worth the Hilton brand.

title: Great service in the ambassador restaurant
text: Stayed there for a couple of nights. Staff in the restaurant were friendly, great location too. Checking in and out is quick. Rooms are well serviced. The breakfast menu is limited hence staying for over a week might be too long to have the same food but it’s well cooked. Bravo to the chefs who are working there tirelessly. Views from my hotel room below

title: Ottima esperienza
text: Location strategica a pochi blocchi dalle principali attrazioni. Hotel molto grande con ottimo servizio ristorativo. Stanze calde e accoglienti quasi tutte godono di un incredibile panorama; staff disponibile e professionale. Da provare

title: Awesome view, great room
text: When we checked in we were told we were upgraded since I am a Hilton Gold Member.  Never did I expect we would get a two bedroom suite!  We had tremendous views of the East River, the Chrysler Building, the Empire State building (which was lit up at night during our stay), and on a clear day you could see all the way down to the end of Manhattan.  We ate at the hotel restaurant the first night since we got in late.  It was a simple meal but very good.  We had breakfast both morning in the lounge which had a large selection of breads, cereals, fruit, eggs, etc and good coffee.  There were a number of restaurants and subway stations within a relatively short walk.  We had a late lunch at one of them since we were going to Yankee Stadium the second night.  The subway ride to the Bronx was a little long but we didn't have to change trains.  We were only there for two nights and then caught a flight out of La Guardia which was easy to get to from the hotel.  All in all a very good location, close to Grand Central, the UN, etc.  We'll definitely be back.  Friendly and helpful front desk staff.  Price was very reasonable considering that it was mid-week in midtown Manhattan.  We paid more on that trip for a property in Newfoundland,  Great hotel and a great value

title: No recomendable: El servicio y la experiencia, dignos de un hotel de carretera (y seguro que lo harían mejor)
text:
Resumen: Nada amables / Robo en habitación / No hablan castellano / 
La experiencia fue mala: de manera general, diré que el personal de recepción es rancio, hay que arrancarle una sonrisa a la fuerza para darnos cuenta de que somos los clientes y de que están a nuestro servicio para supuestamente, hacernos pasar unas vacaciones agradables. El personal de la portería, ni tan siquiera te echa una mano abriéndote la puerta cuando vas hasta arriba de equipaje o te pregunta si te echa una mano... sencillamente se quedan hablando entre si y miran a ver cómo te apañas (a no ser que asomes un billete).
De manera concreta, tuvimos un problema gordo la primera mañana, cuando tras volver del gimnasio, había desaparecido dinero (un par de billetes de dólares y de euros, que ya ves) que habíamos dejado sobre el escritorio. No podíamos creer que sacarán de debajo de la revista y los guantes que teníamos sobre el escritorio el dinero y lo robaran. A pesar de que a las 3 horas nos lo devolvieron y presentaron sus disculpas, nos pareció un hecho increíble que pudiera ocurrir eso. En la vida nos había pasado que durante la limpieza se llevaran pertenencias nuestras, aunque fuera calderilla. Flipante. 
Además, tuvimos a la llegada un problema de conformidad con la habitación ya que está no se correspondía a la descripción ofrecida en Booking; en concreto, la cama extragrande no existía, las medidas que se muestran en la página no son las que miden la cama, y según la dirección son todas las mismas (single o doble, y punto).
Por avanzar, la habitación bien, correspondiente a un hotel de 4 estrellas, con unas vistas buenas, según el lado y la altura en la que estemos. No hay amenities (ni agua, ni ningún tipo de snack, ni nada por el estilo) salvo una cafetera automática cuyo café (cápsulas) sí es ofrecido cada día. No hay canales de televisión de España; a penas es si tienen un par de Europa. El personal no habla castellano, salvo la manager (que fue por cierto, la única persona agradable junto a la recepcionista del buffet que nos encontramos en todo el hotel). Otro problema tuvo que ver con la fianza que se quedan a la llegada (para 3 días, unos 600€ que te devuelven a los 8 días aprox.). Nos parece una barbaridad de dinero que te cogen sí o sí, además del cobro que luego realizan (para que nos entendamos, te cobran una fianza + la tarifa cuando te vas, en vez de descontar de lo que ya te han cobrado).

El gimnasio está bien, tiene unas vistas impresionantes, y la pista de tenis arriba, bien también.... si claro, nos hubieran explicado todo lo que tiene el hotel a nuestra llegada; cosa que no hicieron. El restaurante tuvo buena pinta, el desayuno al menos estuvo bien y el personal del buffet fue simpático.

Sinceramente, este hotel no es digno de su reputación y los problemas aquí descritos son para obtener una buena disculpa por parte de ellos. No falla la parte material del hotel, sino la parte humana.

title: Friendly staffs
text: Staffs are nice. Location is good. Many food restaurants surrounding and relatively quiet place. In-room dining need to improve as quality is not so good, few choices and only available from 5pm daily!

title: Bien placé mais pas insonorisé
text: Hôtel vraiment bien placé à 5min de marche de Grand Station. Le service est bien, sans plus. La chambre est propre et confortable. Le gros point noir c’est le bruit. On entend toutes les conversations dans les chambres à côté.

title: THE Hotel with a view
text:
A mon sens, l’hôtel avec la meilleure vue de NY. Vue sur tout le district du world trade center, Empire & Chrysler building.
Je vous recommande d'opter pour une chambre King Size en corner qui vous permet d'avoir la plus belle vue.
J'ai été bouche bée de jour comme de nuit dans cette chambre juste incroyable
petit point négatif sur la propreté générale de la chambre
Personnel très gentil, accueillant et serviable.

title: Nice hotel in a quiet part of NY
text: The lobby was a little dated but was a classic look. We arrived around lunchtime but was told that we won’t be able to check in until 4 pm. We went out for a walk and visited some of the sites and returned back around 3. In which we were able to check in. We had a corner king room on the 38th floor. Rooms were clean and nice. Bed was comfy. No bottled water in the room. The views from the room were fantastic. Staff were friendly and helpful especially frank the doorman who was very accommodating. Housekeeping was random and would come at either 9am or late afternoon. One day our room wasn’t cleaned at all however after mentioning at reception this was quickly arranged whilst we slipped out for a meal. Overall a nice hotel.

title: Nice, but run down
text: I booked a suite and expected much more from this hotel, adjacent to the UN. The appearance of the inside, appointing of a suite, and general snafus (like bad meals, no bar after 11, and problems with the keys working) made it a little frustrating .

title: Buen hotel pero...
text: Sin duda nuestra experiencia en este hotel ha sido marcada negativamente por el hecho de que, al llegar sobre las 23 de la noche nos comunicaron que tenían un  overbooking y que nos habían reservado una habitación en otro hotel. Estábamos cansados de todo el día de paseo en la ciudad y en general, ya que era nuestro día 12 en Estados Unidos, y lo único que queríamos era descansar. Nos dieron 20 dolares y nos llamaron un taxi (el dinero no fue suficiente para la ida y la vuelta pero tampoco comentamos nada). El otro hotel estaba perfectamente ubicado (justo en frente de central park), pero no estamos seguros de que la categoría fuera exactamente la misma. A pesar del overbooking, no tuvieron ningún tipo de detalle con nosotros, como un upgrade o una invitación a desayunar, nos pidieron una vez disculpa y ya está. A parte eso, la habitación era muy amplia al igual que el baño, cama muy cómoda y vista espectacular. No tiene precio ver el atardecer y tener enfrente el empire states building.

title: Great hotel with 4 stars
text:
This Hilton is really enjoyable. Terrific room (corner with large bed and 2 lovely panoramic view to city and across the East River). Free coffee service, large bathroom, space for yoga exercise, excellent working desk. Mostly quiet. Very friendly staff from the front desk, bell captain, honors officer, cleaning lady and the coffee man bringing each evening the capsule for the Illy coffee machine and delicious tea bags. Fridge very small - could be larger. Now in winter there should be a hook to hang the winter coats. Great hotel. If you go for breakfast in the hotel, very good buffet - high standard for the US.
We also visited the sky lounge on 30th floor - free snacks, small choice of wine for little money, free water and soft drinks.
Unfortunately the TV was only focused on US programs - just news from CNN or Fox, no international coverage.

title: Great location
text:
This hotel was in a fantastic location! Just visited for my 30th birthday - we did email in advance to ask if we could request a room with a view of the Manhattan skyline however they never responded. 
On arrival and checking in the guy on reception explained that we could upgrade to a king size room with floor to ceiling windows with the skyline view for $30 per night. I feel this is offered to everyone as part if his sales pitch but we went for it anyway. $180 for the 6 nights for a room upgrade seemed reasonable. The guy also gave us access to the sky lounge on 30th floor, this was wonderful for breakfast there was toast, bagels, fruit, cereals, yoghurts, pastries, tea, coffee, bottles water and cans of fizzy drinks to help yourself too. On an evening you could enjoy cold snacks free and all the drink options but also wine and lagers for $5. 
Rooms cleaned really well, toiletries replaced daily, beds changed every couple of days. 
Brilliant location for walking everywhere or getting the subway. 

My only minor issue was that the windows were dirty but I imagine this is down to the weather and can't be helped. The bloke on reception also said they take a $50 security amount from a credit card and it just stays pending and is returned afterward however ours is still pending and is $300 not $50.

title: シャワーが少しぬるいのだけが惜しい
text:
部屋はかなり広く、清掃もよくされている。
バスルーム・洗面所も広い。

シャワーの水量は充分、水圧はまあまあ。
ただ水温が、maxでも40℃弱くらいで少しぬるく、冬場のニューヨークとしては物足りなかった。

アメニティはシャンプー・コンディショナー・ボディソープ・ボディクリーム・石鹸。
部屋にエスプレッソメーカーもある。
ドライヤーもあり。

部屋からクライスラービルなどが見え、夜景が綺麗。

チェックイン・アウト時のフロントスタッフは感じも良く丁寧。

title: Efficient, professional and friendly
text: Arrived early at the hotel for a Broadway show and a night out in the Big Apple. Well we got lucky with Mr. Barry at reception who kindly found us a very nice room to check into so we could freshen up after the long drive. This professional approach has happened to us before at this hotel. Can’t thank the staff and management enough. We will continue to frequent this hotel in future.

title: Nothing special
text: While room was ok, we asked to change room as we wanted a view of the city instead of the Hudson River. The check in staff was not helpful at all and was abrupt. It left us very disappointed that no effort was made to at least try and seek a solution.

title: Comfortable and clean stay
text:
Very comfortable rooms, clean and tidy with lots of space for storage and clothes/luggage. 
The location is alright if don’t mind alittle bit of walk to areas like Times Square. You need cabs for most of the other attractions. There are most bus stops for the bus hop on/off nearby which helps getting around for tourists.

title: 무난한 숙소
text: 유엔본부 인근이라서인지 업무를 위한 방문이 많은듯함. 객실과 전반적인 시설이나 비품은 타 힐튼호텔과 크게 다르지 않으나 미니바는 없음(투숙한 객실은 1퀸베드임). 호텔 내에 저녁을 먹을만한 식당이 없고 룸서비스로 주문하여야 하는 것이 다소 의외임. 가족여행에는 적절하지 않다는 생각임(특히 어린이 동반).

title: Lovely hotel in a quieter area of NY
text:
Loved this hotel. Although I was initially concerned about the distance my partner and I would have to walk to Times Square it was actually really easy (20 mins max?) and took us past central station which was nice to see. 

Our room was lovely and big with the most breath-taking views of the city and river. My Boyfriend and I found ourselves sitting by the window for ages at night just staring out at the city, I took so many pictures of all the different angles. The Empire State and Chrysler building could also be seen in all their glory from our room. I found the coffee maker a bit rubbish but there was a nice little cafe in the hotel and a Dunkin Donuts closeby so i didn't really mind. I'd like to give a special mention to the toilet in our room, i've never had a heated toilet seat but i'm also unsure now how i've lived without one... :-)

The only big disappointment for me is the lack of WiFi unless you're a Hilton member, I like to catch up with my family in the evening whilst i'm away, I'm already paying for the pleasure of staying in your hotel, I really don't feel I should be paying for WiFi too? Seems a bit outdated to me!

title: Excellent view
text: Very clean & very modern rooms. The bed was comfortable & the view from the 35th floor was spectacular. I would definitely stay here again. My only complaint is there was no pool & you had to have a Hilton honors membership for free wifi.

title: Marriage
text: We are currently still here in room 3239 & the views are stunning. The hotel staff are second to none & they go out of their way to assist you. For me this hotel keeps up the Hilton tradition of a warm welcome & excellent customer service. We have also got married here in NYC & loving everything about this fantastic city ❤️🇺🇸

title: Toller Aufenthalt!
text: Tolle Lage etwas ausserhalb der Stadt (etwa 7 Minuten zu Fuss vom Grand Central Station entfernt, trotzdem Supermärkte, viele Restaurants und ein ganz toller Diner ganz in der Nähe) in der Nähe von der UN. Sehr komfortables Hotel. Das bequeme Bett und schönes Bad waren Highlights.

title: Très bonne experience!
text: Nuit passée à l'occasion du nouvel an, chambre avec vue du 37ème étage sur Manhattan. Le confort de la chambre ainsi que la vue panoramique sur la ville ont fait que nous avions decidé d'y passer la soirée à admirer le nouvel an depuis la fenêtre!!

title: Definitely worth a look
text: We stayed here December 2018. We were originally put into a room overlooking the review.After requesting to change the room to look over the city, we were put on floor 40 and had an amazing view. The staff were really helpful with our request. We stayed for 5 nights. There are a few restaurants and bars nearby. It’s only a ten minute walk to central station. Great hotel, very comfortable room. Fantastic view. We would definitely stay here again if we got the chance.

title: New years
text: Great location, the hotel staff were very helpful on arrival and when we were checking out. Was told that the internet has an extra charge but if you join honors club its free so the receptionist joined me for free and then received our free internet for the duration of our stay.

title: Great property next to the United Nations
text:
Very good property. We were put in a suite with a separate living room, bathroom and separate toilet which was just amazing.
The sky lounge (executive lounge) is also great with good views of the river, Empire State and Chrysler buildings.
Cannot comment on the restaurants/bars as we did not use.
Only a 10 minute walk from the Chrysler building and Grand Central station.
I would most definitely come back here.

title: El retrete es lo máximo!
text: El hotel es muy bueno, pero el baño supero por mucho mis expectativas pues es automático de inteligente. Me encantó, ahora quiero uno así para mi casa! Realmente recomiendo este hotel. La vista también es maravillosa.

title: Amazing
text: We stayed here for more than a week and indeed we had a wonderful time. The room (and the view) was awesome and the service was excellent. We will definitely be back here when we visit Manhattan again.

title: Always Exceptional
text: The Millennium never disappoints. We have loved the Millennium since we first stayed here about 11 years ago but this visit stood out because of our interactions with the staff. The bell hop, security guard with the dog, the woman at the front desk, the guy in the coffee shop and housekeeping, all greeted us with friendliness and kindness. The rooms are comfortable and clean. The location is an easy walk from Grand Central.

title: Small beds.
text:
Rooms were adequate.  The beds that were “double” should have been called a “big twin”.  Smallest double beds I’ve ever seen. Our king room was large and adequate. The staff was very friendly and the best part were the toilets with heated seats and built in bidet.  The lobby space is small for this size hotel.  The closest metro stop was located several blocks away at Grand Central.  Difficult to believe there is not a metro stop at the UN plaza.  
Although several well - more than several, it was an easy walk to Times Square, Madison and Fifth Avenues. Would have appreciated a microwave in the room and the Illy coffee machine was not the easiest to work, although we were able to get something heated quite easily in the coffee shop adjacent to the lobby. And taxi and Uber/Lyft easy to secure.

title: Poor Hilton and Poor hotel in general.
text: Not like a Hilton. Poor attitude to customers and noisy rooms. Despite having honors status the breakfast was a poor spread with no choice to have it in the main breakfast area. Hugely disappointing and would recommend you stay elsewhere - even if you have Hilton status.

title: 可もなく不可もなし
text: 価格相応だが、室内に館内案内やルームサービスの手引きが無かった。夜にフロントやコンシェルジュに電話しても、全く出なかった。お陰で、栓抜きをフロントまで借りに行く羽目に。

title: December trip
text: Great place very clean. Little pricey for that time of year but great location close to everything with an amazing view near the top floor. Valet parking was ridiculous park yourself down the street for a fraction of the price.

title: Comfortable and clean
text: Millennium Hilton is conveniently located near the UN. There are lots of eating places nearby and it’s a comfortable walk to Lexington Ave or Grand Central. The hotel is well maintained and common areas are clean. Our room was in good order and was also very clean. The bathroom looks recently updated and had a good selection of toiletries. We had a good view of the East River and the city. There is a restaurant downstairs and a small coffee shop in the lobby. Staff was accommodating and seem well trained. There was a dog sniffing luggage at the entrance which was a bit concerning, but then the hotel is near the UN as well as the US mission to the UN. Overall this is a good place to stay at reasonable rates.

title: Stayed here whilst visiting United Nations
text: A perfect hotel to stay whilst visiting United Nations, which is just a stone throw away. The room was small but clean and comfortable. It had great views which I can’t really complain. The staff I found to be a bit uptight and not as helpful. Quite often I would need to reiterate my request 2-3 times before they jump on it.

title: Even better than expected
text: Service was outstanding at every level, the room was well appointed and exceptionally clean, and the Midtown East location is convenient -- close to Grand Central, the subway, restaurants and attractions. Request a room with a view if you can; you won't be disappointed.

title: Great value for an awesome view!
text: Great views, very nice room, good price.  Room was a bit small, but very nice furnishings.  Excellent staff!  Somewhat deluxe hotel.  NIce bar/restaurant, great food.  Good wifi.  Very nice workout room.  Quick elevators, important for high floors.  (I was on the 40th.)  Note: no swimming pool.  Also no microwave in room.

title: Wonderful Experience !!
text:
That is the place to be in NYC!!

Wonderful staff, friendly well trained.

Front Desk accomodate every request and make me feel home !! Ticia , Linda loves my little son !!!!

Clean room well organized with Illy Coffe , my favorite brand !!

Skyline Lounge excellent Kazi very friendly and nice with all the member of my family.

I will recommend to everyone and I am looking forward to stay again in this wonderful location.

Thank you 

From Nicoletti’s Family!!!!

title: Perfect Location to Explore Manhattan
text: This hotel located just behind the United Nations on 1st and 44th is perfectly located. A short walk to all of the midtown sites but away from the main hustle and bustle. On the correct side rooms have wonderful views over the river and midtown. The prices aren't too bad considering but the hotel itself is welcoming and comfortable. Staff are helpful and the lobby is quite attractive. There are good facilities and an excellent bar and restaurant. However these are pricey even for Manhattan. There are plenty of more reasonably priced bars and restaurants nearby. Well worth a stay though.

title: Millemmium Hilton NY UN Plaza
text: A beautiful hotel with very friendly staff.  We received an upgrade to a corner room with an amazing view of NYC.  We could see the river, the Empire State Building and the Chrysler Building.  This was an incredible stay.

title: Anniversaire
text:
A éviter absolument !!

They let us in the street after about 20h of travelling. Saying that my card had a problem few hours before we arrived and never contact us about it! Then sell as fast as they can our room! Try to tell that it was Booking who cancelled it but it was not, and my card is correct on their website (I checked it). I don't know who paid for the room, hope that it was a really good Price!!.
I have aleready been to about more than hundred of countries, this is the first time something like that happened!! This is crazy!
And they tell me dont worry, we will give you a room on Times Square for more than I had to paid and something I didnt want, she said it will be perfect??? Seriously?? 

Be carrefull when you are coming from far away!

title: Nice clean hotel with friendly staff
text: My son was having surgery at NYU Langone so we booked two rooms on points and stayed here for one night. It was an excellent choice. The rooms were clean and the views of the Chrysler and Empire Stare Buildings were beautiful. The staff - from the check-in woman at the front desk to the valet - were all very friendly and engaging. The executive lounge had a nice selection of drinks, snacks and meals also. I would certainly recommend staying here again in the future.

title: Empfehlenswert im Zentrum
text: Sehr freundliches Personal und eine Tolle Aussicht aus dem Zimmer. Vieles war zu Fuß aus erreichbar! Sehr hoher Standard zu einem fairen Preis. Der Service war stets freundlich und Extrawünsche waren kein Problem.

title: Very Good
text: Big rooms and comfortable. Very good area. All the staff were berry nice. Very clean. You can go walking to 5th Ave and Time Square. The Grand Central station is very close. The breakfast at the hotel is expensive but you have several options around the hotel.

title: Good location
text:
We stayed at the Millennium Hilton New York on a recent visit.  The location is good if you need to be on the east side.  It's a relatively short walk to Grand Central, so easy access to the subway.  Our room was great with a nice view of the UN building and the East River.  The lobby area is a bit underwhelming.  Staff were friendly, though there can be crowds at the check-in counter; there are relatively few stations to process check-ins and check-outs.

One small complaint -- newspapers are hard to find.  The shop in the lobby didn't carry and the breakfast room for Hilton Gold members didn't have newspapers on the weekend.  I guess in New York, I still expect to be able to find newspapers.

title: Great place to stay!!!
text: Millennium its allocate it on the heart of Manhattan. It has a spectacular lobby fully decorated for Christmas. We stayed in a super comfy room and the staff was always trying to make you feel great. definity we will stay again! Thank you :)

title: Ottimo albergo , vi tornerei senz’altro
text: Sono stata varie volte a New York e in alberghi diversi, la prossima volta tornerò in questo per l’incredibile vista dalla mia camera al 38’piano, per la cortesia del personale alla reception, la velocità della connessione internet e la posizione, vicinissima all’ONU, lontana dal caos di alcune zone del centro di Manhattan comunque raggiungibili a piedi. in10 minuti si è a Grand Central e quindi alla metropolitana

title: It's a good hotel, but over-priced
text: This hotel is perfectly positioned in midtown, with amazing views from the upper floors. The rooms are kind of tight, though, and room service is pricey. Room cleaning was just average. The main lobby is tiny. On a positive note, the reception desk staff and bell captains were all very helpful and professional.

title: Tired...
text:
Room is not clean - Hilton's tend to hit or miss....we never seem to miss with Marriott...
If your not clean your overpriced....Carpet is worn, and looks like they did not vacuum.
Bathroom - has hair left from previous hotel guest....

title: A lovely hotel away from the hustle and bustle
text: A lovely hotel. The room was gorgeous with an amazing view. Great decor and value for money. Away from the hustle and bustle. Great location for less busy bars. Picking up cabs. If you want a relaxed stay this hotel is ideal.

title: Milestone Birthday celebration with my husband
text:
I called and asked if I could be upgraded since it was my birthday. This very nice lady said she will try.
Try!!  Is an understatement!!! We had a corner room with Eat River and city views!!! The view was spectacular!!! I knew I was going to have a fabulous birthday!!! Hotel staff were very friendly...Now with that said I do not know what the other rooms look like and or the view.. All I can say my room was grrrreat!!😊. My only complaint is that there is no dresser to put your clothes in so I had to keep all my clothes in my suitcase..Thete was a closet to hang clothes but in the winter , you tend to have sweaters... You are on The outskirts of the midtown actown/ theatre district but my husband and I walk a lot so it was not an issue for us..

title: Clean and good size room
text: My husband and I stayed here for one night in November 2018. We switched to this hotel the night before American Thanksgiving because the hotel we had been staying at was much more expensive for our last night. I checked in the day before on the Hilton honours app. When we arrived earlier than check in The guy at front desk told me that he couldn't issue a key to the room because their system was down. Odd but ok so we tried getting the digital key through the app. It ended up working. Thank goodness for the app because we noticed a lot of people waiting in the lobby I am assuming because their systems were down and couldn't check people in. The room was pretty big for being New York City and it was nice and clean. We had a nice view of one of the bridges and the water. The location wasn't the best but it was still decent. Took us about 25-30 minutes to walk downtown. If you don't care about prime location then I would recommend this hotel. It was a nice stay for one night.

title: Beautiful hotel! Fantastic views!
text:
This is a beautiful and classy hotel. From the moment we entered and checked-in we felt special. The lobby was and public areas were impeccable. Brandon checked us in and displayed utmost charm and professionalism. Everyone was cordial and professional.

We had a corner king room and when we entered the view was just breathtaking. The room itself was very spacious for New York City standards. The room had a modern classy atmosphere and was spotless. The bathroom was beautiful with excellent shower and water pressure. The bed was very comfortable. The toiletries were high end. The hotel is about 10 minute walk from the subway and is an a quiet area of the city.

When you factor in the service and quality of the hotel - it's a good value for the area. But, the view is what steals the show and really makes for a worthwhile stay here. You will not want to leave your room.

title: Engagement stay!
text: Monique was the best manager! Our view from room 3731 was beyond breath taking, highly recommend this hotel not one issue throughout stay. Facilities were very clean. Housekeeping did an outstanding job through the entire stay.

title: Booking Scam
text: Arrived at the hotel (Millenium Hilton at UN Plaza) with confirmation paperwork in hand to be told that I had no booking. I was told that the hotel was full, but there was a suite and I'd have to pay full price and then when the booking was sorted out, the price I had already paid would be credited. This happened and I was left with a $350.00 surcharge, as the booking was later in the day confirmed, but by this time I was in the suite that I neither needed nor wanted and anyway, there weren't any rooms left or so I was told. This is a scam that the hotel is running to fill suites. If you arrive at the hotel tired and vulnerable after a long flight or journey, the staff seem to take full advantage by denying your booking and assuming you'll just agree to the upgrade. I cannot believe that this isn't known and approved of by the management.  At lease when you book a rental car, they give you a choice of an upgrade. Although I belong to the Hilton Honours Club (for what it's worth), I'll NEVER use Hilton Hotels again and I would advise others to do the same. Another example of a greedy corporate hotel chain putting its hand in its customers pockets.

title: Great Hotel!
text: The views from our corner room facing the Chrysler Building were amazing. The room was clean and comfortable, but the coffeemaker and fridge were a little small and disappointing for a room of this quality. Overall a very nice experience!

title: Fantastic stay
text:
Stayed Nov 28th until Dec 2nd. Check in was efficient and friendly. Asked for a room in the West tower and was given a corner room as requested with dual aspect views on the top floor. The room was perfect for our stay and had everything we needed. We chose this hotel for its location, which is a quieter location but it was still easy to access anywhere we needed to go. We could walk to midtown and central park within half an hour and if We were headed downtown to wall street, Brooklyn bridge etc we caught the East river ferry which we found very easy and reliable to use and that was our main mode of transport after walking. The checkout was simple and it was easy to show our bags as we made the most of our last day. The lien on the card went back on within an hour of us checking out which is the quickest it's ever been done before. 
Do not hesitate to book this hotel you will not be disappointed. Ignore the bad reviews about hilton honour points etc it's a fantastic hotel and I hope to return one day. The pictures are of the view from our room 4040

title: ottima esperienza
text: siamo stati ospiti del millenium nella prima settimana di ottobre ... arrivati la sera accoglienza del check- in top  gentilezza e disponibilità....camera base con vista su roosvel island e scritta pespicola magnifica  vista camera pulita e accogliente perfetta per me e mio marito ( avevo prenotato un anno prima ) ... l'hotel vicino alle nazione unite si trova sulla 44 esima strada fuori dal caos perfetto per muoversi ...5/10 min a piedi da grand station .....hotel top

title: Estancia inmejorable
text:
Desde que llegamos a la habitación nos quedamos gratamente sorprendidos con el tamaño de la misma, muy acogedora y amplia. Pero sin duda lo mas impactante fueron las increíbles vistas. 
Es un hotel totalmente recomendable y no tengo duda que cuando vuelva a Nueva York volveré a alojarme en él. 
Buena ubicación, a menos de 10 minutos andando de 5th ave. y poco mas hasta Times Square lo que permite ir andando a muchos de los lugares mas emblemáticos de la ciudad.  

Tengo que hacer mención especial al personal de recepción y conserjería, quien nos trataron muy amablemente y nos ayudaron con todo lo necesario para hacer nuestra estancia inmejorable.

title: Family holiday trip
text: We had stayed at the Millennium Hilton NY One UN Plaza previously. It's a great hotel. The staff offered an upgrade (at a very reasonable price) to a 2-bedroom suite. The views were the best we've ever had in New York City. The location is somewhat out of the way (all the way on the East River) but you can easily walk to most places in midtown.

title: Nice stay
text: Just finished off a 5 night stay here, great location if you want to be a bit further away from the madness of the main part of the city.Its directly opposite the UN building. Had a really good quality room 2919 had a slight issue which we made the hotel aware of which they went overboard to make sure it did not affect our stay which we really appreciated although not really needed, would recommend this place.

title: Excelente!!!
text: Dentre todos os Hiltons que já ficamos este foi o melhor, apesar do da 5ª ave ser mais perto do burburinho de Manhattan, a vista deste é indescritível! Quarto novíssimo, recém reformado, vista panorâmica, bem mais espaçoso e com todas as instalações novas! Voltaremos com certeza! Único ponto fraco foi a comida do restaurante que não nos agrafou muito, mas de resto, desde a recepção até o quarto, tudo foi surpreendente e superou nossas expectativas!!!

title: Terrible management
text: They denied my stay, which cost me Honors points! They also denied my reward status during the stay. Management here is as bad as a bed bug problem! They really need to learn how to treat customers better. So does the Hilton Corporate! Their incompetence is wasting my time and energy!

title: Fint
text: Vi tyckte jätte mycket om de här hotellet. Mycket trevlig personal och jätte fina rum. Vi bodde på 35 våningen och hade otroligt fin utsikt! De gick jätte bra att ta sig till och från hotellet. Tog ca 30 min att gå in till centrum.

title: Hotel stay
text: Hotels in NY are too expensive, value is never there as compared to other cities I travel too.  Having said that, this property was very nice. I would return and recommend this property to others.  Thank you to staff for great service.

title: Hilton Rarely Disappoints
text: This hotel's location is ideal for my needs, and I find the staff very accommodating. Andrew Verburg, the hotel manager is efficient and makes my stay enjoyable. The continental breakfast in the lounge is more than adequate, but the cocktail hours could use a little improvement in the hors d'oeuvres, and free wine would be nice.

title: Immer wieder gerne
text: Dieses Hotel ist an einer guten Lage, man ist schnell zu Fuss beim Grand Central Station und kann von dort aus mit der U-Bahn alle wichtigen Orte schnell erreichen.  Die Zimmer sind grossräumig, sauber und mit toller Aussicht.Das Personal war freundlich und zuvorkommend.Wir würden dieses Hotel wieder wählen.

title: Veľmi dobre vybavený hotel blízko centrály OSN
text: Mal som možnosť niekoľko dní stráviť v hoteli. Personál bol príjemný, prislúchajúca reštaurácia Ambassador Grill určite jedna z lepších hotelových gastro priestorov. Jedlo chutné, no obsluha by sa mohla naučiť byť ústretovejšia a pozornejšia. Izby v hoteli krásne, čisté, dostatočne priestranné. Mal som izbu na 36 poschodí, výhľad bol parádny - pozri foto. V izbe širokouhlá TV, žehlička a prkno, fén a ďalšie. Posilňovňa na hotel slušná, viacero strojov však bolo mimo prevádzky. Hotel má aj bazén. Celkový pocit veľmi dobrý.

title: Holiday vacation
text: We ended up at this Hilton by accident! We normally book the Millenium Hilton World Trade Center.  We didn’t know there are 3 Millenium Hilton’s in NYC.  So be careful when you book!  That being said, it was a very pleasant mistake.  The hotel was a short walk to the shops on 5th ave, ice skating, and the beautiful Christmas windows! The hotel itself is very nice, clean and the staff are wonderful. I would advise not to order room service ($18 for 2 eggs and toast) or go to bar for a $20 glass of house wine!  Also, do not take the airport shuttle, it is $20 a person and takes forever to pick up all the stops, a taxi is cheaper and faster!

title: Marvellous Millennium Hilton!
text: First time holiday to NYC and we definitely picked well to stay at millennium! Due to our flight we arrived early but that wasn’t an issue as our room was ready and we had a room on floor 34. The room was very spacious, clean and with extremely comfortable beds. As we were on the 34th floor we had an amazing view of the river and the Manhattan skyline. Ideal location as Grand Central and 5th avenue was around a 10ish min walk. Both check in & our were quick and easy. All hotel staff were very friendly and helpful, overall a fantastic and amazing stay!

title: #1 hotel quality vs price
text: It was the best hotel during my last business trip to US. Everything was perfect from check-in to check-out. Even breakfast was good although I  don’t like to eat in the hotels. I highly recommend this Hilton.

title: Great spot
text:
We had a room on the 31st floor with a view of the Empire state building that was beautiful especially at night.

The hotel was a short walk from 2nd and 3rd with lots of options for food.

The bed was very comfortable.

Loved seeing the dogs working there.  All staff were very helpful. Would certainly live to stay again.

title: Birthday treat
text: Stayed for a week for a special birthday, requested a view of empire and chrysler and reception duly obliged. Checked in a couple of hours early with now problem. Room was superb, large enough with a very comfortable bed. Only downside to this room was lack of space for hanging clothes as safe takes up half the area low down, dont know if this is how other room are or just our corner room. Chambermaids were nice and talkative and a lovely coffee/cake shop beside reception, too many visits there. Always a sniffer dog at the door as close to UN building but it was never a bother. Very good location for grand central terminal and onward travel. Cant really fault this hotel. Never had breakfast there as wanted to try typical NY diners for food.

title: Enjoyed it for the second time
text: I returned to The Millennium Hilton for the second time in a year. I enjoyed the stay as before. I was visiting for business. Things to know about the location: you have to walk the block to reach the nearest shop - it’s not difficult, staff are very professional, clean rooms, room service is great. An advice: if you are visiting during any kind of a storm don’t take the room at the corner of the building you will not have a good night sleep.

title: A Stay at the Millenium Hilton in NYC
text: I stayed at the Millenium Holton at the UN Plaza in NYC for two nights in mid November of 2018. It was for business purpose; the place of my meeting was within two blocks from this hotel. The room was clean and had a nice view of the East side river and Queens borough Bridge. The bed was very comfortable, well made. It has a coffee maker with limited choice, option and supplies for the coffee and tea. No water in the room. No desk either. Restaurant service really closes at 11 pm. It was a night of sudden snow in NYC, causing traffic disaster. I somehow made it back to hotel went to the restaurant at one minute past 11 pm. No food, only drinks.

title: قريب من الامم المتحدة
text: اعتبره من افضل الفنادق للي عندهم عمل بالأمم المتحدة , بخلاف قربه منها , يعتبر في افضل منطقة بمنهاتن و موقعه قريب من كل شيء , وتقدر تروح لسنترال بارك مشيا بالاقدام و كذلك للفث افنيو و التايمز سكوير بوقت لا يتخطى 15 دقيقة , مشكلته غالي حبتين , وانصحك تسوي عضوية بالهيلتون عشان تاخذ نت مجاني :(

title: hotel fine but some staff made stay unpleasant
text:
While I agree with other reviewers that staff at front desk and at door were kind and friendly, the people I had to deal with that came to my room to deliver packages and the cleaning staff were not.  Before I knew what was happening a person who brought a (very small) package upstairs to my room had barged his way inside and gave the excuse of making it easier for me to sign the paper on a table.  I let him know he should ask in future and not just barge in.  On my check out day - far ahead of check out time the cleaning staff also knocked 10 times in a row very loudly on the door and when I answered I asked why she had to knock like that - she said she has to knock loudly to know if we are there and spoke in a very harsh tone to me.  Very unfriendly, very rude, very intrusive - my experience was not pleasant as a result.    One last person came to the door just before I was to check out to see if I needed a coffee refill and this person knocked in a normal manner and was very polite so it seems some staff are well trained and others are not and would benefit from support from their management to make guests feel comfortable and welcome.  
I would have given 5 stars as property is nice and clean and as some staff are also kind, polite and friendly - but the feeling of intrusion by the person delivering a package and harsh and rude tone of cleaning staff made my stay extremely unpleasant overall.  It takes just one bad interaction to ruin the whole experience and in this case there were 2 such unpleasant interactions.

title: Great Hotel, incredible views, great location
text: Beds were very comfortable, The view was incredible, housekeeping was great! Expresso machine was to difficult to use. Would rather have a coffee pot.  It was a short walk to the subway. Nice cheap dry cleaner next door,

title: Great Hotel with great views
text: We spent a week at this magnificent hotel, rooms were very clean, location is perfect for all the monuments you need to visit in NY, great staff and very helpful. Food is not bad at all but they need to increase the list of options. Prices are within the range of all similar hotels in NY

title: Great value friendly staff
text: Good value for right across from the UN. The staff were exceptionally friendly. Our FAVORITE was the doorman Edward.  The only issue is once the cafe is closed, no options. One big issue: DO NOT waste your money on the breakfast buffet. 100$ for 2 and the food is abysmal.  Staff still awesome though!

title: Good value
text: I was speaking with a guy in the gym (nice views from there, by the way) and we agreed that the room rate here was noticeably lower than other similar hotels in the area. I was attending an event at the Convene Center on 3rd Ave, and it was ideally placed for that. It had everything I needed, including being just a twenty minute walk to Times Square. My room was clean, a good size, great views, working wifi and everything else I wanted.

title: The place to stay in NYC!
text: Me and my family spent a weekend in NYC and we were verily pleased with the hotel accommodation! The view from our suite overseeing the river was as nicer as the one you see from Empire State Buliding! Very spacious and clean room and friendly staff. We coilsnt ask for more. We will be back for sure! Thank you!

title: Ottima esperienza
text: Hotel in ottima posizione per poter visitare comodamente Manhattan. Servizi molto buoni e personale disponibile e gentile. Ottimo rapporto qualità/prezzo e connessione internet veloce. Assolutamente consigliato

title: Excelente!!
text: Muy bueno hotel muy cerquita de Times Square y al lado de los headquarters de la ONU. Manejan muy buenos precios para los que es la ubicación que tiene, lo que lo hace muy conveniente. Tiene muy buenos lugares para desayunar y comer al mediodía, The Smith, por ejemplo. El cuarto para el promedio de NYC es enorme, muy amplio y con unas vistas excelentes. El personal es muy atento. Volvería sin dudas.

title: Excellent view; room was not the best
text: The room was not fully cleaned and the hotel was showing its age. Staff was great and location is decent, but not close to Subway lines. The views from the upper floors are amazing. I would give this hotel another try but wasn't overwhelmed with the experience the first time.

title: East Mid-town gem
text: The UN Plaza hotel is well appointed, staff very efficient and in a great walking neighborhood with the UN site across the street. Taxis and Bell service were ample. Room service from on site restaurant has limited hours, however, restaurants abound within 2 blocks. Room was great, lots of amenities and the view was outstanding.

title: A fantastic experience
text:
Just back from a 4 night stay in this wonderful hotel. We arrived to a very friendly reception from a gentleman called Avery who was happy to check us in early.
He offered us an upgrade to a suite for a very small fee which we accepted and we were not disappointed.The room was amazing! The view was spectacular. All the staff we encountered were very friendly. The hotel is in a prime location only two blocks away from Grand Central. This hotel enhanced the wonderful experience of NYC

title: My new base for New York
text:
Reception staff especially Raquel and Liam were so helpful and welcoming and then Linda in guest services (I think that’s the correct name) was so amazing and always so ready to help really went above and beyond and then in the restaurant the Chef Donald creates wonderful meals and such a personal service to come and check if you are happy and if there is anything else needed what service! As for the wonderful waiting staff especially the Asian/Indian gentleman who was so attentive and very welcoming and so warm. 
In the cafe, which was a huge bonus to grab a coffee or drink on the go, Herman was such a pleasure to be greeted by everyday always happy and smiling and he made the best hot chocolate. 
They have a great team at this hotel most important of all are such an asset to the Hilton group. 
My only regret is that I couldn’t stay longer! I will be back very soon as this has become my chosen base now for my frequent trips to NY!

title: First trip to N.Y.C
text:
Just got back from a fabulous week in New York. It was our first time as a family in New York so we were unsure of hotel locations. This hotel didn't disapoint. It's only a 15 minute walk from Grand Central and a good base for all the attractions.  The evening that we arrived our room wasn't quite ready and so we were invited to have free drinks in the bar while we waited. We were also given vouchers for the week for both rooms (4 people) for breakfasts for our whole stay (7 days). The staff can't do enough for you and are very polite and helpful. The room standards were very good with exceptional views. We were on the 37th floor. Rooms were very clean, air conditioned and have a fridge. There are coffee making facilities, free Wi-Fi and a safe. The bathrooms were large and modern. The waiting on staff were really lovely and attentive. On checkout day we were allowed to use our rooms late at no extra charge as our flight was early evening. When we left the porter looked after our cases and called a taxi for us and helped with our luggage.
 All in all we had a wonderful stay. We would definitely return. Thank you Hilton

title: Good location
text: Ideally placed for a New York City break to celebrate my 50th birthday but the staff were surly and unhelpful. The heavily pregnant receptionist made me feel I was being an inconvenience by merely checking in. I was hoping for more than a snarl upon arrival but she clearly did not wish to engage in any conversation despite me asking when her baby is due.The room was comfortable but coffee machine had a bit missing and once replaced, didn’t work very well. The water barely trickled through.The bedside spotlight didn’t work and despite leaving a message at reception, it was not fixed.A great location but don’t expect friendly staff.

title: Brilliant hotel
text:
Travelled from ireland to NYC earlier this month to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary. Stayed in the millennium Hilton and had a fab time.
The hotel is amazing. Very close to grand central. Within walking distance to times square. The staff were very helpful. Room amazing,the hotel upgraded us to a corner view room and had fantasticviews of the Manhattan skyline. 
Thanks @millennium hilton for making our stay amazing
Edel

title: Nice hotel, great views of the city
text: This is a good hotel with great front desk staff. The rooms are quiet and clean. The views of the city are incredible, and the location is great. We would stay here again. One thing to note is that there is not a pool or a hot tub.

title: Fantastic stay!
text: I planned a girls weekend with my 2 daughters, stayed at the Millennium UN to celebrate my birthday and they were fantastic! Our room was amazing and the breakfast was terrific. Great location, wonderful staff and Monique went out of her way to make sure our weekend was memorable.

title: Great hotel
text: Wonderful hotel with an international flare. The room was clean and I had no problem with the internet, television or the safe. I would recommend having different pillows—they were a bit soft. Very quiet and lovely view.

title: Mr c Glasgow
text: Nice hotel but way to expensive for what you get .Id expect a full all inclusive package for what ive paid .In comparison to other hotels and locations ive stayed in the cost is way to high .Hilton is supposed to be high end but no breakfast is poor for  an hotel group of this stature .Noise from traffic below 34 floors is way to high for what you pay id expect total silence up 35 levels from the ground .....................................................................

title: NYC Trip
text: Check-in left a bad taste! The feeling I received was we were just Hilton Honors members & not premium members so we were not valued!  Totally a class system in dealing with customers! Having stayed at various Hilto properties, this one was by fa the worst!

title: illyのコーヒーメーカー
text:
場所は、国連の近くでグランドセントラルステーションから10分くらいです。
客室は25階以上なので、イーストリバー側の眺望は良いです。
Illyのコーヒーメーカーが置いてありました。セキュリティもしっかりしていました。

title: Spacious rooms with the best NYC views
text: Always a great experience staying at One UN Plaza.  Staff is so friendly and accommodating and the location fantastic.  Rooms are updated, spotless, and so comfortable.  I recommend the west tower for an unforgettable NYC skyline view.

title: The best welcome you can get in the States!
text:
As a team member of the Hilton brand myself I have of course went with where my loyalties are in terms of hotels for my first visit to the States. 
My partner and I were quite tired after a long flight from the UK but our check in was smooth, friendly and the gentleman that allocated us a room (sadly forgot his name) gave us a corner room upgrade with incredible views over both Roosevelt Island and Long Island AS WELL AS the Lower Manhattan. Stunning, impeccable room and we were very grateful.  

But I would like to say the highlight was the lovely staff in the executive lounge, special shout out to Llany for being amazing, giving very good NYC tourist tips, they simply cannot do enough for you. They are an asset to you.
Everyone from the bell desk have been ever so polite and helpful, insisting we should take umbrellas with us and it turned out they were right. 
All in all lovely staff throughout, the lady on check-out too. 
Will definitely stay again!
Thank you.

title: Ok stay but with a few problems
text: First off, I am a Diamond member.  The hotel was OK.  I have stayed there on more than one occasion. However on my short 2 night stay this time I had some issues.  The first night I went to the Executive Lounge for light snacks.  However, the lounge was closed due to a private event.  As a concession, the hotel offered 50% off on a meal at the hotel restaurant.  Not complimentary like the Executive lounge would have been but I did get a decent meal--but ended up spending $40 nonetheless (I ended up double tipping--as I did not notice that a gratuity was auto-added to the bill for a single diner (me) until after I paid and got back to the room).  That was bothersome, but shortly afterwards the fire alarm sounded.  False alarm in the end--but about 10 minutes of a lot of noise and drama wondering whether I was going to have to walk down 29 floors.  The 2nd night I was awoke by knocking at the room door--2x.  The first time, the security guard (or one who said he was) wanted to know if everything was alright.  Asked about whether water was leaking in the room.  I said all was ok.  Another 30 minutes later another knock on door.  This time three people were at the door.  Same thing, same message.  I relented opened the door after getting decently dressed.  Short inspection, but inconvenient and I remained wide awake after that.  Checking out early AM I was not asked about how I liked my stay by the front desk staff and I did not get a chance to followup with hotel management.  Not sure I will return after a bad two night stay.

title: Short and Sweet Visit
text:
Stayed here for 1 night with my boyfriend last Oct 21-22. Hotel was nice, walking distance to most places. I love using the digital key! PBX person was so nice and gave us amenity for our 1st anniversary, I really wanted to get her name but I wasn't able to get it.. The room was also very nice, sheets were new and bathroom is so spacious. Our room was overlooking the river and it gave us a great view of Long Island City. I love it! Really enjoyed our stay. <3

Only one thing is we didn't receive the free water bottles at check in, I'm a Silver member and I know I was supposed to receive it, it wasnt a big deal at check in. I figured I'll just call down, they said they'll bring it to the room and we waited for a long time but it never came. There was no DND sign on the door either so im not sure what happened.

title: WORST PLACE TO STAY , SAVE YOU MONEY
text: Please save your money. It’s  the worst place to stay , Horrible Cstomer service, nobody cares about YOU even for a GOLD member like me. Even I complained  and spoke to the front desk manager and she did promise to take care of everything she did NOT do anything. I will NEVER ever stay in this place again. NOT recommended to anybody.

title: Beautiful hotel
text: We had an amazing view of the city from high up. Good fitness facility with a view of the Hudson River. Staff is professional. Beautiful room, would be happy to stay there again. Was just there one night - wish we'd had more time!

title: Outstanding Room and Service
text: I had an excellent stay in a very comfortable room on the 30th floor, with superb views of the Empire State building in one direction and East River in the other.  The bed was very comfortable, and the service from the staff was outstanding.

title: Incredible views
text: Stayed here for 9 nights in September. Very close to Grand Central Station so it’s very accessible. Hotel staff were friendly - we were greeted every morning by the wonderful doorman and security with their dog! Great location and incredible views! We were on floor 36 in a king size room and the views were just breathtaking! Our room was cleaned every day and we were given fresh towels and tea/coffee. The room had a small fridge which was very handy to store drinks and snacks in. Room was very spacious also! The gym is on floor 27 with fantastic views as well! All that’s missing here is a pool! The lobby was modern and always busy with the small shop there, bar/restaurant was lovely with modern decor also. Large tv with good selection of channels and option to use Netflix. Bed was massive and very comfortable. Window only opens a tiny bit but aircon and heating facilities in room. Next time we travel to New York we will definitely stay here again.

title: Awesome hotel!
text:
Booked this hotel like nearly one Year before arrival & it was worth it! Booked a room on the corner of the building & we had an awesome view over Manhattan with direct view on Crysler and Empire State building and also on the River.
It was very clean and the housekeeping did our room daily. Also it has a little Café where we bought our breakfast Daily.
Highly recommend it!

title: Best view ever!
text: My room on 17 floors made my stay perfect. As a diamond member, I was upgraded to a suite with an office room (where I was able to work) and a separate bedroom.  2 bathrooms are spacious and overall comfort is high. The only observation is about breakfast at the restaurant not included, as a diamond I was granted lounge access where is breakfast is good but basic choice. Thank you to the GM Stefan for ensuring a great experience

title: Beautiful hotel tucked away from the hustle
text: We struggled between staying here or Times Square. We made a good choice. It was easy to get to Grand Central Station and thus the city was our Oyster.  The rooms were clean and spacious. We had a fantastic corner room with great views. The only negative there were slack of drawers to put our clothes in. Had to use the closest shelf. The bed and pillows were up to Hilton standard.

title: Nice Area, Many Conveniences and Great Views
text: We were just here in October. The area is nice and quiet (so glad that we didn't stay in the Times Square area - way too many people and this was in October). Walking distance to many restaurants, convenient stores and banks. We frequented the local store at the end of the block. They were open 24-hrs and had a cook ready to make whatever was on the menu above. If where we wanted to go was about mile, we walked (flat and easy walk), otherwise we took a cheap Uber/Lyft. I know...we didn't do the metro...but we've done it in a few countries overseas so it's gotta be the same, right? Our room was good size, clean and had a great view. I slept with the shades opened because of the view. (I joked with my husband to 'turn off the night light because it was too bright'). The staff was great and the pastry shop downstairs was good. I'd stay here again.

title: New York 2018
text: Das Hotel ist ziemlich runtergekommen, der Lack ist ab, Zimmergröße ist gut und das Bad war sauber. Möbel und Teppiche waren abgenutzt. Kein kostenloses wLan. Die öffentlichen Bereiche wie Flure und Lobby wirkten sehr ungepflegt.

title: Excellent views but the room was subpar
text: Let me begin with a disclaimer: I worked in the hotel and restaurant industry prior to becoming an O&G accountant. Plus, I’m a neat freak and very picky especially when it comes to lodging. The exterior was nice but kind of inconspicuous although it’s near the UN. Check in was quick. There is a little breakfast shop that had Ily coffee and various pastries that I’d rate a 10. The highlight of the room, however, was the corner room views of the river and the bathroom. I brought a black light (no critters, thank God!). But there were a lot of stains on the window settee (I didn’t touch it), dust on the nightstands, and no extra blankets on the bed. The bed was reasonably comfortable. There were stains on the carpet by desk that looked really questionable. I stayed without complaint because of the view and it was only a weekend trip. I did get a bit perturbed when I asked for a bucket of ice from restaurant services 10 minutes before closing and they said they were closed already. A front desk agent did get a bell man to bring it up and I was grateful.  I got a pretty good rate for the location but I probably won’t return. A carpet upgrade, nice blankets for the beds, and better housekeeping would help.

title: Lovely
text:
Room: I had a very lovely room facing the Chrysler Building and an stunning view! Shower was amazing! Bed super comfy!

Staff: the guys in the lounge for gold/ diamond members are stars! Really! The best staff in the hotel! Always smiling, politely greeting us. 

I’d definitely stay again!

title: Great stay, as always. Great views. Good size room
text: Great stay, as always. Great views. Good size room.The staff at the Millennium Hilton are helpful and friendly. We were thoroughly looked after from the moment we arrived until the moment we left. The bed was very comfy. Really enjoyed our stay.

title: Great hotel with friendly and helpful staff.
text: My wife and I visited the hotel between 3-6 October. The rooms have amazing views, and the deluxe room we had was very spacious. All the staff we encountered were friendly and especially the bell boys, who helped plan our sight seeing. Situated about 10 mins from Grand Central Station makes it an ideal base for sight seeing.

title: One of the better place to stay near everything
text:
This one is just adjoining to UN headquarter and it is highly secured area. however the rooms and the service is one of the best in the area. If you want to stay near time-square or central park, this is just 20 min walk away, the grand central station is just 2 blocks away. 

So if you want a better area to stay still close to timesquare this is one of the recommended hotel. You can walk everything.

title: Meu primeiro 5 estrelas
text: Foram 4 dias de uma experiência única. Localizado na ilha de Manhattan, em frente à sede da ONU. Nisso se tem acesso às mais movimentadas ruas, comércio e pontos turísticos de NY. O hotel perfeito, atendimento excelente (fiz questão de colocar a foto com o recepcionista do hotel, Frank, pessoa fantástica, sempre de bom humor e aberto a uma conversa). Café da manhã delicioso, Wi-Fi funciona em todo o hotel 100%, camas confortáveis, quarto agradável, vista maravilhosa. Vale a experiência.

title: One of the best Hiltons
text: I wen to NY for a short time, but Hilton is as usual providing me the best hospitality experience. As soon as I entered my room, I was as amazed by the furniture and fixtures in the room but also the cleanliness. Whenever I travel, for business or pleasure Hilton will be my first choice

title: Great location - lovely hotel!
text: Modern, clean, great location and service! I was able to walk to my appointments and it was convenient to my Client's office.  Dinner and drinks at the bar were very good and reasonably priced. Meeting space worked out well. I will definitely return to this hotel.

title: A new Hilton
text: The hotel passes from Millennium to Hilton management and it remained a perfect, tuned base point to meet at UN and other locations in the surroundings. Complete and good breakfast. Great room with two problems: too much light from the door profiles...it is disturbing a nice sleep. Small volume for the wardrobe no drawers. Enjoy!

title: Great  hotel
text:
We had a lovely stay at this hotel from 29 Sept - 04 Oct. Very large room with superb view. 
The door/bell men were all very warm, helpful and friendly. A real shame I didn't feel the same warmth and friendliness from the front desk staff hence reason for not giving 5 stars.
It would also be useful if the rooms were soundproofed. We were on the 33rd floor and the noise from the street was noticeable. Luckily I had earplugs.

title: Honeymoon visit
