text: When visiting New York we searched lots of hotels however we decided that the room was only for us to sleep in-so didn't need  top notch. This hotel was perfect- spacious, clean and easy to locate. Tourist places are all in walking distance so again ideal. There is a deposit to pay when you arrive but this is to cover room service etc.

title: Best Value Hilton in New York
text: Problem with the City is finding a good hotel for an acceptable price.  Although far on the East Side (UN Plaza), this hotel is a top tier Hilton and very affordable with a magnificent view of the East River.  Well worth the extra distance to popular Manhattan destinations.

title: Great Hotel Great Location
text: We came to New York to see the 911 museum among other things, and used this hotel as our base camp for four days of adventuring around Manhattan. The staff is professional and courteous and very helpful. The property is clean and conveniently located in lower Manhattan. Across the street from the Oculus the 911 museum and adjacent to the financial district it served our needs well. I would recommend this property to anyone looking for a quality hotel that is reasonably priced!

title: Wonderful Experience; Looking forward to my next trip!
text:
The overall service was excellent - lovely room with a wonderful view, friendly and helpful staff. I was booked to stay at the hotel for two weeks. After the first week, I was notified of an upgrade of the room for the rest of my stay at the hotel; and guess what? I was upgraded to a Suite!
Although the change was quite swift, I totally loved it. The bellman who was sent up to help move my things was super helpful! The suite had very beautiful views and I enjoyed and the entire room was equally beautiful. I very much enjoyed my stay at the hotel

title: Will be back!
text: Great Property, everyone I encountered were friendly and welcoming. Great location, within walking distance to lots of places, I used room service a lot and the food was delicious, menu was great. Thx!

title: Enjoy the 80's fabulous lobby!
text:
The lobby is very throw back to the 80's! The rooms are very nice, clearly recently renovated.  Nothing special but clean and modern. Everything was in good working order. The staff on check in was friendly and the lobby staff (for bag check, etc) was very friendly and helpful.

The location cannot be beat if you are attending anything at the UN and there are several good eating places within an easy walk.  I enjoyed my short stay.

title: Take-over of this hotel by the Hilton chain not yet a success
text:
The Millennium hotel group was neither fish nor fowl -at their rare best its properties could prove decent business hotels.  Hilton used to aim higher, but is not yet delivering well at all several months after taking over management of the property.  

Some assets: nearly all rooms have great New York skyline views.  The rooms, while charmless, are serviceable.  Recent renovations have been successful, on balance.  And for those doing business at the UN, the location is unbeatable.

The weak point: the staff - deplorable by what used to be Hilton standards.  And the hotel is so nakedly revenue-driven as to chase away any sense of actual service or customer loyalty.  The restaurant serves an over-priced, altogether synthetic and unoriginal, breakfast.

Whatever happened to Hilton?  It used to be a terrific business brand, its international properties often genuinely luxurious and stylish.  The Conrad collection or the sprawling Hilton brand now aspires (without much success) to those laurels internationally,  but Hilton itself, domestically in the US, is increasingly pedestrian.  In my lifetime, I have rarely seen a proud brand degrade itself so thoroughly.  It now aims only to serve its share-holders rather than customers, who are treated anonymously. 

A disappointment.

title: Customer service is non-existent! Unfriendly staff at the front desk.
text: We are currently still staying at this Hotel and the first impression is just awful. A few days later I can say it still is. Our American Express concierge service booked a room for us in this Hotel and the confirmation clearly stated ‚King bed room w/ city view‘. Arriving at this Hotel, the rude lady at the front desk just told us, that we also cannot get an upgrade although we have the Hilton Honors Gold Status. She said the hotel was fully booked, which was clearly a lie, since there were still plenty rooms available at booking.com. What she didn‘t tell us, is that she only gave us a queen bed room, which we first saw when arriving at the room. So we tried to change to the correct room category, that we already paid for, but the rude lady at the front desk refused to help us again. Since I was too tired after a long-haul flight to discuss this with the manager, we had to sleep the first night in an uncomfortable queen bed, which is way too small for two people! View is awful, since we are just looking onto another building, that is right in front of the window. Customer service at this hotel is simply non-existent and I wouldn‘t recommend this to anyone! There are road-side motels, that have a better Standard than this Hilton... Beware! If you have the Hilton Honors Gold Status: That won‘t get you anywhere in this hotel. No late check-out, no upgrades, nothing. The only positive thing was the friendly staff at the executive lounge and the cleaning staff also did a good job, although the furniture is rather worn out.

title: Todo bien!
text:
Estuvimos 3 noches alojados en este hotel en new york. La ubicación nos encanto! En la habitación encuentras de todo. La cama es fantástica. Lo único negativo fue el personal, en recepción! No nos gusto como nos trataron... no entiendo como un hotel con tanta categoría no tenga buen personal... y mas las chicas en recepción es la primera imagen que da el hotel! 
Pero en cuanto al hotel esta muy bien! Vistas espectaculares!!!

title: New York  ,New York
text:
Found this hotel on booking. com stayed 2 nights.
On my way called hotel was running late to let them know.
Arrived at hotel great directions easy to find check in was a breeze went up to room the room was dirty stuff on walls and floor told lady at desk was given another room the beds were comfortable nice size room hotel had a lounge area and gym, restaurant  . Very nice and clean 
The hotel was close to the subway station in walking distance of shopping the hotel staff was very helpful with directions 
I liked that hotel held your luggage while we shopped or picked up our car great experience would stay again my next time in New York

title: great experience,
text: excellent staff and very hospitable to our needs. location was very convientent. the prperty is super clean.you must try this place if you are in the eastern part of Manhattan. In a quitter part of NYC but close to everything, specially all kinds of restaurants.

title: Nos causo buena impresion, podriamos repetir
text:
El hotel en lineas generales nos gusto, destacar en la parte negativa que no tienen wifi gratis en las habitaciones. En la parte positiva destacar en el personal a Osvaldo en el Bell Desk fue muy amable y habla muy bien Español. En la cafeteria destacamos a Wendy muy cariñosa y servicial, tambien es de habla hispana. El hotel esta al lado del edificio de la ONU, esta muy cerca de la Estacion Central.
Tiene una vistas muy buenas desde las habitaciones, el hotel empieza a partir del piso 28. Nos parecio recomendable.

title: Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza
text: I stay at this property all the time because of the value you get for the money. The property is pretty centrally located as well. Its about 10 minutes from Time Square, a four minute walk to the train stations, as well as great food all around. The staff is super friendly and know what they are doing. After talking to them some of them have been with the property between 15 and 20 years.

title: Perfekt
text: Fantastiskt hotell med väldigt trevlig och tillmötesgående personal. Där finns en person som enbart hjälper till med bokning av teater och andra shower. Vi hade glömt att ta med adapter till elektronik. Inga problem det fick vi låna. Ville man ha hjälp med att fixa taxi hjälpte de gärna till. Vi bodde på 37 våning med fantastisk utsikt. Nära till grand central station. Nära till det mesta.

title: Gutes Stadthotel mit toller Aussicht
text:
Insgesamt war unser Aufenthalt im Hilton ONE UN Plaza sehr gut.
Das Hotel ist zwar schon etwas in die Jahre gekommen aber unser Zimmer im 39. Stock im West-Tower war sauber, relativ groß und komfortabel. Außer dort geschlafen und die wundervolle Aussicht genossen haben wir in dem Hotel keinen weiteren Service genutzt.
Man ist schnell per Fuß bei der Grand Central Station, auf dem Weg dorthin gibt es gute Frühstücksrestaurants
z. B. John’s Cafe in der 2. Ave/44.E.. Das Personal war freundlich, wir hatten aber wenig miteinander zu tun.
Also, das Hotel hat 4 Sterne verdient - auch wegen der fantastischen Zimmeraussicht!

title: Excellent Hotel
text: I recommend to all! Excellent Hotel! Perfect location, gorgeous views, very clean rooms, comfortable beds and so so friendly staff! Special THANK YOU, Masha Kirr! You are very positive, unrealistically clever, amazing, unique and absolutely fantastic person!          The next stay in New York will be only in this hotel!!!

title: Amazing views!!!
text: I highly recommend this Hotel !!!! I have nothing negative to say about this hotel , the hotel has spectacular views, staff very friendly and helpful, the incredible location (if you like walking you can walk to many parts) is very close to the grand central, Central Park , Times Square , etc . You have many options of bars, restaurants, supermarkets , coffee shops etc. the area is very safe because is near to the building of the un , there is even a dog 24 hours as part of the security team ....

title: Highly Recommended
text:
Most amazing view of the city, would definitely recommend this hotel.  Staff were friendly, although I did have to wait at least 30 minutes in a queue to check in after an 8 hour flight!

Very friendly gentleman in the cafe, who makes a mean vanilla latte.  

Very comfortable beds and overall a lovely room to fall in love with the city that never sleeps.

title: Transport airport theatre  service
text:
We stayed in this hotel for our last three nights in the us before we headed home .  On the morning of our check out  we thought we would use the hotel service to arrange a transfer to airport. We approached the tall blond guy standing at the small desk with a sign transport/airport/Theater booking  he was looking down.
I stood across the desk about a  foot from his face he did not acknowledge me I gave him 2 -3 minutes ( thinking he was probably looking at a screen that I cannot see or writing something) when I noticed that his eyes and hands weren’t moving I said Hi ! He gave me an resentful look
Without answering so I asked him how much would it. It’s to arrange a transfer to JFK airport 
He replied When? I said 0130 he asked louder when?! I thought he meant where so I said JFK airport so he yelled WHEN??? WHAT DAY??
I was shocked what kind of a hotel service is this who gave him the job? Couldn’t he just ask polity “is it for today?” Or clarify nicely “I meant to ask what day?” I know this is not the Four Seasons hotel but does it mean you have abuse your guests because they don’t pay as much as those of a 5* hotel?!
English is not my first language but I lived in an English speaking country long enough to know that if I say I have an appointment at 3 it’s 99.9% I am talking about today unless I specifically mention the name of the day.
Or Did I have to tip him first as I approach him to get a smile and respect ? Sadly this experience left a bitter taste in my mouth after an otherwise pleasant stay at this  hotel.

title: Overall ok
text: The hotel is very close to the UN and clean. It has a nice view, especially if you're staying in the east side. There is a relatively new incoming mail policy which is very expensive if not absurd. I've had a bad experience with the staff

title: Bucket list holiday with my daughter
text: The hotel is slightly away from the centre, but we found that to be a plus point as less hustle and bustle, but only a 10minute walk to Grand Central Central, also lots of nearby bars and restaurants without having to go into the centre of the city.  All the staff were very polite and friendly and professional.  Our room was amazing with views over the Chrysler Building and Empire State - we loved keeping the curtains open at night to enjoy the views as it was better than watching the tv!  The beds were very comfortable, and toiletries were by Crabtree & Evelyn. The whole hotel was kept spotless.  We felt very safe there, and security was high with the United Nations building next door.  Will be very happy to recommend to friends and family.

title: Maravillosas vistas desde la habitación
text:
Estuvimos en una habitación con vistas al skyline impresionantes. Hay que decir que el hotel está muy bien, la habitación era grande, espaciosa y limpia.

La ubicación es buena, es una zona muy segura en la ciudad y estas a 10-15 minutos a pie del centro. 

En cuanto al personal, deja un poco que desear: el día que llegamos nos dieron la habitación equivocada(había huéspedes dentro), y al reclamarlo no fueron muy agradables.

title: Oh the noise!
text: We were upgraded to a suite with Hilton Honors status which we appreciate. We took a nap immediately after check-in, but the noise in the hall way were not tolerable. Surprisingly, it was not rude customers but house keeping staff!!! Overall a fine experience but some details really were below what Hilton's mission is.

title: Special trip, with special service
text:
We (2 couples) stayed here for 4 nights in August to celebrate my best friend's 50th birthday.  We were treated so well, with upgrades to lovely suites with great views.  I wish I could remember the name of the receptionist who checked us in (Dania?) because she was lovely and found us rooms at 9 am (we'd just arrived from Vancouver) which we really appreciated.    My husband is a Diamond Hilton member and never have I been so glad!
The hotel itself is located really well, as it's only about 4 blocks to Grand Central station, walking distance to loads of places as well.  
The Executive lounge works on an honesty bar, which is fine, and there was a good choice of wine (not always the case).  Breakfast was also good, with lovely fresh fruit. 
We had to be moved due to some weird rumblings as the aircon couldn't cope with the ridiculously hot weather.
All of the staff we came across were professional and friendly and we would definitely stay here again.

title: Mum and daughter 21st girlie trip
text: Excellent views and a spotless hotel.Staff polite, informative and relaxed.Hotel views of the Empire State, Chrysler Building, Times Square. Hotel is situated near to the United Nations buildings a little too far to walk to most ‘tourist sights’ but a cab is a quick and relatively cheap ride just outside the hotel. Request a room facing the Chrysler Building we stayed in room 38 on the 32nd floor. Would highly recommend this hotel

title: Ubicación y vistas excelentes
text: La ubicación y las vistas lo mejor. El trato en recepción muy bueno. Lo peor el trato con las maletas. Habitación muy amplia y el baño estupendo. Muy buena relación calidad-precio. El desayuno muy caro y sería aún mejor si tuviera una parada de metro al lado.

title: Huge rooms, quiet area
text:
These rooms are enormous by New York City standards.  Spacious and modern bathroom, comfortable beds, nice seating areas, and a refrigerator/coffee maker made our stay very comfortable.  We had fantastic views and the housekeeping staff was really responsive to our requests.  The rooms were very well sound-proofed.  

Area is pretty quiet, but you’re only a block away from tons of places to eat and public transportation.  

Will definitely stay here again.

title: Perfect place to stay on UN business
text: The hotel is literally across the street from the UN building.  Most of the rooms have a view of the Hudson River.  The rooms are large, with good-sized closets and safe, and are comfortable.  The alarm clock is easy to use.  The workspace is large, with a couple of extra outlets (USB and regular) on the side of the desk.  The wifi and cable TV work well.  Lighting is good for working at the desk.  The fitness room has a superb view of the river.  Unfortunately the cardio machines are placed in the part of the room with the worst view, but the overall experience is much more pleasant than most gyms.  The service is good, especially the doormen.  The check-in staff are friendly and helpful.  Check-in time is 4pm(!) but I was able to get in my room at 2pm and could use the locker room in the fitness area to change and freshen up in the meantime.  I recommend bringing a padlock if you plan to use the locker room lockers.  The cleaning staff are efficient, though when I ran out of shampoo after the first day (the bottles are small!) they were not replenished.  At peak hours the check-in area gets crowded and the wait can be long.  The hotel should bring in an additional staff member to help with surge.

title: Settimana a NYC
text: Hotel nel complesso bello ed accogliente, pulito e fornito di tutti i comfort necessari.Probabilmente non lo sceglierei di nuovo data la posizione leggermente decentrata, a mezz’ora a piedi da Times Square ed altri punti di interesse, ma nonostante questo la zona è molto tranquilla.

title: Excellent hôtel !
text:
Hôtel excellent en tout points. 
Très bien situé! A seulement moins de 10 minutes à pied du Grand Central Terminal.
Chambre très belle, moderne et surtout très propre! Sans vous parler de la vue sur New York, qui est magnifique.
Nous avons adoré séjourner dans cet hôtel.

title: Location and comfort!
text: I recently stayed a long weekend at the Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza. It was lovely - I stayed on the 30th floor, had an amazing view, a most comfortable King bed AND a heated toilet seat! The location was perfect - across the street from the United Nations, with coffee shops close by, as well as the famous Patsy's one block away.And while it was a long 8 blocks to Time Square, it was totally manageable. I did it twice during my stay. The staff couldn't have been kinder and more helpful. Would easily stay here again.

title: A beautiful and accomodating hotel for a stay in NYC
text: If you are staying in New York for a weekend or over night - Millennium is a great place to stay.  The rooms are clean, comfortable, updated.  With easy check-in and check-out. The front desk personnel are pleasant and efficient during the stay.

title: As usual Hilton doesn’t know how to charge promotional rates
text: Just checked out.  They charged me full rate, though the 3rd night had a promo.  Impossible to reach the front desk as they don’t pick up the phone. The lounge is boring, same exact thing every morning and evening.  What a great customer service for a diamond member.

title: The perfect base for a new adventure
text: My wife and I stayed at this hotel to celebrate our anniversary.This was the perfect location for our New York stay being a gentle 8-10 minute stroll  from Grand Central Station.The staff were both delightful and helpful,and the rooms were spacious with incredible views.Highly recommended..

title: Lovely hotel, stunning views and friendly staff - Great choice for NYC!
text:
My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights to celebrate our 20th Wedding anniversary.
Upon request we were allocated a room with stunning views of the Chrysler building, Empire State and Freedom Tower - just stunning day and night!  
When you arrive outside the hotel your bag will be 'sniffed' by a friendly sniffer-dog - this is just standard procedure due to the close proximity to the United Nations and just an extra security measure I guess but it really didn't bother us at all.  In fact we felt very safe here.
When we entered the lovely lobby, we were warmly greeted and given a coffee/pastry whilst we waited for our room to be ready (we had arrived early from the UK!)
The reception staff, concierge and cafe staff were very friendly and helpful and made us feel very welcome.
A lovely touch was complimentary chocolate dipped strawberries and Prosecco in our room to celebrate our anniversary - how kind!
We found the location of the hotel very convenient and it was just a short walk from Central Station - from which you can catch the subway to other parts of Manhattan and further afield.
I would recommend this hotel to friends/family or anyone else visiting New York.

title: Excelente atencion
text: Estuve 4 noches.  Habitaciones muy amplias, tremenda vista y excelente atencion, principalmente por parte de Wendy y Tatiana en el snack donde siempre estuvieron atendiendo con una sonrisa. El hotel esta cerca de la estacion central de trenes, aunque un poco alejado del centro de midtown.

title: Not the experience that I was expecting from Hilton
text: Well not what I was expecting from the Hilton hotel. Altogether it was a very pleasant stay. The hotel is at great location, staff very friendly and rooms comfortable. The negative side was that I didn’t have WiFi in the room (although I got the passcode), which was a big hustle. Had to go down to the lobby to check my emails. There was no fridge in the room and complementary water (maybe that’s not the thing in NY). Had to ask for the disposable toothpaste and toothbrush (which I got right away by the friendly staff member). Was expecting five star experience from the world renown brand like Hilton, but got a bit disappointed.

title: Great Location
text: Staff were very helpful & friendly, Barry on reception was a real gent. Would stay there again. The location is great, just a few blocks away from the real hustle & bustle of New York. I rarely give 5 stars but i'm willing to do so on this occasion given the helpful staff on site. The room was quite good as well.

title: Super bra!
text:
Super bra hotell. Bra belligenhet i ett trygt område i New York og fantastisk utsikt fra hotell rommet vårt. Så ut over hele new york fra etasjen vi bodde på. Kort gangavstand til veldig gode restauranter i nærområdet. 
Utrolig god Concierge Service.

title: Great Hotel
text: This was our kids first time in NY. This hotel is clean good size rooms, for being in NY. The King Corner room very very spacious. They have breakfast at the restaurant grill inside the hotel, along with dinner and a little cafe also. The views from our rooms were phenomenal. You couldn't ask for more. The hotel is also close to Grand Central Station about 5 blocks.

title: Amazing hotel
text:
I rarely give 5 stars to hotels, but this one deserves it for its spotlessness and comfort as well as its breathtaking views. There is no free wi-wi, unfortunately. You have to pay $10 for it. There is a restaurant and a cafe at the hotel, but we went out to eat. Check out La Vera for delicious pizza, that place was awesome for dinner.
Our room was a standard queen room, but the bed seemed larger somehow so we slept through the night perfectly without disturbing each other, and we are used to California King. We stayed in the 37th flooor. The hotel is in a quiet neighborhood so noise is reduced.

title: Comfortable Stay
text: I arrived early for a 2 night stay. I had already checked-in online and selected a room and it was ready for me despite my early arrival. Maybe I'm not New York City material, but being asked to put an extra $100 deposit on hold from my credit card took me aback a bit. Not my first surprise while in the city though. The room wasn't far from the elevators and had a very nice view from the window onto the East River and directly down onto the United Nations. The room I was in was larger than most, mainly due to its location - it was about 1.5x larger than what you would expect as you can likely see in the pictures I'm posting with the review. The long window along the wall gave a great view during the day and even moreso at night. Things I liked about the room included the flooring in the bathroom which was never cold even when I had the A/C turned up. Things I didn't like? The Illy Coffee-Espresso maker in the room. It was terrible and wouldn't make a complete Espresso or coffee unless you played with it and pushed the buttons repeatedly. Filling it with water was a bit tricky as well as the reservoir didn't want to come off and I worried I was going to break it (and buy it!). The plug in the bathroom sink wouldn't come completely up either, so I could only run water there slowly as the sink wouldn't drain as fast as water filled it. It took quite a while for the water to turn hot enough to shave as well, especially at a trickle. Speaking of hot water - there are very nice bags of tea available to you on the coffee bar, but no way to boil water for them...unless you want to trickle hot water in the sink for about 20 minutes or so first. The TV was first rate and I liked that extra streaming channels like Crackle were included; Netflix is also there but you have to sign into your own personal account to view anything. The bed was comfortable, no complaints there and ultimately that is the point of a hotel - to have somewhere to sleep. The alarm clock provided was an iHome brand oriented towards Apple products, but if you have a USB cord you can connect other devices to it as well. With the location of the hotel and the branding, I expected much more than I found here. It was still a comfortable stay and if in town again for business in the same area I would book again.

title: Ottimo rapporto qualità/prezzo
text:
Per una quadrupla abbiamo speso 160 euro per notte, colazione esclusa.
Dall'hotel è possibile raggiungere a piedi central station, times square e il palazzo dell'ONU. Lo consiglio per il rapporto qualità/prezzo a patto di prenotare col dovuto anticipo.
Sconsiglio la colazione: costa molto mentre potete rivolgervi ad uno dei tanti locali nei paraggi.
Se siete fortunati la vista è spettacolare.

title: Love this hotel
text: Great rooms for the value. Best views in the city. The friendliest staff, always willing to help. Perfect location, right in the middle of the city. Always stay here when I'm in the city and always will.

title: A hotel with a fantastic view.
text: The hotel has an excellent location. 8 minutes to Grand Central, 20 minutes to Times Square. The view of Manhattan amazing. As a diamond member I got an upgrade to the suite, which was very nice. A room with two bedrooms and two bathrooms overlooking the East River and Manhattan. The room is corner which makes the views are perfect. Room very well cleaned. The air conditioning was quite loud. Staff at the hotel were not very interested in the guests. Breakfast in the executive louge very poor: bagels, 2 pastas, jams and two cheeses, fruit, yogurt. Little space. It happened that there was no place to sit. Even worse is the executive lounge during happy hours. Every day for a week were served wings and carrots, peppers, cucumbers and all that. There was beer and wine but extra pay: 5 $ for a beer and 5 $ for a glass of wine. This is the first time I have experienced such a situation, I have stayed in many Hilton hotels around the world and you do not have to pay for beer and wine anywhere. Very weak. Great location, very good rooms, poor service and a terrible executive lounge.

title: Nice stay!
text: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The facilities were well maintained. The staff was nice and helpful as our flight arrived early and we were allowed early check in. The view from our corner bedroom was beautiful!

title: Amazing hotel
text:
Have just returned from this hotel and love everything about this hotel, our room was amazing and the views were out of this world definitely the best hotel I have ever stayed in was traveling with my wife and 2 children who loved the room, the room was cleaned to a very high standard everyday and the staff were very friendly,  breakfast in the hotel was also fantastic great choice, hotel very central 20 min walk to Times Square and only 2 blocks to grand central, this hotel has made our holiday in New York one to remember, And would 100 percent recommend it, will definitely be back 
Thanks again

title: Fantastic room and executive lounge views.
text: The city , river and UN views were some of the best we have ever had. Even the gym  has a panoramic view of river and UN. Great front desk and luggage staff, Kevin? Busy place, lobby was busy and outside front is busy. In the heart of UN related business.

title: Manca qualcosa
text: Ottima posizione per girare New York, rapporto qualità prezzo non buono, la camera non era dello standard Hilton, pulita, si, ma non eccezionale, si sentiva un po’ di odore di polvere. Colazione non compresa nella camera, che non è regalata... e soprattutto dovete fare attenzione che vi ricalcolano il prezzo della vacanza, nonostante sia stata prepagata. Detto questo, è sicuramente molto bello.

title: Excellent
text:
Brilliant hotel, friendly staff at reception and in particular at the executive lounge. Housekeeping also friendly and efficient 

Was upgraded to a king suite at check in as a diamond member, which was very welcome.

Exec lounge facilities are good, working PCs, printer, good coffee and decent breakfast spread.

WiFi very fast - only problem is it drops out quite frequently. Netflix accessible on TV which is very convenient

Would definitely recommend for those wanting a quiet hotel in a good location with great views

title: Semplicemente il top
text: Già dalle foto/recensioni eravamo contenti ma quando siamo arrivati eravamo estasiati. L'hotel modernissimo, lo staff efficiente, cortese e sempre sorridente (molte volte fa la differenza).Fatto il check-in in breve tempo eravamo 4 famiglie e in mezz'ora eravamo in camera. La camera pulitissima,addirittura anche sotto al letto la moquette era linda e immacolata.Il letto comodissimo si dormiva benissimo.La tv da 40 pollici e la macchina del caffè erano la ciliegina sulla torta. Il bagno immacolato con la carta igienica addirittura col sigillo dell'hotel. Le finestre della camera affacciavano sull'East River. La palestra con attrezzi di prim'ordine pulitissima, con asciugamani sempre puliti,Kleenex, salviette umidificate e distributore dell'acqua. A 2 giorni dalla fine l'autista del van che ci doveva portare all'aeroporto ha dato forfait (prenotato dall'Italia a un agenzia esterna) la receptionist in 5 minuti ce ne ha trovato un altro. A qualsiasi richiesta c'era una soluzione sempre col sorriso. CONSIGLIATISSIMO

title: Retreat location
text: Was here with my family for 4 days. Had rooms with a brilliant view of NY, 2 days with a view of the New York  skyline fromt he 34th floor and 2 days with a majestic view of Queens Bridge and Long Island. Rooms were clean and nice toiletries in bathroom, however several fixtures may need to be spruced up a bit as cupboards etc were slightly damaged. Breakfast was amazing with brilliant food and excellent table service, a special shout out to Abu who looked after us so well.Location a bit out of the way, but 10 minute walk to Central Station and perhaps 15 minute walk to Times Square, some shops 5 minutes away that sell groceries and offer laundry and other such services. One gripe, I had 2 children with me that did make some noise, but was not impressed to betoldby security at 7.30 am that neighbours had complained, we then moved room as we felt a little uncomfortable and again the same issue occured again. Not sure if my kids were making too much noise or that the walls were paper thin, both times we were in interconnected rooms and this is clearly not a good idea with kids when your neighbour wants to have a lie in etc.. hotel tried to rectify problem, so did we, but kind of dampened our mood, having to tell our kids to always not make noise....when they were just being kids and when I have not had that problem before in any other hotel.

title: The worse thing a hotel can do.....check you into a room that another guest is occupying!!!!
text:
We drove from Washington DC in the pouring rain. We were so grateful to be back at The Millennium Hilton! We had called on our way to NYC to confirm our suite. We were told that the room was ours and that the manager, Titia?, had checked us in herself. We were assured the room was ready and waiting. 
When were arrived the doorman loaded our bags on the luggage rack then stood waiting for a tip. We gave him one and know we will need to produce another tip for the bellman because the doorman only helps to the lobby! 
We got to our suite and the key didn’t work. We hear the tv and knock. Another guest answers!! WTH!! Now my son, tired from driving, has to stand at the desk and wait for this issue to be resolved!! 
Hilton you have fallen so far from the grand hotels of the past. 
Way to ruin the end of our trip! Never again!!

title: Nice hotel on the mid-east side
text: We were in New York for a dance convention. We stayed here because it was centrally located to Times Square . Hotel is very nice and the rooms are pretty good size when you consider you were in New York. The only downside was $90 to park our vehicle. Other than that, it was a good hotel.

title: Very good service and great view
text: The hotel is very clean, the staff is extremely kind and reactive to any request (even at very late hour when we have faced a problem due to a noise coming from somewhere in the ventilation system), great location and view!!!!

title: Séjour Parfait
text:
Très bon séjour de 8 nuits dans cet hôtel. A l'arrivée nous avons été surclassé en King Size Room au 38è et dernier étage avec une vue magnifique sur l'Hudson river, l'Empire et le Chrysler (#3824). Plateau de courtoisie, machine à café, frigo, coffre fort font que l'on peut être autonome et même prendre le pdj dans la chambre le matin.
Le personnel est très serviable et agréable.
Le quartier est calme tout en restant central. La station de métro la plus proche se trouve à environ 10 minutes de marche à Grand Central Station. Ce n'est pas gênant en soi mais parfois le soir en ayant marché toute la journée, le trajet peut sembler interminable 😉.

title: Huge room, decent staff.
text:
Wonderful room on the 38th floor with amazing views of the river and midtown. The only issue with the room is that it's impossible to charge your laptop at the desk because there's no room in between the desk and plug. Not a huge problem, but very odd.

I don't really expect much from hotel staff, but a greeting from the doormen and the lobby staff is always a nice touch. Don't expect that here. However, the housekeepers are very friendly and good at their jobs.

title: Good clean hotel with good service
text: Stayed here during a business trip to New York. Stayed in a king room with city view. Rooms were very clean on arrival. Housekeeping over the following days wasn’t great. Bits of rubbish left on floor were never hoovered or cleaned. Location is good however everything was expensive around the hotel. Water 1l in the newsagent across the hotel cost $3. Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. Had the buffet Breakfast at hotel which cost $35 per person. Breakfast had a large selection of food items. Will recommend a stay if in New York for a business or short trip.

title: Fella's Get-Away Weekend!!!
text: This hotel was really nice. All of our rooms were comfortable and clean. However, I went to grab a towel from the rack and it had been used. (so advise to the housekeeping staff, check or replace all towel when cleaning the bathrooms) The bathrooms were clean, one nice feature is the bathrooms have heated mirrors that will not fog while taking a shower. The Check-in and out process was easy! All the staff we encountered were all friendly and helpful. I tend to be a brand hotel snob but I wasn't responsible for the planning of this trip, however, I was very pleased! Will stay again and recommend.

title: Top Lage!
text:
Wir haben 9 Nächte in diesem Hotel verbracht. Es gab keinerlei Komplikationen beim Einchecken und der Zuweisung des Zimmers. 
Ein Upgrade wird zwar schmackhaft gemacht (30$ pro Nacht mehr), aber ist total unnötig. Denn der Grund FÜR ein Upgrade liegt darin, dass die Mitarbeiter die Queen-Size-Zimmer für zu klein halten. 
Die Lage ist genial. Man kann Bus, U-Bahn fahren oder mit dem Leihbike die Straßen unsicher machen. 
Alles war stets sauber (auf einem sehr hohen Stand). Im Zimmer ist es gemütlich mit LED TV, Mini-Kühlschrank und einer Wanne. 
House-Keeping morgens ist sehr penetrant. Obwohl ein Schild hing, klopfte man immer nach.

title: Just Fabulous!!
text: Recently stayed at the Millennium Hilton UN Plaza for three nights, and loved everything about our stay.  Upon entering the Lobby area, we were warmly greeted by several staff members.  A special "thank-you" is extended to Frank, one of the Bellmen, who could not have been nicer.  The view from our corner king room was spectacular...an unobstructed view of the UN, and the East River, and we could see the Empire State Building, the Chrysler Building, and the Freedom Tower from the other window.  This hotel has a good location, and there are several excellent restaurants within walking distance.  Taxis are always available immediately as you exit the Lobby, and the subway and buses are close by, as well.  I highly recommend this hotel to others.

title: 4 Personen-Zimmer mit 2 Betten
text: Das Hotel ist sehr schön, sauber, hat einen herrlichen Ausblick aus den Fenstern und das Personal ist sehr nett. Soweit das positive. W-Lan nur in der Lobby im Jahre 2018... Wir zwar von vielen Hotels so praktiziert um mehr Geld aus ihren Kunden herauszuquetschen, diese Praxis sollte aber nicht von einem Hilton, mit beachtlichen Zimmerpreisen durchgeführt werden. Dieser Punkt ist ja vertretbar. Wir hatten ein vier Personen Zimmer gebucht, doch waren erstaunt als wir nur 2 Betten vorfanden. Man könnte jetzt denken es sind große Betten, aber die Betten sind für eine Person "zu groß" und für 2 Personen zu klein. Ende von der Geschichte: 2 Personen habeb auf dem Boden geschlafen. Leider muss man sagen das dieses Hilton Hotel von seinem Namen lebt.

title: Good base in NYC
text: Stayed for 5 nights start of August, arrived after 10pm to a very helpful woman on reception who checked us in quickly. Room  was nice and bed was comfy. Cleaned everyday by housekeeping. Hotel is in a good location, quiet area but 15/20 min walk to time square etc.  Taxis readily available right outside hotel. Couldn’t fault our stay.

title: Awesome Escape to NYC
text:
My wife and myself had the absolutely pleasure of staying at the Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza from July 31st-Aug 2nd 2018.  We came to NYC for our anniversary as well as my wife's birthday.

For our stay we were located in room 3131 which was a gorgeous and spacious two bedroom suite.  I would have to say that one of the many highlight of this particular suite was the sweeping views of not only the East River but Midtown Manhattan as well, especially the One World Trade Center and Chrysler/Empire State buildings. Besides the vies, this suite was extremely spacious and main living area consisted of a large circular dining table, built-in coffee/mini bar area, a desk and chair, lounging chair with ottoman, wall-mounted t.v., two chaise loungers a coffee table and more. The main living area also had a wall mounted digital/touchscreen unit which controlled not only the HVAC for the main area and bedroom but as well as the lighting for the whole well which was divided into zones. 

The master bedroom was equally large and had flanking wardrobes at the entrance with ample pull-out shelving and hangers, a king-size bed as well as a bench at the foot of the bed.  The views from the bedroom were just as great as the main living area.  The master ensuite was luxurious to say the least - large soaker tub and glass enclosed walk-in shower with multiple shower heads including a rain shower head.  The ensuite also had a dressing/makeup table and of course a single vanity.  

The Skyline Club which was located on the 30th floor, was where continental breakfast and evening snacks were served.  Breakfast consisted of cubed cheese, bagels and breads, an assortment of pastries, yogurt, cereal, granola, jams/spreads, juice, coffee, milk and fruit.  In the evening, the lounge offered small bites such as cheese, bread, pretzels, veggies and dips and some warm items such as chicken wings and crispy deep friend beans.  The selection of food items change daily so the aforementioned menu was what we encountered during our 3 night stay.  The lounge also offered wine and beer for an additional cost.  The other option for breakfast would be to visit the Ambassador Grill restaurant on the main lobby level of the hotel. This is a full buffet spread with just about anything you can imagine.  There is a fee for this breakfast option. Similarly, there is also Un Cafe on the main level as well which serves snacks, sandwiches and salads as well as crafted coffee beverages.

Location wise, you're Midtown East area and within walking distance to Central Park, Empire and Chrysler Building, Times Square as well as the iconic Grand Central Terminal.  

All in all, we loved our stay at the Millennium Hilton New York One UN Plaza and will definitely stay again when we return.  The staff we had contact with was amazing - super friendly, always willing to help out and above all, very hospitable.  The suite was probably one of the nicest rooms I've ever come across at a Hilton property and I'd highly recommend it if you are looking for a bit (lot) of extra space.

title: Che dire .... fantastica esperienza
text: Arrivati avevano pronotato un normale eh però aveva vista su long island.... chiedendo alla reception l’operatire (Lui è stato favoloso) ci ha proposto con una aggiunta di 100 euro la suite su due piani.... ci siamo guardati (100 euro non sono pochi) così ci ha dato anche l’accessi allo Sky club..... dove abbiamo scoperto che apertivi serale e colazione sono compresi e senza extra (solo il calice di vino e extra) che dire fare colazione e apertivo e soggiornare con Manhattan così non potevamo chiedere di più .... totale circa 300 euro per una notte..... ma ne vale la pena provare per credere!

title: disappointed as waiting better results
text: I was expecting a better quality globally; I had to way tw0 hours to finally make the ceckin; room not perfect and needing better accuracy in its preparation. global quality lower than other similar experiences in other countries

title: Amazing place to stay while in New York
text: Very nice and professional staff. Great location to walk to various points of interest. Beautiful views! The staff treat you as an individual and make sure you are taken care of. The hotel has a very welcoming atmosphere the minute you walk in the door.

title: Family trip
text: This hotel was our second in the area and was a good location for walking to most area mid town.  Rooms were spotless and the service was good.  We didn’t use the restaurant as it was shockingly expensive, as was the shop in the foyer for basic things like water.  It was a pleasant stay and would go back.  We stayed in a family room with four of us.

title: Great hotel - what a view!
text: My daughter and I had a short break in this hotel and stayed in a deluxe double on the 40th floor. The view from our bedroom was incredible - the Chrysler Building and the Empire State Building both felt within touching distance. Other than that, the room itself was the largest I've had in a New York hotel, was clean and well appointed and the bed was very comfortable. The staff were friendly and helpful - particularly when I had to run back 2 blocks after checking out to retrieve our passports from the safe! The cafe in the lobby is expensive - but then practically everything in this city is - and the quality was good.  The hotel is also really well located (hence the view) and the nearest subway at Grand Central Station is an easy 10 min walk. Definitely recommended!

title: Had a nice stay
text:
It was a good visit. Everyone was courteous and we were upgraded for free. It was hard to figure out the elevator but we got it in the end. The room and the view was great. Had a brilliant electronic toilet. Need on in my house now. 
They didn’t have any coffee but the manager gave us complimentary drinks to compensate which was really nice

title: The old days are gone. Not a 4-Star Hotel anymore.
text:
A great, but a "has been" hotel. I stayed in this hotel several times whenever I go to New York. I can see that things are slowly getting detoriated.
The Lobby remains impersonal, dark, gloomy. No place to sit comfortably upon.
A rigid reception desk which is cold, uncaring, without any empathy, not interested in clients and even arrogant. What some people such as Barry are doing behind a reception desk?
Poor internet connectivity over-charged at high cost.
The only good thing about this hotel are the bellboys: They are as usual courteous, nice and provide a quality client service.

title: Pas déçu mais presque...
text:
Si l'emplacement est bon et le niveau de service très bon (comme partout dans la chaine, en général), notre chambre se trouvait dans l'aile "arrière" et j'ai la mauvaise impression que c'est la moins jolie...
Notre chambre avait une chouette vue sur East River. On était à un étage élevé. Ca, c'était très chouette. La clim' fonctionnait très bien et était commandée par une "tablette" accrochée au mur: ça en jette! Mais sinon, rien de spécial...
Par contre ce qui vaut une évaluation à 3 boules, c'est la reconnaissance du statut Honors (je suis Gold). Je n'ai pas obtenu de surclassement de chambre (cela devient SUPER RARE dans les Hilton US) mais bien l'accès au Lounge (où nous étions obligés d'aller prendre un petit déjeuner -gratuit, certes- mais TRÈS réduit) où POUR LA PREMIERE FOIS DE MA VIE, j'ai du payer $5 pour pouvoir boire une bière; je trouve cela mesquin! Soit on reconnais que je suis un client fidèle et on me récompense mais pas comme ça!
Sinon, je le redis, la chambre était ok. Le personnel aussi. On a passé un bon séjour...

title: Clean. Friendly staff. Nice view
text:
We stayed in the
Roosevelt suite which has a separate bedroom, 2 full bathrooms, a full kitchen, 3 closets, 2 entry doors and a large living and dining room. The view was spectacular. The sky lounge for diamond members was nice and has a great view but the food could have been better and alcoholic drinks should have been complimentary. The pool was closed for renovation and we weren’t aware of when we booked it. Pix is view fm our suite.

title: What a fabulous hotel
text: At absolutely fabulous hotel, our first trip to New York with our children 15 and 13 years old.  Very spacious clean, private and a little way from the huddle and bustle but within walking distance of all the sites.  Everyone we spoke to from reception, house keeping and restaurant everyone was extremely welcoming, helpful and polite.  We all felt very safe comfortable and secure after very busy days seeing all the sites.  We have been to many Hilton hotels throughout the world and this one of our favourites.  A special thank you to Thomas and Erica whom made our stay extra special.  Would I recommend absolutely 😊 enjoy.

title: Great hotel for business trips
text: I stayed in this place for a business trip, and it was comfortable, clean, and the staff was super friendly. I would recommend a little renovation to the lobby as it feels quite dated in contrast with the modern and tastefully decorated rooms. It was a great stay.

title: Great place to stay in NYC
text: I stayed with my daughter for 5 nights a the beginning of June. Loved being greeted by the sniffer dog -  staying there at the same time as Kim Jong Un's deputy made it quite interesting. As a Hilton Honors we were offered an upgrade at reduced cost for a 2 bdrm suite on the 39th floor. Originally said no but changed our mind and when we got back down the suite was gone. But the check in guy was super helpful, got us another one with just a couple hours wait housekeeping so we went out for dinner. The suite was perfect. Spacious, clean and  comfortable and the view was an amazing 280 degree view around the city. We looked forward coming back each day, in fact a couple of nights chose to eat in so we could enjoy the suite.  Location was great as well, just a few blocks from Grand Central.  The only disappointment was the restaurant / bar. Seemed super dated and not attractive to go to. But a very memorable stay. I dont think I'll be able to splurge like that for some time again but it was so worth it.

title: What a view!!!!!!!!
text: We stayed on the 34th floor with a view of the east River, NYC and the UN Plaza. Memorable!  Especially at night when it was like another world.  The Bell staff were very helpful. Parking is very expensive - 79$ / night with NO in / out privileges. You can park around the corner for 20$ cheaper.

title: Excelente ubicación
text: Hotel con todas las comodidades que puedas necesitar y una ubicación excelente para visitar Nueva York, empleados muy simpaticos y una habitación estupenda, todos los días hacen limpieza y te reponen café y té que es muy de agradecer. Volveria si tengo la suerte de ir a esa ciudad de nuevo.

title: Amazing
text: We stayed this week with our young daughter. The staff could not have been nicer. Sylvia on the front desk is a treat. She had our daughter smiling ear to ear. The room was incredible with towering views of Manhattan- the Chrysler and Empire State in full view. The room was large and really well appointed with a neat coffee dock and basin which made it convenient for cleaning the babies bottle. The bathroom was really modern and with a great shower. The doormen were courteous and when we got in the elevator the maintenance man was really nice too. Highly recommend this place!!

title: Wedding anniversary
text: So first I would like to thank Ty and  Monique front desk managers. They went above and beyond to make my and my husbands stay beautiful and romantic. We checked in Friday 7/27 I wanted to get an upgrade from the king corner room to a bigger suite the hotel was completely booked. The next day I was speaking Monique she asked me how my stay was going...I told her my wishes and she made them come true “ like In a fairy tale” My husband and I were upgraded to a beautiful Two Bedroom TwoBath queen/King corner Suite! Let me just say I carry a blacklight with me to hotels  both rooms past my famous black test.. Very Clean!Service was great! One Sad thing about our stay is that we couldn’t order breakfast in bed.. they had stopped doing it for some unknown reason.. and the pool was under construction. 4 Star  rating for this hotel. I posted videos of both rooms on my YouTube channel AngelPrettyEyes

title: Trip to New York
text: Great location and a beautiful hotel. The only disappointment was there was no pool in working order. The in-room service food was excellent. The store downstairs could've been open an hour or 2 more and provided milk. All in all a nice hotel.

title: As Hilton should be.
text:
The hotel is located in the city center, but a 10-minute walk to the underground station.
The rooms are large even in Manhattan standards.
The staff was professional and the check-in process was quick and efficient.
And most importantly - they have Netflix on TV!
I really had great 5 nights stay at the hotel.

title: Шикарный вид из окна
text: Остановились здесь с мужем, что можно сказать, персонал дружелюбный, номер хороший, все есть что нужно для комфорта, также присутствует фен, утюг, все для приготовления чая,номер чистый, ну, и, конечно, шикарный вид из окна. Имеется тренажёрный зал (несколько беговых дорожек,эллипсоидов и велосипед).Ничего не могу сказать про питание в отеле( видела на первом этаже что-то наподобие кофейни), но могу отметить, что вблизи отеля неимоверное количество разных кофеен,кафешек и ресторанчиков на любой вкус.Ну, и, месторасположение очень даже удобное.

title: Good location, excellent views
text:
We stayed at the Millennium Hilton UN Plaza on our recent trip to New York for 3 nights.  The Staff at the front desk was excellent and incredibly helpful.  We were able to check into our room early because they had one ready, but they were also willing to have our luggage held and delivered to our room if we had needed it.  Unfortunately, we had less than stellar service from others.  We called three mornings to have ice delivered to the room (they do not have self-service ice machines or vending machines available).  We only got the ice one morning in a reasonable time.  One morning it had not come after 45 minutes and I called to cancel because we were leaving.  The other morning is took nearly as long, but I had learned my lesson and called really early.  

THe location is definitely great for the UN or business travel.  It is also great if a view is what you are looking for while in your room.  It was our first trip to New York, so we knew we wanted a nice room with a view.  We got a corner room and out one window we could see the Empire State Building and the Chrysler Building.  Out the other window was the River and grounds of the UN.  Definitely no complaints about the view.  It was a bit of a trek to the nearest subway, basically you had to go to Grand Central Terminal to get anywhere.  There was another line a little north, but no matter what it was a half mile or more walk.

The room was comfortably sized and in good shape.  The bathroom was very nice.  The main issue we had was rowdy neighbors.  You could hear every word they said and especially when they had been drinking a while.  The other main issue was smell from their  cologne made its way into our room and lingered for a while, which was very annoying.

Overall, I think this makes a better business hotel than family or romantic hotel.  The view can be incredible with the right category of room, but that is the main thing going for the hotel.  We will likely choose another property when we return to New York.

title: Standard Hilton hotel
text:
I stayed four nights at this Midtown Hilton hotel in New York City. It was a great experience as the hotel seems really modern in the common areas and the service at the front desk was nice and efficient.

No problems checking in on a Saturday afternoon. The lobby seemed a little quiet but I guess it comes from the hotel being a business hotel. A little music would have brought a little life to the lobby. The lobby was being restored, however.

The hallways and elevators were perfectly remodeled, too. But the rooms could have used a hand. Loved the view from the 32nd floor but I had a weird room with 70% unusable hallway. And I realized that the evacuation plan had not been updated since the hotel was renovated. Minor detail but still kind of important.

Thanks to the front office staff for providing adjoining rooms with my travel partners. And thanks for doing a great job in general.

The area surrounding the hotel is not very interesting. As mentioned this is a business hotel but it will probably mean that great rates are available during the weekend. THe UN is around the corner. And it takes less than five minutes to walk to Second Ave.

title: "Perfect"!
text:
La posizione di questo hotel è veramente strategica: zona piena di ristoranti a due passi dalla Central Station. L'hotel è davvero molto bello, le camere spaziose e come il bagno.
Non ricordo con grande simpatia gli addetti alla reception.
Nel complesso una buona soluzione.

title: UN visit
text: Stayed at hotel with a group visiting the UN and NYC. Hotel was very convenient to UN and area.  Very clean rooms and well appointed. Breakfast was excellent, and service staff were friendly and very focused on making my stay enjoyable and memorable.

title: 3.5 at best
text: Was upgraded to suite 3007 that was created from a combo of two rooms, which clearly showed it was not designed as a suite.  The bedroom is too small. The 2 bathrooms were either down the hall or across the living room.  Both bathrooms were too small for a regular room, much less a suite.  But at least it has been renovated with stone like finish and a walk-in shower in one bathroom.  There was no robe or slippers in the room.  There was a small kitchen in the suite but the walls of the suite were bare.  The view was ok, not great.

title: Large rooms in great location
text:
We wanted to try a high-rise hotel and decided on the Millennium UN. We were very happy with the choice.
First, the location is great right by the UN and the East River.  With just a short walk (10-15 minutes) to Grand Central Station and lots of restaurants and shops, we found the spot to be a perfect starting point for sightseeing anywhere in the city.  The area seems a lot more laid back than Times Square or downtown, and it feels safe and clean too.

The hotel rooms are large and comfortable, especially compared to many others in the city, with plenty of room for luggage and spreading out for a family of 4.  The rooms are on the higher floors of the building, so most all have some kind of city or river view.

Overall, I would recommend this hotel if you like a spacious, clean room in a more calm and convenient area of town.

title: Great place to stay for UN
text: I stayed here for 3 nights for various meetings at the UN.  The room was spacious and the service was good.  There is even a quick place to get coffee and pastries in the lobby separate from their restaurant.

title: Great hotel for business or pleasure!
text: I stayed at the Millennium for two nights for a business trip. This is my go to hotel when in NY for business or leisure. The rooms are completely renovated and large. The service is excellent and the staff goes above and beyond to assist. The midtown location is ideal within easy walking distance of 5th Avenue and Central Park. The rates are better than any other comparable hotel in the area. You won’t be disappointed!

title: Currently not great, but has the potential to be much better
text: I have stayed at the Millennium Hilton a few times over the past few months for business trips to New York City.  The rooms have been updated and are generally nice.  The staff is also generally friendly.  I have been disappointment in the Executive Lounge for Diamond Members.  First the appearance  is poor as it has not been updated like many of the rooms and more importantly the breakfast food has been downgraded over the last couple of months.  The lounge now only offers bagels, fruit and cheese in the Executive Lounge as management has removed all hot food choices for breakfast.  I have pointed this out to management, but no action has been taken which was a bit disappointing.  Diamond/Gold members who use the lounge should be aware of this change.  This property has the potential to be great and hopefully management will take the steps needed to take it the next level.
